A game resembling the designer’s Foodie Forest and Poison with some twists and important differences. It is also a sort of a trick-taking game, but instead of everybody playing one card and seeing which one wins the trick, everybody takes turns adding cards until the total would add up to more than 13 (you can’t place a card when the total would increase over 12) and the player who can’t add a card takes the whole pile. But the total grows only when a player plays a card that is of a different color than the last card played. And when a Joker is played, the total goes back to zero again. In the end of a round, your score is the total of the cards collected (the less the better). After a pre-determined number of rounds the player with the lowest score wins.

4. Hamstern (Hoarding, age 8+)
A simplified Cheeky Monkey-like game with cards drawn from a deck instead of a bag (and cards in the discard deck are reused later) and two wild cards. On a turn, a player may draw cards until either (1) he chooses to stop or (2) he draws a number that he has lying in front of him from a previous draw this turn. In this latter case, he discards all new cards in front of him and the next player then takes his turn. In the former case, he keeps the cards (in the order they were collected. If a player draws a number that matches the number on top of an opponent's deck AND/OR the card on top of the open discard deck in the middle, the player can steal this card, adding it to the top of the deck currently in front of him. The player with the most cards in the end wins the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Trick-taking

name: Sheepdogs of Pendleton Hill: The Wolf Booster Deck
description:
From the webside:
Don’t be sheepish! The Wolf Booster Deck adds even more wolfish mischief to this quick playing game of interactive strategy.

With the wolf-card every player has more chances to move the wolf in the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Jackson's Shenandoah Valley Campaign
description:
Jackson’s Shenandoah Valley Campaign is loosely based upon the Twilight’s Last Gleaming (2) rules system (S&T issue #225), and simulates the movement of Gen. “Stonewall” Jackson’s army into the Shenandoah Valley in 1862, raiding the Union forces and allowing Jackson to move out to reinforce Gen. Robert R. Lee’s forces outside of Richmond to participate in the Seven Days Battles that decisively defeated the Union Army of the Potomac. One player plays the Union, and the other player plays the Confederate. The Confederate player will primarily be the attacker, but an observant Union player may have plenty of opportunity to counterattack.

Each combat unit generally represents 250 men or two artillery pieces; however, adjustments have been made to reflect individual unit levels of élan, proficiency, command control, etc. Each game turn is equivalent to one hour of actual battle time. The distance from side to opposite side of each hexagon on the map is equal to 300 yards.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters

name: Signature Bingo
description:
User Summary

In Signature Bingo players work to create a 'bingo' by finding people to sign their bingo card. Each square on the bingo card has a phrase or statement that must apply to the person being asked; for example, a player might be searching for someone who fits the square, "I can speak 2 languages," and thus ask a new acquaintance whether they can or not. If the acquaintance can, the player asks for their signature on the square.
Players who achieve Bingo within a particular time frame are usually rewarded with a prize, though the game is more of an ice-breaker for large groups.

name: SQUAR3
description:
SQUAR3 (pronounced "Square") is a small but complex tactical tile laying game for two to four players. The players take turn placing square tiles on a 3x3 grid that forms the game board. Each tile has a point value and will influence all adjacent tiles. The players also place gems on top of these tiles to claim them for the final scoring. Some of the tiles have special actions that the player claiming that tile can use.

SQUAR3 is similar to games like Isis & Osiris or Go as the placement of tiles and player pieces is crucial for scoring the most points. A further depth of play stems from the orientation of each tile, the layering of tiles and the management of the actions available to each player.

Games of SQUAR3 can last for only a couple of turns or up to 30 min and can be quite mind-burning.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Malifaux: C. Hoffman Crew
description:
From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

Hoffman is a Master for the Guild.

Appropriately enough, C. Hoffman crews play like a machine full of complex moving parts with Hoffman as the clockwork heart of the whole amalgamation. He both grants power to his constructs and borrows their own, creating powerful synergies between himself and his metal bodyguards. His low speed is offset by his ability to catch a ride (from Drawn to Metal) with a nearby construct. Hoffman does not fight the enemy directly, instead he enhances his Constructs to fight for him even taking temporary control of them with Machine Puppet to make a Strike. But all of this power and synergy with his crew comes at a price, as he is very reliant on his crew for his success and if you are too careless with them you will soon find Hoffman stuck in the middle of the fight without anyone to help him.

Naturally, C. Hoffman's synergy with Constructs makes them the best choice for his crew. The Guild offers these in the forms of the Guardian, the Hunter, the Peacekeeper, the Watcher, and Ryle. C. Hoffman's Arcanist Ties ability gives him access to the Steampunk Arachnid, Large Steampunk Arachnid, the Steamborg Executioner, Joss, and the Soulstone Miner.

Minion constructs included in Hoffman's starter box:

The Guardian - With potent spells like Shield Wall and Protect, plus the ability to armor nearby enemies, a healing flip that can be Assimilated, and a way to keep up with the rest of the crew, the Guardian is a stellar addition for any Constructs of Order crew. His weapons include a Sword and Shield, the latter granting a damage flip (with 2 negative twists) even on a miss, guaranteeing a minimum of 2 damage when used in tandem with Machine Puppet.

The Hunter - With the ability to shadow speedier models, the Hunter offers a much needed independent Construct to guard objectives and chase down models. It's not going to stand up to a lot of punishment, however, so make sure to utilize Ambush when possible, and keep it at range of your foes.

The Watcher - It not only has an invaluable set of deck maintenance abilities, it also has some great abilities for C. Hoffman to Assimilate, notably Slow to Die.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Shingen vs Kenshin: Blood bath at Kawanakajima
description:
One of the first two games for the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku), depicting the 4th battle of Kawanakajima during the Japanese Sengoku period. Takeda Shingen and Uesugi Kenshin were great warlords in the Sengoku period. Kawanakajima was their main battle ground in Shinano Province.

Players control either the Takeda or Uesugi clan army.
Each unit represent 500 soldiers and named by the commander.
Each turn, players alternately activate one unit for movement and combat. Combat result table is a differential of strength between attacker and defender.

The winner is determined by the destruction of the opponent army.

name: Void
description:
From back cover:

"Void is an Exciting fast paced miniature tabletop battle system for 2 or more players. The game is set in a universe where the homeworlds of Viridia, Ironglass and Prime battle for colonies in the farthest reaches of the galaxy. VASA, the policing boby of panhumanic space, tries to keep in check the ambitions of the imperialistic homeworlds. However with the emergence of the Koralon what remains to be seen is whether humanity can put aside its petty rivalry or whether mankind will become another victim of the aliens."

Void is played in turns, split in phases. In the third phase players take turns activating a squad and completing one order for the squad. Once all squads have completed their orders a new turn begins.

Victory conditions vary and are choosen before play starts. examples include; Annihilation of opponent, Most Survivors, Most Damage, Objectives, Scenarios or Time Limit.

Players build armies before game play starts based on a agreed upon point limit from army lists provided in rules.
500 points a couple hours
1000-1500 a afternoon
3000+ a full day

Reimplemented By Void 1.1.

name: VICTUS Gladitorial Combat
description:
Victus recreates the the ancient world’s most deadly sport, Gladitorial Combat! This is a complete stand alone game that puts two or more players in control of history’s greatest fighting machines using Dynamic Movement, Abilities Pooling and pure Cunning! The rules allow for play of one off games to settle old scores, bracketed tournaments or full immersion in the Ancient world using the Victus Campaign system. In the campaign, Gladiators battle to win their freedom or to gather glory as they advance in both wealth and skill. The Fortuna tables are used to expand a Gladiator's fate beyond the arena. The rulebook comes with it’s own board and paper models to allow for quick start to play; however, since gameplay takes place on a hex board, scale is not limited.

Players use a system to record their actions each turn and perform them in the order of a contested Initiative, which is determined by a roll off with modifiers for gear based on weight. Although Actions are recorded, maneuvering takes place in each turn as players perform counter strikes and have chances to maneuver in response to their opponent. Guard and Facing play a role in this. Gladiators use their Fortitudo (used for striking), Agilito (used for defense and movement), and Virtus (used for stamina and as a resource pool) to perform their Actions each turn through the phases. As wounds are dealt, Gladiators become weaker.

Weapons have different effects against different armor and carry their own advantages and disadvantages in relation to the fighting styles. For example the Thracian's Sica is able to reach behind a Myrmillo's shield more effectively. Striking takes place with models either targeting specific areas of the body or attacking untargeted areas with both players rolling in Attack/Defense. Armor for specific areas hit are taken into account and then if the attack passes through the armor the player rolls on a Wounding Table which can lead to anything from a Stun to a Fatal Wound. Fatal Wounds are worked up to, Stuns count as Modifiers to Abilities and subsequent rolls on the Wound Table. Gameplay invloves combatants striking, counter striking and working each other over in the process.

As this action is taking place, a Gladiator can attempt to ask for Missus, i.e. Mercy (if the match allows!) and depending on his performance and roll on the Missus table he could prolong his fighting career before being seriously wounded.

name: Blumen finden
description:
Simple memory game for very young children. It consists of a color die and 16 large green wooden tiles in different shapes. These either show a flower or a beetle on one side.
The tiles are laid out face down. Players take turns rolling the die and flipping over a tile. If it shows a flower in the color matching the die, the player gets to keep it. If not, the tile is flipped back. The player with most flowers at the end of the game wins.
As tiles come in four different shapes (because the flowers have a different number of petals) and each color/shape combination exists only once, there is a deduction element - if there is only one tile left with a given shape, it must be the beetle.

name: Sei stark. Sag Nein!
description:
Sei stark. Sag Nein! is aimed at teaching kids how to react to dangerous situations with strangers. It consists of cards in three colors:


Red cards show a picture and ask a multiple choice question about how to behave in the corresponding situation. The player should give the right answer and also explain why she thinks it's right.
Green cards demand physical tasks of the players and are aimed at strengthening the physical self-conscience.
Blue cards train observing skills: The players see a picture and are asked questions about it.


Players take turns drawing a card; a moderator poses the questions. Each correct answer or fulfilled task is rewarded by a point. After a pre-determined time, the player with most points wins.

name: The Wycliffe Game
description:
This game was created by the Wycliffe Bible Translators, an organization with the goal of translating the Bible into every language on earth, to give potential recruits an idea of the hazards, obstacles and rewards of working for Wycliffe.

Though there is no publication date, the game appears to be from the 1970s or '80s. It is primarily a roll-and-move game in which players must start on an inner (or Home Country) track and amass items, knowledge, funds and supporters that will allow them to proceed to an outer (or Tribal Work) track, where they must overcome various trials and be the first to finish their translation. While the mechanic seems to be mainly roll-and-move, there are a few decisions that may add a small element of strategy.

From the game box: "Taste the problems & joys of a Bible Translator--without getting your feet muddy. First, getting training and support at home. Then language work and pioneering abroad. Real-life incidents to help or hinder. The first to complete St. Mark's Gospel wins the game."
publishers: Marshall, Morgan & Scott Publications, Ltd., Wycliffe Bible Translators

name: The Lost Dutchman: Pixel Prospector Player Board
description: An additional player board for The Lost Dutchman. The Pixel Prospector has a cheat code enabled and he will use it to his advantage as he searches the Superstition Mountains for The Lost Dutchman's Gold Mine!

name: Das lustige Drogistenspiel
description:
"The funny game of druggists" published by Julius Süss, Leipzig, Germany in 1920. It is the typical children's roll and move board game with interesting theme - children's games in pharmacy store.
The goal of the game - to pass the pharmacy store first (pass the 110 stops).

Game board measures - 29 x 44 cm.

name: Jekyll & Hyde
description:
A two-player, print and play game designed for 2013 Two-Player Print-and-Play Design Contest.

Players take turns moving a pawn around London using tokens as action points. The Jekyll player is trying to discover the parts of a cure, to rid themselves of the Hyde personality. Hyde is trying to take full control of the pawn, by limiting the Jekyll players ability to use the tokens.

Most of the players' actions turn into a tug of war with the other player. Moving the pawn can place it in an advantageous location for the other player, and playing cards gives the other player a chance to draw them into their hand. Players must try to accomplish their goals without aiding their opponent.

name: 8Bit Flashback: Super Mario Bros 3
description:
This game was inspired from the game villages created by Jaron Frost.

Players play cards in groups of 3 cards to create levels, and may add more later on. Each card has a coin values. The first player who reaches 100 coins wins the game. Each turn players may attack a level of a player with one of their units to steal one of their cards. Each unit have a special ability that may affect their values during the game.

Cards are in French and English

name: Happy Feet Two: Slippery Slopes Game
description: In Slippery Slopes, players attempt to be the first to move his or her penguin to the end space. After rolling a die, a player moves his or her token to the next space matching the color or design on the die. When landing on a Happy Feet space, the token slides down a snow hill and lands in a new space.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ravenna Fatto d'Arme
description:
The game re-creates the Battle of Ravenna, fought on 11 April 1512 (tragic Easter day), by forces of the Holy League and France. The players are divided into two camps and guide the opposing armies with the sole purpose of defeating the opponent.
This game introduces a new mechanic like referring to a real circumstance. At that time give orders in battle was very difficult and in the chain of command it happened that someone not obey to the orders: the same thing will happen in the game where each team can decide whether and when to comply with an order.

name: Grablin
description:
Are you a geek? Maybe even a little nerd? You love pixel art and fantasy but are too lazy to learn complex rules? Then GRABLIN is for you!!! A fun dice game based on simple rules, to play with your friends.

Throw your dice! "Grab" the treasure and start running! GRABLIN is the dice game that mixes luck, greed, and cunning. Choose whether to risk it and grab more treasures, or to play it safe. Steal your adversaries treasures, but pay attention! Behind every corner there's always the risk of a red skull, ready to bust you.

Game Rules:
A) Choose 3 DICE from the dice box, ROLL THEM, and add them to any other dice you've rolled so far this turn.
B) If you have 3 SKULLS showing, your turn ends; return all dice you've rolled this turn to the dice box.
C) If you have 3 FISTS showing, return them to the dice box in order to steal a TREASURE from another player, then go to STEP(D).
D) Otherwise, you may choose to go back to STEP(A) to continue rolling, or you may end your turn: for each group of 3 TREASURES showing on your dice, keep 1 TREASURE; return the other TREASURES and all FISTS and SKULLS to the dice box.

The player who gets 5 TREASURES first is the WINNER

name: Ciber: IT's all in the game
description:
In IT's All In The Game you try to place your consultants at the best positions with ongoing projects. The better you do this, the more points you score each round.

Meanwhile you have to keep an eye on the deadlines. And try to stop other players from making you lose your consultants for the rest of the game.

Every playing round exists of more action rounds. At the start of each playing round you receive 2 senior consultants (playing cards). In your turn you can perform 1 action.

Actions:
- Place 1 consultant with a project
- Move 1 consultant from a project to another project.
- Pay 2 points and a consultant. Choose another consultant (without the other players seeing which one).
- Pay 2 points and a consultant. 'Upgrade' this consultant to a principal of the same color. Show other players this principal.
- Pay 6. Same action as above, but withouth showing any card to the other players.
- Pass.

A project has 5 phases. Consultants have to be placed first at the 1st phase. Only then can a consultant be placed with the second phase. And so on.
The last or the last two consultants always have to be principals.

If a project is finished (that is consultant for phase 5 has been played) it is scored, the project and the consultants are put at the discard pile. A new project is then placed on the table.

Once all players have passed, the playing round is over and points are scored.

Every project is scored. Points being awarded 6/4/2/1 (later 10/6/4/2). The further towards the end of the project a consultant lies, the more points it generates.

After scoring all cards remain with the projects. Players can therefore score multiple times for the same consultant.

IT's All In The Game in a few words:
- Lots of interaction.
- Tactical choices.
- Basic game with two expansions.
- Unexpected depth.

For now it is only available with Dutch game rules.

name: Champion of the Great Dog-Race
description:
A game to learn about the needs, thoughts and feelings of your dog!
Whether it's a Fox Terrier or a sheepdog, with this new table game pocket made ​​by Vitakraft, our beloved four-legged friends can demonstrate all their skills! As soon as the race gets under way, what matters is the speed and a bit of luck, which never hurts.

Do not play with your pet, play as if you were the animal!
The conduct of the game "Champion of the Dog Race" is totally based on the point of view of the dog. Up to four players can participate and learn, for example, playing the role of Westie, herding dog or Setter, to identify the needs of four-legged friends, to keep them healthy and in shape. The roll of the data and decide the fate of action cards: if your dog is well located, will earn positions and reach the finish line first, but if not it will recede. After you successfully run the laps of the course, the lucky winner will receive a well-deserved trophy card.
You want to be the Champion? So, ready, set, go!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Рубеж. Брестская крепость
description:
“Defensive line” is a game about severe fights which took place in Brest fortress in the beginning of WWII. Each player takes command of one or several units holding their positions in the fortress. The aim is to stand firm, restraining the enemy, as long as it’s possible.
Does everybody play for Soviet Army?
Yes, each player is in command of Red Army unit which can accomplish different military missions. You can win if you exactly coordinate your efforts, which requires high cooperation of players. “Defensive line” teaches to understand each other at a glance, because altogether you have one goal which you must gain at any costs. Any mistake may lead to the destruction of the whole unit.
What does the move look like?
The units hold several positions when the game starts. At every move the enemy’s troops attack the position. Players choose one of the actions (for example, install mines, build fortifications, fire machine-gun etc), according to the situation and the type of enemies. At the end of the move residuary enemy troops attack the fortification.
What does the gameplay look like?
“Defensive line” is a cooperative game, where the mechanics itself takes the role of opponent. The actions of units are simulated by the cards with tactical decisions. Each unit has 10 cards of a kind. Having played one card you can take another one from the deck without looking. The point of the game is to use tactical cards which are the most effective in particular moments. The victory is possible only when you have the high level of the cooperation of actions: each player must assess the situation and deliberately and precisely use their opportunities. Even when you use an optimal strategy there is a chance of losing or winning with heavy casualties.
Who is “Defensive line” for?
• For those who like good collective games.
• For playing with friends or family.
• For the journey (game board is composed of the cards).
• For those who like extraordinary and difficult enough table games.
• For connoisseurs of balanced tactical games.

name: Mafia: Death and Deception
description:
Mafia: Death and Deception is a game of an uninformed majority versus an informed minority. It involves two randomly selected teams of players: The Civilians and the Mafia, both of which are racing to kill one another. The catch is, the civilians don’t know who their enemies are.

Through arguing, accusations, and heated debate, players attempt to figure out who is a member of the mafia, and eventually vote to execute each other. The members of the mafia, meanwhile, try to lie and deceive their way to safety while secretly killing civilians in the meantime.

• Features 22 optional roles to add skill and complexity
• Includes non-allegiance-specific roles known as “traits”
• Thousands of possibilities, so every game is different

name: Zombie Mall
description:
Zombie Mall is a print & play survival game for 1-6 players set in a local shopping mall. In the basic included scenario, players are locked inside of the mall and searching for keys to unlock a door and a radio that will allow them to call for help and be rescued.

Zombie Mall can be played as a cooperative game, with all players working together toward the end goal of being rescued. Zombie Mall may also be played where it’s every man for himself (sometimes you have to sacrifice a friend to keep from becoming zombie food).

While searching the mall, players will come across Loot (random items & events) and will find Objectives (hopefully one of those keys that will unlock something important, but possibly something not helpful – such as a swarm of hiding zombies).

That mall map is constructed from Map Tiles which may be configured differently each time you play Zombie Mall. Sample layouts are shown in Sample Tile Layouts. The size of your mall directly affects the difficulty, as larger malls will take longer to search and increase the odds of running into hordes of hungry zombies.

One thing that makes Zombie Mall different from many other games in the zombie genre is that players aren’t forced to constantly scrounge for weapons. Basic combat takes into account that players are grabbing whatever is handy and using everything possible as a weapon. In addition, the players are not treated as ninja trained since childhood, so those randomly grabbed items are more than likely thrown or lodged into a zombie when used. There are weapons to be found, but the odds are good that a given weapon won’t be durable for more than a couple of uses.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: High Noon Saloon: Dynamite Promo
description:
The Dynamite Promo is an additional card that can be added to the Saloon Deck.

It is a special weapon that allows a player to make an attack with dynamite, choosing a cover rather than a player. Dynamite deals damage to every player in that cover and each player in reach of that cover. Affected players may block with either gun or melee blocks.

Dynamite cannot be affected by attack enhancement cards, cover bonuses, or cover defense. Dynamite is dropped when used.

Dynamite is not used in a team game.
categories: American West, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Amid The Ashes
description:
Amid the Ashes is a post-apocalyptic survival game in which you must ensure the supremacy of your faction by dominating what few resources are left amid the wasteland of an obliterated city. You must explore the ruins, survive radioactive fallout, fight mutants and rival factions, all in a bid to secure the last scraps of fuel, ammunition and clean water. (This is a build-it-yourself game. You must print the PDF and cut out the components to play)

It used a tile system where the tiles are revealed through exploration, each one containing a variety of buildings, environments and resources that will aid the player in achieving victory.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Exploration, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Zpocalypse: Bonus Cards
description:
A set of six cards included with the Kickstarter version of the game. The two Doom and two Mutation cards are corrections of KS ZMaster misprints, while the Armory cards were listed in the enclosed letter as being "prototypes" as a thank-you for patience.

2 Armory Cards
- Firearm: RPG
- Melee: Hunting Bow

2 Corrected Doom Cards (backs on KS ZMaster cards were erroneously printed as Mutations)
- Hematophobia
- Blank card

2 Corrected Mutation Cards (backs in KS ZMaster cards were erroneously printed as Dooms)
- Lieutenant
- Big Boss
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Rallye Photo
description:
In Rallye Photo, players split into two teams – each with the same list of items – and they race through the city streets trying to photograph those items as quickly as they can. A flag, a helmet, a car parked on the sidewalk – whichever team has found the most objects after twenty minutes wins!

In addition to more than two dozen cards focusing on items found in cities, the game includes a half-dozen cards for the countryside, beach and mountains. (Cameras not included.)

name: The Amityville Project: Lethargos
description:
Saturday the 27th, 1964

Is been 14 days since the detective was lost in the Amytiville Asylum and no one knowns anything about his disappearance. The members of the Syndicate trapped him and made him their lab pet. All this time, they try to reform his mind but they do not know that another group of people was watching his moves and knows what he wanted to achieve. On the side of the city this team plans to rescue the detective. A couple days later, the team tries to penetrate the Amytiville Asylum and they achieve it. They found the detective tied on a bed, drugged and they save him from his torture. Thanks to their plan, they managed to take him and transfer them to their hiding. There, the mastermind of the team has a plan. He has built a dangerous device capable of entering the detective's mind. The team agrees that they will try to awake the detective from his Lethargos but they must first come to same state as the detective through the new device and there is a high possibility that they will die from the pressure their minds will suffer.

In Lethargos you lead the members of the team trying to find information and awake the detective. You enter to his dream asylum and there you have to face several Ghosts, trapped memories of the detective inside his own mind which try to kill you but occasionally to help you. The Ghosts which own several abilities, are managed by an extra player who takes the role of the detective. Your purpose here is to open the 6 of the 12 Asylum Tiles and then to find the real exit in order to escape. When the last tile is revealed, several walls and one real exit are placed around the tiles and you must find the real one. If one of the team reaches the real exit, then all the team escapes the dream world.

In each round the players follow some certain actions: Movement and Search. Each player can move 1 space inside an Asylum Tile and can search the different rooms on that tile by drawing cards. These cards give different abilities which allow to the players to reveal new Asylum Tiles and trap the Ghost. At the end of each player's turn the Detective-Player rolls a special 6-sided die and based on the result he can activate a Ghost and hit a player. The Detective-Player handles an Event Deck and activates such a card for each new revealed Asylum Tile and he also owns the Phobometer. The Phobometer includes several numbers and each time a Ghost hits a Player, the Phobometer is increased. If the Phobo token reaches the last number, then you lose the game. In this game all the players must work together in order to survive and escape the Detective's Dream World. Be prepared to face your worst living nightmare!

Fear is your only god!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play

name: Jenga Blast
description:
Based on the Classic & Original Jenga Game

Keep your tower from toppling! Set up your tower of multicolored blocks—each color counts for a different point. Then, aim your blaster at the tower to try to knock a block off. Just aim carefully, because you don’t want the tower to fall! See if you can even manage the ultimate trick shot: blast out the last block in a level to drop the top blocks down!
Includes JENGA blaster, 39 foam blocks, pedestal, 13 crash chips and rules.

name: Lyssan Bonus Cards
description:
A set of bonus cards provided to backers of the Kickstart project. Nine cards provide new actions/events to include in the game, and twelve cards are blank to add your own ideas.

New Cards:
- 5 new Surprise cards
- 1 optional rule card
- 3 new Courtier cards

Blank Cards:
- 2 Courtier blanks
- 2 Vassal Courtier blanks
- 2 Surprise blanks
- 3 Debt blanks
- 3 Triumph blanks
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hand Management

name: BattleTech: Field Manual – 3145
description:
(Publisher information)

ENEMIES AT THE GATES

It is the year 3145. Only thirteen years have passed since Gray Monday—the day that most of humanity’s interstellar communications grid suddenly and mysteriously collapsed. Plunged into darkness and fearing the worst, the leaders and armies of the Inner Sphere scrambled to act, some fearing the approach of invaders, others seeking to exploit the chaos. Now, armies are on the march, war has erupted on every front, and the Republic of the Sphere—once a sign of mankind’s hope for a brighter future—has retreated behind its fortress walls to prepare for the inevitable.

Field Manual: 3145 updates the military and political state of the Inner Sphere as it stands in the year 3145. This report includes a brief history and overview of recent developments in the BattleTech universe, as well as current TO&Es for the major ’Mech forces and mercenary commands employed by the realms and Clans of the Dark Age Inner Sphere. Special era-specific rules are also included, enabling players to create characters and forces for use in campaigns set in and after this critical point in BattleTech history.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Supernova
description: Supernova is a 36 card space battle game published in six installments of the 2000 AD comic. Players take turns dealing a card from the top of their and selecting one of the parameters listed on the card, such as Attack Armament, Crew, etc. The opposing player then plays the top card from their deck and compares the ratings of the chosen parameter. The highest rating wins that contest. The Supernova ship beats all others. The player to collect all the cards wins.

name: Convention: konwentowa gra karciana
description:
"Convention: konwentowa gra karciana" is collective card game. Each player tries to organize manga/anime convention. Players use their card to expand school buildings, prepare events, hire event makers and try to prevent other players to lunch their own conventions.

Released in 2008 at polish MAGNIFIcon convention by manga publishing company Studio JG, game was a parody of polish manga/anime fandom. Many of the cards are based upon real people or situations famous in the polish fandom.

name: Świecino 1462
description:
Battle at Świecino was one of the most important and decisive battles of Thirteen Years' War, conflict that was fought in 1454–66 between the Prussian Confederation, allied with the Kingdom of Poland and the State of the Teutonic Order. It was first major victory of the polish forces.

Game allows players to play whole battle. It also contains a variant that adds army of the prince Eric of Pomerania as the Teutonic Order ally.

"Świecino 1462" is a first mini game created for the "Medieval" wargames system and uses same rules, prepared for the games based in medieval times. Game was added to the 16'th issue of "Taktyka and Strategia" magazine.

name: Gipfel Geiss
description:
Gipfel Geiss (Peak Goat) is a fast paced dice rolling game which is inspired by the famous Snakes and Ladders.

The players are climbing towards the peak, but each step can change everything: landing on an action field, you have to take an event card, that can effect everyone on the board. Landing on a ladder you have to climb up or down. Goal of the game is to reach the peak.

Gipfel Geiss was invented by two 10 year old Swiss girls.

German card texts.

name: Rogue Chess
description:
What is Rogue Chess? In five words: Advanced Strategy Cards for Chess. In more than five words...
Rogue Chess uses cards to modify the move and capture of chess pieces. Each card is specific to a certain chess piece and when played will modify that piece's move, capture, and/or add a special effect. Every round a player may use a card or move as normal. Once the card is played, the player discards it and draws a new one.
These cards are placed face up and everyone knows exactly what each other can do. In this way, you're still basically playing chess. Strategy is still king. However, you now have to play on your toes and by the seat of your pants. Rogue Chess will challenge your ability to adjust strategy much like actual battle. Because no plan survives contact with the enemy.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: ESCAPE! The Dice Game
description:
In this new Print and Play dice game, from MM Games, each player starts with an escape plan listing various items they must collect in order to carry out their escape!

Each turn, players can roll the ‘Search’ dice to look for items; they may get to select one item at random or if they are lucky they will be able to search the item deck for the counter of their choice. Their turn ends immediately if they are sent to their cell, and a cell search will mean that one of their collected items may be confiscated by the prison guards (and discarded).

Instead of rolling the search dice on their turn, a player can opt to roll the ‘Steal’ dice to try and take an item from another player’s cell. This option comes with its own set of perils; your opponent may stop you with a ‘shank’, you may be sent to the ‘Hole’ (you remain in the hole on each subsequent turn until you roll to leave), or there may be a cell transfer meaning that all your items change hands.

When you have collected all the items on your escape plan you win the game. There are optional rules to make escapes a little harder and extend the game.

name: In the Shadow of the Rising Sun: The War Against Japan 1941 to 1945 – A Supplement for I Ain't Been Shot, Mum!
description: In the Footsteps of Legions - This supplement details how to organise and field your forces for I Ain't Been Shot Mum, dealing with the forces deployed around the Mediterranean, from the early conflict in East Africa, through the North African Desert, Greece, Crete, and also with details of such sideshows as Madagascar, Syria and Iran. The following forces are covered: The British Empire and Dominions, France (Free and Vichy), Germany, Greece, Iraq, Italy, United States and Yugoslavia. AFV and weapon stats are included along with national characteristics and additional rules are also present to deal with this theatre.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Last Seven Days
description:
Last Seven Days is a solitaire card game with a story theme from a Japanese indie publisher. The game consists of a deck of cards; each turn the player draws as many face-down cards as he likes from the deck and applies them to two of five locations. The locations' special effects may or may not be activated depending on the cards drawn. The player then sets these cards up on a timeline, following certain number restraints. After seven days have been completed this way, the player may choose to end the game and count points, or to loop the week to try to improve his points by adding and/or replacing cards on the timeline.

The completed games forms a "story" of the last week of the world, which characters the player encountered, and what finally happened.

Last Seven Days allows for cooperative play if two card sets are available.

name: Rakpoka
description:
Rakpoka is an easy to learn seven card poker card game for
two or more players aged 8 to adult.

Unlike poker there is no bluffing or gambling involved in the game.

Play is on a Rakpoka mat using two traditional decks of playing cards (including jokers) in tile form.

Each player, in turn selects and lays combinations of traditional poker hands in a crossword fashion in order to secure the highest possible score.

(Score charts are printed on each corner of the play mat).

Scores can be doubled, trebled, quadrupled or quintupled by laying hands over Bonus Squares (labelled x2, x3, and x4).

If you have ever played Scrabble, you will pick this up very quickly....

The rules booklet can be found on our website.

name: Hemloch: Vault of Darkness
description:
Hemloch is a peculiar city; its nights and days last for decades, and control of the city swings wildly during the weeks leading up to the change. The Great Houses, using Minions as ark and peculiar as the town itself, vie for control of Hemoch's districts.

The Long Night is ending, and you have precious little twilight remaining to assert you House's dominance over the city's 4 districts. In 8 nights, the sun rises, and in that time, you must use the Spoils of the Vault of Darkness to draw as many minions to your side as you can, while thwarting the rival House's plans.

One of Small Box Games' most anticipated reprintings, Hemloch has received an overhaul; both graphically and mechanically, drawing from the mood, theme, and mechanics that made Hemloch a well regarded two player game and melding them with new mechanics and more dynamic gameplay.

While this game is specifically Hemloch: Vault of Darkness (a game of 2 players), as a bonus in this limited edition, the material needed to play an additional game, Shadow of the Sun (a game for 3-4 players), is included.

This limited edition print run is limited to 500 copies.

name: Wissen gut dosiert: Musik
description:
100 cards with questions and unusual and sometimes bizarre information of Music, well-known artists and bands.

If the card is drawn the search begins for the right answer. Who guess correctly gets the card as a point. Get the most points and win the game.

name: Twelve Elements of War
description:
Welcome to the Eastlands of Dothmora, a realm riven by intrigue, feuding lords and warbands fighting in the secretive Shadow War. It is a land steeped in rune magic and blood, yet one where the various races – humans, elves, dwarfs, fauns, trolls, ogres, orcs, goblins and halflings – live in harmony, owing allegiance not to race but to one of the mighty factions that make up this war-torn kingdom.

Twelve Elements of War is a 28mm Tabletop skirmish wargame. A typical warband will include between 7 - 12 models (depending on your faction and style of play), activating one model at a time. Players alternate turns activating models, keeping both players engaged and thinking. Despite only activating one model at a time, it successfully simulates combined attacks with multiple models; the first attacks in a round weaken and lock-down a model, making it easier to finish off by attackers later in a round.

It uses a multiple D6 dice, one-roll system for all rolls during a battle. Roll a number of dice equal to the Model Statistic that you are using to attack/defend/employ, add bonus dice if you have an advantage of some type, like charging. Compare the result of this roll to the enemy model's statistic or enemy model's roll to see if you succeed. The dice system does not use charts or tables & is used for all rolls, making the game extremely easy to learn.

The broad range of Faction Lists each bring something special to the battlefield, and each faction choose from the 9 fantasy races. Each Faction is balanced to each other, despite having multiple fantasy races and at least 6 roles per Faction to choose from. Successfully employing a variety of different races performing melee, shooting or magic roles on the battlefield is the key to winning.

Over 20 different mission combinations ensures that each game of Twelve Elements of War will different from the next. Creating a balanced warband is only the start; quick thinking, using the right model at the right time & an assertive battleplan is the key to completing your objectives while denying your opponent theirs.

The fun with Twelve Elements of War doesn't finish after one game. Twelve Elements of War has a complete Campaign system that sees your models gain experience, better abilities, new skills, money and magical runic items as they play battles and also explore the world of Lumria acquiring strange and unique items. You will also have the option to visit a town after each game. In town you can choose to go to the Tavern to recruit new members and heroes, The Market to purchase new items and equipment, the Arena to watch pit fighting and maybe pick up a few pointers. Lastly the Temple, where you can prey to the gods to heal your wounds or ask for their blessing in future battles. In addition to visiting these places, you roll on one of four unique “random encounter charts”.

Games can be played on a vast variety of battlefield types, from cautious tactical advances in the snow covered Forest of Sighs, to fast paced skirmishes leaping from building top to building top in the sprawling Port City of Arcadia.

Lastly, with 100's of magical item combinations to try out and over 36 unique runic spells to cast with your magic users, this game has a large amount of re-playability.

Factions in the core book include:

- The elite soldiers of Highguard, vying to restore their city-state to its former glory.
- The tough, guerrilla warriors of the Mining Guild, seeking to control valuable mineral resources across the continent.
- The Geniocracy of Toth, who strive to expand their knowledge of technology, science and magic – by sword’s edge if need be.
- The sorcerers of the Shadow Hold, adepts at runic magic, and served by thrall workers and brainwashed fighters. They scour the land for lost runic artifacts and raid other factions to capture slaves.
- The stern Keepers of Talon Crag Citadel, who have vowed to the gods to hunt down all who dare toy with the more dangerous aspects of runic magic.

With more to follow n the future.

name: The Fomorian War
description:
In ancient legend the mythic Tuatha dé Danann arrived on the shores of Ireland and there they met the mighty Fomor, they of chaos and nature. And there ensued at Mag Tuireadh a terrible battle for control of the lands and their treasures...

The Fomorian War is a card game for 3 or 4 players lasting about 30 minutes. Players secretly choose Tuatha deities to help them in battle as part of a clan as they fight for control of the lands and treasures of Ireland. They can also appeal to the Fomor for help of an underhanded sort or use the power of sacred items. Winning a battle for their clan gains Victory Points.

The game continues for a series of rounds or until all the lands and their treasures are held by one clan. The player with the most Victory Points is then declared the winner.

Needed to play - The deck of 54 cards and 2 eurocubes per player. Players may elect to keep score with pen and paper.

Play:

Each round of the game is played in the same order of phases.

Phase 1 - Battle Area. Depending on their chosen detiy, a player will choose which two cards in the Circle of Cards which will be the Battle Sites. The two cards chosen must show different Clan Holding Icons in the lower left. The cards must be adjacent to each other.

Phase 2 - Choose Tuatha Ally. The current start player will shuffle the Tuatha Deck and discard two cards face down to the center of the Circle of Cards, and then choose one of the remaining cards from the deck, keeping it secret from the other players. They will then pass the rest of the deck the player to their left to choose a card from those that remain. The deck will be passed this way until each player has chosen a card. Any remaining cards are discarded to the center.

Phase 3 - Reveal Warrior Cards. Each player, beginning with the current start player, will now play one or more Warrior Cards in front of them, face up for all other players to see. These Warrior Cards will add Battle Point Values, for their clans, to the respective Battle Site cards and their initial Battle Point Values.

Players of the same clan are trying to beat the combined Battle Point Value of the other clan.

Phase 4 - Reveal Tuatha Allies. Now each player will, in turn, reveal their hidden Tuatha Ally. The current start player will call out the numbers in order (from 1 to 7) and the player possessing that numbered card will reveal it and the power of that card may be used by the player. Tuatha allies are resolved in order.

Phase 5 - Resolve Battle. After the Tuatha, and Sacred Item and Fomor powers have been resolved, total the Battle Point Values for each clan and compare. The winner is the clan with the most Battle Points. The losing clan’s Battle Site card is flipped over to the other side to show the winning clan’s alignment icon. In the case of a tie, no Battle Site cards are flipped and no Victory Points are awarded in Phase 6.

Phase 6 - Victory Points. All players of the winning clan receive Victory Points as stated by the chart at the bottom the winning Battle Site card. Track Victory Points on the Score Card.

Phase 7 - Discard and Draw new Warrior Cards or add Cattle Herd.
Discard all used Warrior Cards to the discard pile.

Phase 8 - New Start Player. The player to the left of the current start player is now the new start player.

Game End:

The game ends in one of two ways:
A. After 8 rounds if playing with 4 players, or 9 rounds if playing with 3 players.
B. If all of the cards in the Circle show the same Clan Holding icon.

At this point the player with the most Victory Points is the winner. In the event of a tie the player with the most Cattle Herd Cards played is the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Wild Weather
description:
Wild Weather is a lightweight, portable card game for 2-4 players that plays in 15 mins. Designed as part of the Standing in a Line Design Contest.

The aim of the game is to collect sets of cards that match a given objective card.

Players are dealt a hand of cards - all cards are displayed so all players may see the face in-play and have 4 Seasons - Winter, Spring, Summer, Fall and 4 Colours - Red, Blue, Yellow, Green, plus Symbols that are Black or White.

On a Turn the player Chooses a TYPE (Season or Colour) and an ACTION (Flip Over, Pass-Left, Pass-Right). ALL cards matching the nominated TYPE are affected, in all hands.

Play continues clockwise until any player meets the objective - they take the card and a new Objective is revealed.

Game ends when the 5th Objective Card is won - scores added and winner declared.

The game is also language independent and color-blind friendly.

name: Zombie Mall: Brains on the Brain
description:
Zombie Mall Brains on the Brain is the first expansion to Zombie Mall and features integrating Zombie Players into the existing rules of Zombie Mall. Now players can find themselves reborn as part of the zombie horde after dying, and continue play while attacking the remaining Human Players.

The same map tiles and tokens included with Zombie Mall are used with this expansion along with the addition of a few Zombie Player specific tokens - these tokens are the Zombie Player token used for tracking where in the mall the Zombie Player is located, as well as the new Dead Again marker for those times that the Zombie Player is beaten down by the human folk.

Zombie Mall Brains on the Brain is an expansion and is not a complete game. The Zombie Mall Basic Rules, available for free Print & Play download, are required to play.

Components:
In addition to adding Zombie Players to the A Call For Help scenario in the basic game, Expansion 1 also includes:


New Tokens needed by the Zombie Players
Updated Quick Reference Sheet usable by both Human Players and Zombie Players
New Player Stat Card usable by both Human Players and Zombie Players. This Stat Card also implements a Scoring Track for player stats and Victory Points which drastically reduces the number of printed tokens needed per player: the 90 tokens/player on page 4 of the Zombie Mall Basic Rules Tokens PDF can be reduced to 7.
2 new scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Audatia, the medieval swordfighting card game
description:
Audatia is a two-player historic, sword-fighting card game based upon a medieval knightly sword-fighting system. The goal is to achieve "touches," rather than damage. Players start with all guard cards and 4 actions (diagonal up/down cuts). An additional 6 action cards are also drawn.

Each round of play takes a few minutes to finish with a total of 3-5 touches in a complete game. Both players have a hand of guards with each guard allowing a determined amount of plays with three plays the general standard. Players also have a hand of action cards (blows, thrusts or techniques such as counter-attacks or parries)

Once an action card is played, it is discarded leading to one player running out of options, and a touch scored.

name: La Piste
description:
Designed by a fencing instructor, La Piste is a fast paced, 2-player fencing simulation card game. Each player selects a fencer with special skills and a weapon (foil, epee, or saber). Fencers move along a strip and play a variety of cards representing various fencing moves. A six-sided die determines certain outcomes.

This game focuses on fencing moves and tries to capture the strategy and speed of real fencing.

Extra parts needed to play:

1 6-sided die
2 tokens to track score
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Odysseo
description:
Odysseo is a chance and strategy game. The goal is to move your checkers from a starting point to one of the available exits (the opponents' starting points).

During your turn, rolls the dice, then moves one of your checker by the corresponding number of cases. Whenever possible introduce a new checker on the board.
Checkers movement is limited by simple rules: 1) moving back and forth during the same turn is also prohibited; 2) moving through other checkers is not permitted; 3) finishing the movement on an opponent's checkers removes it from the game; 4) finishing the movement on a blue case removes your checker from the game.
Also, having one of your checkers being removed while standing on one of the white cases surrounding your starting point allows you to recover the removed checker.

The game ends when there is only one player with checkers left on the board and scoring is done as such: 1) saved checkers: 2pts each; 2) checkers on the board: 1 pt each; 3) removed checkers: 0 pt each.

The length of the game can be shortened by starting with fewer checkers.

name: Teocalli
description:
Teocalli Aztec for the God House.

A 4 in a row with 4 pieces and no board.
All 4 pieces are one sided and are made up of right-angled pieces in these color patterns, 2 (white, black, white) and 2 (black, white, black) pieces.

Play

One player is white the other black.

Decide who plays first then turns alternate.

On a turn,

- Select a piece and place it orthogonally adjacent to another piece already on the table.

- The game ends when a line (orthogonally or diagonally) of 4 pieces in your color is made.

If after playing all the pieces there is no winner do the following,

- Move a piece and place it orthogonally adjacent to another piece, play continues like this until you have a winner.
Restrictions
- You may not move a piece that would by its removal create two groups.

- You may not move the last piece played by your opponent.

- If by chance you create a 4 in a row for your opponent and yourself on the same turn, your opponent wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Monster College: Lunchtime Battle
description:
Back to school! Here comes the annual retreat for monsters from all hierarchies to sharpen their skills after playing bad guys in a variety of board games for the past year. The most anticipated event, of course, is the legendary lunchtime battle! No one wants to be sent off on an errand to buy lunch for all the others, so brace yourself and fight for your monster's dignity!

In Monster College: Lunchtime Battle, each player chooses one monster from his hand to join the "counting circle" each turn. Based on the die roll and a counting process, 1-3 unfortunate monsters are fingered to buy lunch for others (earning minus points along the way for the corresponding players) — but these candidate monsters are so childish that in later turns they'll use their special abilities to bend the counting rules in their favor. In the end, the player whose collected candidate monsters show the most overall "hunger" loses the game and must go buy lunch (or whatever else they agreed to before the game) for everyone else!

一年一度的進修日又到了，平時在各大遊戲扮演稱職壞蛋的魔物們再度回到校園，認真複習各種魔物必修技能。好不容易撐過早上的課程，魔物們最期待的午餐時間終於到了！今年究竟是哪個班級的魔物要當跑腿小弟去幫大家買便當呢？這場年度便當大戰即將揭開序幕！
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: LUDA Tischfußballspiel
description:
This game from the 1960's from the German Demokratic Republic or from Poland is a soccer game for the table.
The game is for two gamers.
On the plastic playfield every gamer has 10 outfield players and 1 goal keeper in his team. The outfield players and the goal keeper have little springs under the feet and the gamers try to shut the little metal ball in the goal.
The winner is the gamer who had shot more goals in the playtime.

name: Wo sind Zebra, Löwe & Co?
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The two cheeky friends Zack Zebra and Luisa Lion are thinking up many funny game ideas for their zoo friends. Who wants to join in?

Be it a memory game, a competition or a look-closely game, the game collection Wo sind Zebra, Löwe & Co? offers to all small animal fans a variety of fun games with simple rules and a short play duration. With this collection, children enter the world of zoo animals and, as they do so, learn fine motor skills, concentration, close observation and a basic understanding of rules. Plus, they can play independently with the wooden figures until their heart's content.

name: Slabberjan
description:
A traditional Dutch game from the Zeeland region, very similar to the version of the Danish-Norwegian game Gnav or the Swedish Kille, played with wooden pawns rather than cards, of which it is a derivative; all of these games are actually reimplements of the 16th century French 'hazard' card game Coucou, later popularized in 17th century Italy as Cuccú (Cuckoo).

A set consists of 42 wooden pawns with a number or picture hidden under the base. Each of the 21 subject occurs twice: the numbers from 0 to 12, the trumps "Rider", "Bird", "Cat" and "Inn" above the numbers, and "Whitebread", "Mug", "Pot" and "Jester" below.

At the beginning of the game, each player recieves a number of point tokens. In each round, each player draws one pawn from a bag and secretly looks at its value. Then the players in order decides whether to keep their pawn or trade it with the following player. If that player holds a trump, special rules for each trump applies, otherwise the pawns are traded. At the end of the round, the player with the lowest valued pawn loses one of their point tokens.

A player who runs out of point tokens is out of the game. The last remaining player is the winner.

It is not known exactly when this little known variant first appeared. It must be after the the wooden pawn variant of Gnav – originally a card game – gained popularity as an effect of a ban on playing cards by the pietist king Christian VI of Denmark-Norway (1730–1746). On the other hand it probably did not happen very much later, as it lacks a couple of the developments otherwise separating Gnav from other games in the Cuccu family.

name: Chemundo
description:
Chemundo is a teachware cardgame in the world of chemistry.

General features of the basic game:
• Choose the 40 inorganic chemistry cards (IC) or
organic chemistry cards (OC) deck and all the action cards; thus, having a deck of 61 cards

The game:
• Shuffle the cards.
• The dealer then deals seven cards to each player.
• The players choose a referee.
• In each round each player may discard one matching card.
• When dropping the card, the player has to name the
compound on the card correctly.
• If the player is unable to discard, he has to draw a card from
the drawing pile.
• The game is immediately over when the first player goes out of cards.

There are rule variants for Chemundo Rummy and Chemundo Poker

name: Dead@17: The Battle for Darlington Hills
description:
Dead @ 17: The Battle for Darlington Hills is a deck-building game in which players fight for the side of good or evil, building powerful decks. This game, based on Josh Howard's Image comic book series, has players taking on the role of the main character Nara and her friends. They will have to collect and use an arsenal of weapons that can range from knives to powerful magic. These weapons are used to push back the seemingly endless army from Hell. One player will use an evil avatar to summon these minions. Using characters right out of comic they will attempt to open portals to Hell at locations around the town of Darlington Hill.

The struggle between the factions plays out in the supply deck of cards as well as at the locations. Each card that the players acquire has a use for either the good or the evil player. The more powerful cards for one is a weaker card for the other. Players may take on aggressive or defensive strategies while building their decks. The game concludes as one player opens the gates to Hell or the other banishes them to the darkness.

name: Rolemodels: The Battle for Vyk' Tornaahl
description:
Rolemodels: The Battle For Vyk'Tornaahl — a limited-edition, RPG-themed card game curated and designed by Light Grey Art Lab — features a diverse collection of alter-egos and fantasy self portraits from 99 artists from around the globe. Each of these artists have traded in their pencils and brushes for battle armor and wands in an effort to embrace their inner swordsman, warrior, and healer. This exhibition of artwork celebrates each artist as a creator, individual, and a modern-day art hero and role model.

Each artist's self-portrait represents a character in the game that players use to outwit their enemies, form their ranks, battle against foes, define their allies, and go to battle in the hope of obtaining influence and, ultimately, power over the fallen land of Vyk'Tornaahl.

At heart Rolemodels is a poker variant with additional rules and flavor. Players start the game with five cards in hand. Three cards from the deck are revealed to form the Adventurer's Tavern. At the start of a round, the dealer rolls a d20 die to determine the amount of influence up for grabs. Each player then takes one of two actions on his turn:


Draw two cards, one from the Adventurer's Tavern and the other from the face-up cards or the deck.



Declare battle, which takes place in two phases:



Scout Phase: Whoever started the battle plays two cards (called "Scouts") face up in front of him. Each other player in turn decided whether to pass or join the battle; in the latter case, they also play two Scouts face up.



Reinforcements Phase: First, a player can choose to surrender and withdraw from battle. All players who don't surrender, then simulaneously play and reveal three cards as reinforcements. Whoever has the strongest cards wins the available influence; in games with three and four players, the second best hand wins half this amount of influence.


After discard all played cards, the player who initiated battle draws two cards, then a new round begins. When one player has fifty or more influence, the game ends and he wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Make Rule
description:
Make Rule is an (almost) ruleless card game that comes with 36 cards in six types numbered 1–5 and one each with a star.

Lacking rules, the game comes with instructions on how to create rules. Rules can basically be anything, but should generally be "who wins" and "how do you play the cards". Each player gets to suggest three rules, and each rule is voted on. If at least half of the players vote yes for the rule, it's accepted.
publishers: ワイビーワイゲームズ　(YbY Games)

name: Franken Delivery
description:
User summary:

A mix between memory and the traditional card game where players draw cards from each other trying to form pairs.

The deck consists of a variety of cards of which there are four of each, except Frankenstein's Monster, of which there are three. These are dealt to all players who put them down before them. Each turn, players can turn two cards, his own or another player's, showing only the second one to all. If he turns two cards of the same sort, they are discarded, and the player gets to apply the special effect of the card. Special effects include sending a card to another player, shuffling cards and other effect.

The player who remains with the lone Franken card loses.
publishers: ワイビーワイゲームズ　(YbY Games)

name: Middle East '48
description:
Middle East '48 (originally known by Sinai '48) is a brigade level simulation of the Israeli War of Independence in May through June of 1948.

Map is 11x17 glossy paper of the Sinai through Lebanon, 64 uncut, one-sided counters on card stock.

One player commands the Jewish (Israeli) forces, while the other commands the various Arab forces. Game play is I-go, You-go with 15 game turns.

Victory is based on the number of major cities held by the Arabs at the end of the game.

Published in Wargaming: The Magazine of Fantasy & Historical Simulation, Issue 04.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Know It All
description:
A trivia card game where players or teams compete to give as many correct answers as possible to a question posed from one of 80 cards.

Example categories include: naming Santa's reindeer, naming signs of the zodiac, or naming the countries which border Germany.

Players score points for each correct answer and the team or person with the most points, wins.

name: Symmetry
description:
Symmetry is an abstract 2-player game. Players need to create symmetrical patterns on the board to gain territory, while simultaneously preventing the opponent from creating symmetrical patterns on the board.

Symmetry can be played using a Reversi set (board+stones).

The excact rules of Symmetry are as follows:
-Black and White take turns putting stones on an NxN board (White starts).
-When a stone placing causes a square on the board to be fully covered with stones, this square changes into the color of the last placed stone if the square in question has become horizontally or vertically ´mirror´ symmetric!
-So ´diagonal´ symmetries will not cause any color change.
-Symmetric squares can potentially have any size (2x2, 3x3, 4x4 etc.)
-Sometimes more than one square becomes a 'symmetry' by a move. All such squares change color.
-The winner is the player who at the end has the most stones of their color on the board!

name: Ariadne's Thread
description:
A 2 player card game you can play with a standard 52-deck of cards.

In Greek mythology Theseus was sent to convey the tributes of the Athenians to the Minotaur, which prowled a Labyrinth. Ariadne the daughter of King Minos of Crete and his wife Pasiphae, fell in love with the dashing Greek hero Theseus. Now according to the myth, it was Ariadne who helped Theseus to escape the Labyrinth by supplying him with a sword to kill the Minotaur and a ball of thread to navigate the tangled passages…

THREAD– An orthogonally connected group of five or more like color cards.

The goal is to have the most points within your color threads.

THE DECK – Remove the 10s from a 52-card deck and divide the rest of the deck into red suit cards and black suit cards. You will also need one Joker card with a different color back and a way of keeping score. Aces can be either high or low. An Ace can beat a King but a King cannot beat an Ace. Cards are ranked in this order (A-2-3-4-5-6-7-8-9-J-Q-K-A) A=1 or 14, J =10, Q=11, K=12.

PLAY– Player 1 has the black suit cards and Player 2 has the red suit cards.

Thoroughly shuffle each other’s decks and return them.

The decks are placed face down in front of their respective players, these are now the draw decks from which the players will draw cards from during the game.

The game is played in 2 rounds.

The back side of the Joker card will be the Minotaur and the face of the card will be our hero Theseus.

At the start of the first round the Joker card is placed face down at the center of the tableau and at the start of the second round the Joker card is placed face up at the center of the tableau.

Each player at the start of a round draws 3 cards from their draw deck to their hand.

In round 1 the player holding the black suit cards plays first, while in round 2 the player holding the red suit cards plays first.

Players take turns.

On your turn you may take 1 of 3 actions:

1.Play a card from your hand face up to the tableau or

2.You may swap out the last card played with a higher ranking card from your hand as long as the lower card does not divide evenly into the higher card or the lower card is not one number below the higher card. Then flip over and move the swapped card to a different spot on the tableau or

3.Swap out the Joker card with a card from your hand and then flip the Joker card over and move it to a different spot on the tableau.

Players then draw a card from their draw decks returning their hands to 3 cards, this now ends a player’s turn.

•Once players run out of cards in their draw decks they continue to play the cards that are left in their hands.
•The game ends when all the cards have been played to the tableau.
•The round is then scored.

CONSTRAINTS – All cards must touch at least one other card either orthogonally or diagonally.

Cards may not be played on top of other cards.

You may not play a card from your hand to the tableau so that the playing area exceeds 7 cards in any direction, this also applies to moving a card.

SCORING – The point values of the cards are as follows: Aces are worth 1 point, (2-9) are face value and (J-Q-K) are worth 10 points each.

To score a round, add up all the threads in your color suit.

If the Joker card is face down and is orthogonally adjacent to one of your threads you subtract 10 points from your score. If the Joker card is face up and is orthogonally adjacent to one of your threads you add 10 points to your score.

Finally players add up their scores from both rounds and the player with the highest score wins!

If after scoring both rounds there is a draw, play another round.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Trick-taking

name: Don't Shoot The Messenger
description:
The Fast and Fun Game of Phrases, Sayings and More! Every round is a verbal free-for-all in this extremely fast-paced family game. Your goal? Find the missing word in a common phrase, saying, or expression before anyone else! You’re given the first letter of the missing word to help. So if the Presenter says “(B) Up The Wrong Tree”, shout BARKING. If they say “Timing Is (E)”, yell EVERYTHING. If you hear “When Pigs (F)”, holler FLY. It’s that easy.

The Presenter starts things off, then it’s up to how quickly you react. It isn't good enough to be fast: you have to be the fastest! So whatever happens, DON'T SHOOT THE MESSENGER...

name: Can't Fool Me!
description:
CAN'T FOOL ME! you say? We'll see... If you like to think and have fun at the same time, this is for you. It’s fast, challenging and tricky, so prepare to pit your wits against others in this highly entertaining brain-teasing game. You're given a Keyword & Clue and have to find the Answer. All set? If the Keyword is "Sun", and your Clue says "Reach for a spoon, not your sunglasses", be the quickest to shout out SUNDAE. If the Keyword is "Dragon", and the Clue states "No knight ever tried to slay one", yell out DRAGONFLY. Or try this: Your Keyword is "Comfort" and the Clue is "Money can't buy you love, but it can buy you this". Did you guess the Answer: COMFORTER? So fooled or not, get ready to scratch your head, shout and laugh a lot!

Includes: 320 Question Rounds on 160 Dual-Sided Game Cards, Gameboard, Game Pieces, Instructions

name: Leningrad 1941:  The Embattled City
description:
A division to army level game having a map from Pskov up to Leningrad (but not Finland or Finns) and east over to strategic Tichvin. 20mis/32kms per hex, 11 10-day turns. Terrain is simplified: it was all bad up there, off the roads. :)

Game system uses Disruption and Entrenchable (flip-side) infantry/rifle units, to simulate momentum of advance and/or positional inertia.

Includes special rules for the Red Banner Baltic Fleet and Marines, railway guns, Red Air Force 7th Fighter (interceptor) Aviation Korps, optional reinforcements (historically used), etc.

Free, to print off, assemble, and play.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Supermarket Sweep Game
description: Based on the hit ITV game show from 1993-2001 & 2007 with Dale Winton as your host, answer questions correctly and go wild in the aisles as you race to get the most items in your trolleys as possible in order to win.

name: Crib-box
description:
From the instruction book:

Crib-box is a two dimensional method of playing cribbage in which twenty-five cards are arranged in a five by five array and scores are made in rows, columns, and diagonals of the array.

Game consists of rule booklet for playing 6 game variants using the special board and two standard decks of patience playing cards provided.

name: Gene Hunt's 70's and 80's Trivia Board Game
description:
A trivia game where you move around the board trying to correctly answer all 6 topics before moving back to the centre square.

All questions are related to the 1970s and 1980s (with a strong lean towards the UK).

name: Wild Guess?
description:
Wild Guess? is a quick and easy game, where two contestants try to guess which animal their opponent has picked from the animal cards by asking questions that can be answered with yes or no. For example: Can your animal fly? Does it have 4 legs?

Animal cards can also be used as an animal memory game.
Similar to Guess Who?

name: Gem c'Rocks
description:
Gifu, of the kingdom, they have big and many gem mines. It’s called “The sea of Gems”. The kingdom has just one scraper, named “Bagar” by the king.
The Bagar is too big, so the king need to wait for 10 years. But the power is the top of the world.
Once, the four countries adjust Gifu has the celebrations with the same time. Kusatsu, the trade city has the new king. Ishikawa, the shrine in the fog has the beautiful but fascinating maiden. Suzuka, the silver grass plain, the prince merge with the noble woman. Aichi, the natural country has the hero.
The Gifu king say “The Gifu strives for the gift to the countries. The Bagar runs, and I will have the auctions for the ores of gems!”.
The players are the merchants for the gems. So they get the ores, and make the gems. It will be the excellent gift for the other countries.
However it’s not the normal auctions. The auctions are made in the Bagar. So the players must go the digging site, must carry the money on the carriege with the horse. So that, the money is limited. Who make the best gift for the other countries?

name: Acute Care
description:
Ever wondered what it's like to work in the stressful environment of a hospital? Do you have what it takes to ensure the health and safety of your patients who have needs that can change from minute to minute?

Acute Care is a co-operative board game in which players take on the role of nurses staffing a busy medical/surgical unit in a hospital setting. Through one 12-hour shift, they must work together to provide care for their patients and deal with emergencies and complications as they arise — ideally achieving a high level of quality while doing so.

The most precious and limited resource for real-life nurses is their time, so in Acute Care time — in the form of "time cubes" — is exactly what you must spend in order to complete tasks and care for patients. Each hour, you have six times cubes (each representing ten minutes of real time) to allocate to various tasks; cards that require you to spend time cubes have little boxes on which to place the cubes to indicate that you're performing that action.

Since the players are all working together, the Challenge Deck provides the opposition to the players throughout the game. Each card drawn from it represents some challenge or opportunity that the nurses must face in order to care for their patients and manage the unit.

Gauging success in a healthcare setting can be difficult. Having patients get better and discharging them home are the main goals, but the quality of care provided is also important, regardless of the outcome. Quality care includes patient satisfaction, staff cooperation, timeliness, performance improvement, and effective patient and family education, so in Acute Care, success is measured on a scale of quality points earned or lost, eventually leading to either Commendations (for high quality) or Deficiencies (for low quality).

name: French and Indian War Battle Collection
description:
The French and Indian War battlepack is Bill Molyneaux's conversion of our AWI ruleset to this earlier conflict. Although it is far more detailed than the AWI sets, especially the unit differentiation, it is still easy to learn.

Most of the 12 battles can be finished in under 2 hours regardless of your wargaming experience. Experienced players will comfortably finish most battles in under an hour.

The battle scenarios included in this campaign pack are:-
Jumonville Glen
Fort Neccessity
Braddocks Defeat
The Mary Jemison raid
Lake George
Sideling Hill
Fort William Henry
Snowshoes
Carillon
Plains of Abraham
Sainte Foy
Bushy Run

name: Shōgi
description:
An LPS bonus mini-game, Shōgi is an expansion for Operation Cartwheel.

The game covers Japanese and American carrier operations in late 1943, and includes new counters, rules, displays, and a new map.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Junior Poker
description:
This is No. 35 in the HABA games in a tin series.

Game itself is a simple draw poker variant. 4 different types of animal cards with no different card values. In one round of exchanging cards players try to get the highest x-of-a-kind. In case of a tie there's a ranking of the different animals. Betting is done with food cards instead of chips. Game ends if a player runs out of food cards.

name: Gold Rush
description:
Gold Rush is a card drafting and voting game that is based in the wild west. Each player has to grab some precious minerals. At the same time, the richer you are, the more likely you will be voted, and you will have to give up some of your earnings to the town.

In addition, every player will receive one pet that can earn bonus points or special abilities every round. Can you show a poker face and avoid the accusation from the other players?

The end is played in rounds. After 3 or 4 rounds, the player with the most money wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Voting
