name: Stop-Over Gelsenkirchen
description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Gelsenkirchen-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

name: Chancery Lane
description:
Played on the London Underground map, the aim of this game is to be the first player to reach Mornington Crescent.

Players take turns to move their pawns around the board, optionally adding (initially meaningless) tokens to stations they visit. At any time, a player may spend one of their two veto chips to veto another player's move, announcing a new restriction under which that move is illegal (such as "players may not move more than six stations in a turn"). In doing so, the players gradually build a set of restrictions for how the game is to be played. Play continues until a player is able to reach Mornington Crescent without having their move vetoed.

By framing all discussion of additional rules as mere "reminders" of a deeper, undisclosed ruleset, the game appears to an audience to be a fully-formed boardgame rather than something that the players are largely inventing on the fly.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: The Gate of the Sun
description: A roll and move board game designed in Australia in 1971, this has an interesting mechanic in that there's a separate piece of the board that rotates during play. It's very reminiscent of an early Talisman, with simpler mechanics.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Shifty Partners
description:
Shifty Partners is a partnership trick-taking standard deck playing card game, with randomly-selected trumps. Partnerships change with each hand, and scoring is by individual. Trumps change with each hand, determined by a d6 die-roll.

The object of the game is to have the most points at the end of the game. The game ends after each player has dealt one hand. During the game, each player will be partnered with every other player. Partnership designations shift after each hand. A unique feature is that the dealer is always a partner with the player on his right.

A partial deck is used, with the number of cards determined by the number of players. Five cards are dealt to each player, with one being face-up. Only four tricks are played in each hand.

Each trick captured counts 1 point, and each Queen and Deuce counts 1 point. Each member of a partnership scores the total points caught by the entire partnership.

name: Zombie Mall: Dead On Your Feet
description:
Expansion 2 to Zombie Mall:
After running around trying to escape the oncoming zombies as a nameless mass of player, you can now add a little character to your game with the introduction of Character Cards! These new Character Cards will flesh out those nameless avatars you've been playing with by giving you careers, perks, and traits to add in to your play.

In addition to adding 72 Character Cards to the the basic game, Expansion 2 also includes:

New Tokens for being Knocked Out and using Starting Weapons.
8 new scenarios.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Morocco Ablaze: A Solitaire Game of Revolts and Uprisings in French North Africa
description:
BACKGROUND: MOROCCO ABLAZE is semi-historical simulation of the French Colonial Conquest of Northern Africa from 1870-1930. The Game begins shortly after a North African Tribal Leader has stirred up the natives in the whole region and are poised to launch assaults on French Settlements to drive them out of the Country forever. As the Commander of French Forces, you must protect the French Settlements and squash the rebellious Forces.

OBJECTIVE: Game Objective: Player takes command of the French Forces in Morocco. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to control a number of Arab Settlements whose Fortification Levels (FVs) total 18 or more before the Campaign Deck is exhausted. If the Arab Army captures a number of Settlements whose Fortification Values total 18 or more, the Arabs win. Also, if the French do not control 18 FV worth of Settlements before the Campaign Deck is exhausted, the Arabs Win.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Nobunaga's Gamble: Storm Over Okehazama
description:
Nobunaga's Gamble: Storm Over Okehazama is a two-player wargame on Battle of Okehazama.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Okehazama

One player controls the Oda forces, the other the Imagawa forces.

About 100 counters consist of commander units, troop units and dummy units.

name: Mr. Card Game: Mr. Store Cards
description: These character cards were available via the Kickstarter campaign to backers who backed in the first ten-dozen hours. Each player is randomly dealt one of these items before the game begins and each provides a special power for the player. There are twelve unique Mr. Store cards in the package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Reign of the Judges
description:
Exciting card game set in high point of Nephite civilization.

Reign of the judges is a card game where you join one of three teams that is fighting to control the judgment seat. One player is the Chief Judge, and everyone else secretly becomes a Nephite, Lamanite, or Gadianton Robber. Nephites are basically the good guys defending their homes; Lamanites are the invading horde intent on complete domination; and Gadianton Robbers want to take over the government secretly from within.

On your turn, you attack players that you believe are on the other teams. When you defeat another player you take one of their votes; your clout in society grows as the defeated player's influence wanes. You win if your team wins the most votes by the end of the game to control the government and become the next Chief Judge.

name: Beneficiary
description:
Beneficiary is a 2-player game of scheming and second-guessing, with a side-order of push-your-luck.

Each player is one of two siblings, both prominent political figures within Nigeria's government. In an unfortunate circumstance, their rich father, a foreign national from Connecticut, was killed in an airplane crash. His bank account is now being locked down by government auditors in the US. The players will be seeking assistance from bank account holders in order to transfer the inheritance money back to Nigeria and into their own accounts. The player with the most Naira in their account at the end of the game is the winner.

In Beneficiary, the players will each choose 5 of the 8 counties in Connecticut to send mass emails to. Each county has a Naira value (per supporter) and a special ability. The 3 counties not chosen will provide the player with a special ability they can use during the game. If both players choose the same counties they will have to bribe and negotiate with each other until one backs down.

Then, each county is resolved individually. The active player will choose pairs of tiles secretly arranged by their opponent. They will continue until they are happy with the number of supporters, or until they fail out because of scam reports. Each successful supporter will add Naira to the active player's score. Will you cash in the supporters early enough or will you push your luck too far and have to withdraw from the county?
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Grifter: A Game of Cons
description:
Grifter is a fast-paced set building game of bluffing and hand management. Using subtlety, theft and countering, players take on the roles of Grifters operating during the late 1800's hoping to complete the perfect Con before their opponents do.

Each player adopts one of four unique Grifters with special in-game benefits as they try to complete a set of Businesses, Opportunities and Marks.

Through unrevealed Plot cards attached to these Businesses and Opportunities, players attempt to Bluff their Marks and opponents into completing a set that may or may not be a legitimate enterprise. Through a hand composed of Tricks cards along with these set cards as well as potential allies, or Shills, players have to assemble a Full Monte of cards to walk-away with the winning hand, or be revealed to be nothing more than the Con artist they truly are.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction

name: Tricky Chess
description:
Tricky Chess is a partnership trick-taking chess game for The King's Caste deck / game system. Through successive rounds comprising recruitment, deployment, and mobilization, each team tries to eliminate the other's two kings.

Recruitment is done through trick-taking. The card that wins the trick goes to the respective player's deployment zone, regardless of who won the trick!

After the hand is played out, players Deploy their units to the board.

Next, the teams play chess against one another with the units available, until four units are eliminated, at which point a new round starts, after a little preparation for the new round.

name: Clan War: Crab Army Expansion
description: Clan War: Crab Army Expansion includes a 64-page army list filled with Crab personalities and units, rules for items, new spells, a new maneuver, and a lot of great background on the Crab Clan. In addition, it includes Force cards, Tactical cards, Hida Yakamo, and twelve Hida House Guard models (13 metal figures) - only available in this box set! (Box Set - 13 metal miniatures, 64-page army book)
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Letter Dice
description:
Letter Dice is a word dice game similar to Spill and Spell and Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes, where players make words to score points.

It scores differently than those games, with objectives like longest word and most words:

Throw the dice and race against your opponents (and the clock) to turn the jumbled-up letters into words. Can you make the longest word? Can you make the greatest number of words? Can you score the most points? Lots of different rapid-fire challenges for word game fans of all ages.

It is for 2 or more players.

name: Aterui Saga
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #21.

The game covers the campaign of Sakanoue no Tamuramaro against the Eastern Barbarian, Emishi (in 8th century). Aterui was the most famous leader of the Eastern Barbarian.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aterui

One B3 size map
140 counters
8 pages rulebook
30 cards

The game uses a modified card-driven system.
The standard scenario is 12 turns long, and one turn represents 2 years.
The card can be used either of 1: conducting march, 2: trying to influence the barbarian clan or 3: getting supply in barren land.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Schrödinger's Cat
description:
シュレーディンガーの猫 (Schrödinger's Cat) is a three-player card game in which the players must manage their hands so that it corresponds with the final outcome for the cat. Players start with eight cards in hand, with the cards being black or white with values 1-4. Playing a black card increases the chances of the cat being dead — and a white card for it being alive — but anything above 100% gets lowered by 100.

After six rounds, players win depending on the outcome of the cat and the two cards each player still has in hand.

name: Thieves!
description:
This card game simulates a dungeon crawl if the entire party was made up of thieves.

Each player is a thief and plays a Chamber card which gives some information about the next room the party is about to enter. This card is played face down and the current player describes its contents, generally by lying. Each player then plays a card face down to express how they intend to deal with the upcoming room, and then everything is revealed.

The players accumulate treasures which equate to victory points and also give each player some special powers depending on the treasure captured.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Alfred the Great: The Great Heathen Army 871AD – Miniatures Edition
description:
A two player or solitaire game that uses Hex, dice and miniatures, a game with complexity on the lower end of the scale that has the Vikings invading Wessex in 871AD, players will have to consider when and where to fight, re-supply and other challenging factors to win the game.

Players have Warriors, Earls/Jarls and Kings to do battle with and will have to make strategic and tactical choices to win the game.
A turn chart of 15 moves commences in January 871AD and goes through to May 871AD.

The same game as Alfred the Great: The Great Heathen Army 871AD (Counters version) but players purchase their own 1:72 scale figures and plastic counters to make a 3D version of the game. Map will best printed in A3 size to fit miniatures on the board comfortably. UPDATE! this game was originally released as a PNP game but is no longer available, High Flying Dice Games released a hard copy zip lock game :Alfred the Great The Great Heathen Army 871AD http://www.hfdgames.com/alfred.html

name: Zpocalypse: Animal Survivor Card Pack
description:
What’s better than getting yourself as a survivor? How about a pet! This deck includes many of the animal submissions from the backers from our first Kickstarter and a few of our own devising. Some of them are walking time bombs, and others are just plain adorable. Either way having a fifth member of your Squad can come in handy when holding back a zombie horde. Whether it’s man’s best friend or a polar bear, you never know what they will bring to the Squad dynamic. This deck also includes new special abilities.

Each deck comes with 25 Survivors and 2 Blank cards for you to create your own.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies

name: Zpocalypse: Survivor Card Pack #1
description:
Thanks to the amazing backers from our first Kickstarter, we were given an army of downtrodden, desperate Survivors to add to the Zpocalypse struggle. We selected a number of them to make Survivor Packs, which include new special abilities and a host of people who think they’re ready to face the onslaught.

Each deck comes with 25 Survivors and 2 Blank cards for you to create your own.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies

name: Zpocalypse: Aftermath – Angry Joe
description: Before the Zpocalypse “Angry” Joe Vargas was a video game critic with a global military organization dedicated to protecting consumers from corporate greed. When even his mighty forces fell before the zombie hordes, Joe put out the call to his most powerful allies determined to form a Squad of the finest post-Zpocalyptic Warriors in the world! Now without his beloved video games and filled with rage, Joe has only one purpose. Kill them all!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Yummy Scrummy, What's in My Tummy?
description: A children's game where you spin a wheel and choose a monster. Each monster has one of five colours in his tummy. You are trying to collect one of each colour as a healthy fruit, while avoiding junk foods, called "oh no's".

name: Haven: Titan Command
description:
Haven: Titan Command is a 2-4 player sci-fi strategy card game set in an new and exciting galaxy where each player takes command of a hulking futuristic battle Titan. There are four rivalling factions currently at war, and each player must choose their allegiance, construct a deck and then charge into battle to claim victory for their faction.

The Core Set features over 190 cards, allowing players to build their own decks using a combination of faction and neutral cards to fully customise their Titan build. Each Titan build must carefully balance its reliance on combat equipment armed and activated during the fight, pilot manoeuvres which are activated as surprise actions to evade or ambush, and field skills which provide support from other battlefield units.

Players battle it out over a number of rounds until only one Titan is left standing victorious.

name: Typhoon: Modern Air Combat
description:
Typhoon is a set of miniatures rules for modern jet combat, specifically designed as an introductory level game for those gamers who wish to use the most current aircraft, but to not get bogged down in the complexity of hi-tech jet warfare. The game’s systems allow each player to control several jets in a fast paced game that can be easily completed in a few hours.

Modern jet combat, particularly with aircraft such as the F-22, Eurofighter, and SU-35 can be extremely complex with the wide variety of radars, ECM, DDS, weapons, etc., which can bring a game to a crawl when using these planes. Typhoon attempts to incorporate the technology into the various game systems which lets the players fly and fight their jets without having to worry about whether or not you have enough chaff or flares still left in your dispensers to defeat the enemy’s next attack.

This makes Typhoon an ideal way to get new gamers into the modern jet combat era as they can focus on the basics of jet
combat instead of memorizing a two page sequence of play. The game is designed to be used without a hex mat or special stands, so this will let gamers use any miniatures that they have and however they are currently mounted for the game.

Hopefully, Typhoon will introduce gamers to the exciting world of hitech jet combat and let them use some of the most powerful aircraft in aviation history in a fun and fast moving game.

name: The Red Masque
description:
The Red Death is running rampant throughout the country, claiming countless lives. In an attempt to avoid this plague, Prince Prospero and a thousand of his closest friends have shut themselves inside the seven rooms of his castellated abbey. One night, the prince decides to throw a masquerade ball to keep his friends entertained. But while this ball is in full swing, a masked figure, of who had not been seen before, has started to make its way throughout the rooms of the abbey. Angered by this figure’s mask of a plague ridden corpse, the prince tried to kill the figure but was killed in the process. Now the prince’s nobles are hunting for the masked figure that at some point covered its mask with another. Now nobody knows who is who in this game of bluffing, deduction, and hand management.

In this game for 2 to 6 players, the game begins with the abbey of seven rooms being built and each player receiving one role card. The roles are kept hidden as they will be revealed during game play. Each player then selects one of the seven rooms where they will start the game. On each player's turn they will have a variety of actions that will allow them to trap, kill, or reveal other players, move throughout the abbey, or use a key to unlock a trap. They can perform these actions by using the cards that they draw. The goal of the game is to be the first collect five victory points and can do so by being a Noble alive at the end of the round or by not being trapped at the end of the round if playing as The Red Death.

Awards
2014 MicroGame Contest Best Theme
2014 MicroGame Contest People's Choice - 4th Place
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play

name: Going... Going... GONE
description:
From the box:

If you've ever watched a public television auction, you know how crazy bidding can get. Sometimes, you just gotta have that item. Sometimes, you can't stand the thought of somebody else getting it, or sometimes you get caught up in it, and don't know exactly why.

Going... Going... GONE gives you all the excitement of a real auction... plus the satisfaction of a real auction... plus the satisfaction that comes from supporting a worthwhile cause.

Just as in a real auction, you get to select items of particular interest to you, which makes them worth more... and maybe, just maybe, you can get an extraordinary value. Or maybe you're more interested in getting the competition to pay more... as long as you don't get stuck. It's all part of the fun and the strategy... and since a portion of the proceeds from Going... Going... GONE go to public television, you'll also be supporting the best television you can watch.

name: Boxing
description: 2-player game. Each player must move his boxer in the box adjacent to the opponent and hit him. The punch cardboard and electric wheel randomly selects a shot and how many points collects the attacker. To the twelfth point or exits the KO shot the attacker wins the round.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Uprising: A Kingdom Asunder
description:
Take part in a rebellion in this all vs. one game! Overthrow Enderlin or defend it - your choice.

'Empires rise and empires fall. Whether through mistreatment of the locale, mismanagement of responsibility, or outside invaders all empires eventually meet their reckoning.

The reckoning day of the city of Enderlin has arrived. Civil unrest has led to rebellion. Rebel leaders take up the sword in the name of freedom. They raise their battlecry in the hopes that the people will join them in taking up arms against the King and Empire.

This is the story of Enderlin. This is the story of its Uprising...'

In Uprising, players take on the role of either the King of Enderlin or one of the Rebels working towards toppling the Empire. In this all vs. one scenario, players must defeat the opposing forces through the use of influence and diplomacy - swaying the ten unique Districts of Enderlin to their cause by the actions that they take. The Districts of Enderlin are the key to victory. Only through his influence on the people can the King squelch the rebellion that has arisen. Only through their influence on the masses can the Rebels hope to topple the tyrant. Who the player influences determines their bonuses and abilities as well as the ultimate fate of Enderlin. Use your Influence wisely to sway the Districts of Enderlin for your forces!
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Hot Tin Roof: Deluxe Catwalks
description:
Adds 4 tiles and the following rules to the base game:

1. During setup, each player must take 1 deluxe catwalk in his own color.
2. As soon as ALL players have earned at least 1 fish tile from the fish market, you may place your deluxe catwalk instead of one of your regular catwalks. Any cat that crosses a deluxe catwalk must pay the owner 2 instead of the usual 1.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: IJA Tank Division Series: Operation Ichi-Go
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #118

IJA Tank Division Series: Operation Ichi-Go is a two-player operational game of the Imperial Japanese Army Operation Ichi-Go. It was launched in April 1944 to conquer Southern China.

One player controls IJA, the other Chinese forces (National Revolutionary Army).

This game uses a basic system of The Battle of Changde: Operation Yo Go.

name: Tower War
description:
A two-player game with Looney Pyramids and playing cards. Players each begin with a stash of 15 Looney Pyramids, and draft 15-card individual decks from a standard 54-card deck (13 cards in each suit, plus 2 jokers).

They then play in battles of three skirmishes each, where the high card determines the winner of each skirmish. The loser of a skirmish contributes a pyramid to the tower, and the loser of a battle contributes any further pyramids needed to complete a set of three, plus a card to raise the tower to its next level. If a player is unable to play a pyramid, or knocks over the tower, his opponent wins.

name: Henchmen!
description:
This game reminds us how important henchmen are when it comes to attaching lasers to sharks and getting things done that we don’t want to get caught doing ourselves! Henchmen are the backbone of society but they’re never appreciated and are often killed, strangled, beat up, or even shot off of high ledges...and this game won't be any different!

3 to 6 players will work with or against each other to earn as much ca$h as possible before the end of the game in order to please Da Boss but watch out, taking on a job could alert the Super Jerk who won't think twice to kill half of everyone's henchmen! If 5 Super Jerks are revealed, the game will end and the player with the most ca$h will be declared the winner.

Henchmen! is a fun, easy to learn game that is fast paced and has great replay value. The art was all done by the game's designer Daniel Lanza and was styled to be a call-back to famous television shows and movies of the 80's and 90's that truly emphasized the henchmen stereotype we all grew up loving.

We hope you enjoy this truly unique game!
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Negotiation, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Shinkukan
description:
Shinkukan is a deck building, head-to-head collectible card game, akin to Magic or Pokemon. With the world, art, and visual designs created by artist John Hathway, and game system designer Takashi Sakaue, this is JH Lab's latest attempt to expand "true understanding" of otaku culture.

The game is set in a possible future world where science and spirituality have merged, causing a certain regression of technology. Mainly, it is found that spirits could be contained in now-defunct vacuum tubes, which could in turn be used to power various robots and androids. Human beings could transfer their consciousness into androids, and man-made androids could develop human intelligence. The world has embraced this discovery, doing away with any national, religious or ethnic segregation. Instead, people are identified by their intelligence.

The game utilizes 4 different types of cards. 1, The Android Cards are your main cards which are built up and strengthened by the other cards. 2, The Resource Cards strengthen the androids. 3, The Unique Resrouce Cards are one time use cards capable of changing the properties of gameplay. And, 4, Assist Cards are one time use robots that have the ability to shift the flow of battle! Using these cards, your goal is either to destroy all your opponent's androids, or completely deplete their main card deck.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Spice Winds
description:
Spice Winds is a card game, where the cards, and the whole table become the board. Players play ship captains and traders in a wild and hardly explored archipelago, exploring and trading between the islands, trying to make their fortunes.

The game is made up from a custom card deck:
Some cards are scattered on the playing surface and become the islands to trade between.
Some form an event deck - controlling random events that may beset players journeying between islands
Others form a marketplace that is used to control the price of goods throughout the game
The remainder are used to record player wealth, ships' cargo or provide player information and determine other events through the game.

Players seek to generate wealth through trade, and convert this into stockpiles of spices ready to ship back to the Old World. The first to amass a stockpile of 5 chests of spice is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Exploration, Print & Play
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Point to Point Movement

name: TARDIS Run
description:
Many of the Doctor's most feared opponents have teleported into the TARDIS to steal the last copy of the Black Scroll of Rassilon from the TARDIS library. With no one else, the Doctor's past regenerations have been gathered to help. Whoever finds the Black Scroll and escapes first wins!

TARDIS Run is a 3D printed, Print 'n Play, two-player game as inspired by Backgammon, Parcheesi and Senet, a game played by the Ancient Egyptians. This game turns the standard "roll and move" upside down by making you choose which character to move before you throw the paddles and add them up to move the piece you've chosen. But the very uneven distribution of the paddles means you can rely on the pieces probably moving 3 spaces. However, when the black scroll of Rassilon is found (by rolling all blanks) with it's 2x multiplier on one side the statistics become considerably harder to predict.

The board for this game is designed to fold into a neat carrying case that holds everything necessary to play inside.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Whitewater: Jutting Jetties
description:
This official Mayfair promo expansion is included on a tile sheet titled: Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #10, which can be found in issue #175 of GTM.

Includes two River Hex tiles.

SETUP:
You may place either or both of the 3-hex tiles anywhere on your river boards as long as two of the three hexes line up with river hexes underneath.

Treat these tile river features as you would any on the standard the board tiles (sic). These tiles do not move during gameplay.
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game

name: Colmar 1945
description:
Game covers fights for "Colmar Pocket" held in central Alsace, France by the German Nineteenth Army from November 1944-February 1945, against the U.S. 6th Army Group during World War II. The French First Army has notable role in this sturggle.

Game was published in 28th issue of "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine.

name: Super Tooth: Euoplocephalus Promo Card
description: This promo card was originally made available at PretzCon as part of the Super Tooth 2014 PretzCon edition. The card shares the special ability of the Triceratops and the Herbivorous Heroes, the ability to chase off Meat-Eaters.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric

name: Anno Domini: Bern
description:
Each Anno Domini game consists of 340 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other. Anno Domini: Bern focuses on the capital city of Switzerland. Like all Anno Domini sets, this game can be played as a standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

In Anno Domini: Bern, each player receives nine cards (or fewer, if you want the game to be shorter) and may look only at the descriptions. In turn, players place a card on the table, trying to place their card in chronological order to those already present. Instead of adding a card, a player may claim that the order in which the cards have been placed is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.

If the order is correct, then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order is incorrect, then the previous player – who accepted the order as correct or made it incorrect through her own placement – receives three cards. The first player with no cards remaining in hand wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Wenn ich groß bin ...
description:
A jobs-themed collection of games for very young children.

The game contains 7 picture cards (each consisting of two jigsaw parts) showing a profession, 7 wooden pieces (something to to with these jobs, like a fire for the fire rescuer) and a draw bag.

In the basic game, the players take turns turning over two jigsaw pieces. If they match, the player gets the picture card and the wooden piece that goes with it. The player with the most wooden pieces wins the game.

Variants include one in which the players not only have to find the matching jigsaw pieces but also the corresponding wooden piece in the draw bag (by touch only, without looking), and another one in which one player secretly draws one of the wooden pieces and the other players have to guess his/her job by asking yes/no questions.

name: Babylon 5: The Board Game – 2259 Starter Kit – Earth
description:
In the Babylon 5 Component Game System, you take control of a certain faction which is trying to gain power in the galaxy. You play the role of an ambassador on board Babylon 5. You explore the vast stretches of space, lead huge fleets into battle, and control the economy of your faction. There are several ways to achieve victory ranging from economic growth to all out militaristic control of the universe. Diplomacy is not to be neglected either, as the more powerful game changes are brought up in Babylon 5 council vote to be decided.

You construct your playing 'board' using hexagonal shaped pieces that come with the game. The various pieces are different and can represent a multitude of things so that the game is different every time you play. In addition to the board and the ships that move on it, there are cards. Players may buy cards allowing special actions above and beyond the normal game, like an extra move or more EPs.

Using your faction's wealth and resources you play the game and explore the map. You search for planets to colonize and possibly conquer. Use your fleets to engage in battles and use characters to assist you in reaching your faction's goals. The choices are yours and will decide if your faction is successful.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Mia and me: Salviamo Centopia
description:
Mia and me: Rescue Centopia is a cooperative game, with Mia and me theme.
The players move their figures on the 3D board to collect the 20 Trumptus pieces.
During his turn, each player:

moves his figure on the board, according to his energy (a value from 1 to 4).
draws the tile on the space he lands. If it's a Trumptus piece, he can collect it. If it's an enemy, he has to lose an energy or come back on the starting space (and put the tile face down).
draws a card and apply the effect. It could be an enemy or a bonus card (gives an energy to a player or goes to a new space)


If the players collect the 20 Trumptus pieces and go to the Panthea's castle, they win. If the cards end, they lose.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Turn Coats
description:
Materials
A hexhex5 board
A supply of bi-colored stones

Definitions
Adjacent – meaning orthogonally or diagonally.

Setup
Set the empty board between the two players and place the bi-colored stones nearby so both players can reach them.

Play
The bi-colored stones are communal.

One player plays black the other player plays white.

Black starts, turns then alternate.

On a player first turn they will place one stone friendly side up onto an empty cell on the board.

Henceforth players on their turn must take one of the following actions, which consist of two steps.

1. (A) Place a stone onto any empty cell friendly side up. (B) Then move another friendly stone already on the board in a straight line to another empty cell, as long as the stone has a clear path orthogonally or diagonally, then end the move by flipping the stone to your opponents color or

2. (A) Place a stone onto any empty cell friendly side up. (B) Then using another friendly stone that is already on the board jump over two friendly adjacent stones and end the jump on an empty cell directly after. Complete the turn by flipping the two friendly stones that where jumped over to your opponents color.

Object
A player wins if he manages to form a straight line of four adjacent pieces in his opponents color or his opponent is unable to take his turn.

name: Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-1: Environments
description: In Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-1: Environments, Pixel Lincoln is up for re-election and along with that comes all new environment cards that change the way that levels work. See how wind effects Pixel Lincoln, pushing him back further and further. Spikes are deadly and prevent players from jumping. Warp zones allow players to swap levels. You will want to play these!

name: Imperial Orion
description:
Imperial-Orion is a print and play derivative of Imperial 2030 by Mac Gerdts.

It takes the basic premise of Imperial, that the players are amoral financiers and twists it so that players are shadowy 'powers' in a grand space opera. The game takes its name from the Orion Nebula which is used as the backdrop to the central (neutral) region of human (known) space.

At some time in the future humans have expanded among the stars. In the more densely populated areas colonies are connected by wormhole networks whilst vast fleets span the trackless expanses of the void. Contact has been made with a number of alien races around the periphery of human space but for the most part this has been peaceful and limited to scientific missions and the exchange of ambassadors. As a generalisation humanity is content, inward looking and exploited - by you, the players of the game.

This game is played on a board composed of 7 hexagonal tiles, comprising 6 regional powers and a central neutral zone that may have different configurations depending on the episode of galactic 'history' the players choose to replay. Additional part-tiles are arranged around the edge of the board to make the playing area into a regular hexagon. These part-tiles are of 2 different types and can have a significant effect on the topology of the game board.

In Imperial-Orion the players do not take turns, the six regional powers do, in an order that is determined randomly at the start of each game. The players are shadowy organisations who exercise power through unspecified means to further their own ends. By gaining control of the population of the regional powers,
the players influence the politics. The player with more control over a region's population gains control of that power's government and decides what the it will do. As control of a government can change with each new surge of controlled population, players may be able to manipulate several governments at the same time. As investors, players should not get too attached to a particular regional power, but rather focus on where their 'investments' have the best rates of return. Essentially the game is about power, in all its form: economic, cultural, military, biological…
categories: Economic, Political, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Point to Point Movement, Stock Holding, Variable Phase Order

name: Flippin' Fruit: Melon Mowbray
description:
This is an exclusive promo card for backers of the Kickstarter campaign.

The Melon is simply added to the Fruit Basket deck and when played, it counts as any fruit when it comes to flipping your dice.

name: Shatranj Kamil
description:
As documented by Harold Murray and John Gollon, Shatranj Kamil was an early and largely unsuccessful attempt to expand the game of Shatranj. The board has been enlarged from 8x8 to 10x10, and in addition to two more pawns, each player is given two of a new piece, the camel, which jumps two spaces in a straight orthogonal line (i.e. it is an orthogonal counterpart to the elephant and significantly weaker than the rook). The camels have variously been placed in the corners, in the fourth and seventh columns, and possibly in other configurations. The rules and pieces are otherwise the same as in Shatranj. The word "kamil" does not refer to the camel piece, but instead means "perfect" or "complete".

This game should not be confused with Tamerlane Chess, which is also referred to as Shatranj Kamil; most likely there were several other variants being ascribed the status of higher perfection.

name: Starlight Stage
description:
スターライトステージ基本セット (Starlight Stage) is a card game in which players produce newcomer idols who have various talents into top celebrity idols and collect popularity points.

There are three types of card decks on the table:
Idol cards have combinations of three talent types (note, diamond, and heart) and popularity points.
Produce cards have popularity points.
Event cards have special resources necessary to get more talented idol cards.

Each player have three initial idol cards of single talent of each type. The start player plays one of idol cards to either
(1) take a lesson and acquire a single talent chip,
(2) get an event card, only for this action multiple idol cards can be played,
(3) get a produce card,
(4) replace the played idol card by a new idol card from the table.

Each card has acquire costs which is paid by talents of played idol card, resources from previously acquired event cards, and additional talent chips. Then the next player plays his idol card. When every player take turns, the round ends and each player reclaim played idol cards, and the next round begins with the start player shifted to the next player.

At the end of round when the produce card deck is expired, the game ends and the player with the most popularity points from his/her idol cards and produce cards combined wins the game.

•••

アイドルプロデュースカードゲーム『スターライトステージ』は、
アイドル事務所のブロデューサーとなって、新人アイドル達を個性豊かに成長させ、様々な仕事に挑戦させてたくさん人気を集める事を目指すゲームです。

それぞれのプレイヤーの元には、新人アイドル、新人女優、新人モデルの3人のアイドルがいます。
彼女たちの音楽・演技・魅力の才能を使い、イベントをこなして実績を獲得しましょう。
実績を集めれば、より才能と人気の高いアイドルに成長できます。
アイドルが成長したら、プロデュースに挑戦して賞を獲得したり大舞台を成功させて人気を得ましょう！
1番人気を集めたプレイヤーの勝利となります。
あなたのアイドル達と、目指せ、名プロデューサー！
publishers: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: Chicken Caesar: Metallicus Promo Card
description:
Metallicus is a promotional rooster card included in Mars Needs Mechanics. It has unique art and ability and can replace one of player roosters during game setup.

The card ability reads:
At game end, this rooster can trade both of his own bronze insignia tokens for a single silver insignia of his choice, OR he may trade two silver insignia for a Caesar insignia.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Political

name: Pick-a-Dog: Polar Bear Expansion
description:
Expansion contains three additional cards with elements common with Pick-a-Dog and Pick-a-Polar Bear games. As those cards are rare and hard to match with other cards from the base game, players get more (2 or 3) points for them.

The fourth card contains instruction with illustration of all cards matching with the expansion.

This expansion was published as a promo for the SPIEL 2013. Fair's name and date is printed on the instruction card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Duel of Legends
description:
Duel of Legends is a combat card game where the players take on the roles of Legends of different class types. They use Weapon and Defense items, along with Spell cards to try and defeat their opponents and be the last legend standing.

Average play time per Duel is 5-10 mins (2 players). Turns are fast but every choice has game changing effects. Easy Learning Curve: Most players feel comfortable with the game after 1 or 2 Duels. The game mechanics are simple, it’s the choices you make that separate the beginners from the veterans.

Over 1200 Class:Equipment Combinations, over 1.3 million starting Combinations. (with spells) Up to 4 players: Adding more players changes the dynamic of the game dramatically. Deciding who to attack and when is a key factor. In the end there can be only one, so allies don’t stay allies long.

name: Come About
description:
In Come About players are maritime merchant traders in command of a fleet of trading ships navigating along many perilous trade routes. The player with the most ships along the most number of trade routes is declared “Nauclerokubernetes”, the Greek word for merchant-master.

Materials
64 double sided tiles, two sets of 32 tiles in two colors Red and Green.
A way of keeping score.

Play
Come About is played on a board-less playing surface.

Two players Red and Green have each two sets of 16 double sided tiles in their chosen color.

Red starts by placing a tile either side up onto the table.
Players then take turns placing a tile alongside another existing tile, connecting trade routes ( the dotted lines) across tile edges.

The game ends when all the tiles have been played.

A trade route is a continuous dotted line or loop containing 3 or more ships in either players color.

The player having the majority of ships in his color on a trade route scores 1 point for each of his ships. If a trade route has an equal number of ships in both colors, then neither player scores along that trade route.

The player with the highest score wins.

name: Colour Wheel
description: Colour Wheel is a simple to learn, easy to play card game that teaches ROYGBIV color theory. The object is to be the first to have no cards left in your hand. Players lay down cards to make an ever-expanding wheel, creating a unique work of art every time it's played.

name: Hamster Ball Challenge
description:
Race down the slopes in your hamster ball while passing checkpoints and avoiding obstacles that could give you a nasty headache and end your hopes to be declared Hamster Ball Champion!

Hamster Ball Challenge! is a 2-player racing microgame consisting of 8 counters and a custom deck of 30 cards. On each turn, players choose one of three actions: place a track card, change speed, or move. Track cards contain goals, obstacles, and variable slopes. Increasing speed moves hamsters more quickly to the finish lessens control of the hamster ball. Players may also ram each other.

The game ends when a hamster reaches the finish, when a hamster is disqualified, or when a hamster ball is destroyed. Points are given for each checkpoint passed. Five additional points are given to hamsters that reach the finish. The racer with the most points is declared Hamster Ball Champion!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Oklahoma Boomers: Sooners
description:
Oklahoma Boomers: Sooners is a mini-expansion for Oklahoma Boomers, that adds 3 Sooner meeples to the game.

"Sooners entered the prairie before the official start of the Land Run. Even though that was not allowed. As penalty they must help the boomers by placing cornerstones. But beware! Sooners can suddenly change from a good help to a big threat!"

The mini-expansion contains 3 grey Sooner meeples (and 6 stickers), that are placed on the board at the beginning of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure

name: Land of the Free:  Wargames Rules for North America 1754-1815
description: Land of the Free is a set of wargaming rules from Osprey that allows players to recreate the various conflicts that broke out in North America shortly prior to and just after Independence, including the French and Indian Wars, the American War for Independence, the Northwest Indian War, and the War of 1812. This set of rules lets players begin their campaigns with small warbands of 10-20 miniatures of any scale and develop their forces over time, building them into armies hundreds strong. A unique system of command points and the need to carefully manage resources or risk becoming vulnerable to counter-attack have to be finely balanced against the need to gain objectives throughout the game, creating a challenging, but enjoyable environment for your armies.
categories: American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Citizen Cane
description:
Citizen Cane is a dice-drafting game in which 2-4 Christmas elves vie to build their gift-building empires!

Each turn, players roll a die for each elf on their team with up to two re-rolls - then all the rolled dice are pooled and players draft the numbers they want for that turn. Dice are spent to join elf unions that grant players special abilities, buy things with candy-cane currency at the quartermaster's stores or get on with the work of building, wrapping and tagging gifts for Santa.

Citizen Cane is a single-sheet game that relies only on a few items most gamers will already have around the house, and is intended to be printed on the inside face of Christmas cards for gamers.

name: Classic Gold Pop Trivia
description:
Pop trivia card game in a tin box. There is six categories of questions: 60's, 70's, 80's, Brit pop, Soul and Songs & Song writers. There is also one deck of questions with thematic picture. And last there is score sheet, pen and die. There is 2100 standard questions and 300 pictured questions.

Question master rolls the die and ask question corresponding to the number rolled. If player in turn answers correctly he/she gets a mark to that category. If the answer is wrong he/she gets nothing. In both cases he/she will be the next question master. Game goes on until one player has marked all categories. The player with most marks wins.

So what we do with the pictured cards? If question master rolls a six and player answers right, then he/she may request additional picture card question. Question master then asks all six questions on that card. Player gets extra points (number of right answer -2). He/she adds/subtracts the amount from category he/she already has marks. So category 6 (Songs & Song writers) seems to be more substantial than others.

name: Platoon Leader: Red Devils!
description: Red Devils! is the new, second expansion for the Platoon Leader game system. Hop into the action at Arnhem where you'll fight to stay alive and maybe even change history! Red Devils! continues the same exciting style of game play established with Platoon Leader: random draw to determine when and where the enemy is, suppression, reaction, its all here and more...

name: ATS: Winter War
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System returns to Finland in this module pitting the might and mass of the Soviet war machine against the resourceful and determined Finns during The Winter War of 1939.

This module comes with four beautifully-rendered geomorphic maps, six scenarios, all the personnel, weapon and vehicle counters required to play (including new artwork for the Finns) and a Battlefield Walkaround booklet with special rules and historical notes.

Standard ATS markers, playaids and Rules are required and not included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tomodachi Maze
description:
Tomodachi Maze is a small, solitaire, maze game based on the Japanese Momotaro folk tale. Two double-sided cards are included as the play surface. Players start at the center of of the start card and move around the paths until they reach the edge of the card. At that point, you can do one of two things:

1) Flip the card
2) Explore

If you do either of these things and the path does not connect, you cannot continue this way and you must go back and try a new path. Continue until you find each of Momotaro's friends and then head off to Ghost Island to finish!

name: Zwikken
description:
Zwikken is a Dutch betting game played with a twenty-card deck of traditional playing cards: AKQJT in four suits.

Ante, deal three cards each, and turn the top card for the trump suit. The player to the left of the dealer opens bidding. The high bidder leads any card.

Cards are played according to these rules of precedent:
1. Play any card of the suit led.
2. Beat all trumps in play.
3. Play any trump.
4. Play any card.

Highest trump wins the trick. Otherwise it goes to the highest card of the suit led. The winner leads the next trick.

Aside from a couple rules complications, the high bidder either (A) wins the pot by collecting two of three tricks or (B) loses and doubles the pot for the next round.

name: Okashinobi
description:
オカシノビ is a game modeling the epic struggle between the ninjas of the Mushroom and Bamboo Shoot factions. It employs hidden team affiliations, asymmetric player powers and inter-player combat using a rock-paper-scissors resolution. In addition to the Mushrooms and Bamboo Shoots, each game also incorporates a set of neutral factions: so the agendas of each player are never clear.

Players manage a hand of six cards: all different; each with a faction symbol (Mushroom, Bamboo Shoot or Neutral) in addition to the image of a rock, paper or scissors hand gesture. In a player's turn she may:

Pass a card from hand secretly to another player to inquire as to their faction loyalties. For the most part, a player responds "yes" if their affiliation matches the card, and "no" otherwise. Some player affiliations require a false response to any query!
Attack another player. Both players select a card from hand, then reveal together. If tied, another card is played. Cards played are unavailable for re-use until all six cards have been played: at that point all are reclaimed.
Reclaim one played card to her hand.


The various player powers affect the actions: some are strong one-shot powers; others more modest powers that always apply.

The game continues until one faction has achieved their victory.
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)

name: Politburo
description:
In Politburo, you play a politburo member in a totalitarian regime, responsible for a five-year plan. You have a secret personal objective as well but anyone not following the party line may be purged.

At the end of the game, you score 1 point for each plan that was executed according to your objective but you also lose 1 point for each time you have been purged.

The players take turns to play the general secretary and lead the turn through three distinct phases:

1. Plan: The general secretary proposes one of the three ministries of defence, finance and security and calls for an open vote. The ministry approved by a majority of the members enters the execution phase.

2. Execution: The general secretary appoints three members for a secret execution where they choose between repression and reforming.
a) If they are unanimous, the ministry adds 1 point for repression and subtracts 1 point for reforming.
b) If no unanimity is attained in three attempts, the ministry is unchanged and the three members enter the purge phase.

3. Purge: The members secretly points out another member to purge.If a member is pointed out by the other two, he or she loses 1 influence.

The players’ objectives may be related to the repression or reforming of one or more ministries or to the other members’ influence. They may coincide or collide.

There is a delicate balance between pushing the common agenda towards your own agenda and avoiding the "blame game" that may follow. You need political alliances but your allies will take any opportunity to purge you!

name: Bedlam
description:
Bedlam is a card-shedding party game with ever-changing rules.

Players are dealt a hand of cards at the beginning of the game and play same suit or number onto the discard pile if they can. However each player has their own rules card (e.g. When playing a red card, players must say 'better red than dead!') which they enforce by giving penalty cards to players who do not abide by them. There is also a shared rule card visible to all players.

The first player to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

name: ChromaWerks
description:
ChromaWerks was designed for the 18 Card Microgame Contest on BGG.

In ChromaWerks each player uses 9 double sided cards (shuffled) to make a 3x3 grid. Each quadrant of each card is a different color and type of machinery: Red Gears, Yellow Drive Belts, and Blue Pipes. There are also sections of 'broken' machinery with images of damaged components on a black background. Players must take turns completing one of four actions (Flip, Rotate, Slide, or Swap cards) to try to get all four center squares to be completed parts of the machine (solid colors).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Tradeworld
description:
Theme
Global trade needs to have the monopoly of goods. To obtain it, you must prevail over your competitors!

Tradeworld is a dice rolling pocketgame, where players have to collect the five colours of the cubes for declare themselves the Lord of the Global Trade!

Gameplay
Each player, in his turn, roll a die and compare the value came out with a table of permitted actions and performs one of his choice. The choices are between moving their marker on the map of the world, take / exchange a cube from the map or take / exchange a cube with the opponent, if present on the same continent.
When a player has collected at least one cube for each colour (12 cubes in 5 colours are contained in varying numbers in the game) is declared the winner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: U.S.S.R (Ultra Simple Skirmish Rules)
description:
20 pages of easy to play WWII skirmishing for two or more squads of two to ten figures. Comes with mission and objective cards and two play summary sheets.

For use with 28mm miniatures.

Both players selects an objective, and two blanks at the start of the game. Thus nether side knows what (or where) the other sides objective is.

name: Reino de Ambar
description:
In Reino de Ambar (Kingdom of Amber), players assume the roles of heads of influential families, politically and militarily, in the kingdom. In the shadows, players compete for prosperity and reputation. As head of the family, each player tries, through the skillful use of his seven cards Action, increase the power, influence and prestige of his family, avoiding in turn be destroyed by barbarian hordes who claim ravage the kingdom.

When you play an action card, you can add influence in places where influential people in the kingdom. So, for example, when you choose to increase its influence on the Market, Gold increases its access; or when providing care to the Castle, receives more influence; or when visiting the wicked witch who lives in the Cave removes a marker of influence of one of his opponents.

Each player along just seven rounds, following his own path, make its own choices with action cards from his hand to try to gain prestige.

In each round the players have also should try to solve two of the most serious problems plaguing the Kingdom. Whenever a problem is resolved their savior can enhance their prestige or position, use the special Confident or hire the services of places or personalities. In contrast, if the problems that appear in each round to win the barbarians are resolved. Rarely, the best choice is obvious, but often not be. A good player will find the right moments to make the best use of their cards and solve problems.

At the end of the game, the player with the most accumulated prestige is the winner.

name: Admin Test Item 2
description: The sequel to admin test item.

name: Card City Nights
description:
A simple TCG game with an interesting mechanic about the disposition of card in a 3x3 grid (resembling Tic-Tac-Toe)

There are 4 types of cards: attack (red sword icon), defend (blue shield icon), revitalization (green cross icon) and neutral (yellow circle icon). Also, the cards may have arrows in one or more 8-way directions (up, diagonal up-right, right, diagonal down-right...) Each player starts with a 3x3 grid, 10 points of life and a deck of 25-40 cards. With the flip of a coin is decided the order of playing, at the first turn you must draw 5 cards and play 1 card, for the rest of the match you must have 5 cards in your hand (except when you have 0 cards on your deck)

The purpouse of the game is to combine at least 2 cards to produce a combination of at least 3 symbols. To combine the cards you must put them in the 3x3 grids and achieve to match the arrows (for example, a card in the second row and second column with an up arrow matches with a card with a down arrow that is in the first row and second column). The effect is determined by the greatest symbol value (except neutral, that haves no effect), in case of draw (for example, 2 sword and 2 crosses) the player chooses what effect it should be. Attack effect (sword) deducts 1 point of defence from the life of the opponent for each sword in the combination OR you can disable a card in the rival's 3x3 grid. Defence adds to the player 1 point of life for each shield in the combination. Revitalization can undisable 1 card in your grid.

There are 2 ways to win the game: by reducing the rival's life to 0 OR when the rival have cards in the hand and cannot play a card (the grid is filled with 9 cards that cannot combine in this turn) It should be noted that when a player haves 0 cards in its deck, losses 1 point of life at the start of his turn.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Tile Placement

name: All-Star Baseball Card Game
description:
The All-Star Baseball Card Game is a system for using your own collection of baseball cards to simulate a game, a series, or an entire season. Teams are only limited by your collection and your imagination!

The game uses a 10-sided pitcher's die, and a 12-sided batter's die to determine outcomes based upon the players' statistics and the included tables. Each roll of the dice represents a single at-bat; the game information is then recorded with your own pencil and paper.

Advanced rules are included to permit for stolen bases, extra bases, and double plays.

name: The Magnates: A Game of Power – Princehood
description: The Magnates: A Game of Power – Princehood is a promotional card for The Magnates that grants the owner of the card an additional three points at the end of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management

name: Geeks and Tonic
description:
Geeks and Tonic is a hilarious, fast-paced and slightly nostalgic drinking game. With characters like "Mrs. Pongman" and "Trashd Brandycoot", it takes everything you love about your favourite games and turns it into an evening (or morning if you're into that) of inebriated bliss. The cards are easy to understand and follow even after you are well into the game, which is really helpful. The expansion possibilities are limitless!

With fast paced, turn based, PVP drinking combat! Keep up or be taken out!

GOAL: To get 5 Points in Chieveable cards before your opponents do; and to drink and have fun :)

CONTENTS: 108 card deck: 12 heroes, 60 action cards, 35 cheivables, 1 Instruction card(extra hero card if you choose a reward that includes it!)
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: Dark Age: Fanaticism
description:
"His will be done". Deadly Archangels will be descending from the heavens to unleash the wrath of the Lord on to the unholy of Samaria with Fanaticism, the next trilling expansion to the Dark Age table top game.

Fanaticism brings forth the Council of Prevailers and their Warknights, the Archangels. Prime human specimens, augmented by physical grafts, crammed into a highly advanced suit of armour, with a mind wiped clean by psycho-genic conditioning, making them the perfect soldiers and all the latest miniatures belonging to all the various factions that belong to this awesome game.

This is an essential source book for any Dark Age collector who wishes to know the rules and backgrounds in exquisite detail for to all the heroes and warmachines belonging to the Fanaticism expansion, all encased in a beautiful hardback book.

name: Dragon Valley: Kickstarter Exclusive – Kings Aid Cards
description:
If Kickstarter backers pledged at Noble level or higher each copy of Dragon Valley came with three exclusive King's Aid Cards (Lure, Teleport and Monument) that will not be included in the production run of the game.

Lure - Why let your opponents get all the glory for defeating formidable foes? Use rumors of treasures to lure dragons and orcs to your heroes.

Teleport - Your lands are vast. To quicken your advance to the front lines or into a siege in the valley, the King can send a mage that specializes in teleportation.

Monument - In an effort to demonstrate the greatness of your Barony, this ability allows you to use building materials towards a great monument, scoring end game points.

name: Senet-modern
description:
Senet is an ancient Egyptian board game.

Senet and Senet-modern are almost looks same but Senet-modern rule is arranged and renewed more speedy, offensive and strategic.

Players move own 5 pieces due to 2 dice number and be up the goal side.

One difference is that players can make opponent's piece out of board and another is Senet-modern pieces are printed different number's dots 1 to 5. Number is score.
The winner is the player who get more score when 3 pieces(both own and opponent) are upped.

name: Channeling
description:
Channeling is a game of tactical spellcasting. Each match represents a battle between channeling wizards - be it a schoolyard quarrel at the academy, the real stakes struggle of a magical war or a grand clash on the very edges of reality.

The players draw cards from a standard decks full of basic spells, but each sorcery cast and summoned magical entity becomes unique combination between its original form and the channeling abilities of the caster.

There are different modes of play - in the most basic one that's recommended for learning, each player may cast trough the four basic elemental channels (Flame, Rock, Frost and Lightning) before dabbling in asymmetrical duels where the same elements are randomly drawn and duels utilizing advanced channels and player powers.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: The Arab-Israeli Wars: Tank Battles in the Mideast – Lebanon: New Scenario for Arab Israeli Wars
description: Published in The General 21/6, add new counters ( MBT Merkava, T-72, Gazelle helicopters, and MRL artillery) and 5 new scenarios for arab Israeli Wars.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Ca$h 'n Guns (Second Edition): The Cop
description:
Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition) Expansion: The Cop adds four new guns, new loot cards, and new unique player powers to the Ca$h 'n Guns base game.

What's more, this expansion includes one element present in the original Ca$h 'n Gun$ game: role cards that place one player in the role of an undercover policeman who has infiltrated the criminal underworld. Over the course of the game, this player must try to sound the alarm before everyone has finished splitting the loot.

name: Villainous Vikings (Second Edition): Ernie the Geek Promo
description:
"The bow of his Longship splits the water like the skulls of his countless victims. His reputation precedes him, causing panicked villagers to abandon the town to escape his wrath. From Greenland to Constantinople he is known as the scourge of mankind. Every corner of the known world fears the sight of his vengeful prow. Stepping onto shore, the ground trembles at the might of... Ernie the Geek?"

Expand your crew in this BoardGameGeek exclusive promo pack for Villainous Vikings 2nd Edition. You can now give four different Ernie captains control of your Longship in your continuing quest for gold, glory, and Valhalla. Each of the new Ernie captains gives a unique bonus that makes for a wild, unpredictable game.

Comes with four unique captains based on BGG's beloved mascot, Ernie the Geek.

name: Ritual
description:
Now is your chance. The kingdom is falling to ruin. The land has stopped producing food, the populace is starving, and the king is powerless to help. No longer relegated to the shadows you and other Necromancers like you may emerge; offering understanding and defeat over death itself to the fearful people in exchange, merely, for their unquestioning and total obedience.

Your goal is to destroy all your opponents' villages and be the last necromancer left alive. Utilize the deaths of your enemies’ servants or even sacrifice your own to fuel your dark magic. Use your cards to build up your villages and summon afflictions and monstrosities to set upon, attack, and destroy your opponents’. You win when every other player is undead. Become the last in power and leave destruction in your wake. Nevertheless, beware your fallen foes--for, as a Necromancer, death is but a tool.

In Ritual, you always have a chance to come back and steal the win. It’s a fun and unpredictable cutthroat card game for 3-5 players which is easy to learn and quick to play, yet offers significant strategic depth. How can you best use the cards you've drawn? Who shall you attack first? When will you make your final move and crush all who oppose you?

name: All The Kingdom's Men
description:
Todos los Hombres del Reino (All the Kingdom's Men) is a Decktet playable game.

The players must ride around all the kingdom's regions.
The player who gains the favor of all the Lords wins the game.

The game is playable with Decktet but it has been redesigned for an easier game experience. It adds four new Decktet cards for an advanced game. You will also need several tokens and the Decktet chips.

To gain the favor of the region Lords, player must pay resources according to their travel cost. Then the region cards are activated and executed.

If no region can be activated, player must pass. Optionally, on his turn, player can ride, paying the cost of travel (one resource, with different types for each round).

To indicate that a region has been activated, it should be marked with a token; when a player has placed all his tokens in all the regions, he has won the game.
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Stetsons & Sixguns
description:
What’s been missing in every wild-west shootout game you’ve ever played? That’s right: you don’t get to point guns at one another. Well, now you can!

Stetsons & Sixguns is a fast-paced card game played over 8 rounds. Channelling iconic characters from classic Western adventures, 2-8 players compete to become the most notorious gunslinger in town.

Beginning with 4 Action Cards, you secretly select an Action to play, then draw your gun and point it at your target. Decide whether to tough it out or dive for cover and reveal your Action Card. Every Sixgun has Bullet counters loaded into its 6 chambers. Flip a Bullet to see whether you hit your target. They may be protected by Cover or the Action they played, but you can counter this with your own Action or a wily Special Ability unique to each character. Those of you still standing at the end of the round gain a new Action to play.

Players gain Notoriety for shooting other ‘slingers and holding valuable cards at the end of the game.

Expect lots of bangs and laughter: Stetsons & Sixguns is fast, furious fun that puts the ‘gun’ back into ‘gunfight’.
categories: American West, Card Game, Print & Play

name: 7 little korpokkurs
description:
Publisher's summary:
コロポックル　見～つけた! (7 little korpokkurs) is a children's game published in Japanese and English.

A Korpokkur is a small fairy in the Hokkaido district in Japan. In this game, you play hide and seek with Korpokkurs. You trade chips and gather not leaves but Korpokkurs. Simple rules and easy to play with small children, but adults can play it as a harder mind game.

Publisher's summary:
アイヌのコロポックルたちが隠れんぼしています。
プレイヤーはフキの葉に隠れるコロポックル達を捕まえましょう。
ルールは簡単。でも心理戦の熱い、チップ交換ゲームです。

name: Long way home
description:
Long way home is a game for 3 to 6 players about a drunk guy trying to get home. But, due to his drunkenness, he gets a lot of ideas. Some of them are good, some of them not so much. But all of them sound fun. At least to him.

In a game players are playing as ideas in a drunk guys head. They are controlling him, and his actions, trying to achieve secret objectives. There are two types of objectives, big ones, that happen at the end of the game, and small ones that are scored when done. Big objectives are connected to finishing the game - Get home in time, Give wife flowers, sober up, or lose consciousness in bar, while small objectives are different, some logical (eat a hamburger, drink coffee), some irrational (punch person in bar), and some just plain crazy (eat a flower, punch a wall).

The game is print and play, and files and rules can be found in files section.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mushroom Hunters
description:
You and your fellow players are mushroom hunters. You're attempting to go out onto the mushroom mountain and bring back the most mushrooms, while also selling them for the best price at market. Mushroom Hunters is played using colored meeples, curved mushroom cards, and flat price cards. Who will be the best mushroom hunter?!

Initial setup of the game requires mixing up all of the curved mushroom cards and kind of shoving them into a big pile (aka mushroom mountain). Then shuffle all of the market / price cards and deal the top five face up and place the rest in a deck face down (which I messed up for this picture, oops!). Each player gets all 5 of their specified meeple color.

On each player's turn, they can take one of the following three actions:

1) Place one of your meeples on any ONE mushroom card on mushroom mountain. The meeple must have both feet touching the card and must be STANDING in order to count. If it falls, I think you must remove it from mushroom mountain and your turn ends with no properly placed meeple mushroom hunters.

2) Return any ONE of your meeples, along with the card it is standing on, to your play area. The number of mushrooms on the card is the number that you have collected.

3) Return ALL of your meeples, along with the cards that they were standing on, to your play area. The number of mushrooms on ALL of these cards is the number that you have collected.

At any time during your turn, you can cash in any amount of mushrooms you have collected during the current or previous turns for a market / price card.

The game continues until either all of the market / sell cards have been taken by players, or all of the cards from mushroom mountain have been taken. Once the end is triggered, players count up their money and the player who has earned the most from their mushroom hunting adventure is declared the winner!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Economic, Farming
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ready Room Resource
description:
Ready Room Cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "All Good Things," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Q Continuum. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using the resource, you begin the game with 4 Mission Tokens on your Ready Room Card.

Once per round, one of your ships may spend 1 of these Mission Tokens (i.e. remove it from the game) to achieve the following effects:

1) During the Activation Phase, when you reveal your maneuver, before you move, you may add up to +2 to your speed.

2) At the start of the Combat Phase, increase your Captain Skill Number by +2 until the End Phase.

3) At any time you may replace 1 [EVADE], [SCAN], or [BATTLE STATIONS] Token that is beside your ship with 1 [EVADE], [SCAN], or [BATTLE STATIONS] Token.

OR

4) Prevent your Captain from being disabled or discarded by an enemy ship's Captain or Upgrade Card.

A player cannot use these abilities for a ship that has no Captain Card or whose Captain Card is disabled.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Building Giza
description:
Pharaoh needs his newest pyramid to be built, and he turns to you, the various government contractors and architects to help him build it. Each player bids secretly the amount that they would pay Pharaoh to build his pyramid. The winner then gets to try to build the next block in Pharaoh's pyramid. As a reward for building each block, you will receive some of Pharaoh's valuable gold. The player with the most gold in the end wins!

It is challenging to build Pharaoh's pyramid because you have to pay to supply enough people and resources to build each block. But that is left to chance. Each player determines how much they would like to spend on their roll, but they only get one opportunity to succeed.

The game is broken down into levels, rounds, and stages. There are three levels in the game, one for each layer of the pyramid. As the pyramid gets taller, the game gets more challenging. Each level is broken into rounds, one block is built each round. Will you end with the most of Pharaoh's gold?

name: The Earth Wars Saga: Galactic War
description:
The galaxy is slowly falling into chaos. The UNE and the Akoran Empire are fighting a bitter war over centuries old claims. The Decoran Republic has been stabbed in the back by the Andromedan Empire and the Federation Commonwealth is launching suicidal Crusades in all directions. The Horloth have been drawn into the conflict and the Ilin are close to declaring war on the UNE. With the Adromedans once more at war other races have grown nervous and have mobilized their militaries. The Nan'Tra'Ki are powerless to stop the spread of conflict and war. The fate of an entire race rests in your hands. Who will you fight for?

Galactic War is a star ship combat game set in the Earth Wars Saga universe in the year 3565. The game comes with an history of both the galaxy and humanity. There are 13 pages of rules and five fleets detailing over 100 ships, patrol boats, and fighters.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: DICE Basketball
description:
DICE Basketball is a sports simulation game that recreates individual seasons using detailed formulas and actual statistics from real basketball seasons.
DICE Basketball uses 2 10-sided dice and can be played with 1 or 2 coaches. Each coach chooses a team, and the two decide who will be the home team and who will be the away team.

name: For Glory and Honor: A Game of Soldiering during the Napoleonic Wars.
description:
INTRODUCTION
For Glory and Honor is a game for one to four Players. Each Player creates a Player Soldier during the Napoleonic Wars. The Player Soldiers will attempt to gain Merit Points in order to advance in rank throughout various Campaigns of the Napoleonic Wars. Player Soldiers can be assigned to a Cavalry or Infantry Regiment serving in the British or French Armies. This game is especially suited for fans of Bernard Cornwell's Richard Sharpe Series, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Brigadier Gerard Series and Richard Howard's Alain Lausard series.

OBJECTIVE
The Objective of the Game is to have your Soldier be the first to complete his Career during the Napoleonic Wars. Career Progress is tracked by moving your Soldier’s Counter along the Game Board’s Career Track. The Career Track consists of Garrison Duty and Campaign Duty Assignments. These Assignments will result in a variety of situations and encounters including Skirmishes, Patrols, Battles, Encampment, Headquarters, Siege Assaults and Special Missions in which the Player’ Soldier must resolve. The outcome of these Encounters and Situations determine whether the Player’s Soldier advances along the Career Track.
