While the Soldiers conduct Challenges, they might gain or lose Merit Points, which are used to improve their Attribute Ratings and Rank. The Player Soldier with the Highest Rank after reaching the Ending Space on the Career Track, is the Winner. If this is tied, then the Soldier with the most Merit Points remaining is the Winner. If this is tied then the Soldiers may conduct a Duel to determine the Winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Million Hit Chart
description:
User summary

A cooperative game where the players are all members of an idol group, aiming to create a million hit.

At the beginning of the game, a number of Appeal cards are lined up by each member of the idol group. These cards can, during the game, be looked at by players and can also switch places to and fro.

These appeal cards must match the requirements on the popularity sheet and come in a specific order, in order to generate a specific amount of sales. The goal of the game is to get as high sales as possible

name: Rychlé šípy: Společenská hra
description:
Players searching for hedgehogs in the cage are moving forward with a unique system based on the combination of 66 different illustrated playing cards, using motifs from popular novels by Jaroslav Foglara.
Players move towards the target using playing cards that move forward them or slow down other players. Winner is the player that first reaches the middle of the board.

name: Mariupol 2014-15
description:
Mariupol is an expansion for "Battles of XXI Century" ("Bitwy XXI Wieku") system - you get board, tables and counters and two scenarios but the core game is needed, because you need the rule book and help counters. This is not a stand alone game.

War of Ships is the stand alone game, with board, counters, rules, tables and three scenarios.

The game was published in issue 40 of Taktyka i Strategia (Tactics and Strategy) magazine in both Polish and English editions.

Scenarios are included for the following games:

Kursk 1943 (2 scenarios)

Battles of XXI Century (4 scenarios, including two for Mariupol and two for core game)

Battles of the II WW (two scenarios and 2 for Mokra 1939)

Crecy (two scenarios)

Borodino 1812 (one scenario)

ASL Starter Kits 1-3 (two scenarios)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: When Life Deals You Lemons
description:
A thirst quenching card matching game!

When life deals you lemons, you make lemonade,of course! Collect Lemon, Water and Sugar cards to make lemonades. Make your lemonade even more delicious by adding CHERRY or LIME flavouring. Make it extra awesome by using ULTRA WATER! Serve it on a SUNNY DAY or with POPCORN! Secretly sabotage your arch-nemesis' lemonade with a sprinkling of icky YAK HAIR!

When Life Deals You Lemons is a super fun game for ages 5 and up, and was designed and drawn by Hannah (9), Miles (8) and Erica (5) Barker.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – R.I.S. Pi Expansion Pack
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: R.I.S. Pi Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 22 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Pi is a Romulan scout vessel class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Dolmen: The chamber tombs
description:
Expansion for Dolmen that adds 10 tomb tiles and one black stone to the game.

The tomb tiles are placed in the center of each octogonal stone circle. If you are the first player to place a stone in that stone circle you get to take the tomb tile and keep it secret in front of you. When and how the tiles' ability can be used depends on the tile itself.

name: Foretold: Fatesworn
description:
Fatesworn is an expansion to Foretold: Rise of a God in which players take on the role of a deity who gathers followers, builds a temple and then smites rival gods. Foretold is a deck-building game with a tower defense element. During the game you may purchase cards or tiles from the Marketplace to grow your followers and your temple. Players may raid a rivals temple and if they get past defenses, roll a mighty smite die to deal damage. You win the game if you build a full set of 4 aligned Fate Relics or your rivals life points drop to zero.

Fatesworn features a number of new and exciting additions to Foretold: Rise of a God including cards that count as having every Fate alignment type and powerful new relics. It adds a new game mechanism called Decree. While a card with Decree is in the Marketplace, its Decree ability is active and affects game play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Steam Wars
description:
User summary:

Steam Wars is an abstract territory-occupation game for two players. Your goal is to earn victory points by expanding your territory while making your opponent lose their territory.

You initially control a territory with three hexes and one robot token on the hexagonal grid board. Each turn, you move one of your robots to expand or secure your territory. A robot can move to any hex within your territory or one hex outside, including hexes marked by your opponent, except for a hex adjacent to or occupied by your opponent's robot.

After movement, place one of your occupation markers on the destination hex if there isn't a marker there already. This hex is now part of your territory. If the hex was your opponent's, they lose control of it, and if this causes their territory to be split, they lose control of all hexes not connected with their robot. Discard all their occupation markers on these hexes.

Your opponent's robots cannot move to one of your hexes adjacent to or occupied by your robot, so secure your territory by moving your robot wisely.

Some hexes have a higher value but have a special requirement to control. As you expand your territory, you will be able to deploy more robots and fulfill the requirement to control these hexes.

The game ends when either player uses up their 30 occupation markers. Add up your victory points earned by hexes you control and occupation markers your opponent discarded. The player with higher total wins the game.
English rulebook is now available.

Publisher's summary:
２人用アブストラクト陣取りゲーム
研究所の地下で２体のロボットが戦うゲーム。
勝利条件：どちらかのプレイヤーの歯車タイルが０枚のとき、勝利点の多いプレイヤーが勝利。
勝利点はボード上の歯車タイル＋獲得した相手の歯車タイル。
ヘックスのボード上でロボットを動かし、自分の陣地を示す歯車タイルを置いて陣地を広げていく。
ロボットは陣地の周り１マスに移動でき、相手の陣地も攻められる。
ロボットの周り１マスの同陣営の歯車タイルは相手のロボットに攻められない。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Trickster: Tianxia
description:
Trickster is a fun and easy-to-learn card game for 3-7 players, lasting about 15 minutes. Each Trickster set features its own heroes and new ways to play. Find the set that’s right for you... or mix together characters from different sets to customize your own game!

A Trickster set has 49 cards with seven heroes, each with their own simple effect on play. A hero appears in seven different suits, each a color of the rainbow: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet. Each hero and suit combination appears once in a set.

The first player of each round may play any card from her hand. The second player in the round is called The Trickster, who may also pay any card from her hand. Any subsequent player that round must play a card that follows the pattern set by the Trickster. (If the first two cards are Yellow, then everyone must play a Yellow card.)

If you cannot follow the pattern, you must collect cards played this round into your personal scoring area. If everyone was able to play one card, then the Trickster collects the cards.

The goal of Trickster is to have the fewest cards by the time any player has emptied her hand. Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner... with one exception! If you have more cards of a suit than any other player, you may ignore those cards when scoring.

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Prodigy / "Lucky" Luke
description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: As an action once per wave, you can pick up 3 cards, then add one to your hand, discard another, and put the last one back on the top of your deck.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: BuildaBeast
description: BuildaBeast is a card game where you get to create cool creatures. Your goal is to craft powerful beasts by buying head, body, and tail cards. But beware, if you play too many body cards without a tail, you’ll bust! Players buy cards and build beasts until the supply of new cards is exhausted. Then the players tally the cards they have gained to see who has the most victory points.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Salamis ad Actium: Naval Wargames Rules for Ancient Times 2000 BC to 900 AD
description:
From the back of the rulebook:

With these rules you can take command of the fleets of antiquity with oared galleys roaming the Mediterranean, maintaining control of your Empire and keeping the Pirates in check. In those days warfare was up close and personal. The wars between Greece and Persia, Rome and Carthage, The Roman Civilk War, all are covered. You can ram, carry out oar rakes, board the enemy, fire archers and ballistae, hurl rocks from stone throwers.
An extensive list of ships is provided with their advantages and disadvantages. We have incorporated our usual command system which allows for both good and bad commanders, and which has an effect on the flow of the action. The turn is of variable length and certain actions will only be permitted during an Intermediate Phase which happens at random.
A simple campaign system is provided as a basis for those with Imperial ambitions
40 pages
Recommended scale 1/1200
Complexity 6/10
Level of detail 6/10
Avg game length 2-3 hours
Dice required D10, D6
categories: Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Mein kleiner bunter Krabbelkäfer
description:
The little ladybug wants to dress up. She’s bored with her black dots today and wants to try on something new and colorful. Do you think you can help her out? Together, gather colorful dots for her new outfit. And whoever has the ladybug at the end of the game wins and gets to fly around the room.

Getting started:
Put the 12 colored dots on the leaf and place it in the middle of the table well within everybody‘s reach. The youngest player receives the plush ladybug and die. That‘s it! Now you can start the game.

Take turns in a clockwise direction. The youngest player slides on the plush ladybug over his or her right or left wrist. Then roll the die. Depending on what is showing on the die, here‘s what happens next:

- Hurray! A new color!
Pick up a matching colored dot from the leaf and stick it on any free circle on the plush ladybug. It doesn‘t matter who has
the ladybug around his wrist.

- Oh, oh. There are no more dots of this color!
Are there no more dots on the leaf maching the color you just rolled? No problem. The player to your left tries his luck and rolls the die.

- Ladybug, change hands!
You already have the ladybug on your wrist? Great! You can keep it! You don‘t have the plush ladybug? Then the player who has it has to give it to you. Slide the plush ladybug over your wrist.

- End of game:
Have you attached all the colored dots onto the ladybug? Then the game is over. If you have the ladybug around your wrist, you‘ve won the game and get to fly once around the room! Ladybug, ladybug, flyyyyyy!!!

name: Creepiest Pet Shop
description:
Help famous horror movie monsters adopt equally monstrous pets into their forever homes in this fast paced, family friendly card game!

Creepiest Pet Shop includes speed, matching, take that, and unique fun artwork and theme to make a game that is easy to learn, fast paced fun that is great for families and is a fun micro game for gamers!
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Kegonsa
description:
A warm summer breeze sends ripples across the water as the sun begins to rise over Lake Kegonsa--It’s a great day for fishing!

In Kegonsa players are competing in a local fishing tournament and must carefully manage the assortment of lures and special equipment in their tackle boxes while scoping out the best spots in the lake in order to out-fish their opponents.

At the start of each game, the lake tiles are shuffled and laid face-up in a grid of variable size depending on the number of players. Each lake tile depicts 1 to 3 fish that players are trying to catch during the game by placing the highest value of like-colored lures around them. A player’s turn consists of two phases: movement and placement. In the movement phase, players must move their boat token 1 or 2 spaces to a new unoccupied lake tile. In the placement phase, players must select an available lure tile from their tackle box using a unique rondel mechanic and place it adjacent to the location of their boat. After a set number of rounds, each of the lake tiles is scored and the player who caught the highest value of fish is the winner!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: AFL DVD Trivia Challenge
description:
"DVD Bonus Extra DVD 500 New Action Film AFL Trivia Questions For The 2007 Season 2 DVD Extra Bonus DVD"

AFL DVD Challenge is the Trivia Game for the whole family.
Prove what you have known all along. That when it comes to matters AFL you've always been right.

Official AFL Trivia Challenge has over 1000 questions and answers presented on DVD with exciting action shots from the greatest game in the world.

name: Litterateur
description:
Litterateur is a card-drafting and word-building game for up to five players.

For five rounds, players will draft cards into their hands and use these cards, along with three common cards, to produce a word. the player with the best word will get to choose any three cards in play to put into their score pile. The player in second place will get two cards and players in third and fourth place will get one card each.

In the sixth round, players will use these previously scored cards to produce a final word. The player with the best word in this final round wins the game.

To win, players must draft wisely at the beginning and end of each round.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Campfire Tales
description:
Plan your day, where you will be, what you are trying to catch and explore the beautiful areas between your starting point at the cabin and your destination, the campfire. Gather with your friends, but you will have to be clever as you recount your day and the events that happened in order to collect the catches you need to win!

Campfire Tales is a game about story management! As you progress in telling the path you took, hour by hour other players will have a chance to interrupt, and change the sequence of events in their favor. There is a lot of storytelling fun to be had and of course an incredible amount of strategy in what information you reveal or keep hidden from other players.

In the game, players will plot out their movement from area to area strategizing on what type of 'catch' they want to collect. If no one contests, they have first pick. As the story progresses, other players will jump in to alter the events provided that they were in the location at or before the current player. These interruptions allow the other players to sneak in and grab 'catches' that they want. At the end of the game, players will total their catches and declare a winner!
mechanics: Action Queue, Memory, Storytelling, Take That

name: Pinsamhetsfaktor
description:
The title Pinsamhetsfaktor translates to "Embarrassment Factor".

A Swedish party game consisting of a deck of cards with questions nobody should be proud of knowing the answer of. For example "What color does the drunk cell mattress have?" and "What body part is the most delicious according to cannibals?"

Each and every one of the questions are worth different points, and if you're the quickest to know the correct answer you get those points. The more embarrassing it is to know the answer, the more points it's worth.

The player with the highest score wins the game of embarrassment.

name: Picture Carousel
description:
I´ts time to make the carousel spin! Check the picture on your secret disc and try to build the picture by turning the three levels of the carousel on your turn. Be careful though, as you might accidentally help someone get closer to victory.

Picture Carousel is the perfect game for anyone who loves exciting twists and turns! The double-sided game board offers players double the fun - just turn it over and keep playing!

name: Fish'n'Stones: Heron
description:
Fish'n'Stones: Heron is a promotional card for Fish'n'Stones that is available in Plato Magazine N°79 (september 2015) and at the Logis booth during Spiel 2015.

The heron, a long-legged bird, is shuffled into the deck instead of one empty water card, and it steals one random card out of an opponent's bucket of your choice at the end of the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Quark
description:
Exert your influence and guide the swirling mass of the smallest bits of matter back together to form sub-atomic particles while racing to build the biggest atom.

Quark is a lighter weight card game. Players have two actions each turn they can use to collect quarks, decay quarks down into other quarks, annihilate quarks for energy or to create particles.

At the end of the game, players score points for particles created, the best atom created and any energy they have left over.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Tea House of the Blue Moon
description:
A Tea House is a place where patrons come to drink, eat and be entertained by honorable, traditional Japanese female entertainers who act as hostesses; and whose skills include performing various Japanese arts such as classical music, dance, games and conversation, mainly to entertain male customers.

The game starts with a "Tea Table" in the center of the table. "Patrons" are randomly drawn, and placed at each of the six place settings. Each player starts with three cards; and each turn, players must play one card onto a patron, and then draw one card.

It is most important that the patrons are kept happy. A happy patron gives generous tips. Each patron favors or dislikes some of the services that the entertainers provide, so serve each patron in a manner to make them most happy.

You entertain the patrons by playing cards onto a patron of your choice, which adds the promise of a tip. The amount of the tip increases as additional entertainment cards are played on the patrons. A player can only collect the accumulated tips on a patron by playing a "Collect Tips" card.

Once a player has collected enough Yen to end the game (based on number of players), they may choose to end the game by saying: “I win.” All players finish the current round, and the player with the most Yen is the winner. If players are tied for the most Yen, they share the victory!

Winner of the August 2015 24-Hour Game Design Challenge! Revisions and tweaks being made to publish on The Game Crafter.

name: Dinkee Linkee
description:
Meet Linkee's little brother, Dinkee!

Kids love a quiz. It's just that most are too hard. Or too boring. But not Dinkee. It's easy to learn, loads of fun and everyone plays at once.

Simply answer four questions and work out what links the answers. Then shout DINKEE! Get it right and win the card. It is easy-peasy lemon squeezy.

name: Mystics of Mana
description: Novice mages compete by completing objectives to impress their headmasters. Plays 2-4 players in under 30 minutes. Each turn mages will takes turns drawing mana and spells and deciding the best use of each. By playing different spells they will complete objectives from healing damage of players to summoning the biggest earthen shield. Or even collecting all types of mana. Once a mystic has reached 20 objective points they win the game

name: Pretense: The Champ & Sore Loser
description:
2 additional roles for the best and worse players! The Champ needs to win two in a row, and the Sore Loser needs to come in last place twice. You must stop them!


A pack of three bonus cards consisting of the Champ, the Sore Loser and a rule card. Add these to your games for more variety, or swap out some cards that don't apply to your game group.

Champ
If you win two games in a row, you may take any other player's role card.

Sore Loser
If you come in last place for two games in a row, you may take any other player's role card.


Included in Pretense (AEG edition 2016).
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Die Box
description:
Without huge rulesbook, without masses of material, without lots of fuss.
The different games in this box are small, easy to learn and you may play them everywhere.
There´s something in the box for everybody – for strategic thinkers, for optimizers, for bluffers, for memory-cracks….

Nußknacker – Nutcracker
For 3-4 players
What shows the hidden card? Ask smart and listen how the nut cracks.
Not a game for people with brains like bricks#

16 cards with the values of 1 to 8. One card is placed face down - the aim is, to identify this card) The active player asks another player about a value between 1 and 8 (a game with all 16 cards (2x8) is quite complex...). The value has to be on his hand either as single card or as sum. The others answers either with "No" (no card/s with this value on my hand) or with the value in one or more cards. The other players just see the number of exchange cards, not their values.
I.e. if one askes about a 6 and passes one card, is HAS to be the Six. If the other player passes two cards it might be 3/3, 4/2 or 5/1.
Whoever indentifies the face down card correctly, wins.

Bauab – Buildown
For 2 players
It´s a rough play amongst the building contractors. Save building sites for you, plan buildings, kick the others and force them to retreat.

Sorry, Folks, but this here is too complex, to explain it some sentences. Two players try to save construction areas for their own buildings, by placing planning-chips or reservation-chips on a variable board. Every player tries to take the last free area of his opponents chips - reminds me a bit on Go..., but of course, the game is faster and the value of the chips is important too.

Raufer – Upper
For 3-4 players
Chase the others through the staircases and take their opportunities to move. But take care that you are not sticked by yourself…

20 cards with values of 1 to 20. Quite easy card game. The active player plays a card and commends to the next "up" or "down", which means to react with a higher or lower value. If possible, the player gives the next command to his neighbour. If not, he has to take an additional card. Bad luck, if nobody can react properly - than the first player has to take additional cards. So, recall all played cards.
Winner is the player, who played his last card.

Misd
3-8 Players
Which symbol is missing? Is it missed really? A game for fast thinkers.
Kids will blame you…

Everything planned?!
For 3-4 players
Is there a plan? Change places? Change Cards? Plan the use of your cards?
Who plans with lack of plans, wins.

Schollenschubser – Floe pushers
For 2-4 players
Be the first to cross the icy sea over swaying floes to safety. Charity begins at home. Shurely not a game for the kindhearted…

Schlauraff – Smartsnatch
For 2-4 players
Use your dice perfectly and get the uppermost points. More than simple but never the same

Just a remark: since the producer delievered us... eh... somewhat insufficient dice (from our point of view...) we ordered better dice, and pass them with every sold box.

And another remark: authors of the games in this box are: Till Meyer, Klaus-Peter Rudolph and H.&W. Fuhr

And another one: there only one language-based game in the box, but for this and all other games we offer an english rulesbook as download. It may need some time, since Christian enjoys his holidays and we want to present you grafics too - not just plain text. :-)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Dice, Economic, Memory
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Stranded: A Quick Card Game
description:
Stranded is quick easy card game. It is about a group of people who crash land in a forest somewhere and need to survive until help arrives. Unfortunately everyone is out to save their own skin. Can you survive long enough to be rescued?

Game play is for 2-5 players and lasts anywhere from 10-20 minutes. Stranded is played in rounds with the simple mechanics of draw a card them play a card if able. The first player to receive 5 points or hold the highest number at the end of the deck is the winner.

name: Robox
description:
You and your opponent have a team of 3 Robox that are fighting to see who is the best, and the player who defeat the opponent's team will be the winner. Both start with 1 active Robox and the other two will be in the reserve waiting to fight and helping to the active one. Plus, every Robox will be secretly configured with one of the 4 Special Powers.
On your turn you have to pick 2 of the 7 possible actions:

Attack: Only the active Robox can attack. Roll a die, if it's equal or less than your Attack Power (energy tokens + base point), remove 1 Energy Token from the defense of the opponent's active Robox.
Charge: If your Robox is in the Potentiate Position, change it to the Charge position and add 1 Energy Token from the pool to its Defence.
Potentiate: If your Robox is in the Charge position, change it to the Potentiate position and move 1 Energy Token from the Defence to the Attack.
Accumulate: Only the Active Robox can accumulate. Put 1 Energy Token from the pool next to your Robox Card. It will count as an extra Energy to your next attack and then it will go back to the pool.
Donate: Only the Reserve Robox can donate. Give 1 Energy Token from the defense of this Robox to the defense of the Active Robox; or from the attack of this Robox to the attack of the Active Robox.
Replace: Switch the Active Robox for 1 of the Reserve Robox.
Special Action: Use your special power.
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Protocol Resource
description:
The Protocol Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 1, "Shockwave," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Temporal Cold War. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using the resource, you are granted three abilities of which you may do one of per round with any one of your ships. You may a) place 2 tokens instead of one when performing an Evade, Scan or Battle Stations action, b) prevent your ship from being Target Locked on the round it Cloaks, or c) use a 3 Forward Maneuver template when performing a Sensor Echo.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction
description:
Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction is the ultimate dungeon creator! By using a unique random generation system you can create endless dungeon levels using the Dungeon Construction set.

Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction uses multiple variations of Rooms, Corridors, Corridor Room, and Junctions to help create a randomly generated dungeon level every time.

Each of these components contains different obstacles such as doors, treasure locations, random encounters, etc... You build the level and then you explore using the second system - Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure.

Dungeon Hack is a solo D&D game on a micro level using 4”x4” tile cards representing dungeon rooms, corridor rooms, corridors and junctions while colored cubes represent your characters and the ever increasing monsters. A multitude of cards depict and define the monsters, treasures, encounters, and obstacles you will face within the dungeon.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: PAX & Pergamemnon Expansions
description:
From the publisher:

PAX Expansion: the slaves are re-arming themselves and Rome, too, does not remain idle. With the new cards; Militia, Scouts, and Adversaries, additional tactics are possible for the slaves as well as for Rome.

Pergamemnon Expansion: out of the Abyss come the Germans and the Macedonians, two more powerful nations to compete with the others. In addition to the specific skills of each people, all players now have the option to acquire additional skills.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Schinderhannes: Schwarzer Peter
description: Schinderhannes: Schwarzer Peter, an expansion for Schinderhannes, consists of eight "not true" cards. During the game, you can play one of these cards with an information card to reverse the information provided by that card. If, for example, a player plays the card "Schinderhannes commits a crime in the east" and the "Schwarzer Peter" card, then the information becomes "Schinderhannes commits a crime not in the east" (i.e., he commits a crime in the west).

name: Rocket Shogi
description:
Rocket Shogi is a stand-alone small board (5x7 grid, with 8 pieces per player) Shogi variant. Unusually, it uses all standard Shogi piece types except for pawns.

It can be played using standard Shogi pieces.

It is also included as a second independent game (using its own board and pieces) with Simple Shogi in a combined package sold under the title "Simple Shogi".

name: Isle at War 2
description:
Starting from the idea "A territory an action" to Isle at War I rebuilt the game by adding my ideas and other games trying to keep it simple and fun intact.

The variations are:

I added an action called "Alliances" in which you draw a card from the Allies that can make a additional action;
I replaced the original map with a modular hexagons;
You can play up to 4 players;
The territory with the castle can produce 2 troops;
The game lasts 10 rounds;
The player with the most points in this way:
1 point for a territory;
3 points for the special territory;
1 to 3 points for cards Allies;
At the end of any turn, the player with more than half the territories may declare the end of the game.

Enjoy!

Alessandro
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: ATS Great War: Blasted Woods – French vs. German Scenarios!
description:
From the publisher's website:

Prior to his unexpected passing designer and author Ian Daglish (dec.) sent in his GWASL module materials, joining the work of other CH designers in the effort to bring another era of warfare to the collection. Losing top men is sad, and they can never, ever be replaced.

But their contributions, like authors of yore, can speak to us, and we are grateful to have this chance to make the Great War return for an encore ... on your gaming table in the form of ATS GREAT WAR MODULE II. It is all very straightforward, and the Special Rules give you the handbook you need to maneuver the men and machines, some representing combat systems never seen before, but prominent since. The Chauchet LMG, new French soldiers, Attack a' Outrance rules and couinters, French tanks and Guns, and more!

You receive all the combat counters you need to play. Special rules in color, 3-hole format. And of course, a collection of color format scenarios (8 in all) that all feature German/French combat.


Schneiders at Soissons – Soissons, France, July 18th 1918
Window of Opportunity – Bois Des Caures, France, February 22nd 1916
Blasted Woods – Bois Des Caures, Verdun, France, February 21st 1916
Dead Man Hill - Bois Des Caures, Verdun, France, March 8th 1916
Flag Signal: Advance! – St Pierre Aigle, France, May 31st 1918
Pilckem Ridge – Pilckem, Belgium, April 22nd 1915
Baptism – The hamlet of La Ville Aux Bois, France, April 16th 1917
The French Spirit – The Alsace border town of Altkirch, France, August 7th 1914

name: Carcassonne: Easter in Carcassonne
description:
This first fan expansion from the HiG forums, is designed specifically for the Easter season.

Together with the Carcassonne Forum, "Fritz_Spinne" (Christof Struck) has thought up this fan expansion. It is about Easter eggs (chocolate eggs, or real eggs or whatever you like) to gather during the game. Of course you can eat them if you like, but it is advantageous at the end of the game to have the most eggs left.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Dark Tales of Nadaras
description:
In Nadaras, players start as faction leader planning their perilous journey to Nadaras, a mechanical island mysteriously appeared in the middle of the ocean. Every attempt to establish an outpost on its metal shores failed and just one survivor returned, telling tales of horror ad riches beyond imagination. The Emperor himself tasked the bravest and most resourceful nobles to claim the island in his name with the promise of eternal power and glory.

To win the game you have to develop your faction according to several different aspects: military power, territory, knowledge, fame and influence over the imperial court. To fulfil this objective players have to explore the island and exploit its resources to support the growth of their settlement and armies. The resources are found on tiles that are randomly spread across the game board.
Turn by turn you have the opportunity to make wondrous scientific discoveries or exploit the natural magic of the island to unlock new structures for your settlement or units for your army. Exceptionally gifted individuals, heroes, will become your field agents, discovering the deepest and darkest secrets of this island.
Conflicts over territory or resources are common between factions and, far from imperial supervision, what really matters is the end not the means to reach it. The island itself, however, reacts to human presence, trying to reestablish order by cleansing the land from all living beings.

What pathway will you choose to become the Emperor’s favorite? Force, wealth, fame or knowledge?

Will you cultivate science or rediscover lost magic?

All this and much more is Nadaras!

name: The King's Armory: Alexian the War King
description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlin' Bastards of Bataan Pack
description:
10 Scenarios compatible with the Advanced Squad Leader System

Scenarios:
FE 25: Trouble At Agoo
FE 26: Precious Minutes
FE 27: The Bravest Thing I Ever Saw
FE 28: Figety Bridget
FE 29: Reluctant Warriors
FE 30: Trail #2
FE 31: Plenty of Time to Rest When You're Dead
FE 32: Get to the Point
FE 33: Battlin' Bastartds of Bataan
FE 34: Go Down Fighting
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Wildwood
description:
Wildwood is a card game in which two players, or two teams, compete to call Druids and build the most fitting Grove.

Each round you draw three cards. From those cards, you decide which to use as a bid to call a Druid, which to place in your face-down back row for end-game scoring, and which to place in your face-up front row as a source of effects.

The Druids you have successfully called add scoring bonuses, the ability to rearrange your cards and those of your opponents, and other special effects.

At the end of the sixth round, you score your back row. You count the face value of the cards you have placed within it, bonuses granted by the Druids you have called, and you also gain bonus points for suit or number matches you have created.

Team play adds chances to meaningfully cooperate with your teammates, and to read and respond to the other team's gameplay as it unfolds.

name: Zirkus Leo
description:
Zirkus Leo brings Leo the Lion and his friends into the ring where players will experience many turbulent events. In this speedy card game, players try to play the cards from their hand as quickly as possible, and to carry out all actions quickly and correctly, so as not to receive any more cards.

Players must concentrate, because all actions shown on the cards are carried out at the same time. As a general rule, whoever is the last to perform the action receives all the cards in the ring.

Pay attention, as the illustrations on the cards provide assistance. However, since there are a total of 14 different action cards, it is not always easy to perform the correct action immediately. Whoever has the fewest cards at the end wins the game.

name: Visou
description:
You have a good eye? Learn to recognize the places, monuments, characters, landscapes, buildings and the most famous works of art.

Roll the color dice for the categorie of the card, take a card, look at the pictures, identify the named one and earn that card.

The first player to win three cards in three different categories or six cards of the same categorie wins.

name: Posit: 3-D board game
description:
Abstract strategy game for two players, played on a 6x6 square board.

Each player has a pawn. Initially, the pawns are placed on the c6 and d1 squares.

In each turn, players move own pawn to adjacent square, and then place a cube in any square. The cube can stacked up to three levels.

Pawn can move vertically, horizontally and diagonally. In addition, pawn can climb to the cube on one level. However, pawn can not go down the level, climb two levels at once or climb on top of the three levels of the cube.

A player win if the opponent's pawn can not move.

name: The Labyrinth of Cards
description:
User summary:
In the game カードの迷宮 (The Labyrinth of Cards), players explore a six-floor deep labyrinth. In each floor, there is treasure whose value is hidden until someone explores that floor. You collect that treasure if you commit most effort to exploring that floor.

The game is played like blind auction, but six floors are auctioned simultaneously. You may play an exploration card, which indicates how much effort you commit, face-down on your current floor or on a deeper floor, but once you explore a deeper floor, you may not go back to an upper floor.

At the end of the round, count up the treasure values players have collected. The player with higher total wins the round. You have to win two rounds to win the game.

With four players, the game is team battle (2 players vs. 2 players).

Publisher's summary:
カードの迷宮は【後戻りができない】地下迷宮を探検すると言うテーマのゲームです。探検がテーマですがやることは競りゲームです。探検の労力をより多く割けば地下迷宮から財宝が得られるでしょう。財宝をより多く獲得すればラウンドで勝利となります。２つのラウンドで勝てればゲームの勝利になります。４人プレイの場合はチーム戦になります。
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: Pirate Loot: Kickstarter Bonus Cards
description:
A pack of 18 exclusive Kickstarter Bonus cards that can be added to the base and expanded 5/6 player game.

Cards include:
6 Loot cards (Albatross, Captain's Musket, Mighty Cannon, Powder Bomb, Monkey's paw & Giant Clam)
6 Pirate Crew Horde cards (1 for each of the 6 suits)
6 Pirate Crew Navigator Cards (1 for each of the 6 suits)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Pirates

name: Bomarzo: Worship expansion
description:
Shuffle the 8 Worship cards and place the deck near the board. Each card represents a Divinity. During their turn, players can take 1 card from the Worship deck plus 1 additional card for each 2 resources (any type) paid to the reserve. Players can keep only 1 card from those drawn, and the others must be put back (reshuffle the Worship deck). Keep the card hidden from the other players.

At the end of the game, a Worship card is considered accomplished if the player who holds it won his corresponding category. For each accomplished card, a player gains 3 VPs. For each card that is not accomplished he loses 1 VP.

name: De Bumbatrein
description: Before the game starts you can build up the variable game board that consists of different train pieces. Every piece shows 3 objects in a different color. The players start in the beginning of the train and roll the die. They can move their pawn to the next object on the game board that has the same color as the die. As soon as you roll a color that isn't present between your pawn and the locomotive the player can move his pawn to the locomotive and he or she is the winner of the game.

name: Swan Date
description:
The pond at Inokashira Park in Kichijoji is jinxed and has a famous phrase associated with it that (nearly) everyone knows: "A couple, if you ride in a boat, will break up."

You and your partner, however, had never heard this phrase before you entered a swan boat on the pond — but now that you have, you're wondering whether a break-up is inevitable. Work together in Swan Date to take pictures in the park, and perhaps you'll remain a couple by the time your boat reaches shore...

name: Schäferstündchen: Das tapfere Schneiderlein
description:
Promo Role

From the card:

Bewegung 3
Kampf X

Dein Kampfwert entspricht dem Grundwert deines stärksten Gegners.

Movement 3
Fight X

Your fight value is the basic fight value of your strongest enemy.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Racing

name: Deck zu!
description:
A tile laying game with 62 cards.

Every card has 4 squares on it. Squares come in four colors.

Winner is the player who covers the smallest area laying out the cards delt to him on top of each other using matching color patterns.

Part of the Ravensburger Compact Serie

name: Denmark (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Pirates Code II: Pirate Alliance and The Curse of the King
description:
User summary:
パイレーツコード 2　-海賊同盟と呪いの王- (Pirates Code II: Pirate Alliance and The Curse of the King) is an expansion to Pirates Code, but you can also play this set alone.

This expansion adds the "Alliance Battle". This is a co-operative game players work together in pairs to decrypt the code. Alliance Battle rules are for four players only, but when you decipher a code in co-operation with a partner, the sense of accomplishment that you get becomes higher than just playing the base game.

In addition, the card called "Curse" appears in this set. It interferes with the action of the opponent so that you gain advantages, making Pirates Code even more fun to play.

Publisher's summary:
「パイレーツコード」の拡張セットです。拡張ではありますが、このセット単体だけでも遊ぶことが出来ます。
この拡張では、新しくペアで協力して暗号を解き明かす「同盟戦」ルールが加わります。 同盟戦ルールは4人専用となりますが、仲間と協力し見事推理を的中させたときの達成感は今までの勝利より、さらに一層の達成感を得ることができます。 また、「呪い」という自分に有利な行動を取るように相手の行動を制限する意地悪な効果を持つカードが登場し、パイレーツコードをより一層楽しいものにします。

name: Snowball Fight
description:
Snowball Fight is a micro deckbuilding and deduction game for two players that only contains 18 cards. In the game players go head-to-head with their arsenal of snowballs in an attempt to be the ruler of the Blizzard Realm!

In Snowball Fight each card has two possible actions, one on each half of the card (top and bottom). The action a player takes each turn depends on the direction they play the card. The game is played in two phases, a quick Drafting phase where players build their initial arsenal and then the Snow Assault phase where there is all out war! Play is simultaneous and players try to attack each other with an arsenal of snowballs, slushballs, and the dreaded iceballs and snow covered rocks while also trying to dodge attacks and build up their weaponry!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pizzeria Allegro
description:
A tasty fun play set for 1-4 pizza bakers

This pizza bake sets contains two games.
Pizza presto:
A red hot pizza duel for two children, flip a card the first kid take puts the right toppings on the pizza and puts their pizza in the oven wins the card. Best of 9.

One Pizza Margarita, please!
A crunchy listen-well game for 1-4 pizza bakers and an adult

On a little bakers turn the adult reads the ingredients on the card, if the pizza has the correct ingredients the little pizza baker gets the card. Most cards wins.

name: Blackjack Dice Attack
description:
Blackjack on 12-sided Dice.

Roll for 21, one die at a time - but don't bust (go over 21).

Contains 6 D12 dice. 5 are white with red letters/numbers. 1 is red with white letters/numbers

Each die has 12 of the 13 ranks of a standard deck of cards. (The missing number varies from die to die, and falls between 4 - 8.)

name: Terraofensiva
description:
Terraofensiva is a strategy area control game where 2 player battle for supremacy over the board. There is also the variant of 3 and 4 players, which can be played with 2 copies of the core set.
In the best tradition of abstract games Terraofensiva uses limited movement and strategic placement to battle the enemy forces. Each player will be the commander of an army and try to outmaneuver the other player/s. Every army has a safe haven and a deployment zone which can be random or chosen, making each game a unique experience.

Get your tanks, infantry and parachutes corps to overcome your foes and take control of the board. Terraofensiva favors the bold!


Terraofensiva es un juego estratégico de control territorial donde dos jugadores pelean por la supremacía sobre el tablero. También existen variantes de tres y cuatro jugadores, las cuales pueden ser jugadas con dos copias del juego básico.
En la mejor tradición de los juegos abstractos, Terraofensiva usa movimientos limitados y posicionamiento estratégico para combatir a las fuerzas enemigas. Cada jugador será el comandante de un ejército e intentará superar tácticamente a los demás. Cada ejército tendrá un refugio seguro y una zona de entrada que puede ser aleatoria o elegida, haciendo de cada juego una experiencia única.

Lleve sus tanques, infantería y cuerpos de paracaidistas al combate para vencer a sus enemigos y tomar el control del tablero. ¡Terraofensiva favorece a los osados!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: Blood Before Richmond: Savage's Station
description:
Savage's Station is the third game in the Blood Before Richmond series, following Gaines's Mill and Glendale & White Oak Swamp; it actually takes place between those two.

The story of the Seven Days is the story of bizarrely incompetent leaders and badly-timed attacks, but Savage's Station really takes the cake. The usually wily Rebel general "Prince John" Magruder is charged with leading an attack on the lightly-defended Union rear, to be supported by three divisions under Stonewall Jackson. Jackson got confused and never showed (surprise-surprise), and Magruder, stoned out of his gourd on morphine, dragged his feet all day before finally launching a half-hearted assault after 5PM, which was ended by a sudden thunderstorm.

This is the smallest (and weirdest) of the games in the Blood Before Richmond series (only a half-sheet of counters this time around), and it's all about taking chances. The Confederate Player can bring in extra units, such as the famous Land Merrimack (a rail-mounted naval gun), but at the cost of precious VP. Will he have enough time to make up the difference, or will the game be called on account of rain?

name: Malifaux: The Plague Cometh – Hamelin Box Set
description:
Eons ago, Plague was a preeminent alchemist in Malifaux, well respected in his field of study. He developed a fascination with decay and aging, focusing his research on the manipulation of both. A tragic accident during an experiment involving the aether and a plague rampaging through Malifaux City nearly killed him. Drowning in his own blood, the alchemist tapped into the aether desperately. Screaming in agony, his eyes closed. The next day, Plague's eyes opened.

Few records remain from the years of the Tyrants of Malifaux. The only certain thing is that they were locked away, trapped because they could not be killed. Plague slept millennia in the necropolis deep below Malifaux City. He was awoken by Hamelin the Rat Catcher, a pitiful bully on the run from the Guild. Hamelin's death was messy and horrific, reminiscent of Plague's first rebirth. Immediately, the Tyrant went after His ultimate goal, only to be prevented by Kirai Ankoku who shattered His physical form. It took months, but Plague eventually reformed Himself. Now, He acts more slowly to ensure His victory in the long run, searching for a new method of ascension into the aether- and the acquisition of true immortality.

Plague is the most aggressive of the active Tyrants. He holds to a strange view, that all of the Tyrants are playing a great game, one which is only worth playing because existence itself is the gamble. While His first attempt at ascension, harnessing the power of the Red Cage, failed miserably, He has discovered new methods to try. With everything on the line, He refuses to admit defeat.

Hamelin’s box comes with ten models, including Hamelin himself. Four of those models are Malifaux Rats, the skulking vermin who invariably follow in Hamelin’s wake. Also present are the Stolen, Hamelin’s totems, who serve him either as a gamble to prolong his own life when killed, or as fresh meat to lure more Malifaux Rats into the battle. The Obedient Wretch helps her master by throwing rats at her enemies, some of which even survive to scurry away into the shadows. Hamelin’s dog, Nix, is also present, if only as a festering plague-ghost who excels at locking down groups of enemy models.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: Ninja Squares
description:
Ninja Squares' is a tile placing game where your pieces are controlled by everyone but yourself. Players attempt to place the pieces of the other players in a way that satisfies certain conditions for their own pieces.
Players seek to have their tiles surrounded by a specific number of other tiles, earning one to four points with corresponding tiles needing the same number of other tiles to border them. When this condition is met, the tile is removed and the player gets that number of points. There is also a special fist tile that only comes to the player after another tile being removed leaves the fist no longer touching any other tiles, which is worth five points.
Players start with five tiles for each opponent they have in the game, plus their equal share of 12 total Mystery tiles. Players then place one tile at a time, until all players have placed all of their tiles. Whenever a tile is touching the exact number of other tiles that it indicates, it immediately goes to the player of that color for points. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Animals off the Hook
description:
These adorable animals will steal your heart in this crazy card drafting and dice stealing game. You will have to think on your feet to make the most of the animal cards you are given.

Overview
Each player chooses an animal to play. The cards are dealt and dice are rolled. Then players draft cards each turn and place their dice to try to get the highest score. Each card has two possible effects depending on which player drafts the card. To win the game, players will have to choose the best combos of dice and cards. After 5 rounds the hand is done and players add up their scores. See the tutorial link for more information.

name: Palangui
description:
It's in Indian version of a famous counting game. There are 14 slots, 7 slots per player. Middle slot is to count your score for each player. The rest of the 12 slots have 12 beads each to begin with. You start by taking beads from one slot and move in a clockwise direction, putting one bead in one slot, till you run out of beads. If you end up in an empty slot, you score that bead + the beads in the slot opposite that.

You cannot take beads out of your scoring slot.

name: Kill the Overlord: Anarchist
description: Kill the Overlord: Anarchist is a promotional character for Kill the Overlord that bears the following power: "Give 1 gold to the Overlord during the Income Phase. If you have no shield cards, you may play any book card as if it was Revolution - all Active Players randomly switch roles and the Execution ends."

name: Kill the Overlord: Conspirator
description: Kill the Overlord: Conspirator is a promotional character for Kill the Overlord that bears the following power: "At the start of the Round, all other players close their eyes. Players with book cards raise their hands."

name: Hashtag Me!
description:
Hashtag Me! is an interactive storytelling game for small to medium groups. Everyone has their favorite stories to tell, but some stories have been buried over years of neglect. It’s time to dust off those old pages and share ‘em. A set of Ninja throwing stars you got for Christmas when you were 12? An excursion into the snowy wastelands in a beat up old car? Tell your stories and other players will interact by hashtagging your story!

Everyone starts with 6 hashtag cards in their hand. Players take turns being the storyteller. The storyteller draws two question cards and chooses which question to tell their story about. Once the story has begun, the rest of the players lay down hashtag cards during the story as they become relevant. At the end of the story, points are awarded and the role of storyteller passes to the next person.

It's a fun party game that's easy to pick up. It’s great for an icebreaker or as a way to get to know your friends and family better.

name: Karawanix
description: Karawanix challenges players to climb atop their dromedaries and make their way through the desert together, enduring sand storms and mirages on their way to the oasis.

name: Animal Upon Animal: Rhino Promo
description: This promo was available at GenCon 2015 at the HABA booth and consisted of 4 Rhinos for the game Animal Upon Animal. The Rhino figures have a HABA logo on one side and a QR code on the other.

name: Devil Tree Station: Skin That Smokewagon!
description:
In Devil Tree Station: Skin That Smokewagon! each player takes the role of either a Wanted gang outlaw or justice fueled Posse member in a lead filled shootout in the dirt covered streets of the Wild West town of Devil Tree Station. Out think your adversaries through decisive actions and straight shooting.

Each player selects a character card to portray them, either a Posse Member or Wanted Outlaw and teams emerge The Posse and the Wanted Outlaws. Each team has a four card action deck from which each player on the team selects an action to play each turn. Also of interest is each character has a action card that if played by them allows them to reroll any or all of their action dice once. This is their "tell" as the other side sees this as well. Will you follow you tell and risk the other team playing an opposing card or do you avoid it and surprise them but forfeit the chance to reroll. If the other team plays the correct corresponding action they steal half of your action dice, so the risk and rewards are very real.

Each player plays an Action Card face down and places some or all of their dice on the action Card becoming their Action Dice...the remainder goes on the Character Card. Play then proceeds from fewest Action Dice to most...there's the fast and the dead.

The Active Player flips over their Action Card while designating a target on the other team who flips over their card. If the Active Players Action Card counteracts the Targets, the Acting player immediately steals half the Target's Action Dice and places them on their Character card.

Next the Active player rolls their Action Dice looking for icons that match their Action Card. For example, if they played the Cover Action they look for Cover icons on the dice. Each rolled die that matches the Action card allows the Active Player to move one of the Target's Action Dice to the Active Players Character card. Then the next lowest number of Action Dice goes and so on...Last Team of Player with dice remaining wins!

The real beauty of this game is that it can be played as either an every player for themselves free-for-all or as a team based battle fighting for dominance of the town. Each version of the game supports up to four players, but feel free to combine two games to have up to eight players fight for supremacy!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: (Self-Published), Dice Made Me Do It! LLC

name: Flames of War: Berlin – The Soviet Assault on the German Capital, April-May 1945
description: Berlin is one of Flames Of War’s late-war intelligence handbooks. It focuses on the Soviet assault on the German capital city of Berlin, the battles to encircle it, and the final desperate defence by the by the rag-tag German forces defending it. Russian forces that fought are presented, as is the Berlin Kampfgruppe.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Open Market
description:
You are the owner of a very successful restaurant that prides itself on using great, fresh and quality foods from the local farmers’ market.

The walk-in refrigerator at your restaurant is on the fritz due to a freak power outage, but instead of closing for repairs you decided to make an emergency food run to replace your spoiled food. The “Open Market” is only open for so long and you have to get everything you need quickly while prices are ever changing.

When you arrive you notice that your competitors have also had similar issues and are here for the same reason. Now is your chance to keep your restaurant open and maybe stick it to the competition and make some money off of them while you’re at it.

Welcome to the “OPEN MARKET”

Draft your list of Orders from the restaurant with the other players at the market. Each Order has a payout of different amounts, but be careful not to spend more on your ingredients than you get by completing the order

. As the amount of ingredients goes down the prices go up so make sure to keep track of what everyone is buying and look for ways to trade and barter to complete your orders. You have to be fast and clever because the market is only open for so long don’t get stuck not completing an order.

In the end the person who has the most money when the market closes has proven themselves a successful restaurant owner and Open Market guru.

Seize the Supply to Deliver the Demand

Educational Goal:
This game is meant to teach and experience the basic economic concepts of Supply, Demand, Net Gain, Monopoly, Oligopoly, Production Possibility Frontier and Opportunity Cost while enjoying a fun game with cute Food.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Breakout to Paris: Operation Blücher, May-June 1918
description:
Breakout to Paris 1918 depicts the third Aisne German offensive. It followed Operation Michel in March. Ludendorff was determined to win the war and these offensives were Germany's last attempts. Michel was a near catastrophe for the Allies and Blucher would be just as dire and a near miss: the Germans were within hours of reaching Paris.

Some claim the two American divisions that had just arrived saved Paris from calamity for the Allies because within a period of a few days, German troops had created a huge bulge and gained over 35 miles and had taken 50,000 prisoners.

The map scale is about three miles per hex. Each combat unit a battalion( tank only), regiment or brigade. A game turn
represents one day.

name: Curling Dice Game
description:
A dicegame for 2 players with a Curling theme

Each player has 8 dice in their color.

Players alternate their turns by first calling "Draw" or "Take Out" and then roll 1 dice. The object is to have more dice with
lower values than your opponent.

name: Commissioned:  Divine Prophecy
description:
Promo card

Divine Prophecy. (4 cost card)

Elder may examine the next 3 Trial cards and return them to the top of the pile in any order.

acts 21:10-14
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Crossfire
description:
Crossfire is a territory control game that only requires two decks of standard poker cards and a table.
The game involves two players starting at either end of the table making his way towards (and through) his opponent. Cards are setup on the table as a grid that players build upon to reach the other end. Players must maintain a line of "powered" cards to continue moving forward. There is a high level of strategy and tactics to obtain victory.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Network and Route Building

name: Quarantine D.O.A.
description:
You are all workers in a Top-Secret underground corporate research facility of D.O.A. (Dynamic Oscillating Architecture) when all of a sudden the quarantine alarm sounds. You know what that means. The "Cleaners" are on their way. You only have so much time to get what you need and be where you need to be to enact your plan or else they will "take care of" you. Don't let anyone get in your way.

Each game of Quarantine D.O.A. will be played on a selfishly player made map that will change every game. With a large selection of special room cards all with unique conditions to randomly choose from, no one will know what will be placed until the map is complete.

Players will take turns spending actions trying to find the items required to enact their plan. Those that succeed will win. There can always be multiple winners but you don't really know who might help and who will get in the way so to be safe don't trust anyone. Search, steal and push to ensure that you are one of the lucky few, but remember, sometime the no one escapes and the "Cleaners" win.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Take That

name: The Princess Bride Scwamble Game
description: The Princess Bride Scwamble Game resembles a certain other word-creation game with a similar name as players take turns putting wooden letter tiles on a grid in order to score points, but in addition to the normal words one might find in the dictionary, players can also score for spelling "mawage", "togeder", and "foweva" as well as iconic phrases such as "Tru Wuv".

name: Myth: Iathi Minion Pack
description:
From the publisher:

The Elementals have always existed but were dormant within the very land and air itself. The manipulation of magic and its misuse by the younger races stirred something within them.... anger. Iathi are composed of three elembents, Earth, Air, and Fire. Their intellect has evolved over time, allowing them the understanding to use items found upon those they slay and return to the Foundation. This expansion requires Myth base game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Force of Will: Valhalla Cluster
description:
Valhalla Cluster is the first block of card sets in the Force of Will trading card game.

Valhalla Cluster's beginning was on December 1st, 2012 with the release of The Dawn of Valhalla expansion in Japan. The cluster ended with the release of The Shaft of Light of Valhalla expansion on July 25th, 2014.

List of Sets:
The Dawn of Valhalla
The War of Valhalla
The Shaft of Light of Valhalla

name: GUJA HUNT!
description:
GUJA HUNT! (好獵手) is a board game designed for parties, featuring simple rules, that's fast paced and full of interactive game experiences. It combines elements of ice age civilization and modern sports with a bright art style, allowing the player to enjoy a leisurely, humorous, and fun board game experience as a primitive hunter.

《GUJA HUNT! 好獵手》是一款針對派對場合設計的桌上遊戲，強調簡單的規則、明快的節奏以及互動性。結合了冰河時代背景和現代運動元素，搭配上鮮豔明亮的美術風格，讓玩家在原始獵人無厘頭的狩獵行動中享受輕鬆、幽默且歡樂的遊戲過程。

name: FOOD FIGHT: A Game of Scones
description:
A competitive skirmish nano card game by Charles Ward.

SUMMARY
Players play on a card size board with 9 spaces. The spaces are not connected equally and some spaces have an advantage when doing a ranged attack. Players move tokens on the board trying to eliminate the opponent's pieces and be as close as possible to their opponent's picnic spot at the end of the game. Players take actions by playing their hand of 8 cards, or both sides of the four cards. The game ends at the end of round 8, or after all cards have been played.

GAMEPLAY
Players choose 1 card from their hand (either the top or bottom half of that card) and simultaneously reveal them. The player with the highest initiative number (in the coin) goes first, and each player either takes 1 of the 2 actions on their card's chosen half or passes. Cards that have been played once are flipped from the silver coin side to the gold coin side and return to the players hand; cards played twice are discarded.

On their turn a player may move 1 or more of their tokens, attack in the same location or a target location, block, hide, taunt, or add 1 reinforcement. Although the actions are resolved in order (highest number card), a block or hide can cancel a certain type of attack as a reaction or preemptively.

The game ends after 8 rounds, when all cards have been discarded. Equidistant tokens are removed after which the player nearest to the opponent's star wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fighting, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Movin' On Up
description:
Movin' On Up is a dice chucking, tile building, meeple swapping game for 3-5 players. Players are attempting to building the most swingin' apartment with the best renters in this fast paced game of strategic meeple and building placement.

Contents:
6 Custom Dice in 6 Colors
115 Meeples in 6 Colors
35 Apartment Tiles

Game Play:
After basic setup of the apartment buildings, players will take turn rolling and resolving the 6 custom dice. Resolving the dice will result in placement of meeples, building of apartment buildings, or movement of already placed meeples. Play is ended once 3 of the 5 buildings are complete and players score based on the tiles they have left at the end of the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, City Building, Dice
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Rivet Wars: Elsa Frost vs. Cher Ami
description:
From the back of the box:

Cher Ami spent his youth on the roof of his home caring for the family pigeons. When war broke out he and his brave pigeons got right into the fight. With his amazing pigeon skills Cher is able to deliver messages with the upmost certainty that they will be delivered. When it's time to call in an artillery barrage Cher Ami is your best bet.

No one ever described Elsa Frost as warm hearted. She is more like a machine than a rivet. But this strong unbreakable presence has instilled a loyal fervor in her troops. When Elsa leads her soldiers into battle it is certain that they will be faster, stronger, or more accurate. One thing is for sure, you had better get out of her way!

note: contained in the "second wave" expansion
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: La Storia Divertente
description:
Collect points by answering questions about history along a path divided in 4 Ages: Prehistory, Antiquity, Greeks and Romans, Middle Ages. Roll a dice to simply go back and forth along the path. If your movement ends on an uncollected disk, you need to answer a question. If your answer is correct, you get the disk with the victory points. You can advance to the next Age if you collected one of the disks from the previous one. Once in a while you can get a bonus to help you in your quest.
The game ends when the first player reaches the end but the winner is the one with more points in his/her disks.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: B ATAKY!
description:
B ATAKY! ("To the attack!") is a Soviet-era board game described as being for secondary school students clearly has its roots in chess, with a mapboard laid out in squares, 15 across by 20 deep. There are three terrain features: a six-square box at the centre of each side representing the headquarters that must me captured; a river (which slows movement) across the middle, two squares wide in the centre and one square on the sides; and four yellow squares on each side closest to the players, which are reserve areas in which pieces may be placed but not attacked.

Each side starts with 21 pieces: 8 infantry, 4 tanks, 4 artillery, 3 missiles and 2 airplanes. As in chess, each piece moves differently and destroys an enemy piece by moving onto its square.

All moves are orthogonal, and pieces may attack in any of the four directions. Infantry may move one or two squares. Tanks may move 1 - 3 spaces. Missiles may move up to 5 spaces but when attacking are destroyed along with their target. Artillery moves one space but may attack a target up to 3 spaces away (without moving to that square). Airplanes may attack up to 10 squares away. Finally, each player may record one space that is mined and will destroy an enemy piece that moves onto it.

There is a screen that allows players to make their initial placements in secret. The first player makes a single move; his opponent then makes two; the first player makes two; and then the opponent makes three. Thereafter each player's turn includes three moves, enabling a variety of assaults, probes and counter-attacks.

name: Matanga Kids
description:
In Matanga Kids, each player has a sheet with numbers from 1 till 40 all messed up. The players have to find and check the numbers in decreasing order (from 40 till 1). There is only one pencil and the players must roll the dice and get an "X" to receive the pencil. As soon as another player gets the "X" result in the dice he receives the pencil and starts to find his numbers. The first player to complete his sheet is the winner.

This is Matanga! for kids.
The sheets are changed to,
1-20 for 5 or 6 years
1-40 for 7 or more, and for shorter game.
Others are variations of Matanga!.
Spiral
Ladybug（Illustration)

name: Kue: The Magic of Nines
description: Ninety-nine number tiles (eleven each of numbers zero through eight) are placed in Scrabble fashion onto a 13X13 grid. Each player plays from and replenishes a rack of six tiles, placing some or all of those tiles in a straight line so that they intersect or extend an existing line of tiles in the grid. The tiles in each line affected by the play must add up to zero or to a multiple of nine. The player scores a point for each multiple of nine and for each occurrence of zero in the affected lines. Placing on premium squares enhances scoring. The game ends when no tiles are left to draw, and one player has emptied his rack.

name: Bird Catcher
description:
Pick three birds of the same color and place them on the game board! We marked their places with three colored tiles for each
color. That is where you start!

The player who can get all three of his birds to the princess by rolling die and moving before the other players, wins the game. The remaining players continue until all the birds reached the goal.

name: Detective Bullshit
description:
Detective Bullshit is a game for 3-5 players you win by making shit up.

Think of Clue meets Cards Against Humanity, sort of. It's a competitive storytelling game centered around a fictional criminal case. Unlike Clue, there's no right answer, but like Cards Against Humanity, the fun is in getting your friends to pick your ridiculous story.

For each case, one player is Chief Bullshit and other players are detectives.

The Chief draws a victim card and decides the location of the crime. It's then up to the other detectives to play suspect cards from their hands and convince the Chief that their suspect is guilty. But things get complicated in the 3 rounds of each case as additional evidence, complications, and bribery keep even the best bullshitters on their toes.

—description from the publisher

name: The Boy Who Cried Wolf
description:
Goal:
Players have to collect cards by bluffing.

During the game, players have to collect Sheep cards (positive points) and pass Wolf cards, which eat sheep cards(minus points) to others by bluffing. At the end, the player with the most points is the winner.

Notice that Shepherd cards change your points (positive points into minus points or minus points into positive points).

name: Superior Defender Gundam Collectible Card Game
description:
The Superior Defender Gundam Collectable Card Game gives you the chance to command an army of Superior Defenders to conquer dangers in an epic struggle for planetary supremacy. Armed with a Force Deck of 30 cards (consisting of SD Cards, Weapon Cards, and Mission Cards), 2 battleships, and 10 points worth of Power Supply Chips, each player’s objective is to win battles among SD Gundams and move their 2 battleships to collect Power Supply Chips and advance into enemy territory, ultimately destroying their opponent's 2 battleships or conquering their opponent's base.

The game is played on two connected game mats with a Battlefield where SD Cards fight, a Command Board where battleships move to attack their opponent, activate Power Supply Chips, or Capture their opponent's Base, and an area where support SD Cards, Mission Cards, and Weapon Cards are played. Gameplay consists of five stages that are repeated until a player either destroys their opponent's 2 battleships or moves one of their battleships onto their opponent's base.

Supply Stage:
Draw one card from the Force Deck into your hand.

Advance Stage:
Move a battleship one connecting space on the Command Board, flipping over any Power Supply Chips it lands on.

Operation Stage: This stage is skipped during a player’s first turn.
Choose a Weapon Card with a range capable of attacking your opponent’s battleship from your hand and place it on the Weapon Card area in the Force Sector. Its Power Supply Requirement must be paid and the SD Symbol on the Chip must match the SD Symbol on the card being put into play. Weapon Cards are not sent to the Discard Pile until the Battle Stage is finished.

Battle Stage: This stage is skipped during a player’s first turn.
1. The player that initiates the attack goes first by choosing one of the SD Cards on their Battlefield and flipping it over. In order to attack, the chosen SD Card must have must have a target grid that highlights an area where an opponent’s SD Card is placed.

2. The ATTACKER and DEFENDER compare SD Powers. The SD Card with the higher Power, taking into account all Effects in play, wins the battle. The winning SD Card stays on the Battlefield face up. The losing SD Card gets sent to that player’s Discard Pile. In the event of a tie, both SD Cards remain face up on the Battlefield for the next turn. Face-up SD Cards can no longer be used to attack but can still be attacked by your opponent. They remain on the Battlefield until they have been defeated.

3. The DEFENDER is now given the chance to attack. Repeat steps 1 & 2 with the DEFENDER now as the ATTACKER.

4) Repeat steps 1-3 until a player defeats an opponent’s battleship. A player defeats their opponent’s battleship by defeating 3 of their SD Cards thus sending them to the Discard Area. If there are not enough SD Cards on the Battlefield for a player to defeat 3 of their opponent’s cards, the player who defeats more of their opponent’s SD Cards wins the battle.

5) The winner sends their opponent’s battleship back one space on the Command Board and moves their victorious battleship to the previously occupied space.

If the losing battleship cannot move back a space due to another battleship obstructing its movement, the losing battleship is destroyed and removed from the Command Board.
If the losing battleship cannot move back because it is at the back (1st Row) of the Command Board, the losing battleship is destroyed and removed from the Command Board.


Assign Stage:
Place one SD Card from your hand face down on any unoccupied space on the Battlefield. One Power Supply Point is required when placing an SD Card on the Battlefield. The SD Symbol of the chip must match the Symbol of the card being placed.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ascot: A Day at the Races
description:
This is a complex horseracing game that includes the purchase, sale and training of individual horses, choosing the best horses and jockeys for each race, establishing betting odds for each horse and trying to win money both by having a horse finish well and by winning bets.

Players each start with GBP250,000 and one horse, all with the same form rating. While at the Auction Ring each turn, a player rolls a D6 three times, to determine the mix of actions he may take: 1=Sell a horse for Form rating times current Auction Price; 2/3=Buy top horse on the deck on the same basis; 4=Read the Ascot Bulletin (draw event card); 5=Change the horse up for auction; 6=Change the Auction Price by drawing a new Auction card.

Then the players take the next card in the Race deck to see the distance, entry fee and prize money.
