Some races are restricted to horses of a certain Form Rating, or apply handicaps that help low-rated horses. Each player chooses a horse for the race and hires a jockey (better ones cost more). The combination of horse Form and jockey results in a number of tokens for each player. These tokens allow a horse to be moved extra spaces during the race.

The Form ratings of the horses are totaled and each horse uses it rating against the pack to establish betting odds. Players then place their bets and the race begins. Each move is based on an 8-sided die. Horses can move forward or diagonally, but not into a space with another horse. Tokens add one space, but only one can be used per die roll.

After the race, the prize money is paid out, bets are settled, and the game moves to the next Auction phase. The game may be ended after any number of races, with the player holding the most money combined with horse value (10,000xForm) being declared the winning trainer.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sergeants: Hell on Wheels – M2A1 Halftrack
description:
The M2A1 Halftrack was deployed to armored reconnaissance units because of its ability to maneuver over difficult ground. Equipped for almost any job, from engineering support, to scouting and armored infantry transport the M2A1 saw considerable service.

The Sergeants Hell on Wheels Vehicle Modules are playable with either Sergeants D-Day or Sergeants Miniatures Game. The M2A1 Halftrack Vehicle Module requires Sergeants Hell on Wheels for play.

Average Vehicle 17 VP
Number of Crew 5
Average Crew Total 10 VP

The M2A1 Halftrack Vehicle Module comes with:
•Vehicle Tactics Panel - cut into 6 parts for easy storage.
•32 cards for the vehicle itself and various tactics cards as options
•16 cards for Armored Assault Tactics
•16 cards for Armored Probe Tactics
•32 cards for the 2 crew with their action cards and special training cards.
•Vehicle Flats - to use for play with Sergeants D-Day: In Action, Burning, Tracked and Knocked Out
•Sighting Markers for the vehicles crew sighting targets
•Status Markers for "dismounted" crew and ordnance
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Attack Of The Mids
description:
"A small remote rural town has been attacked by strange gelatinous pyramids know as “Mids”.
Communications to the outside world were cut off as the Mids Assaulted the town, dissolving every thing in their path.
Attempts to fight back were useless, as any attack would only temporarily disperse the gooey Mids, Which would simply reform unharmed shortly thereafter.

The Survivors of the initial attack have gathered in the last safe place in town, The School. It was there amid the townspeople’s despair that a local Professor made an announcement that gave them a glimmer hope.
He proclaimed that he could devise a Formula to destroy the Mids for good. But he needed Samples of the Mids to complete it.

Can a few heroic individuals work together and gather the needed samples before the Town is overrun? Only you can answer that…"

This Is a Cooperative game Designed to be played with a 3house set of Looney Pyramids with gameplay similar to Flash Point:Fire Rescue or Pandemic.

Players will each take control of one of six characters,each with unique special abilities.

On a players turn they have two action points to spend to perform actions such as moving across the board,smashing Mids to remove them from the board or taking samples to deliver and advance the game winning formula toward completion.

After a player has finished their actions they must roll dice to spawn new Mids onto the board or trigger random events from the event die.

Players win if they are able to deliver all the necessary samples to the formula before the town is overrun by the Mids.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Nights of Reckoning
description:
Nights of Reckoning is an expansion set for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle, released by White Wolf in 2006. Unique among V:TES sets, the cards in Nights of Reckoning didn't feature any vampires or Disciplines; instead, they introduced the imbued hunters of Hunter: The Reckoning and their powers to the card game. No starter decks were produced for the Nights of Reckoning expansion, only booster packs; additionally, all cards in the set are new cards, with no reprints.

This set's break with the mainstays of normal V:TES deckbuilding and gameplay proved to be controversial, and its sales reflected its mixed reception. As a result, no further cards were produced for the imbued or their powers, and the handful of later cards that explicitly interacted with the imbued only did so as an additional function on top of their use in a typical V:TES deck.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: DINUOVO
description:
An educational boardgame about dinosaurs, made with the consultation of Cristiano Dal Sasso, a well-know italian paleontologist.

The game takes place in two phases: the hatching eggs and the battle of the dinosaurs
During the phase one you spin the wheel to get the cards of that particular type (i.e. quadrupedal, bipedal, carnivorous, herbivorous, etc.). At the end every player take the corresponding cards forming its own deck.
During the phase two you play the dinosaur cards to make them fight comparing the values written on the cards. The last player with a living dinosaur wins the game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Fighting, Prehistoric

name: Battle of the Penguins
description:
It's the year 3001, the habitat of the Penguins reduced during the global warming and became very small. The Penguins evolved to less friendly animals and became truculent. Now every piece of ice is important to survive. Several clans fight for there lives. This game is played with two of those clans.

The aim of this game is to survive with as many penguins as possible, attack other penguins and nourishing your Inuit family.

Each player draws a card out a line of three open cards and that card indicates the actions you are allowed to perform. There are three types of actions. Lay down your tiles, move your penguins and attack other penguins. When you fight, you role dice!!
There are 10 types of tiles, most of them with a special effect to be carried out. So be careful where you place your tiles,
it could harm yourself!

Meanwhile you have to support your Inuit family, by slaughtering killer whales, seals and opponent penguins. Every fight will be rewarded whether it is successful or not. It's your effort that is rewarded.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Frog Prince
description:
From the publisher:

Our story begins with a rash promise made by the well in the castle courtyard. The princess was playing with her golden ball on the edge of the well when the ball fell into the water. The princess was sobbing… in her despair, she even promised the frog who hurried to help her that in exchange for the ball, he may go with her to the palace.
The frog helped gladly, hoping that this girl would finally break the curse and turn him back into a handsome prince once again with her kiss, but when the princess held her favorite toy in her hands again, she didn’t want to keep any of her promises anymore, and she left him. The frog went after her to remind her of her forgotten promise…

User summary:
Game play:

Each player plays with a frog figure.


Starting from the 4 corners of the maze , frogs advance on tiles that are laid face down. When your frog lands on a tile path is discovered.
Make sure you avoid the maid though, she chases the frogs.
When a frog is caught by the maid, it has to start again from a corner of the maze and the path will be hidden again so memorizing what is on which tile is important.

the first player to reach the castle via the path (avoiding the maid) in the middle of the board may kiss the princess, the frog will become a prince now and that player wins the game.

name: Hector Tayleplufor
description:
The princess is imprisoned in the castle.
All the knights come rushing to save her…To earn a kiss from the princess they will have to: win a sword, trek over the mountain, collect the key to the keep, then cross the river.

(text from publisher's website)

Are you the knight that will save the princess? The first player who can overcome the obstacles and save the princess from the dungeon where she is kept captive wins the game.

How the game is played:

each player (up to 4) has a wooden figure representing a knight, they start in the (4) corners of the board.
the wooden figure of the princess, who is trapped in the dungeons of the castle, start in the middle of the board (castle)
the two dragon figures start in the caves.
during the game the players can gain swords (these are neede to defend against a dragon) or keys
via dice rolls (the dice have no pips but images on them) the swords can be won
in the caves the players can gain cards but beware of the dragons! These cards are needed to gain a key
once they key is obtained the players still need to pass a bridge (a dice is rolled there) and when they do they can free the princess with their obtained key.

the player who succeeds in releasing the princess from the castle wins the game

name: Kaiju Canal
description:
User summary
アミダ魚雷 (Amida Gyorai) means "Ghost Leg Torpedo" in English.

Place your Battle Ship and Ghost Leg panels in a good combination to hit the Monster by your torpedo(s). The player who manages to ring the Fire bell and strike the Monster with their torpedo(es) receives the "gem" left by the Monster.

The player who gathers the highest number of gems wins.

Publisher's summary
自分の「戦艦パネル」と「アミダパネル」をうまく繋げて、「カイジュウ」に魚雷を当てましょう。
「発射ベル」を鳴らして見事に魚雷を当てることができたプレイヤーは、カイジュウが落としていった「宝石」がもらえます。

一番多く宝石を集めたプレイヤーがゲームに勝利します。

name: Explore the 50 States
description:
From the publisher:

Explore the 50 States from Maine to Hawaii - and all points in between. Explore the people and places that make the United States such a unique country.

Question cards teach kids interesting facts about the geography and history of the fifty states, while Travel cards add a fun twist - moving players forward or backward on their adventure. Additional facts are included on the cards to make the topics more interesting.

Addition information:

Players spin to determine which type of card to draw. Three of the four decks include questions about history, geography, or state flags. Answering correctly means the player can move forward. Drawing a travel card simply moves a player forward or backward. The player who circles the board first wins.

name: Red X: Facility 342
description:
Red X: Facility 342 is a hidden role playing game where team loyalty is constantly changing.

Players are either part of an alien race that reproduces by taking over the mind and body of a living host, or part of the research team that is attempting to assemble a purification device that will cure the infected players, ultimately saving the entire human race.

Red X: Facility 342 requires multiple playing areas that allow players to go on missions in order to collect parts, but BEWARE, when left alone with an alien you are in danger of being infected yourself. Two players start off already infected. The rest of the players are human researchers, by the second round you don't know who you can trust anymore.

Roles are assigned by passing out DNA Verification Cards at the start of the game. Players choose a Head Researcher and then get sent on a mission with one other player. Mission Rooms are isolated areas located in other parts of the house. Decided by a dice roll researchers may be infected by the alien they were unknowingly paired up with or the researchers could possibly return with a part to the machine needed to kill off the aliens. The aliens win if they can infect the entire research team; the researchers win if they can collect all the parts needed to build the purification device. Either way this exciting hidden role playing game will keep you guessing the entire time.
________________________________________________________________________

"There's a lot of social deduction games out there. What makes yours different? What makes your game special? Why do you enjoy it?" - Aaron

Great question Aaron,
What makes Facility 342 different from what is out there?
I created my game for a couple reasons.

First was because of the number of players current social deduction games can have. We found ourselves with 10-15 players (5-7 couple) quite often. The Resistance cannot be played with that many people. We could play Werewolf but I do not like how you eliminate players.

Second I wanted to add a new element to the social deduction game. Players loyalty can change during game play in Facility 342. What better scenario than body snatchers.

Lastly I wanted a social deduction game that had a role playing feel to it. In my game you have to physically leave the game table to go on a mission with another player. This allows things to happen in private that can affect the whole game. This also allows players to talk in private about their plans and they can use this time to figure out what is going on, or trick players without the interruptions of other players.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Exploration, Horror, Memory, Party Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Role Playing, Trick-taking, Voting

name: Infiltrate: into the bear cave
description:
Description from the designer:

You have woken up early this morning.
All week long you have been working up courage for today´s big adventure:
Today you will dare to climb down old Doctor Humboldt´s cave to find his fabled diaries
that you and your friends had been talking about all summer.

And now you´re standing there at the cave´s entrance.
The first rays of the sun coming through the last remains of the forest´s foliage are still too weak to warm you up
and a strange smell hovers above the dark hole in the ground in front of you.
The sounds of your stomach make you realize that you must have forgotten your breakfast –
too late to go back now...

Infiltrate: into the bear cave is a cave exploration treasure hunting game for one player – without combat.
The goal of the game: Reach the bottom of the cave, search the storage chambers, find Dr Humboldt´s diaries and return with them to the surface – but don´t get caught by the bears!

The Cave
The cave you will be exploring is made up of two parts:

Part one is the cave itself – a randomized stack of cave tiles creating a three dimensional labyrinth.
Starting above ground all you can see is three manholes leading into the cave below stretching 4 floors deep into the rock. Glimpsing through those manholes might give you an idea what awaits you down there...
This allows you to make an educated guess about which way might be the best path through the cave while still allowing for surprises along the way.

The second part of the cave is the hidden information track that is used to store everything that is hidden and happening below ground in the chambers of the cave you haven´t discovered yet.
The track is not only used to store the items of the still hidden chambers but also to move the cave´s inhabitants through those chambers as well.

During the game when you gradually explore the cave you will fan out the cave tiles along the hidden information track to get a two dimensional representations of the cave that makes all chambers and possible routes between them visible.

The Bears (the AI of the game)
The rumours were right: There is indeed living a bear in this cave – and not only one, but three..
Those bears will roam the cave while you´re busy exploring.

They are steered by their own desires. Each bear´s desires are represented by a cup filled with wooden cubes of different colours.

Each colour stands for a different desire. The composition of those cubes represents what goes on in the bear´s head and will change during the game according to what that bear experiences.
The bears will either be tired – doing nothing, hungry – searching for food, angry – looking for things to destroy, or bloodthirsty – coming for you..!
During the game you will draw cubes form the bear´s cup to determine what the bear wants to do and in which direction and how far it will move.

Yourself and your actions
On your turn you can climb through the cave, open crates, carry and use items.
For all this you need energy. Like the bears you also have a cup with wooden cubes that represent your energy reserve – and also your fear that will get in the way of your plans from time to time .
Each turn you draw as many energy cubes as you like – the amount drawn equals the amount of energy you can spend on this turn. But if you draw a black cube you are instantly paralysed with fear. You could still make your body move but only for a certain cost - or you have to stand still shivering in the dark, hoping that the bears will not find you..

Experience
Certain key moments during your adventure will help you unlock hidden (one time) powers that you never knew to possess.

The Items
Dr Humboldt has stored away his belongings in a huge number of crates that can be found all over the cave. Those crates contain items that will help you survive on your quest.
Some make you stronger, some help you deal with the bears.
But to carry those items around in the narrow cave takes concentration. You have to set aside the necessary energy to be able to do that.
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Cherki
description:
Cherki (Also known as Ceki) is a popular card game originating from South East Asia. Any number of players from 2 to 6 can take part.

Cherki is a card game played using decks of 60 cards (30 different patterns, each one repeated twice), each measuring approximately 60mm X 24mm in size. To play the game, 2 packs/decks are required, so that each single card will be repeated four times.

Cherki is quite similar to the Chinese game of Mahjong (from which it might have originated), though its structure is more simple, and each round requires a much shorter time to be played.

name: Build a Better Bot
description:
Q: What is it?

A: A light card game about building and selling robots in a fluctuating market, for 2-5 players.

Q: How is it played?

A: Players take turns choosing cards from a row, adding value to all the cards below the one they chose. Once they have a complete bot with a head, torso and legs, they can sell it.

Q: What makes it interesting?

A: The money you earn for selling a robot is based on 1: The current market value of each colour, and 2: how many parts are the same colour. The market shifts after each robot is sold, so keeping track of what your opponents are doing and how they will affect the game is important.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Arctic Dash: Curious Kids
description:
Description from the publisher:

The route to the wintering grounds has been planned. As the adult narwhal(s), lure and shepherd the curious young narwhals along the way in time to get the tastiest fish. These are separate solitaire/co-op rules made to use the same components as Arctic Dash: A Narwhal Race, intended to be played with or by younger kids.

You (and an optional second player) are trying to get 2 young narwhals from the start tile, across a short two tiles, to the end tile on the other side. Though not far, the child narwhals movement is dice driven, and they will frequently wander towards seaweed and interesting fish along the path, instead of where you may wish. The board grows organically to provide more distractions as the child narwhals roam.

With a roll of your own movement dice, you (and your optional second player) can pick up fish to lure the children, clear seaweed to remove distractions, and nudge the children along the path.

With luck, and no small amount of planning, you and the young narwhals will have plenty of tasty fish for the season!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Exploration, Nautical, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sway:  A Game of Silver Linings
description:
Description from the publisher:


A hilarious party game in which players go head-to-head in debates about totally different topics.
Challenges like "Speak Like a Pirate" and "Do Yoga Poses" add to the fun.
Compact and easily portable, small enough to fit in a medium-sized purse or hold in one hand.
Includes 500 Topics, 75 Challenges, 1 Alternate Case card, a spinner and a 30-second timer.
All game elements feature original drawings by Sam Birchman, a Seattle-based artist (except timer).


Sway is a hilarious, positive party game in which players go head-to-head in "debates" about totally different topics - the catch is they can only discuss the POSITIVES of those topics, even when the topic seems negative on the surface (e.g. "Locking Your Keys in Your Car." To add to the fun, both players complete the same challenge while making their case; things like "Speak in a Southern Accent" or "Dance the Robot." A judge is decided at the end of the round and awards cards as they see fit for the topic, challenge or both. Sway is a simple game that brings people together, induces laughter, and helps show the good in all things. It exposes sides of your friends, family or co-workers you've never seen before. Imagine hearing your grandma discuss the positive aspects of a getting fired in her best (or worst) Scottish accent - that's what Sway is like. It’s fun and funny, but not anyone else's expense.

name: Circle of the 7
description:
A resource gathering game where you are paying off the various noble houses of Dayrm to become the successor of the dead regent to the city of Farsley. You will move your agents to each of the different merchants to gather the fine goods that these noble families desire in order to back your claim to become the next regent.

The modular board allows each game to be unique. Each of the different payoffs can be played randomly under each of the 7 noble houses. The order of the merchants is never the same as they populate around and create the game board. Be the first to gather all the required items and become the next regent of Farsley.

name: NOS Jeugdjournaal
description:
Time to create your own news channel!

Experience how it feels to be the main editor, cameraman, reporter or presenter for your own news channel. Start your journey traveling through the Netherlands while collecting all kind of different news in towns and cities. You can even travel to the far end of Asia to collect some world news. But watch out! Other news makers are watching your every move to steal your news for their own show. Are you the first one to collect all the news?

NOS Jeugdjournaal is a fun family game for up to 4 players older than 8 years old. A dice roll decides how far you can walk and how much news you can check. Try to remember the colors because each player can only collect news from a specific color. The first one that has his news complete wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tank Hunter 2e Monster
description:
Tank Hunter is a simple yet engaging card game featuring all possible tanks from WW2. The players start with a line-up of hidden tanks and can place them in the front line or the back line. Cards can be flipped to be revealed, and revealed tanks can attack other player's tanks.

Tank Hunter 2e Monster is a standalone game that also serves as an expansion for Tank Hunter.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Hogswallow
description:
Hogswallow is an open ended, mythical storytelling game for 2 to 6 players. Players use the primitive imagery on the cards to guide the creation of a cohesive tale. The glyphs on the cards do not have any fixed meanings. They are purposefully pliable, designed to jump start the imagination, and may be interpreted differently from player to player and game to game.

Hogswallow is wonderfully adaptable and suitable for any age and any group, as the stories told are created completely by the participants. The rules provide the three most common variations of play, including one cooperative method, and two competitive ways to play.

In the cooperative version "High Hogswallow", the players take turns adding an element to the story, building off what has come before until one of them wins by bringing the story to satisfactory conclusion.

In the competitive versions, players play only with their own hand of cards to either trump the single card that was played before them in a storytelling battle (Dilly Dallying) or to tell the best story using a limited hand of cards, argue it's merits compared to the other stories, and ultimately vote on whose was the best (Low Hogswallow).

name: Rulers of the Continent Soccer
description:
Description from the publisher:

Fast-play solo stat sports sim dedicated to the early years of European Soccer knockout competitions. Rulers of the Continent permits you to replay entire tournaments, with scorers, in just a few dice rolls per match.

Individual sets are available, each including the base rulebook necessary to play, for the European Champions Cup, Cup Winners Cup and UEFA Cup.

For each match, teams are rated based on the number of goals they scored and conceded in the historical tournament, and these ratings are compared to identify a column on a chart. Along with a 2d6 roll, this determines the initial number of goals scored.

Teams have a "third dice" stat ensuring that those that did well in the actual tournament have a better chance of advancing, while still allowing for shock results and giant killings. A d10 roll determines whether or not each team gets to adjust the initial goal results, with the "better" teams more often gaining this advantage.

A percentile dice roll provides the name of the scorer of each goal, again based on the historical results of the competition.

With just a handful of rolls per match, an entire Tournament can be completed, and a Champion crowned, in a single sitting.

Builds on the game engine of the designer's World Cup soccer game, Dream To End All Dreams.

name: Final Deathweek
description:
You should have died in that huge accident last summer — but one of your compatriots had had a premonition in which they saw the accident happen, and you had decided to trust this, and thus managed to escape death at the last moment. You returned from the banks of the Styx feeling that you could now enjoy summer life with more treks and more beaches...but you can't relax just yet. Fate doesn't like when people tamper with her whims, and the angel of Death is stretching his hands towards you slowly but surely. Will you be able to escape his clutches for another week? It's a desperate, shared struggle for survival.

Final Deathweek is a cooperative card game. Players hold cards that symbolize "death flags" (death warnings) of certain colors. Each turn, each player in order must select one of the available events for the day, trying to NOT match the colors of the event with the color(s) they have in hand. While not matching colors, they should also try to form chains with the events they take. If the colors do match, the player takes damage, eventually being killed if too much damage is taken.

The game lasts for seven days, and if all players survive, they beat the game.

name: The Nemesis Crown
description:
The Nemesis Crown was a global narrative campaign created by Games Workshop for their Warhammer Fantasy setting, that started in late June 2007. The Mordheim Nemesis Crown development team led by Mark Havener authored the supplement. It was last official Mordheim expansion featuring some of the game's original contributors to be published digitally by Games Workshop. It followed the same story composed by Andy Hoare for Warhammer, through a series of campaign scenario concepts designed by Stuart Cresswell.

Welcome to the Great Forest where the race for the artefact known as the Nemesis Crown has begun. Lying deep within the heart of the Empire, the locale presents a problem for the Vampire Counts, the Skaven Lords, the Chaos Champions and the other warlords who would search for the fabled relic. Marching an army roughshod through the lands of the Empire would be a foolish and inefficient use of resources. If these races are to scour the very heart of the land then stealth and subterfuge will be required. And being a dark, dense, tangled and vast area of wilderness, the Great Forest contains many areas too wild and remote for even the Empire's own armies to access. Thus the responsibility for scouring for clues will often fall to small foraging parties, operating beneath the gaze of the armies who march upon the region.

The Mordheim Nemesis Crown development team were; Ian Davies, John Severn, Chris Templin, Mark Havener, Mike Kitch, Stuart Cresswell, Terry Maltman & Tommy Muller. Story-telling by 'Rev' David Warrington.

Artist credits for the Nemesis Crown global campaign; Markus Trenkner, Alun Davies, Alex Boyd, Paul Dainton, David Gallagher & Nuala Kinrade
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Carillon
description: In Carillon, you buy bells from a workshop to build a carillon, and as in Coloretto, players either set a card on a workshop or gain all cards — but gained cards are set into a particular form, so collecting only cards of the same color is not the best way to play.

name: Justice League: Hero Dice – Superman: Promokarte
description: Promo card for Justice League: Hero Dice - Superman with german text "Neutralisiere bis zu 2 Kryptonit" ("Neutralize up to 2 Kryptonite").
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Prospectica
description:
Description from the publisher:

Prospectica is a 2 to 4 player card game with a theme of mining asteroids in space. The object of the game is to be the first player to successfully find, seed and mine three unique asteroids.

The gameplay changes depending on your starship and various upgrades you may attach to it such as Engines, Drills and Storage.

These upgrades can affect your the number of cards you may draw, how many minerals you can mine and how many cards you can hold in your hand.

Players take turns drawing from the draw pile or discard pile. The goal is to draw a small, medium and large asteroid from the deck and play them face up in front of the player. Once at least on asteroid is played, the player can then begin to seed the asteroid with mineral cards (also found in the deck).

There are six unique minerals, and each asteroid has a requirement of how many minerals are needed to seed it. Once a player has the correct number of minerals for the asteroid, they play them on top of the face up asteroids they have discovered so far.

The final step for the player is to mine the minerals on a fully seeded asteroid. Players only seed and mine their own asteroids. To mine an asteroid, the player must use a pricing contract card (found throughout the deck). These pricing cards have various values from 20 to 120 and are an important part of the scoring. The player is allowed to mine one mineral for each drill on their starship per contract card they hold.

Once the player fully depletes an asteroid of minerals, they turn it sideways to score additional points. The first player to mine all three of the asteroids wins the hand, and all players tally their score up to that point.

The first player to reach 4000 points wins the game. This usually requires a multiple hands of play to achieve.

name: Folanimos
description:
A game of observation and speed. What cry might a lion with a cow's body make? Or a mouse with an elephant's head? A crazy game of animal cries that might make you lose your head!

In more detail: Game comes with 48 wooden tiles, 24 with animal heads, and 24 with the corresponding bodies. These tiles are put together so that heads are connected to a non matching body. Then cards that match the tiles are flipped over one at a time. The players must find the tile that matches the card and then make the noise that you would expect from the other half. E.g. If the card showed a frog's head and the frog's head tile was joined to the body of a pig, the players would need to make an 'Oink' noise. The first player to make the correct animal sound wins the card.

name: Sherlock Holmes Détective Conseil: Oliver Stone
description:
On a brisk Sunday morning at around 10am, as we wind our way around the grounds of the Tower of London, a boy, not more than ten years of age, hails Wiggins with a message:

My dear friends, Oliver Stone was found dead in his home. I think it might be instructive for you to look into this matter. Meet me tomorrow afternoon at 221B to compare our respective investigations, if you wish. S.H.

So begins "The Oliver Stone Case," a single extra case expansion originally published in Role Mag' (#3 - November-December 1990).
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based

name: Octo
description:
Octo is a press-your-luck dice-rolling game where the goal is to set, and then maintain, a high score. Once a player has set the score, it's up to the rest of the players to beat it--and then become the holder of the score themselves.

Players start with eight six-sided dice and roll them all at once, then must set aside at least one of the dice rolled. They may then stop or reroll all dice not set aside. The caveat is that the same face value may not be claimed more than once per turn; once you've set aside two sixes, for example, further sixes you roll cannot be used. If you roll and cannot set aside any of the dice due to them matching previously-rolled values, you bust.

Octo is one of several games Reiner Knizia describes in his book Dice Games Properly Explained.

name: Giftmas with the Grimms
description:
It is Giftmas and you, along with the rest of the Grimm family, are engaging in the tradition of sharing presents, wonderful things like cakes, puppies and electrodes. Will you get what you want, or what you deserve?

In this 18-card game, players each have a character card and two or three gift cards (depending on player count) face down on the table in front of them. When it is your turn you may either swap one of your face-down cards with one elsewhere on the table, or turn a card face-up, possibly activating a special action on the gift cards. The round ends when more than half of the players have revealed their cards or when a bomb is revealed, at which point everyone scores points if they have collected the gifts wanted by their characters.

The twist comes from the bombs: only one of the character scores highly if she collects bombs, but other characters score nothing for the round if they have one.

After an agreed number of rounds, the player with the highest total score is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Cats Abiding Horribly: Episode III – The SJWs Strike Back (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
A third Cats Abiding Horribly party expansion to Cards Against Humanity.

From the publisher:
"Have you played the game and expansions so many times that by now you’ve memorized all the possible funny combinations? Does the game simply not excite you like it used to anymore? Or perhaps you’re just looking for something a little bit different?

If any of this sounds familiar to you then Horribly Abiding Cats is exactly what you need.

Revitalize your games with 150 new, uncensored, unofficial and anti-politically-correct cards. The deck contains 110 answer, 40 question + 10 blank bonus cards that mix in seamlessly with the original game and expansions.

Printed on high-quality casino cardstock with a linen finish, you are guaranteed to enjoy this expansion for a very long time."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Mature / Adult

name: Kreus: Châtiment de Némésis
description:
This French-only promo mini-expansion consists of 10 cards

One aggression card, "Châtiment de Némésis"
Four isolated elements
Card with new rules
Two art cards
Two advertisements


The new aggression card replaces the Hécatonchires ("Hekatonkheires") card. Its effect is to discard the last played card; if that card was already discarded, nothing happens.

The isolated elements replace elements without symbols. An isolated element can only be played directly after an Aggression or Nature card. Otherwise, it is discarded.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Loonacy: Fruitcake Fun Pack Expansion
description: Released during one of Looney Labs' free holiday gift giveaways, it contains five cards: fruitcake/ship; fruitcake/statue of liberty; fruitcake/house; fruitcake/the looneys; and fruitcake/chocolate bar. Requires Loonacy base game to play.

name: Rocket Cats in Space!
description: You are a cat admiral sending your rocket cats into space to mark your territory. This is a fast paced dexterity game were you have 5 seconds to flick your rocket cats on to the planets that match the star map cards. The first person to 10 points wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pattern Building
publishers: Screech Dragon Studios, Vile Genius Games LLC

name: Screen Play
description:
From the Box:

The entertaining movie mime game that's a real performance.

A game for all budding movie moguls! Teams compete to collect the 6 items necessary to make a film - a director, a male and female lead, a script, an advertising campaign and a location.

Success is determined by knowledge of films, by miming talents, and by inventiveness and imagination. Players have 1 minute in which to clue their team into guessing the selected name on the card - by whatever means they can!

And in the grand finale, when a team has collected the 6 necessary cards, there's still a chance to steal success.

A game with simple rules that can provide hours of entertainment - Screen Play is for film addicts everywhere.

name: Das neue Österreich Quiz
description:
Das neue Österreich Quiz is a trivia game containing 220 question cards with three multiple choice answers each.

The game is played in turns. Every player has to answer a question but can choose not to hear the multiple choices. If he opts to do so, he gets 3 points for the correct answer or 0 points if he was wrong. If he chooses to use the multiple choice option, he gets 2 points for the correct answer, but if answered wrong, he gets another chance but then only 1 point is awarded for the correct answer.

The game ends at the end of a round in which a player collected 30 points. The player with the most points is the winner.

name: Kill Doctor Lucky: Ebenezer Lucky Promo Card
description:
Double sided (Happy & Grouchy) Promo Card included in GTM #202

Whenever a player discards the last point of luck on a murder attempt, they take the card. It is worth +2 to any murder attempt.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Lost in R'lyeh: Unholy Presents
description: Lost in R'lyeh: Unholy Presents is a single card expansion for Lost in R'lyeh that forces each player to give one card to the player on their left, then banishes the stack.

name: Perplexus Micro: Q-Bot
description:
From the publisher's website:

The first in the new Perplexus Micro line! Inside the clear cube is a fun and funky robot that features a winding, moving track for players to maneuver the marble through! Perplexus® Micro was designed to attract the attention of Perplexus fans, as well as draw in new players with its 3" size and smaller price. These collectible games are easy to pick up, but hard to put down!

There are 33 challenges to this 3D maze game.

name: Pokémon TCG: Black & White Expansion
description:
The Black & White Expansion was the first expansion in the Black & White Series for the Pokémon Trading Card Game.

Black & White included 115 Cards (114 + 1 Secret).

Products included three Theme Decks of fixed cards (60 each), a Black & White Trainer Kit, and Booster Packs of 10 Cards Each.

Theme Decks for Black & White (60 Fixed Cards Each):

Blue Assault Theme Deck
Red Frenzy Theme Deck
Green Tornado Theme Deck


Booster Packs for Black and White (10 Randomized Cards Each):

Zebstrika Pack
Zoroark Pack
Reshiram Pack
Zekrom Pack
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: The Pokémon Company International, Wizards of the Coast

name: Hybris
description:
Hybris. A planetary system with unimaginable riches...

Hybris is a quick 2-player 4X space game, where players research technologies, build wonders, expand their civilization and fight against each other. You know, the good stuff. At the beginning of each round, 6 dice are rolled. Players then alternate taking a single die, placing it on one of the action spaces, and finally performing the corresponding action. Actions usually involve expanding to new areas, researching new technologies, building galactic wonders, trading or increasing political influence. Game ends when one of the three victory conditions (Cultural, Scientific or Military) is reached.

name: Ninja All-Stars: Clan Tora
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Tora are, much like their totem the Tiger, a proud and haughty people, always ready to pounce, taking the initiative or advantage. The Tora find it hard to understand or trust anyone who won’t fight for their ideas or express their emotions with passion. Honor is of extraordinary importance to the Tora, and they pursue it and defend it with the utmost of their fiery passion.

The Tora have applied their fiercely competitive nature to the arena of the mind in the same way that they compete physically. Combined with their mountainous homeland, this inquisitive competitiveness has shaped the Tora into the preeminent smiths and alchemists in all Kagejima. Tora weapons are finely forged and their understanding of alchemical reactions is unsurpassed, leading them to make, not only the first firearms on the island, but the finest as well.

name: I Attack!
description:
Card, Board & Strategy Game.

The objective of the game is to get rid of all weapons on hand in series of attacks.

The first player who gets rid of all his weapons wins the 1st place, the second player - the 2nd place and so on.

The last player left holding cards takes the last place.
Each weapon has its own power units that determines its ability to attack and defend.

All weapons are ranked by colors - an attack of a weapon can be beaten by a weapon of the same color.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Stalin's Final War: What if the Soviet Union Attacked in 1953?
description:
Stalin’s Final War: 1953 What If? (SFW) is an alternative history wargame intended to investigate the strategic parameters that would’ve been in place during the first 10 weeks of operations had that dictator lived long enough to put in motion his plan to start World War III in 1953. Had he lived, the most likely start date would’ve been one closely coinciding with the signing of the Korean War armistice in July (in order to achieve a surprise effect).

His main goal in starting such a war wouldn’t have been immediate global conquest; rather, in Europe he would’ve been seeking to seize or thoroughly wreck the Ruhr – then, as now, one of the world’s main industrial regions – or otherwise abort the still young Federal Republic of Germany (“West Germany”) as an effective member of the Western alliance. In Asia, the then already long-sought conquest of the Korean peninsula would’ve been the objective, thereby putting Japan into what would’ve amounted to a geo-strategic vice, given the USSR already possessed Sakhalin Island to its north.

There are atomic warfare rules, but their use by the Communist side is constrained by the limited availability of the bombs themselves, as well as by their historic lack at that time of a fully dependable means to deliver them. On the Allied (a.k.a. “United Nations” or “UN” or “US”) side, the limitation is a cultural one. That is, the early 1950s marked the full blown emergence of the anti-imperialist (a.k.a. “hate America” of “third world” or “non-aligned”) movement onto the global media stage. If, therefore, the Americans were to try to win the war by using enough a-bombs to simply blow to bits the attacking Communist hordes, they would do so much damage to the environmental and socio-political ecologies as to undo that battlefield victory in the broader grand-strategic sense. One map covers West Germany and its immediate environs; the other covers the Korean peninsula south from the Pyongyang-Wonsan “neck.” Each hexagon on both maps represents 10 miles (16 km). The Communist units of maneuver are armies and corps, while those on the UN side are mostly divisions along with a few corps. Air power is represented abstractly, with counters and rules showing the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary air superiority above one or both theaters of operation. Each full game turn represents one week of ‘real time’ from late July to early October 1953.

Product Information
Complexity: 6 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 8 out of 10
Time Scale: 10 one-week turns
Map Scale: 10 miles (16.2 km) per hex
Units of Maneuver: armies, corps & divisions

Players: one, two, three or four Playing Time: four to eight hours Two 34x22” large-hex maps Two counter-sheets of 9/16” (16mm) units (456 total) One rulebook

name: Greedy Farm
description:
Description from the publsiher:

Greedy Farm is a fast-paced, totally addictive game that you can play in minutes. Grab all the ripen produce cards as fast as you can, but beware of pests that can make you win big time or lose big time (from the back of the box).

Cards which show agricultural products or various pests are distributed evenly among the players. On your turn you turn over the top card of your stack to the middle of the table. If you turn over the 4th card of any type of product or a critter that eats some of the products showing everybody tries to grab the corresponding cards as quickly as possible. Whoever has collect the most points after all cards have been playe wins the game.
publishers: Party On Board Game Design Studio, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Themiscyra
description:
A territorial game for 2 players, Black and White

Materials
10x10 board
a supply of black and white stones
8 neutral rings

Definitions
Adjacent - means orthogonally and/or diagonally adjacent

Open Area - two or more contiguous empty spaces on the board

Object
A player that is last to move, wins.

Setup
Board starts out empty

Starting with Black turns then alternate

Within a straight line of orthogonal or diagonal empty spaces place two friendly stones and then place a ring over one of these two stones

This continues until all 8 rings are on the board

Play
Starting with Black turns then alternate

Within a straight line of orthogonal or diagonal empty spaces place two friendly stones, then move a ring onto one of these two stones

Restrictions
You may only move a ring from a friendly stone

The ring you choose to move and the stone the ring is to be placed over must be adjacent to the same open area

Clarifications
The two stones placed on a turn must not have any stones between them

A ring can only be moved through an open area that it is adjacent to

A ring that is not adjacent to an open area cannot be moved

End of Game
The game ends when a player is unable to complete his turn

(Thanks to Stephen Tavener, you can play it with AiAi)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Knights of Camelot
description:
You are a Lord of Camelot and the only thing standing in the way between you and the empty Throne are your unworthy opponents.

Play your hand of 4 cards with a skillful mixture of trickery and bluff to secure the support of more Knights of the Round Table than your rivals in order to claim yourself ruler of Camelot.

With a poker face worthy of a King use the abilities of the Cardinal, Seer, Champion and Poisoner to protect your position and hinder your contenders--who of course will be trying to do the same to you!

name: Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition – Tom Vasel Promo Card
description:
This promo was originally available as a reward for backing the 2014 Dice Tower Kickstarter Campaign.

"Tom Vasel"

If you have not been eliminated by the end of the game, you are the only one who wins. -3
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: O Empresário
description:
The objective of the game is to obtain the maximum income from the factories and to apply the profits by investing in Villas or in the stock market.

In each round the investor:

Rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board (if the player is using the Spectrum app, he moves the number of spaces accordingly)
Exports merchandise (if desired)
Makes all the transactions he want.


The game ends when the time limit (decided by the players) is reached or the deck of cards is empty.

The winner is the investor with the most capital.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Avignon: A Clash of Popes – The Heretic Promo
description:
Heretic promo card available through Kickstarter and Patreon from Button Shy games.

Contents:

Heretic x 2
A face-down Character has no name and no abilities (Petition, Alternate Win, or Trigger).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Print & Play, Religious

name: Bullyparade: Der Film – Das Kartenspiel
description: Bullyparade: Der Film – Das Kartenspiel is a game. More details to follow.

name: Bushido: Yuto
description:
Yuto relished and excelled in training involving the use of a range of equipment, he believes that often some well-placed caltrops to thwart pursuers attempts to catch him or his squad or a smoke bomb to throw off their senses can change the course of a mission. His successful string of missions suggests there may be something to his claims. It is certain that members of any squad he is part of are glad to have him and his carefully selected assortment of items along with them.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: KV-47K (TSH) Light Tesla Walker – "Anatoly"
description:
Another tropical variation based upon the classic KV47 series, the L model, or Anatoly, mounts two very efficient Tesla guns, derived from the Red Lightning support weapon. The Anatoly’s capacitors allow it to fire both Tesla weapons in rapid succession, but this leaves it defenceless until the capacitors recharge. Being a Tesla weapon, it incapacitates its targets, even if it does not destroy them outright.

Using pack tactics, the KV-47L Anatoly can take on much larger walkers. Like its cousin the Aleksei, the Anatoly’s small size makes it perfect for special operations. It can easily be air-dropped, put on a landing craft, or travel through a dense jungle with equal facility.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Sheep Sheep
description:
In Sheep Sheep, players are trying to collect the most sheep of a particular color.

Each turn, a player has 1 minute and 30 seconds to exchange sheep from their own line of 4 with one from the 3x3 common area. Once time's up, they collect all the sheep in a row and/or column that have the same color in the common area and tuck them under their own personal goal sheep. They are then replaced with ones from the draw deck.

At the end of the game, players tally up their score. Every sheep they've collected is worth 1 point but those that match their goal card are worth 2. Whoever has the most points wins.

name: Desperados of Dice Town: Tuco Promo Character
description:
This promo character replaces a 'Brain' character from any of the gangs.

When escaped, his powers are:
1 action symbol: Draw and keep the last Wild West card discarded.
2 action symbols: Draw the last 2 Wild West cards discarded and keep one.
3 action symbols: Draw the last 3 Wild West cards discarded and keep one.

This promo was available with issue 72 of Plato Magazine.

name: Monster Rejects: Battle Pack
description: Expansion pack for Monster Rejects. Add more strategy and fun by giving your monsters weapons, curses, potions and more. 50 Cards to accompany Monster Rejects.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Empires: Galactic Rebellion – Faction Power Cards
description: 12 new faction power cards that add another strategic tool to your arsenal! When using the faction power cards, players can either; 1.) Draft these (one per player) in reverse starting order (last player selects first) or; 2.) Blind draw their Powers.

name: Niemenczyn 1794
description:
Free DTP war game.

The game "Niemenczyn 1794" recreates a skirmish, which occurred on 27th April 1794 near Vilnius. Polish unit of Lieutenant Colonel Stefan Grabowski attacked outnumbered force of Lieutenant Colonel Lewiz. The insurgents lost the clash. Board war game “Niemenczyn 1794” gives you the opportunity to lead Polish and Russian forces that fought against each other. An alternative scenario allows players to see how the battle could have turned out if more insurrectionary cavalry had taken part. Will the Poles enter the enemy camp? Or will the Polish attacks be stopped by Russian musket and artillery fire? The outcome of that battle is in your hands.

Rules of the game utilize the proven mechanisms of the games of the battles of the Kosciuszko Uprising ("Raclawice 1794", "Szczekociny 1794" and "Maciejowice 1794"). Due to the small amount of counters, "Niemenczyn 1794" is a good introduction to these games.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Krill
description:
Description from the publisher:

The sea is too small for two! Expand your krill kingdom and stop other krill clans to become the only ruler of the sea. There can be only one krill king! However, be aware of the pitfalls of the sea! Cruel creatures, unexpected natural events and dangerous vessels can stand on your way to victory!

Krill is a tile-laying strategy board game where the players take turns to place tiles on the game board. As they do so, their krill swarms emerge and grow. Players can place krill swarm tiles to build their krill swarm and to block other players, they can play special tiles to move, rotate or remove krill swarm tiles from the game board, or they can place krill knights instead to protect their krill swarm from the effects of special tiles. At the end of the turn, the players can relocate their krill knights for the best protection or suit their strategy.

The game is over when the whole game board is full, and it's scoring time. Each player scores one victory point for each krill swarm segment connected with at least one of his krill knights.

name: Bushido: Takashi Houseguard
description:
All lords maintain a healthy number of household guards, training warriors to keep them safe from their enemies. The Takashi guard’s body may not be as honed as that of the Ashigaru who constantly train and drill. This does not mean that their eyes are not sharp as blades and their ears keen as hawks, skills developed over the years watching for threats to their lords and ladies.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 5150: Alien Fight Night
description:
Nobody likes a punch in the face!

Except for the crowds in New Hope City! Because of the demographics in New Hope City the entertainment entrepreneurs wanted a sporting event that would appeal to everyone, both Basics (Humans) and Aliens, so they chose boxing.

Alien Fight Night is game within a game. Not only is it a fast paced stand-alone boxing game, it's a great diversion for your Urban Renewal Stars. They can supplement their income as a fighter or maybe just be a spectator. It's perfect for generating Encounters like those used in New Hope City, PI.

Alien Fight Night can be played solo or head to head against your friends and inside you'll find:

Fourteen building blocks to create your own unique fighter.
Eighty three pre-generated opponents, both humans and alien.
All the Enhancements from Stims, to Loops, to Physical Enhancements to level the playing field.
Rules for wagering on fights.
A full color Ring and eight full color counters to represent your fighters.
categories: Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Phobos Infection: The Lost Journey of X27
description:
Phobos Infection tries to understand what happened in 1959 when the spacecraft X27 was lost during its voyage to the far flung moon of Mars, Phobos. During this trick taking game, you will fight the four viruses of The Red Planet's moon by various means of attempting to not win tricks, trumps, or even certain high value cards.

After each round an infection occurs and the most infected players will spread their viruses. No one is immune. The least infected player at the end of the game (either 9 rounds with 3 players, or 8 rounds with 4 players) will live to tell the story of the lost X27.

Roots to Barbu
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Horror, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Drakkar: The Card Game
description:
In Drakkar: The Card Game, a fast and fun game with a great interaction between players, you are the leader of a Viking village who must collect and steal resources such as goats, weapons, and gold to show you are the strongest Viking on the island! Will you be a Viking worth the favor of the gods?

During each turn, you use your own cards and the ones that you steal from rivals to build your ship, hire your warriors, and store your beer. Now you're ready to sail and pillage!

At the end of the game, each loot card is worth one victory point regardless of the type for a Viking, a goat, a weapon, or a gold coin have the same value! Additionally, you collect one additional point for each trio (goat, weapon, gold). After three complete rounds, whoever has the most victory points wins!

name: New Billionaire Banshee
description:
100 new Perk and Quirk cards for Billionaire Banshee as well as 20 new Dater or Deny cards and 8 Rabid Animal stickers are included.

Works by itself, or with Billionaire Banshee.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Go Full Beard Special Play Promo Card
description:
Event Promo - Warhammer World Exclusive

The Go Full Beard promo is a special play card for Blood Bowl given out at the Bugman’s Full Beard Cup tournament held at Warhammer World in Nottingham, England on November 26th and 27th, 2016. The card's effect allows a player to beef up their players with bonus skills for one drive before passing out.

name: Consta
description:
Consta is a square grid connection game with a new and simple idea: to use stacked pieces and to resolve crosscuts with a majority mechanism based on the number of stones in the crosscut.

BOARD
Consta is played on a 11x11 square grid; bigger boards can be used for more strategic gameplay. The left and right edges of the board are colored white; the top and bottom edges are colored black.

DEFINITIONS
A piece is a single stone or two stacked stones in a single space.
A weak pair is a set of two like-colored, diagonally adjacent pieces such that there is no like-colored piece orthogonally adjacent to both.
The rank of a weak pair is the number of stones in that weak pair. This value can range from 2 to 4.
A crosscut is a 2x2 set of pieces consisting of two diagonally adjacent black pieces and two diagonally adjacent white pieces.

OBJECTIVE
The goal of Consta is to form a connected chain of your pieces linking the opposite edges of the board marked by your color. I.e. White should connect the Left and Right edges and Black should connect the Top and Bottom edges. A corner is considered to be part of both adjoining edges.

You win when you have a connected chain at the end of the opponent’s turn.

Two pieces are considered to be connected to each other if they are:
- orthogonally adjacent or
- diagonally adjacent and: the weak pair doesn't belong to a crosscut or the weak pair is the highest rank weak pair that belongs to a crosscut.

No draws are possible in Consta.

PLAY
The game begins with an empty board. Each player has an allocated color: Black or White. Black plays first, then turns alternate.

Black plays first, placing one black stone on one space. After this move players take turns placing two stones on two different unoccupied spaces or placing two stacked stones on one single unoccupied space.

It is not allowed to form a crosscut of weak pairs with the same rank.

Online Play

Against Stephen Tavener's AI at http://mrraow.com/index.php/aiai-home/ (Java 8 required)

name: Street Fighter: Collectible Card Game
description: Street Fighter Collectible Card Game is based on the video game franchise and is part of Jasco Games' Universal Fighting System.

name: Relativity
description:
Relativity is a light abstract game with unique movement mechanics. The only random element occurs during setup.

The players take the roles of time and space and move numbered coins to try to complete tetrominoes (tetris piece shapes) while blocking the opponent from doing the same. After one round the coins are reshuffled and the players swap roles and play again. The winner is the player who completes the most tetrominos.

name: Pawsitively Historical
description: The object of Pawsitively Historical is to be the first player to collect all historical pictures cards numbered from 1-14, in order. Roll the die and stretch your memory to find the hidden historical face cards in sequence. The 1st player to collect all 14 historical face cards in a row wins the game.

name: Rage in Glory
description:
Rage in Glory is a game based on old fashion sword fighting.

It is a two player board where both players have a battle board that they are dueling on.

You keep these boards secret from each other, and when you fight, you both set up your boards by putting attack and block tokens on the different numbers, when both players are ready, you reveal your boards.

If you attack a number and it wasn't blocked your opponent takes damage, but if the number that you attacked was block your opponent is unharmed.

The game ends when you are out of health.

Just remember to watch your back in this fast past action game.

name: Mutant Chronicles Collectible Miniatures Game: Golem of Ice
description:
The deadly new demon faction, Ilian, receives reinforcements with the release of the Undying Legions for the Mutant Chronicles Collectible Miniatures Game. Between the chilling powers of the brutish Ice Golem and Ilian's relentless Undead Legionnaires, no faction is safe!

This fixed Warband pack contains the imposingly large, double-based Ilian Ice Golem figure, as well as Undead and Cursed Legionnaires, all-new Command Cards, four new Unit cards, and a sheet of Ice tokens.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: コトバアワス (KOTOBAAWAS)
description:
コトバアワス (pronounced "KOTOBAAWAS") follows the publisher's earlier game 大怪獣コトバモドス (Dai Kaiju KOTOBAMODOS), the name of which combined 言葉 (pronounced "kotoba" and meaning "words") and 戻す (pronounced "modosu" and meaning "revert"). "KOTOBAAWAS" comes from combining 言葉 (kotoba/words) and 合わす (pronounced "awasu" and meaning "match against"), thus as you might expect this is a word-matching game.

More specifically, it's a legacy-style game that you can play only once. As the publisher suggests, "Gather two to five players, open the envelope, then play by following the instructions inside." He clarifies that this is not an escape room-style, puzzle-solving game.

Description from the publisher:

一度きりしか遊べないゲームです。
2～5人を集めて、封筒を開けてください。その後は封筒に指示に従ってゲームを行います。
謎解きゲーム（脱出ゲーム）ではありません。

name: Kabigon's Oyamsumi Yurayura Hammock
description: Players take turns stacking Pikachus on top of a sleeping Snorlax. The game ends when they all come tumbling down off the hammock and the player that caused the tumble loses.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: BattleCON: Shekhtur Malephaise – Daemonic Princess Costume
description: A new Unique Ability with alternative art for Shekhtur Lenmorre from BattleCON: Devastation of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleCON: Kallistar Flarechild – Ice Elemental Costume
description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Kallistar Flarechild from BattleCON: War of Indines.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Glory
description:
Description from the publisher:

Are you ready to laugh while being challenged? Reap the glorious Glory while playing this funny and strategic resource management game!
Glory is a competitive resource management game for 2-4 players. Players take up the mantle of various champions, who are represented by iconic role-playing classes with a slight twist. During the course of the game, players will collect and use resources like might and sorcery. They can use their resources to combat creatures for Glory, spend them with Glory to devote creatures to increase their army and gain more resources every turn, or use them to purchase powerful spells that will sway the balance of the game.

name: Galaxy of Trian: Epic Conflict
description:
The new expansion of "Galaxy of Trian: New Order" announced on kickstarter campaign.

The expansion includes new tiles, more crystals and introduced two card decks:

Destiny deck contains destination cards, artifact cards and tiles with artifact markers. Artifact cars include technological gadgets and unique ancient technology. Destination cards will give new end triggers.

Battle deck gives you the opportunity to use special actions and gain extra combat bonus.

Additionally, this expansion gives the chance to add two players, so it's possible to play with 2-6 players. If the expansion is used twice, it will be possible to play the game for 2-8 players.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Search & Destroy
description:
A multi-player card game for librarians and teachers that teaches database search skills while students compete to stay alive.

In Search & Destroy, every player starts with 4 cards from the Play Deck. On a turn, the player first draws 2 Keyword Cards and lays one down. They may then play up to 1 Action or Mod card, which may effect themselves or another player. Next, the player searches the terms on their played card(s) in a library database. Finally they draw from the play deck to maintain 4 cards in their hand. Play then moves counter-clockwise. Players are eliminated if their database search yields no results. The last player remaining wins!

Box Components:
64 Keyword Cards
41 Mod & Action Cards (the Play Deck)
6 Rule Cards
4 blank Keyword Cards
Rulebook

Search & Destroy teaches the following skills:
search string design
keyword selection
basic boolean searching
faceting
peer-review
friendly competition

name: Cabaret Confidential
description:
User summary
CABARET CONFIDENTIAL is a 3 player only game from Japan. It uses the mechanic known in Japanese gaming as 'butting', where equal values negate each other and the next player down gains.

Each player acts as an owner of a Cabaret, and headhunts dancers. Dancers have three needs: Fame, Money and Love. For each dancer dealt up from the deck each round, players try to negotiate to get the dancer to join their troup.

Negotiation is done by simultaneous blind-bidding on one of the dancer's needs. Each player chooses a card of one type and places it face down. When the three cards are turned up, the player who didn't match the others wins the bid and takes the dancer to their tableau. For example, Alice and Brenda bid on Fame, Cathy bid on Money, so Cathy wins the bid. When the game ends, the player with the most points wins.

Dancers may have special abilities. Some may be triggered when turned up from the deck, some may have one-off effects when placed on your tableau, some may have permanent effects. There is also a "management policy" card which is drafted before the first round, and activated before counting points at the end. This might mess up the other players' scores.

The special effects on the dancers add some language dependancy to the game but the game is still playable with crib sheets or paste-ups for the cards.

Publisher's summary
In Paris, end of 19th century.
Each player is the owner of a Cabaret, and negotiate with the casts to bring success for your stage.

But beware. Casts are artists, and artists have mannerisms. With thoughtful negotiations, assign casts in the best position to produce the best stage in town.

The player producing the most gorgeous Cabaret wins the game.

19世紀末、パリ。
各プレイヤーはキャバレーのオーナーとなり
キャストと交渉を行い、毎晩繰り広げられるステージを大成功に導くことを目指します。

しかし、注意してください。
芸術肌のキャスト達は、一癖も二癖もある人間ばかり。

巧みな交渉でキャスト達の個性を活かしながら、
最高のステージを作り上げましょう。

ゲーム終了時に、
最も華やかなステージを作り上げたプレイヤーの勝利です。
publishers: analog lunchbox (アナログランチボックス)

name: Hut Alive Card Game
description:
Player: 2-4 Players
Time: 10 mins (2 players) 20 mins(3-4 players)
Card deck: 52

SETTING GAME:

Shuffling and sharing cards:
A player shuffles and shares the card. Each player would get 10 cards.

BAITING

Each player selects and place 5 CARDS that would serve as BAITS for the fight. These cards are chosen based on the player's choice on elements such as high number, HUT colour etc).

HOW TO PLAY:

1. At their turns, players try to eliminate other player's BAIT by placing a higher number HUT (with the same colour) on the BAIT to be eliminated.

For instance, if a PLAYER has baits with number 9, 9, 8, 7, 8, an active player (player whose turn it is) who places a card with higher number of the same colour as the BAIT collects the BAIT and other cards on it if BAITS has been HEXED, DEFENDED or INVADED (see below).

HEX:

Players can use their turn to HEX any BAIT (either theirs or another players). They do so by placing ANOTHER HUT COLOUR with the same number as the BAIT to change the colour. This is a very important in the game strategy.

DEFEND:

Players can DEFEND their BAIT by placing another card with HIGHER NUMBER but MUST be the same HUT colour as their BAIT. This is a strategy for defence in the game.

INVADE:

ACTIVE PLAYER can weaken another players BAIT by INVADING. This is done when Active Player place a card with LOWER NUMBER on another player's BAIT but must be the same COLOUR. This makes the BAIT weaker and easier to eliminate at next run by any player.

WHEN GAME ENDS:

The game ends when any player has EXHAUSTED their FIVE BAITS.

HOW TO WIN???

THE PLAYER WITH THE HIGHEST NUMBER OF BAITS AT THE END OF THE GAME WINS.

In situations where there is a TIE, the players FIGHTS and the FIRST to lose a BAIT gets ELIMINATED TILL THEIR IS ONLY ONE PLAYER LEFT.

name: Lee at Gettysburg: July 1st 1863
description:
The March of Killer Angels

Lee At Gettysburg July 1st, 1863 is a quick-playing wargame simulation of the first day of the Battle of Gettysburg. The four included scenarios covering the struggle for control of the historic locations such as McPherson's Ridge, Gettysburg, and Cemetery Hill. Lee at Gettysburg is considered an introductory wargame with rules for morale checks when retreating, facing, and Melee combat. Players can control either the Confederate or Union forces that fought in the battle and offers players a quick game with a lot of strategies.

Complexity: 2 out of 10

Solitaire: 5 out of 10

name: Syndicate: Tau City
description:
In a ruthless, dystopian future, agents from all walks of life toil in the shadows on behalf of the Corporations. These colossal entities wage an eternal covert war against one another for control of the megacities. One in particular, Tau City, is coveted above all others and it is here that death, intrigue, and scandals are just another part of the daily grind.

Take control of a group of undercover agents in Syndicate: Tau City, each with their own powers that can be combined into devastating combos, and deliver the city into the hands of your corporate masters in this game of hidden movement and area control.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Take That

name: Arcane Academy: Bow of Spell Mastery
description:
A single card expansion for Arcane Academy it consists of a card titled: Bow of Spell Mastery.
Its ability is:
"Each time you complete a Theorem, gain 1 Shard".

name: El Alamein: Promo Card Pack #1
description:
This is a promotional pack of cards released for El Alamein.
It contains 5 cards:
- P01 - Supply Officer,
- P03 - British Commanding Office,
- P05 - Brave Veteran
- P07 - Desert Rats
- P08 - Arriving At Tobruk
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Ah Here Now
description:
Ah Here Now is a game celebrating the more wicked side of Irish humour. A party game for bastards, gobshites and thunderin' bitches aged 18 and up.
It is to all intents and purposes Card Against Humanity, but with a distinctly Irish twist. It plays the same, the rules are the same, but if you haven't lived in Ireland it's likely a large portion of the humour will be lost on you.

Gameplay: Players draw 10 answer cards. Player 1 then draws a question card and each of the other players submits an answer, replacing with a new answer card from the deck so they always have a hand of 10. Player 1 will then select the card which they deem the winner, and the player who submitted that card gets 1 point. It is then player 2s turn to draw a question card. Play continues until one person has accrued the agreed upon points total, at which point they are declared the winner.

name: Battles
description:
The next time your favorite kid wants to play War, suggest a game of Battles instead. Unlike War, Battles will be over in 10 minutes and actually presents simple but meaningful choices for the players.

Battles is a 2 player game played with a standard deck of cards. The game consists of 7 battles, each of which has 3 skirmishes. Whoever wins 4 battles wins the game.

SET UP
Shuffle the deck of cards. Deal 21 cards to each player. Set the remaining 10 cards aside.

HOW TO PLAY
The game consists of 7 battles, each consisting of 3 skirmishes. To play a battle, each player draws the top 3 cards from their deck. Both players simultaneously choose one of their cards and presents it face down. After both have chosen a card, they turn it face up. The player who played the highest card (aces are high) wins the skirmish, and moves the 2 cards to their side. If the cards are of equal denomination (a tie) then the 2 cards are set aside in the middle. After all 3 skirmishes are played in this fashion, the winner of the battle is determined. The player who won the most skirmishes (typically 2 or 3) wins the battle and takes all 6 cards and stacks them in a set. Players then draw the next 3 cards from their deck to begin another battle.

RESOLVING TIES
Typically winning 2 or more skirmishes will win a battle. However, if 2 skirmishes end in a tie, then only 1 skirmish is needed to win the battle. However, if both players each win 1 skirmish, and the other is a tie (or if all 3 skirmishes are tied) then the battle is unresolved. In this case, a 4th skirmish is needed and both players draw 1 card from the set of ten set aside at the beginning of the game. Whoever draws the highest card wins the battle. If the 4th skirmish is also a tie, the youngest player wins the battle.

HOW TO WIN
After all 7 battles have been played, the winner of the most battles (4 or more) wins the game (and the war!)

name: Poland 1920
description:
When the World War I ended, a new war began in the Eastern Europe.Bolshevik Russia marched west to bring to bring the communist revolution to all Europe. Poland, which had just gained independence after 123 years of captivity, was its first target.

Game focuses on the Polish-Bolshevik war of the 1920 and allows players to recreate the crucial moments of this conflict in the operational, division scale play.

name: War Games Rules 3000 BC to 1250 AD
description:
User summary:

War Games Rules

These rules were used for the Ancient games in the 1976 National Wargames Championships and were officially adopted by the Society of Ancients, the special society for Ancient and Medieval wargamers.

For the fifth edition:

Previous editions were updated using free amendments, but as the era covered by the rules expanded, the amendments were too numerous and warranted another edition.

Most of the revision is based on feedback from the society of wargamers. Rules passages were rewritten for clarity. Additional explanations were provided where necessary. Also, minor adjustments to the rules were made to accommodate the armies in the expanded eras.

name: Cycles
description: Explore the life sciences with Cycles, a biology-based card game targeted for children ages 8+! Players build sets of 13 life cycles, each with its own special power. On each turn you can start or steal a cycle from another player – winner is the first person with three completed cycles. Fun strategy game for the whole family, where everyone learns without realizing it. Bonus feature: alternate rules for younger players, ages 4+.

name: Capsaicin
description:
Capsaicin is a push-your-luck card game where participants compete in a pepper eating contest.

During each round a pepper card will be drawn from the pepper deck. If the pepper drawn pushes a player over their threshold for that pepper, they have burnt their mouth and are out of the current round.
Before a pepper card is drawn each participant has the opportunity to "Take a Drink" and opt out of the round. This allows the participant to collect what ever points they have collected this round.
The participant who has the most points at the end of the 5th round is the winner.
