Capsaicin was first introduced as a free mini game to all attendees at Boarder City Game Convention 2017.

name: Munstagram
description:
Description from the designer:

This is a 2 players game in which players search the city looking for the coolest pictures of Monsters (who just happen to live in a parallel dimension we've just discovered).

During the game, players will manage their hand of cards and their action tokens in order to collect the most valuable and powerful cards on the table.

This game was designed by the author to ask his girlfriend to marry him, and was a wedding present for the people attending to his wedding. It was also used as a product sample by Cartamundi promoting their "MAKE MY GAME" online platform.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: The Kingdom is Ours
description:
Description from the publisher:

With the Bicorne English Civil War Catalogue and Rules the reader is given a very simple and enjoyable insight into the English Civil War. A compellingly playable set of fast play rules provide entertainment and challenge for both the novice and veteran players alike, entwined with glorious pictures of the Bicorne English Civil War miniature figure range. The rules have been extensively developed from the author's and friends' house rules. These were purposefully designed to provide a fast, fun and challenging game for wargamers of all abilities, whilst encouraging the education of the readers into the troops and the realities of warfare in the 17th Century. There are many parts to the book in addition to the rules, including an introduction to the Civil War written by Linda Doyle, and a section detailing troop types and uniforms. This has all been designed alongside the catalogue of Bicorne troops where the reader is encouraged to collect and paint an army of model soldiers, with a view to playing enjoyable wargames with friends. To this end there is a section on how to build up your army if you are new to the period, as well as a couple of scenarios to give the reader a good idea of what can be achieved with this fun to play set of rules.

name: Pushido
description:
What's Pushido?
It's a pitching game for 2 players. You're a good sumo fighting against evil sumos!

What's in the bag?

+ 6 tiny wooden disks (1 blue sumo et 5 red sumos).

+ 12 tiny stickers (2 blue sumos and 10 red sumos).

+ 1 rules card (English and French).

+ 1 Zip bag.

How to play?

+ Put all the tokens randomly in the center of the table.

+ The youngest player starts, he pitches the blue sumo with one of his fingers.

+ He tries to push one red sumo out of the table.

+ If he succeed, he wins 1 point and plays again.

+ If he doesn't, the second player plays.

+ In turns, the game continues until there is a winner.

How to win?

+ If a player pushes the blue sumo out of the table, he loses the game.

+ If a player has 3 points and the blue sumo is on the table, he wins the game.

name: LazerKnight
description:
LazerKnight is a solo chess variant with a razor sharp edge. You are the LazerKnight! Your whole regiment was slaughtered in a brutal ambush and you are the sole survivor. Sworn to avenge your dead comrades, you sneak through the enemies' territory to defeat them single-handedly. Or at least take as many of them with you as you can!

In this game you take on the role of a single knight chess piece which is going against a full set of opposing chess pieces. Your goal is to take out the enemy king and stay alive. To pull this off against all odds, you have the ability to hide out in black squares, gathering strategy tokens, which allow you to every once in a while break from your cover and strike out with multiple moves at once! But don't wait too long, because the enemy is not standing still and will try to encircle you, until its checkmate for you.

LazerKnight is a 1-page-rule ready to play solo chess game, specifically designed for the Boardgamegeek Solitaire Print and Play Contest. All you need to play is a chess board, chess pieces, 2 eight-sided dice and 5 tokens.

name: Starweb
description:
Starweb is a placement game without movement or capture. Players take turns to place one stone. The starshaped board has 18 corners, 12 outward and 6 inward ones. Groups containing corners have a value of 1 point for one corner, 2 points for the second corner, 3 for the third and so on. A group containing 4 corners thus has a value of 1+2+3+4=10 points. This 'triangular' score makes connecting groups very advantageous.
The game starts with the pie rule and ends when both players pass on successive turns. The player with the highest score wins. In case of an equal score the player who placed the second stone on the board wins.

name: Merlin's Beast Hunt
description:
Most know of the tournaments of knights hosted by Arthur, but only a few know of Merlin's "Beast Hunt" tournament!

In the tournament held on a remote isle, mages use magical seeds and their own sorcery to create fences of natural elements to enclose and capture various beasts. As one of the competing mages, you use your share of eighty custom dice as seeds to hold semi-transparent cards that represent fences of bamboo, lightning, thorns, and water. Use these fences to capture magical beasts: chimeras, unicorns, basilisks, and centaurs. The magician who has the most points for capturing beasts and building fences wins the tournament and becomes the Champion of Magic thanks to Merlin's Beast Hunt!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Hand Management, Square Grid

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Wizard's Wine
description: This additional drink card came as a SlugCrew Minor Reward for 2014. It was re-released as part of the drinks deck in The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Into the Dark
description:
Description from the designer:

Into the dark is the third part of a series of solitaire games that use a very simple core concept – travelling from point a to point b – to explore 3dimensional spaces in which those journeys take place.

After "layers behind each other" (into the woods) and "holes on top of each other" (Infiltrate: into the bear cave) now the shadows cast by 3dimensional scenery influence the movement possibilities on the board.
Therefore the game that has to be played by the light of a single candle.

what it is about:
In this game you will enter a strange land to find a certain secret site and hopefully return to the exit.
To find out where this site is, you will have to venture "into the dark" - which in this game is the bottom of the board.
Here you can find information about the possible secret sites to visit and how that strange land will react to you entering them.

Apart from you there is one local inhabitant roaming the land.
It will try to reach you. If it does the game is over.

How it works:
The land is a landscape of dark (shadow) and light (no shadow) spaces.
You can move freely as long as you do not use a dark connection (dotted line between spaces in shadow) or enter a dark space.
In the last case you would become scared and have to add a despair cube to your cup of action cubes.

These cubes are drawn during the game and placed onto an action display.
9 cubes arranged into 3 by 3 grid define what might happen:
Each round you will choose one column or row of cubes in that display. The cubes chosen will define whose turn it is: Yours (white cube), a tower´s (yellow cube) or the Inhabitant´s (black cube).
In your turns you can either move from light space to light space or modify the board by pushing towers to the left or right.
This will change the distribution of shadows on the board an through that your movement possibilities.

3 x 6 "end game rule tokens" provide 216 possible different end game scenarios you will have to prepare for in the first half of the game.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: Red Peter
description:
Red Peter presents the political struggle in Petrograd during the run up to the October Revolution. Players represent a political faction, and spend political influence to gain control over centers of power and to resolve the many crises that threaten to derail the revolution.

Control of centers of power can provide special abilities and generates political influence among the four main demographics: soldiers, workers,
peasants, and bourgeoisie. Helping to resolve a crisis generates victory points in the form of votes, and can slow the growing chaos level that weakens the political factions. Votes are also gained at four randomly occurring "elections".

A faction wins by gaining an absolute majority of votes by game end. Revolutionary factions also have the option of staging a high-stakes military coup.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Viral Content Promo Card
description:
Body gift Promo card for the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game sent to Kickstarter backers. Viral Content will also be available at retailers.

Body Gift
Discard: Boost Body
Support - Slot: While slotted, Mutate - Recycle & wash your hands: The active saint Heal 2, then upgrade mutation dice.

Keywords: Physician, Resist

Card # 1005
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Starlight Stage: Expansion Card Set 3
description:
User summary
A new Starlight Stage Expansion set was released in May 2017.
This expansion includes 31 cards of 5 types: 7 idol cards, 8 produce cards, 12 event cards, 3 initial idol cards, 1 update card.
publishers: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: Chamälange
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Madagascar, hidden in the foliage of the dense jungle, secluded and shy, lives an extremely rare chameleon family. All members of this family are either orange, green or purple. Through elaborate and time-intensive observations, researchers now have discovered how the chameleons come to their extraordinary color.

Chamälange is an unusual tactic game for 2 people. Each player draws a chameleon color (orange, green, or purple) secretly without showing it to his opponent. The third card is put aside and unknown to both players. Each player is trying to get as many chameleons in his color as possible in the course of the game.

Therefore it is necessary to play the egg cards in the colors red, blue and yellow cleverly. The egg cards have the values of 1 – 3. If two cards with different colored eggs are laid on one another, the already lying card is reversed. From the mixture of the egg colors the new chameleons originate. If, for example, red and blue eggs lie side by side, a purple chameleon is produced. The chameleon, which is produced by touching the eggs, is marked with a stone, in our example the purple one.

Whoever could collect the most eggs under his chameleon color wins this extraordinary game.

name: Befuddled, Bemused & Bewildered
description:
The Senior Moments Game
Just as you think you have more in common with stale bread (you need replacing and you’re only good for toasting), along comes Befuddled, Bemused & Bewildered, the game that will tell you if there’s life in the old dog yet, or confirm what others have been telling you for years: you’re well past your sell-by date.

Packed with quirky questions that will blow the cobwebs from between your ears, heaving with hilarious challenges to get you on your feet (let’s face it, you need the exercise…), take a gentle amble around the game board with every card you draw…

—description from the publisher
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: Make & Break
description:
Card game where players score by forming couples (straight and gay).

Players each start with 5 cards. In their turn, they draw a card and then either play to the table a couple with matching sexual orientation (you can't pair a straight male with a lesbian female) or a card that affects their own or another player's couples. Cards include children, proposal cards (to marry couples) and break-ups. By playing an affair card, a player can split up two couples from other players and take a partner from each to form a couple for themselves.

The impact of the 'tale that' element of the game is moderated by the fact that scoring is continuous rather than end of game; so couples that are broken up are those for which a player has already scored.

The game box gives this game a 17+ rating but there is nothing risqué about the game. It is only unsuitable for children who might be shocked or upset to learn of same-sex partnerships or of marriage break-ups.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Panic Lab: U-turn
description:
Offered to all participants in organized tournament in 2017.

Rules: When the amoeba meets this tile, it makes a U-turn !
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: BrainBox: Mr. Men Little Miss
description:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: Seelenchaos
description:
Chaos in Hell! The soul contracts concluded by the demons have somehow got mixed up and the souls have been credited to the wrong demons. Since one can not even rely on the bureaucracy in hell, it is up to the demons themselves to get their property back. That would not be a problem, if demons were not so devious...

Seelenchaos (Chaos of Souls) is an unusual card game for 3 torn cross-thinkers, in which no player plays with his own cards, but with those of the right neighbor. The neighbor orders the card to be played by a player, but whether or not the card is really played, is left up to the demonic conscience alone. You get points for every trick you make, but the card itself goes back to its owner. And bring him the card value as points. You can not give the other demons the points, of course - it would be much better if the opponents' high cards burned each other.
The right assessment of the other players, clever tactics and a little luck at the right moment are necessary to gain the most points in this chaotic-confusing but highly tactical card game.

name: Wilde Tiere: Schnipp Schnapp
description:
The wild animals meet at the watering hole. But only one of each animal type can be there at a time. If there are two of the same animal then: be quick and hit the crocodile in the watering hole with your hand! The fastest player receives all the animals that are at the watering hole. Who will manage to have all the animal cards at the end?
A wild reaction game.

name: Brawlers
description:
Brawlers is a two player game played in a mint tin. It's quick, silly, easy to learn and surprisingly challenging. Single-player rules are also included to help you learn the skills needed to win.

A rowdy and mischievous game that children of all ages will be able to enjoy.
Quarrel with your friends with a gang of nine tough goons each. Sneak past the angry police man and be the last man standing.
Learn to use your wits and cunning, whilst gaining a steady hand at he same time. But Brawlers is not just educational, it is also quite enjoyable indeed!

The notorious British street gangs of the posh Pips and the blusterous Rousters have been at it for years. Vying for dominance in the smuggling trade, their rivalry has presently come to a pinnacle.
Nine each of their finest pugilists gather upon an east London wharf to settle their grievances at last.
A lone bobby stands betwixt the rival bands, attempting to bar their path. The striving gangs will quarrel until one of them is thoroughly & truly defeated with none left standing.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Print & Play

name: Moods of the Mad King
description:
Moods of the Mad King is a micro-game for 2 to 4 players, where the players assume the role of a playwright in the court of The Mad King! The Mad King demands a play to suit his current feelings, but with his ever-changing moods and propensity for beheadings, all the playwrights are stealing secrets from each other and scrambling to gather information from those close to the king in order to create the perfect play!

When playing Moods of the Mad King, each Playwright will try to collect matching sets of genres. The King has 4 Moods, each corresponding to a different genre: Brooding (Drama), Joyous (Comedy), Lamenting (Tragedy), and Devoted (Romance).

You will try to collect Acts of matching genres to complete a set. The more your set matches, the more points you get, and more your set matches the King's Mood at the end of the game, the more points you get!

Each Playwright will start with an Act I, Act II, and Act III card of a random genre, and one Play Card. Playwrights use these Play Cards to try to collect matching sets and undermine their opponents. Each turn a Playwright draws one Play Card, and then plays one of the two in their hand!

It's that simple! The game ends at the end of the turn wherethe last play card has been drawn!

name: Shadows Upon Lassadar: Ruin & Renewal I
description:
The first of the final 3 trilogy games in the Shadows Upon Lassadar world

This is a short, two player, battle-line style game in which the remaining Elder Wardens of Lassadar and their followers try and stop the incursions of Shadowmajik from the boundaries between dimensional planes. Events take place after the wars against the Grayking and Raven Consort and the invasions of the Barons of the South. Damage due to spell casting has caused rifts and tears between dimensions.

Setup:
Players choose who will be the Shadowmajik player and who will represent the Wardens of Lassadar. The Location cards are shuffled and 7 are dealt face up in a row between the players. Rotate the Location cards as required so they are all in the same orientation with the Location name readable to the Warden Player. The remaining 2 cards are removed from the game.

A Player card is given to each player. They should orient it toward their side of the Location cards - Wardens or Shadowmajik.

Players each take 4 dice and all 4 of either the white or black cubes.

Play:
Players take simultaneous turns in a round, competing in battle at the current Location card (as designated by the yellow cube marker) and contesting over it. Both players place one hand at the top of their Player card and then players roll their respective 4 dice and keep them hidden behind their hand. Dice are placed adjacent to the four corners of their Player cards.

2 Dice are Battle dice and are added together as the base Battle Number in that location.

1 Die is the Power die and may be used to gain additional Mana or Shadowmajik points on a player’s track (the die value is divided by 2 and rounded up for the total Mana or Shadowmajik gained). A player may never possess more MP or SP than the maximum (6) listed on the track.

1 Die is the Casting die and may be used to cast a spell as listed on player card. A player may cast a spell equal to the die value or exactly one value below die value and must pay the listed MP or SP to do so. Certain spells show a Resonance icon next to the die face. If the current location has a matching Resonance icon those spells cost 1 less MP or SP.

You may not use a Power and Casting die on same turn. Only one of these dice will be placed on a corner as an active die.

Both players then reveal their 3 placed dice.

The player with the stronger Battle Number will place and/or move a cube on their respective track on the current Location card a number of spaces. This is calculated based on a nomograph table.

Players only have 3 cubes so, with 7 Locations, they must decide where to deploy forces and which Locations to contest.

Once a Location is won (when a player’s cube moves to highest space on their track) that card will be slid towards the winner and they gain control over it. That Location will not be contested over again. The players take back their cubes from the card to their general supply. Location cards should be slid to fill in the gap left by the now controlled location.

After each round, the losing player decides the next location to move the yellow cube to.

Game End:
Play continues until one player has gained control over 4 Locations.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Continuous Delivery: The Game
description:
The game consists of a board with 20 spaces, where 10-20 cubes representing software work items shall be pushed forward according to the rules. The goal is to make the work items finish as soon as possible at the end space. A lot of set-backs will appear on cards drawn from a deck. The set-backs have names that people within the software development are familiar with.
The cooperative game is won if the group manages to overcome all the trouble caused by the event cards, by choosing from the development cards and implement them in a proper order.
In each turn the players make up a short-term plan for which developments to go for, and which work items to progress. There are dice used for progress during the "testing phase", the middle part of the track where the work items can be stuck if the group has bad luck.
"Continuous Delivery - The Game" is a cooperative board game for 3-5 players who together will try to transform a traditional software development way of working into a Continuous Delivery pipeline.
Each player represents a department, for instance Development, Test or Operations. Together they can discuss and plan how to improve the software development process.
The goal of this game is to create awareness of what implementing Continuous Delivery can be about. This game can be played by anyone and does not require any prior knowledge or experience of Continuous Delivery.
"Continuous Delivery - The Game" is the first of its kind and unique in how it mixes the fun of a board game and the teachings
of Continuous Delivery.

name: クレルソンと夜明けの展覧会 (Clerson to Yoake no Tenrankai)
description:
User summary
クレルソンと夜明けの展覧会 (Clerson to Yoake no Tenrankai) is a Japanese game in which players use large wooden shaped tiles (including a rabbit) to compose an artistic landscape. The game's name relates to an 'exhibition at dawn'.

Players insert their scenery boards into their canvas board to create their own work of art. Keeping in mind that the size of the canvas is predefined, players should strive to achieve balance.

Position the scenery boards as you like to form a unique 3D landscape of your own creation. When players have finished adding all their scenery boards, everyone should attach the sun board to complete their masterpiece.

Points are calculated based on the placement of each scenery board component. The player with the most points wins the game.

User summary
プレイヤーは風景ボードをキャンバスに差し込んで風景を描きます。
キャンバスの大きさは決まっているのでバランスよく風景を描いていきましょう。
指定された風景を自分が好きな位置に差し込み、立体的な風景を描きます。風景ボードを差し終えたら、最後に太陽ボードを差して風景の完成です。風景ボードの配置によって得点を計算し、最も得点を得たプレイヤーの勝ちです。
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Mina, Detektiiv
description:
I, detective in English is party card game.
There is a abstract fragment of story in each card. One player reads it loud and other players start asking questions about it but the story teller may only answer Yes or No.
The player who guesses the riddle gets the card as a point.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game

name: Guardians' Chronicles: Everyday Heroes
description: Guardians Chronicles: Everyday Heroes sees Metro City's super-powered and everyday heroes stand shoulder to shoulder against an unrelenting army of androids. Amid the rubble-strewn streets and burning buildings, heroes are torn between the need to turn back to the mechanical menace and their duty to rescue trapped civilians.

name: Laocoon
description:
A game for two players by Alain Couchot and Bernard Klein

Winner of the Golden Pawn at the 1997 Boulogne Billancourt Game Design Competition (under the name Tor)

COMPONENTS

An 8 × 8 gameboard of 64 neutral spaces.
4 rings (2 white and 2 black).
64 color discs (16 blue, 16 purple, 16 orange, 16 yellow).

OVERVIEW

Each player has two rings to move on the board. At the beginning, each space of the board is one of the 4 colors (blue, purple, orange, or yellow), and the colors are distributed evenly on the board. As the game progresses, space colors change, and certain spaces become inaccessible.

If you can move neither of your rings at the beginning of your turn, you lose, and your opponent wins.

—description from the publisher

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Prognosticating Punch
description:
One of three cards for The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 SlugCrew Minor Reward. This card was given away if you have registered in SlugCrew and have done their events.

This drink allows you to look at any player's "Drink Me!" Pile and put it back in any order.

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (Collector's Edition).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Pokémon TCG: EX Crystal Guardians Expansion
description:
EX Crystal Guardians is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Miracle Crystal.

The expansion includes 100 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Dragons Exalted Expansion
description:
User summary

Dragons Exalted is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Dragon Blast/Dragon Blade.

The expansion includes 128 cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Pokémon TCG: Guardians Rising Expansion
description:
Guardians Rising is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Islands Await You/Alolan Moonlight.

The expansion includes 169 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Ultra Prism Expansion
description:
Ultra Prism is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Ultra Sun/Ultra Moon.

The expansion includes 150+ cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Chrononauts: Beatles Reunion Album Promo Card
description:
Can be added to Chrononauts or Early American Chrononauts.

Text says:
"The card can not be played or stolen unless flipped.
If not flipped, a Beatles Reunion CD in play may be substituted for any one artifact listed on your mission"

Originally included in Fluxx Blanxx, but was added to the original game version 1.4. It was also available by itself from Looney Labs webstore
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, World War I, World War II

name: Pokémon TCG: Advent of Arceus Expansion
description:
User summary

Advent of Arceus - アルセウス光臨 is a Japanese-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous English-language expansion Arceus.

The expansion includes 90 cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Technology Starter Deck
description:
Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey is a new take on the collectible non-collectible KB line, with Jeffrey Neil Bellinger once again putting the rabbits through the grinder. Six new starter decks Animals, Crops, Elementals, Energy, Land and Technology will be available, and players can construct personalized decks of no less than 60 cards, with the cards from any deck.

Ultimate Odyssey is not collectible or random. Players can now buy starter decks and booster expansions for Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey and then use any combination of those cards to form their own constructed decks to play against opponents. Unlike in Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot, where up to eight players play with the same deck of cards, all sharing the same draw pile, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey has players each draw only from their own constructed deck of 60 cards. There are not any random packs, so players will always know which cards they are purchasing in a deck and they can buy the right products for their planned deck. For Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey six brand new starter decks (red, violet, blue, yellow, green, or orange) allow players to construct a personalized deck with any of the cards of any deck.

The setting for the new game is an ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth. Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Energy Starter Deck
description:
Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey is a new take on the collectible non-collectible KB line, with Jeffrey Neil Bellinger once again putting the rabbits through the grinder. Six new starter decks Animals, Crops, Elementals, Energy, Land and Technology will be available, and players can construct personalized decks of no less than 60 cards, with the cards from any deck.

Ultimate Odyssey is not collectible or random. Players can now buy starter decks and booster expansions for Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey and then use any combination of those cards to form their own constructed decks to play against opponents. Unlike in Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot, where up to eight players play with the same deck of cards, all sharing the same draw pile, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey has players each draw only from their own constructed deck of 60 cards. There are not any random packs, so players will always know which cards they are purchasing in a deck and they can buy the right products for their planned deck. For Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey six brand new starter decks (red, violet, blue, yellow, green, or orange) allow players to construct a personalized deck with any of the cards of any deck.

The setting for the new game is an ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth. Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Red deck has an Energy based theme which also includes power, invisible forces, and extraordinary cards such as Gone In Twelve Seconds which can destroy a city and Death Delay which allows your bunny to live past its time!

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Elementals Starter Deck
description:
Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey is a new take on the collectible non-collectible KB line, with Jeffrey Neil Bellinger once again putting the rabbits through the grinder. Six new starter decks Animals, Crops, Elementals, Energy, Land and Technology will be available, and players can construct personalized decks of no less than 60 cards, with the cards from any deck.

Ultimate Odyssey is not collectible or random. Players can now buy starter decks and booster expansions for Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey and then use any combination of those cards to form their own constructed decks to play against opponents. Unlike in Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot, where up to eight players play with the same deck of cards, all sharing the same draw pile, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey has players each draw only from their own constructed deck of 60 cards. There are not any random packs, so players will always know which cards they are purchasing in a deck and they can buy the right products for their planned deck. For Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey six brand new starter decks (red, violet, blue, yellow, green, or orange) allow players to construct a personalized deck with any of the cards of any deck.

The setting for the new game is an ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth. Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Violet deck has an Elemental based theme which also includes metals, jewels and amazing cards such as Slow Smelting which causes players to lose their turn and Maybe, Maybe Not which can eliminate an opponent’s attack!

name: Warlords: Dragon Expansion
description:
The Dragon Expansion is the second add-on to the Warlords game. It can be used with any number of players.

When the first player "goes out", the round continues with that player using the Dragon between each other player's turns, the round ending when a second player goes out.

Fireball dice are placed on the Dragon’s back, between the wings. Dice are flicked off the Dragon’s back from this position in the center ring.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Stargammon
description: Three player backgammon on triangular board.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: BLOCKCHAIN: The Cryptocurrency Game
description:
A high-risk, underground movement has started a new economy free from corruption and manipulation. This new world uses cryptocurrency, a financial system based on secure, anonymous exchange and decentralization. This is where you are at the center of your money – mining, trading, and storing digital coins. But where there is hope, there is hacking. How will you protect your fortune on the blockchain?

BLOCKCHAIN is a 2-4 player strategic action-based card game featuring some of the most captivating aspects of cryptocurrency. You’ll mine for opportunities, trade coins based on changing exchange values, and store coins based on your powerful Block cards. The goal is to collect 10 of each type of coin (Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, Dash, and Peercoin) in cold storage, but the challenge requires some mischievous maneuvers. Learn how to hack or be hacked during every player’s turn, disrupting the entire game strategy. Demonstrate how your clever planning, good timing, and modish moxie will fill your Vault first!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Trading

name: 相場操縦 (Market Manipulation)
description:
In 相場操縦 (Market Manipulation), each player secretly represents a company, with as many companies in the game as the number of players. Each company in the game has a deck of eight tiles, with point values on the back of these tiles.

The start player in a round draws one tile from each company, looks at the point values for each of them, discards one from play, then places the others in a column with some of them above the break-even line (a thick string) and others below. Each other player in turn either moves one tile from the top of the column to the bottom (or vice versa) while keeping the column in the same position relative to the break-even line or moves the column up or down by one level. The starting player for the round does this action last, then this position rotates clockwise, and the next starting player begins another round.

After eight rounds, the game ends and the point values of all tiles above the break-even line are revealed. The player who owns the company with the highest collective value wins!

name: Kort sagt sykt
description:
Kort sagt sykt ("Basically sick") is a shameless party game in norwegian, where the purpose is to make funny, absurd and unfitting combinations of words, phrases, persons and situations.
To generalize, it's the norwegian version of Cards against humanity, with some new rules.

Published by the gaming store Outland, it’s one of their first games.

The rules vary from cards against the humanity. But are mostly the same.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Suddenly Stoned
description:
Take turns drawing cards that have simple tasks to complete but become increasingly difficult the higher a player is, such as "Correctly guess what time it is!" or "Call a family member!" Suddenly Stoned creates interesting conversations and delightful situations that will have you and your squishy-brained friends rolling around the floor in laughter.

—description from the back of the box

name: Třináctá komnata pro partnery
description:
Extension for couples.

Same rules like original games with new questions emphasizes on partnership.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Ta Boite
description:
Ta Boite is the family version of Ta Yeule. A player draws a reflection card and reads one of the two reflections on the card.

The next player must choose one of the 4 replicas on his card to answer.

At the end of the round, the worst replica will receive a Ta Boite!

Simple but hilarious because players can not use the same replica twice. So be strategic or lack of comic choice!

---

French description:

Ta Boite est la version familiale de Ta Yeule. Un joueur pige une carte réflexion et lit à voie haute une des deux réflexions sur la carte.

Le prochain joueur doit choisir une des 4 répliques sur sa carte pour répondre.

À la fin du tour, la pire réplique recevra un Ta Boite !

Simple mais hilarant car les joueurs ne peuvent pas utiliser 2 fois la même réplique. Alors soyez stratégique ou faute de choix comique !

name: Garlic and Cross
description: In ニンニクと十字架 ("Garlic and Cross"), players are vampires with weaknesses (cards tucked into the front of their player screens) seen only by the other players. Players bet on whether they'll be the last alive in this round, then play weakness cards to try to eliminate the other players first. The last vampire alive wins the pot.

name: Glider-Pit Gladiators: Campaign Expansion
description:
User Summary

This freely downloadable expansion for the print-and-play game Glider-Pit Gladiators (GPG) allows players to create and play continuing gladiator characters who can gain experience and special skills over the course of their careers. The game was first web published in 1999 and updated in 2002.

The Campaign Expansion adds rules covering survival, experience, and special abilities and advantages. A system is included for generating random experienced gladiator characters so that players can start with characters having some special abilities and advantages. Finally, there are two new optional rules: throwing attack fumbles and gladiator retirement.

The complete expansion can be downloaded from the BGG files section, below.
categories: Ancient, Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Jenga: Disney Frozen
description:
Offers classic Jenga game play with a cool Frozen twist, as one or more players remove ice blocks, and then use them to build Elsa's ice palace.

In true Jenga fashion, players carefully remove and stack blocks, but this version of the game has a few additions. The ice wall must be set up with the color-coded blocks in a specific order. Players then roll a die to determine which color piece they need to remove. Instead of using their hands, players must use the snowflake wand to remove the blocks. After a block is removed, the player lifts the balcony, and stacks the block to build the palace on top of the ice wall. Players beware because if the balcony falls at any point during your turn, you are out! The first player to build the ice palace 10 blocks high, and then place the Elsa figure in the balcony, wins.

name: Undead Road
description:
UNDEAD ROAD is a cooperative card game for 1 to 2 players*, where the participants cross an inhospitable road, represented by the deck of cards, in which they must survive to endless waves of zombies as much as possible, managing the limits resources they will find in a strategic and convenient way for the group.

UNDEAD ROAD is defined as a "Endless survival game". Each game lasts until the players are defeated by the zombies in the deck. The goal is to endure the most "waves" as possible. Each wave is the full use of a deck. When all the cards of the deck have been played, are shuffled again and start another "wave".


Each deck allows games of 1 to 2 players. You can play games of 3 to 4 players with an additional deck. You can play games of 5 to 6 players with a third deck, taking out the Resources Cards of it.


How to play:

In Undead Road, players (up to two with each gamebox set) collaborate each other trying to go as far as they can through a common deck of cards that represents a dangerous road, full of danger and zombies.

Each player has a card that represents a survivor. That card is used to record the life points of the survivor (turning the card clockwise) and equipping up to a maximum of two objects (one on each side of the card).

During his turn, each player draws a card from the deck and all the players try to resolve the situation that the card presents. From the decks can come out zombies, objects of different types (weapons, healing stuff, ammunition, resources) or multiplying cards that force you to draw huge number of cards at once. Players must agree together how to solve the situation (eliminate the zombies, equip or use the objects, exchange them, etc).

Gradually, the game ends up beating the players. The idea is to try to go through the entire deck as many times as possible.

name: Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS – Xothian Acolytes Box
description:
This box set contains 5 complete Xothian Acolytes. They are the smallest sized Xothians, and each model has arms with spikes. This toughens up the Xothians by adding a unit which hits harder than the initial Supplicants unit from the starter box.

Kits contain 5 Torsos, 5 Legs, 10 Arms with Spikes, and 5 MDF bases

name: Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS – Xothian Guard Box
description:
This box set contains 3 complete Xothian Guards. They are the larger sized standard Xothians, and each model has arms with spikes. While similar to one of the core box units, the spikes deliver a whole lot more damage in combat - allowing these soldiers to carve their way through the enemy lines. Often capable of even handling a Lesser Terrorbeast, this unit makes a solid addition to your force.

Kits contain 3 Torsos, 3 Legs, 6 Arms with Spikes, and 3 MDF bases

name: Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS – Xothian Lesser TerrorBeast Box
description:
This box set contains 1 complete Xothian Lesser TerrorBeast. This is the smaller of the 2 main TerrorBeasts for the Xothians. You may purchase a second model separately, as you can up to 2 in a Unit if you want.

This as the basic level of heavy support for any Xothic Wars army in the field! It is brutally destructive, and capable of grinding through most other Unit types. While 1 is powerful on its own, it takes at least 2 to stop a Greater Terrorbeast.

It contains 1 body, 2 arms, 1 head, 7 chin tentacles, and 1 MDF base.

name: Micro-Football
description:
Micro-Football is a sports themed game that is fast-paced, easy to learn, and can be played anywhere requiring very little table space. Challenge yourself or someone else to see who can score the most points, or see who can score first. Sports fans, families and casual gamers alike will enjoy the back-and-forth card play while trying to anticipate your opponent's next move! Features three game modes: Full Game, Solo, and Overtime.

In Micro-Football, players take turns each quarter on offense and defense. The offense has the goal of reaching the Goal Line of the defense for a Touchdown, or get close enough for a Field Goal, while the defense has the goal of stopping them. Each player has seven cards to choose from (only four will be played), and as they are played simultaneously with your opponent, the results of the combined yardage moves the marker along the football field. If one player can consecutively guess their opponents' next card 3-times, they will trigger a Big Play like an automatic touchdown or a turnover. The player with the most points after four quarters wins!

Components
- 18 cards (7 offense, 7 defense, 4 football field)
- 4 cubes (2 blue, 2 red)
- 1 coin
- 1 gem (football marker)
- rulebook

name: Cream of the Crop
description:
Competing farmers are all trying to use the same farmland to grow their crops. They realized that in order to keep the pests away it's best to mix the crops they grow onto the same field. The challenge is that the farmers can't agree on who should plant which crops.

Players use seeds (coins) or dice to move their tractors (pawns) around the board while trying to form patterns with the seeds. Successful patterns are rewarded with prizes from the county fair and collecting enough prizes wins the game. The seeds grow four different crops: arms are almonds, crowns are corn, moons are melons, and suns are sunflower seeds.

On your turn, choose whether you're going to move using a seed or a die. Seed - Pick a seed from your hand, and show the value to the other players. Play the seed suit side up on the board space under your tractor, and move the tractor. The seed's suit tells you which direction to move and the seed's value tells you how far to move. Die - Choose the die for the direction you want to move. Roll the die to determine how far you move in that direction.

If you finish your move on a space with a seed, pick it up and place it in your hand.
If you finish your move on another player's tractor, pick it up and place it in any empty space on the board.
If you created a diagonal, vertical, or horizontal line with three seeds of one suit, take the prize tile of that suit from the county fair. A line of four seeds with one of each suit collects the grid tile as a mixed harvest prize.

Collect three prizes to win. In a four player game, play as partners with the opposite player and collect three prizes as a team to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Varmint
description:
The sun beat down as a dry wind swept over the small desert town. Squinting his eyes, the bartender looked out across the dusty horizon. Hundreds of varmints were closing in. The little monsters had to be dealt with; it was time to call in help.

Overview
Varmint is a 1-6 player tower defense game. The objective of the game is to protect the town of Dry Gulch from waves of invading varmints.

Gameplay
The game is played over a series of rounds, each consisting of three phases:

Varmint Move Phase
Hero Phase
Varmint Attack Phase.


Each hero has a special ability. The various varmints have different move, attack and health stats. The various buildings in town also provide aid to the heroes in protecting the town.

More to come soon.

name: Goblin Tower
description:
Goblin Tower is a worker placement game by designer Patrick James that also includes push your luck, gambling, and resource management elements.

Players control a faction of Goblins attempting to build their tower faster than the other factions by recruiting more goblins and gathering resources in order to build tower rooms, which each enable the faction new perks. Players also use their faction specific abilities and epic side quests to expedite the building. The first faction to build six rooms will top their tower with a devastating catapult to destroy the competition and win the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Superfight: The Core Deck – Expansion Two
description:
100 New general cards for Superfight. New characters include: MEGASHARK, JEFF GOLDBLUM, and HERCULES. New attributes include: CAN SUMMON AND COMMAND SQUIRRELS, HAS GIANT MAGNETS FOR HANDS, and ARMED WITH A BAG OF INFINITE BEAR TRAPS.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Plunderous
description:
You are a Privateer in an alternate history Steampunk world, sailing the seas of New Caribbean for wealth and fame. The Royal family, no longer interested in directly governing, have decided to appoint a Governor. Through piracy, pillaging and politics will you amass Loyalists and take your place as leader of New Caribbean.

Plunderous is a game of area control, resource management, hand building, dice manipulation and negotiation. Each round you must strategically assemble a unique Crew to carry out your orders, navigate and explore the islands, manipulate resources and politics, parley with other Privateers, complete personal Patron requests and defend and conquer Ports to acquire resources, influence, rewards and Loyalists. The Privateer with the most Loyalists at the end of the game will be appointed the first Governor of New Caribbean by the Royal family.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Deep War
description:
Based on WWII mechanics, Deep War is a fast paced strategic card game. The 2 players have to choose their faction, one Commander and than build their own armed forces. Every Commander has its own skills and values around which specific and focused strategies can be built.

Each player must create their decks using 30 cards for the main deck and a certain amount for the Reserve deck (if requested by certain cards).
They can choose from a huge variety of classes and types. Players can use in the same deck every combination of units they wish, like: infantry, artillery, reconnaissance vehicles, AA guns, tanks, SPG, fighters, bombers, aircraft carriers, submarines and many others.

Units have a certain deployment cost, attack and defense values, skills and historical descriptions.
When the battle begins, both players start with 0 Manpower. This value is necessary for card deployment and skill activation and it grows up by 1 each turn, but it can be lowered or increased even more using powers (like a well performed bomb-raid or a supply vehicle deployed).

Units fight each other and can attack the Commanders.
Ground units cannot attack the Navy, except for some special cards like coastal defense guns. The Navy can attack ground units only if the fire is coordinated by a spotter. Like in real life, the Aviation is a crucial part, planes are capable of attacking every other card on the field and can be attacked only by other planes or Anti-Air capable units.
The player who most wisely creates his deck and uses the synergies between its cards to beat the enemy commander will win the game. Beware...there are secret weapons, which can overturn even the most desperate situation.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Frog Pig Pug
description:
FAST-playing, Quick-thinking, PUG-yelling FUN!

Frog Pig Pug is a quick, simple to learn, yet challenging puzzle game. Frog Pig Pug is suitable for players as young as six. Borrowing mechanics from the classic card game Set, the game has been updated with fun animal art, new game play, and new rules - it takes 10-15 minutes to play and each game is totally different.

The goal of Frog Pig Pug is to identify a Proper Unit Group or 'PUG'. Each PUG consists of three cards that are all the same OR all different in their individual traits. There are three traits on every card of Frog Pig Pug: type of animal, color of animal, and number of animals. Six cards are dealt on the table face-up from the deck into the community pool, and each player is dealt one card that only they can utilize. Once a PUG is identified, a player yells "PUG" and gathers the cards in the PUG once confirmed by the other players.

Any used community pool cards or cards from the player's hand are replaced and play continues until all the cards from the deck are spent. The player with the most PUGs wins!

name: ABC-Insel
description:
Who comes to the treasure hunt on the ABC island? Together, the team looks for the right path through the letters. For each letter there is a term/picture for which a mime, gesture or sound is agreed at the beginning. A teammate explains the route (by using the agreed mime, gesture ...). The others have to remember and choose the right way to go.
Teamwork leads to the goal here.

—description from the designer

name: Random Coping Chess
description:
Best described as chess with a sprinkling of D&D, Random Coping Chess is the result of bedtime roommate chat being taken much too seriously and much too casually simultaneously. Randy (Our affectionate name for the game) adds components of storytelling and randomness to your average game of chess. You might encounter blizzards, landslides, or outlandish parties at which all your sliding pieces get drunk and their movement is best described as Brownian until they sober up. Assassins, tricksters, and temptresses may appear to thwart your plans.

If you play a lot of chess, Randy can freshen the game with it's new spin. If people of two very different skill levels are playing chess, Randy can level the playing field and make the game exciting for all players. If you never liked chess, maybe... just maybe... you'll like RANDOM COPING CHESS!!!

Random elements are added to the game when cards are drawn. Cards are not played by individual players - rather, a player rolls a die before each turn. If the die comes up a 1, a card is drawn. The card describes the elements that are added to the game, changing the rules of the game as it is played.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Ultra Quick College Basketball
description:
Ultra-Quick College Hoops features over 1800 teams from the 2017-2018 college basketball season. All Men's teams belonging to the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) Divisions 1, 2 and 3, the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics (NAIA), the National Christian Collegiate Athletic Association (NCCAA), the United States Collegiate Athletic Association (USCAA), the Canadian Interuniversity Sport league (CIS), the Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA), the Association of Christian College Athletics (ACCA), and Men's Independent Teams. The 2018 Women's Division I teams are also rated. No other game comes even remotely close to rating as many teams!

The 2018 Edition features our exclusive Strength of Schedule system. You can match any team from any division, and get realistic results. We also include the brackets for all of the tournaments!

Ultra-Quick College Hoops allows you to easily complete a tournament or team schedule in one sitting, without sacrificing realism. Included in each year book are the tournament brackets for every division that has drawn at press time.

All of the teams have their TEMPO reflected in both OFF and DEF ratings. This makes the final scores in line with real life scoring.

Ultra Quick College Hoops is the complete package for the college basketball fan. You can replay all tournaments, or even every game played in the 2017-18 season. The only limits are your time and imagination. (This description fits generically for most seasons).

name: Mera Rappakalja
description:
Mera Rappakalja (More Balderdash) is a new Swedish variant of Balderdash and it was released only in Sweden by Casper.

There are two changes in this version that differ from Balderdash. The game board is shorter with only ten squares and the dice has a symbol instead of number six. If the symbol is rolled then it is instead the answer that is being read and the players must enter the word that is searched for. Otherwise, it is the same rules as in Balderdash.

name: Dirty Secret: Reveal your friends' most private and naughtiest secrets
description:
With just a simple set of cards and coins, uncover your friends’ dirtiest experiences and socially unacceptable thoughts while maintaining complete anonymity. Drawing inspiration from Korea’s rampant drinking game culture, this raunchy board game will transform any stale party into an unforgettable night bursting with laughter. If your mind is constantly flooded with naughty thoughts, this is the game for you.

-- HOW TO PLAY --

1.Starting with the youngest player in the group, players take turns drawing 2 cards from the question card deck.
2.The player chooses which of the cards to ask the group and discards the unused question card.
3.Each player answers the question by putting “Yes” or “No” answer coin into the secret box in the middle of the table. Don’t let other players see your answer, this should be anonymous!
4.After all players have placed a “Yes” or “No” coin into the secret box, the players choose a guessing card from their hand to match the number of “Yes” coins that they think the group has placed into the box. The player places their guessing card face down.
5.All players flip their guessing cards at the same time to show the group.
6.Open the secret box and count the number of “Yes” coins inside. Any player that chose the correct number guessing card gets one point and moves their Meeple to the next space on the score tracker.
7.Repeat this process until someone reaches 5 points and becomes the winner.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Mosaic
description:
Mosaic is a two-player board game like Go and Othello. However, what differs from Go and Othello is that it is a 3D game that extends the position not only in the plane but also in the vertical direction. You can solidify your footsteps first, expand the territory, or hold down the upper floors early to divide the opponent's piece or develop a complex bargain. And from the middle to the end of the game, the pieces of each other pile up at once, and a dynamic reversal play occurs. Once you play it, you should be able to understand the benefits.

The game board has 7 x 7 = 49 holes, and a neutral piece is fixed at the center from the beginning.

Two players each have 70 pieces. The game is as follows.


Starting with the first player, place your pieces one by one in the empty hole of the game board.
If four pieces are lined up in the smallest square shape adjacent to each other, pieces can be placed on them.
If four frames are arranged in a square, and three or four of the four are occupied by the same color, the frame of that color is automatically placed on it (apart from the turn).
The piece fixed from the beginning to the center of the game board becomes a neutral piece which is not that of either player. When a square containing neutral frames is created, frames are automatically placed on top of the square only if the remaining three frames have the same color.
Automatically placed pieces will create new squares, and if 3 or 4 of the squares are occupied with the same color, pieces will be placed automatically as well. In this way, pieces are stacked in a chain reaction. The pieces to be stacked may not only be the pieces of the active player, but also the pieces of the opposing player.
In this way, the person who put the piece in turn alternately and who finished all his pieces first wins.


The fun of the game called mosaic is in the rule that "pieces are stacked in a chain reaction by putting one piece". From the middle of the game, development accelerates at a stretch, and the situation changes rapidly. In the early stage, even if you allow the opponent to lead, I think that the feeling when the development of one-shot reversal at the last moment is reached is unique to mosaics.

Gameplay in Mosaic is identical to Margalith Akavya's Upper Hand, but with the action taking place on a larger initial playing area.

--user summary


Laplace is a two-player abstract strategy game in which your goal is to play all of your pieces before the opponent can.

The game is played on a 7x7 grid, and the players each have pieces of a different color. A piece of a third color is placed in the central square on the game board. On a turn, a player places one of their pieces into an empty space on the grid. If a player creates a square of four pieces and at least three of those pieces belong to that same player, then the player immediately places another piece on top of those four pieces; if the placement of that piece also creates a square meeting the same condition, then they place a piece on top of that square.

Thus, as more pieces are placed, they collectively form a pyramid, with the bottom layer being 7x7, then the next layer 6x6, and so on. Whoever places their final piece first wins!

Gameplay in Laplace is identical to Margalith Akavya's Upper Hand., but with the action taking place on a larger initial playing area.

name: ¿Quién es el... Personaje Secreto?
description:
Game of deduction through questions and then try to find out who is the hidden character in an envelope.
—user summary

Juego de deducción mediante preguntas y para después intentar averiguar quién es el personaje que se esconde oculto en un sobre.
—user summary (Spanish)

name: Supervillain: This Galaxy Is Mine! – Nebula Expansion
description:
— Dad, – a little minion asked, – what is shining so bright in the night sky? Is it a planet?

— No, it’s dark on the planets during the night – they are saving power to build Secret Projects.

— Perhaps, it’s a star?

— No son, we can’t see stars – the entire outer space is veiled by smoke traces left by Asteroids.

— So, what is it? – the kid insisted.

— They say, it’s an ancient space station flying in a nearby nebula, – mysteriously whispered father minion making his eyes even more round. – This is an artifact of proto-Villains who had lived long before the birth of our Master! This station contains countless treasures...

— New Secret Projects, Asteroids, and more Minions? – the kid supposed. In response, the father gave a pat on the son’s helmet and tousled his toy plasma gun hanging on the belt. A smart boy is growing! Just like his father.

Shuffle one or both Nebula Discovered! cards to the Domination deck. When a Villain draws Nebula Discovered! card from the deck, draw a Nebula card randomly from the Nebula pack of cards. Put three Asteroid-proof tokens near it.

While the Nebula card is in game, each Villain may launch Asteroids into the Nebula – instead of targeting other Villains.

When an Asteroid hits the Nebula, the Villain who has launched it gets exactly what is printed on the Nebula card. Then the Villain discards the Asteroid and removes one of the Asteroid-proof tokens placed near the Nebula. If it was the last remaining Asteroid-proof token, the Nebula card also goes to the discard pile.

A Villain may send a charged Asteroid into a Nebula as well. Such an Asteroid smashes the Nebula into pieces after executing its effect. Why do so? To prevent other Villains from getting benefits from that Nebula, of course!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
publishers: Moroz Dev Studio, Rightgames RBG SIA

name: Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin? 2
description:
The objective of Kust Ma Seda Kuulsin? 2 ("Where did I hear it?" 2) is to guess the quote: which movie, song, novel etc. is it.
This time all quotes are connected with Estonia.

Player who guesses correctly moves forward on the game board.
The player who finishes first is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Pradün
description:
The little fiend Pradün came from the Other Side to throw the house into confusion. Help your Family to defeat the diabolic forces that are threatening its quiet life.
But be careful, the enemy hides inside the walls!
There are four card types: Family characters (green), Objectives (white), Demons (red) and Power-ups (blue).
The 72 cards deck features two games in one:
- War at home: for 3-6 players, the complete game
- Run for the Pradün: a basic version using only 46 cards, for 2-4 players
Each player takes the role of a character (one of the family members), possessing a special ability (for example increase power of her/himself or of a fellow family member). However, one of the players is secretly possessed by the Pradün demon: his goal is to score points without being caught while the other players must find out who is it.
On her turn, a player can decide to attack one of the Demons and if she succeeds (having cards that grant a power greater than that of the Demon) she collects the Demon as a Victory Point (VP). During the fight, other players can help or interfere by playing additional cards. Alternatively, the player can draw additional cards to strenghten her hand.
VP can be spent to attack another player, hoping to reveal its objective card: if it is the Pradün, the player wins; if not, the game continues. However, if the Pradün scores 2VP, the player controlling it wins the game.
The game is very funny, with Demons like the "Damned alarm clock" (whose power is equal to the time of the day, in hours) or the "Were-elevator" which tries to crush and block you.
Power-ups can be temporary or permanent and they include things like "Bunny's kiss", the "Garbage sack" or the "No-purpose knife"...
In the simplified version, character's special abilities are neglected and the family members simply race through the house fighting demons to be the first to beat the Pradün; however, other players can also be attacked and slowed down.

name: Orodeloro
description:
Lost in the sea or hidden on the islands, many pirates have left their spoils there. Be smart, plan your route wisely and find their treasures.

Each player has 3 tiles face up in front of them and on his turn must place one of his tile to keep the treasure map going however it must fit with the rest of the tiles already placed.

You gain 1 coin every time you place a tile and then you draw a new tile.

Some tiles have special power:
Treasure chest - allows you to gain 1 extra coin by number of tiles it touches when you place it
Hurricane - allows you to switch between players (you included) as many tiles as your tile touches on the board.
Parrot - allows you to became the captain. The captain can't get attacked and chooses in case of equality at end game who wins.
Fight - allows you to steal from another player (except the captain) as many coins as your tile touches other tiles on the board

If during your turn you can't play one of your tiles, you can discard the last tile and so on by paying 1 coin for each tile you discard.

Game ends when there is no more tiles to draw after playing one.
The winner is the one with the most gold at the end of the game.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Serengeti: A Race For Life – The Hunt
description:
The Hunt is the first expansion aka thematic pack for Serengeti: A Race For Life. It contains 30 cards and provides an alternative to the starting setup as well as changing the dynamics of the game.

In The Hunt the emphasis is on predators, a class of animals found in the game that is further expanded in this expansion with the addition of the Cheetah, boosted by the inclusion of a secondary scavenger, the Vulture.

The Vulture takes center stage in this thematic pack and is required in every game playing with this setup while the Cheetah can be added to any setup provided by the base game or other thematic packs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Sneak Peaks
description:
Sneak Peaks is an adult NSFW party game of memory, concentration and XXX cartoon boobs.

Sneek Peaks is a naughty game for perverts with a sense of humor. If you are reading this then you most likely are in fact a pervert or know someone who is... *wink*

By definition, pervert means a person whose sexual behavior is regarded as abnormal and unacceptable...

So get ready for a HOT 15 minute funny flashing matching card game.

To play is simple. Just lay out all the cards face down and take turns flipping over 2 cards at a time.

Each scene will be shown a bit different to qualify as a match unlike normal matching games where the image is identical.

The person with the most matches at the end wins!

-description from publisher

name: Whatever the Weather Game
description:
This is a simple roll and move game.

During set-up, each player takes a coloured playing piece and four teddy weather cards, each depicting a teddy bear dressed for different weather (snowy, windy, sunny, and rainy weather).

On a player's turn, the active player selects one teddy weather card and they then spin the weather spinner. If the weather selected by the spinner matches the teddy weather card chosen by the player, then the player can roll the dice and move that many spots on the board.

If a player lands on a storm cloud space they must return to the start.

The first player to reach the honey pot at the centre of the board wins.

name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Elven Vestiges
description:
"Elven Vestiges" is a brand new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the Campaign Chapter included, your heroes can venture into the ruins of ancient Elven temples. The Elves have left a precious relic that will be of great use to our Orc heroes, and these haughty beings have decided to return to take possession of their remains.

Our heroes will have to progress with caution. To approach the ruins, they must be vigilant and not be spotted by the Elven Archers hidden in the trees. Each escaping Elf Archer will increase the Alert Level, and the higher the Alert Level, the more Elven Archers will shoot at you from the trees.

If the Heroes manage to penetrate the vestiges, they will have to face the Elves who protect the place. Their magic is frightening and will keep the Orcs at bay. And that's not counting the traps set in the Event cards, like the giant ball!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Phat Pack
description:
The Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Phat Pack contains three Munchkin CCG core booster packs, one The Desolation of Blarg booster, one Fashion Furious booster, and two surprise (new!) Munchkin CCG cards randomly chosen from twelve possibilities!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Horus Heresy: The Battle for Prospero
description:
A "battle box" including two pre-made 60-card decks (one for the Space Wolves, and one for the Thousand Sons) that allow the players to recreate the famous "Battle for Prospero" from the Horus Heresy timeline. Three sector cards from the planet Prospero are included.

This expansion is playable right out of the box, but decks can be modified with cards from the base game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Sweetheart Candy
description:
Love is in the air and Sweetheart Candy is here to celebrate Valentine’s Day by joining your Heroes in Super Dungeon!

Includes:
1x Sweetheart Candy Resin Model (Assembly Required)
1x Sweetheart Candy Hero Card
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Catch!
description:
Catch! is a co-operative childrens game of cat-and-mouse.

A mischievous little mouse has stolen the cats’ bowl of treats and is making a run for the fence. If he can make it through the garden and to the fence before the cats surround him, he’ ll get to keep the treats all for himself. Can you help the cats surround the scuttling little mouse before he gets away? If you can, you all win!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ZnajZnak: Felismered?
description:
ZnajZnak. Feliszmered? is an educational game designed for two players, who acquire knowledge automatically while playing. ZnajZnak allows even 32 persons to play with the use of one set of cards. While playing the ZnajZnak game, players learn to recognise symbolic characters, dates, figures, places and objects of the Polish history.

The game is composed of 132 cards. Each of them presents 12 different symbols concerning the contemporary history of Poland and Hungary. If you take a closer look at any two cards, you'll find out that they contain a common character. 132 cards, 133 symbols and always only one common character. The aim of a player is to notice the character on two other cards on the table and to tell its name as fast as possible. If the player succeeds to do that, he/she passes his/her card to another player. If he/she does not know the name of the character, he/she turns the card, reads the definition of the symbol, puts a new card on the table, and the game goes on. The winner is the person who first gets rid of all the cards in hand.

The fates of Poland and Hungary have been linked together for centuries. Examples may be found not only in the distant past, but also still so close to us, in the 20th century. Poles and Hungarians could also count on each other’s friendship and support in the face of threats from the greatest totalitarian regimes of all times – German Nazism and communism.
The stories of both nations are filled with symbols, so when preparing the game, we had to make a selection, limiting the timeframe mainly to the 20th century. This is how a set of 133 symbols shown on the cards of the game was created. We hope that it will give both nations a chance to take a closer look at each other’s stories. After all, the Polish-Hungarian celebrations of the sixtieth anniversary of the 1956 events, organized in 2016, were held under the slogan "Poles and Hungarians, we all remember together".

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time

name: Zack Zack
description:
In Zack Zack, Players compete to be the first to form a series of words conforming to specific subject cards using only the letters rolled that round on the three letter dice.

Every round, players reveal a new subject card, and then roll three letter dice and a single number die. The players then must be the first to form a amount of words denoted by the number die, containing letters shown on the letter dice. Whomever is first wins the round, and receives a subject card as a point.

After a player hits a pre-determined goal of subject cards, then that player wins!

name: Loaded Questions The Game
description:
The Family/Friends Version of the Classic Game of 'Who Said What'

If you never owned this classic game of 'who wrote what' or need to update your older copy, this NEW edition is the one to get.

Features 880 new and classic Loaded Questions, all new design, and added game play features for a lifetime of memorable game nights.

Questions include: What is something you only need one of? / What word would people never use to describe you? / What is your most useless talent?

This core Loaded Questions game is perfect for families and adults.

Let’s Say It’s Your Turn…


Read aloud the Loaded Question that matches the colored space you’re on. (Let’s say the question is “What is something you would love to do every day of your life?)
All other players write a personal answer for the question on their answer sheets, which are collected and read aloud by the player to your right.
After hearing all of the answers, match which player wrote which answer. Advance one space for every correct match. The first player to reach the WIN space wins the game!


—description from the publisher

name: Badly Drawn Death
description:
Badly Drawn Death is a quick, brutal and stupid battle card game where you try to kill your friends in silly ways. For 2-5 players, the aim of the game is to be the last person standing to win. You do this by building your defences and attacking your opponents.

72 unique cards make up the game, each featuring a humorous and sometimes downright outrageous drawing. From the Cake of Death to the Badly Driven Tank, you'll be laughing as you rain death down on all of your friends!

You'll also find plenty of opportunities for picking on other players back-stabbing at the opportune moment. Badly Drawn Death is both brutal and unexpected in its gameplay. You never know what will happen next and nobody is ever safe!

—description from the designer

name: Smuggles n' Snuggles
description:
