Smuggles n' Snuggles is a 2 player strategy card game where players compete as crime families of bootleggin' bears in the 1920s! borrowing from classic playing card games, each card needs only one number. However, with a few simple rules, all your cards take on new roles as they move around the table - sometimes smuggling their fuzzy family members into rival territory or snuggling the competition with big ole bear hugs. Combining these tactics and letting each bear do what they do best will be the keys to victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Humor
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Rejtély a babaházban
description:
The tiny diamond ring of Lisette Black, the beautiful doll has disappeared! The inhabitants of the magnificent dollhouse set out to investigate who, where, when and why hid the jewel.

Regardless of the number of players, eight dolls are used in this deduction game. In each turn, 3 action points are at the players’ disposal for diceless movement and/or other actions. They use a handful of cards to make assumptions and narrow down the possibilities through the reaction of others. The player who successfully identifies the perpetrator and all the circumstances of the theft wins the game.

This investigation/deduction game can be played by 3-8 players. Despite the dollhouse environment, the game is recommended from at least 8 years of age, but it is more suitable for bigger kids, and is challenging for adults as well.

The graphics of the game board and the cards are very special. They meticulously depict a world of 18-19th century dolls and dollhouses, the originals of which are parts of the amazing collection of the Hetedhét Toy Museum of Székesfehérvár, Hungary. The very first piece of the game was made for the Museum itself.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Eltűnt a szépséges Lisette Black baba apró gyémántgyűrűje! A pazar babaház lakói összefognak, hogy kinyomozzák, ki és hová, mikor, hogyan rejthette a páratlan ékszert.

A játékosok ebben a dobókocka nélküli dedukciós játékban nyolc babát irányítanak. Három akciópont áll rendelkezésükre, amelyet a helyiségek közötti mozgásra és/vagy egyéb akciókra használhatnak fel. Kártyák segítségével ellenőrizhetik a feltételezéseiket és szűkíthetik a kört. A játékot az nyeri, aki hiánytalanul megnevezi a tettest és az összes körülményt.

A Rejtély a bababházban 3-8 játékos által játszható dedukciós, nyomozós játék, ami 8 éves kortól ajánlott. Annak ellenére, hogy színterét egy babaház adja, ez a játék kifejezetten a nagyobb korosztálynak szól, sőt a felnőtteknek is izgalmas, kihívásokkal teli játékélményt nyújt.

A különleges játéktáblán és kártyákon ábrázolt, 18-19. századi babaszoba-enteriőrök eredetije a székesfehérvári Hetedhét Játékmúzeum gyűjteményének egyes darabjait ábrázolja; a játék legelső példánya is eredetileg a múzeum számára készült.

—description from the publisher (Hungarian)
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Canimals: We Can Do It
description:
The stars of the Korean children's television show Canimals are the pieces in a curling/shuffleboard style flicking dexterity game.

Two players select four pieces each from the following characters: Nia, Pow, Oz, Uly, Fizzy, Mimi, Ato, and Leon. In alternating turns, each player flicks one of their pieces towards the target at the end of the mat. Players score points depending on how close each of their character pieces are to the center of the target. After ten rounds, the player with the most points wins!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Sports

name: The Whole Sad Story: The Battle for West Timor, February 20-22, 1942
description:
The Japanese attack on the Island of West Timor, in the Dutch East Indies, was anticipated by the Allies as early as late December 1941. Soon after the start of the war, Sparrow Force, comprised mostly of Australian troops as well as some from the Dutch East Indies and Great Britain, occupied West Timor and began preparing defensive works. This would allow a defensive island fortress between the expanding Japanese Empire and Australia.

To assault and secure the island, especially the airfield at Penful, the Japanese planned an amphibious assault supported by an ambitious paratrooper air-assault by the 1st and 3rd SNLF (Special Naval Landing Force) Battalions. The resulting fight for West Timor resulted in a confused and bitterly fought battle that ultimately resulted in the destruction and capture of the majority of Sparrow Force, one of the largest and most tragic defeats in Australia’s military history. The Japanese paratrooper force was also savaged in the fighting, with nearly half of their number killed, seriously wounded, or missing. Those surviving paratroopers were dispersed throughout the Pacific in different commands and never performed another combat jump in the war.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

-description from designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Kokomots
description:
Check the themes and compose related words.

• launch the hourglass (in fact, just turn it)
• pick up a theme
• find a word related to this theme, using the letters in your hand and on the grid

If hourglass still not empty, try to find another word for another theme.

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Battle of France
description:
The Battle of France saw German forces sweep across the Low Countries and towards Paris, crushing Allied resistance in just six weeks. From Fall Gelb and the British withdrawal from Dunkirk to the decisive Fall Rot, this new supplement for Bolt Action allows players to take command of the bitter fighting for France, and to refight the key battles of this campaign. Linked scenarios and new rules, troop types, and Theatre Selectors offer plenty of options for novice and veteran players alike.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: The Story of Little Red Riding Hood
description:
The Story of Little Red Riding Hood is an extremely rare Greek board game, from the early 60's. It is a simple roll the dice and move game, with a few surpises.
First of all, it can be played from 2 to 11 players. On the board there are holes, with different sizes. Each hole represents a step. Some of them are a trap!! You fall and start again from the beginning.

—user summary

name: Poor Choices: Purple Rain Expansion
description: The First Expansion Pack includes 112 brand new cards that work well when combined with the Classic Edition.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Storytelling, Take That, Voting

name: Spielesammlung
description: In the ten different games in Meine ersten Spiele: Spielesammlung, children learn to group colors and shapes. Matching games train the memory, while dicing and stacking develop eye-hand coordination. Children can also indulge in free play with this game collection and immerse themselves in the colorful, happy world of the farm.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Sickbay Ressource
description:
The Sickbay Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the Turret Turmoil Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource and costs 6 squadron points.

It can only be equipped to a ship with a hull value greater than 3, and allows the player to either place 2 time tokens on this ship's admiral, captain or crew when they would otherwise be disabled, or discard Sickbay when one of those cards would be discarded.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Seanchaí
description:
Seanchaí (bearer of old lore in Gaelic) is a matching/capture card game based on the myths and lore of Ireland. There are seven regular suits (Warfare, Legends, Landscape, Treasure, Roles, Religion, Stoneworks) which are captured by matching cards of the same suit. There are two special suits: Shamrocks and Dark Cards. Shamrocks are free points and extend a turn. Dark cards are discards against another player.

Each turn consists of an action followed by a discard. The action can be either capturing a same suited card on the Tableau with a card in a player’s hand or flipping over a card. The flipped card is now the only card that can capture: either a card from the player’s hand or one from the Tableau. Captured cards are moved to a player’s point field. A discard ends the turn which is either a regular suited card on the tableau or a dark card against another player.

Complexity and strategy is created by determining when to play Shamrocks to extend a turn, when to capture cards that can be effected by Dark cards, saving wild cards or other counter cards to combat a dark card, and strategizing to capture the cards that are part of a scéal (story).
The goal of the game is to amass the highest points after four rounds. Points are counted on individual cards as well as in combinations of scéalta (stories) that are depicted by matching icons. Dark cards are negative points and have special effects that can target other cards. Any cards left in a player’s hand at the end of a round are counted against them.

—description from the publisher

name: The Mannerheim Line Campaign 1939-1940
description:
The Mannerheim Line Campaign (MLC) is a low-intermediate complexity two-player historical wargame that’s also easily adaptable for solitaire play. It allows players to investigate the parameters of the final Soviet offensive into Finland in the late winter of 1940. For play purposes, that historic outcome is considered to have been a Soviet minor victory.

—description from the publisher

name: Stack Burger
description:
Stack Burger is the game that players remember the material cards that are upside down and make various burgers according to the sequence on the burger card.

Players can build the ability to arrange the order of the material tiles and the ability to design effective strategies to remember the location of the cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Mystery Wizard
description:
On a hexed isle far across a shining sea, wizards duel for magical supremacy and the fate of the island itself.

Mystery Wizard is a game for 2 to 6 players that takes around an hour to play, starring 8 unique spellcasting characters, each providing a radically different strategic experience. When each player chooses a wizard, they are selecting a totally unique set of spells and abilities which will flavor their strategic choices and paths to victory.

Each wizard begins the game in their village, in a corner of the hexagonal board. In the center of the board is a tower filled with ancient secrets. The objective of the game is to loot the tower and return two of its Mysteries home to your village. However, Mysteries are scarce, and in order to secure your own, you’ll need to take them from someone else. Fierce opposition from rival wizards will take the form of fireballs, cyclones, wild animals, lightning bolts and more, leading to a chaotic capture-the-flag brawl where alliances can form or dissolve in the blink of an eye.

Players must also navigate the effects of villainous priests, friendly goblins, burning desert sands, civil war, and more. A dynamic and engaging quest system brings the hexed isle to life with events and monsters, and provides a way for wizards to earn enchanted gear and powerful spells by seeking out lost temples and buried treasure. However, a creeping madness threatens to corrupt the land if the wizards do not move fast enough. The tension and difficulty slowly increase throughout game and lead to an end game characterized by knife’s edge decision, where making one wrong move could spell doom.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Right Hand Path
description: Right Hand Path is a single page roll & write game. Collect relics and craft a protective salt circle to keep yourself and your home safe from invading dark and demonic forces. You need a writing utensil and two six-sided dice to play.

name: Hockey-Dice Challenge
description:
Hockey-Dice Challenge is a unique and fast paced game. It's an exciting "head to head" match that leaves everything to chance - the luck of the dice!

Here's how to play:

The home team controls red and blue dice and gets first roll. The visiting team controls black and yellow dice.

The red and black are offensive dice and the blue and yellow are defensive. When the home team rolls red, the visitors roll yellow die to try and stop the scoring attempt. When visitors roll black, the home team rolls blue to try and stop the scoring thrust.

Both offensive dice have power play goal side as well as penalty sides.

The score sheet allows each team 6 offensive rolls per period. If there is a tie after 3 periods, sudden-death overtimes comes into play.

Drop the dice and the game is on!

—description from the publisher

name: Access Denied
description:
You are part of a team of three elite Infiltrator Agents, tasked by your shadowy employers with infiltrating the Advanced Cyber-Dynamics (ACD) Corporation complex, and stealing as much industrial technology data as possible. ACD is world leader in robotics technology, and their precious technical data is locked in computer terminals and protected by firewalls (anti-hacking protection). The more data you steal, the more credits your team will be paid. Credits are also stored in corporate safes, and cracking these open will boost your pay.
How far will you push your luck?

Objective
Steal as much data and credits as possible before the game ends. The game ends when either: (1) all 5 data terminals have been hacked – you win the game, or (2) all 3 Agents have been arrested – you lose the game. Stealing credits from safes is optional, but doing so will increase your score. Win or lose, the total credits earned by your team determines your score when the game ends.

This game is an entry to the 2018 Solitaire Print and Play Contest. Contest results for Access Denied:

Best Advanced PNP Build:
2nd place

Most Thematic Game:
7th place

Best Push Your Luck/Survival:
4th place

Best Dungeon Crawl:
4th place

Best Science Fiction Game:
3rd place

Best AI System in a Game:
3rd place

—description from the designer
categories: Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lovely Home
description:
Lovely home is a digital calculation and area estimation game. It tells the story of packing and loading, and decorating the room. The children need to estimate the area, choose a reasonable baggage storage and load, and put the code of the orderly classification of the baggage on the car in the corresponding room through digital calculation. The game contains a variety of gameplay, corresponding to different levels of difficulty.

After turns of calculation and choice making for each player, the game ends only when one of the players finishes his/her target perfectly, mistakes drive you away from being the winner, so if anyone wants to win, he/she needs to learn how to calculation efficiently.

name: Tanks: Lend Lease M3L Stuart Tank Expansion
description: In Soviet service, the M3 light tank was designated as the M3L (L= legkhiy: light) to distinguish it from the M3 medium tank which was called the M3S (S= sredniy: medium). It was first put into action in the spring of 1942 in the fighting in the Kharkov area. During the course of the war the Soviet Union was shipped a wide variety of versions of the M3L and were widely used throughout the war.

name: Tanks: Lend Lease M3S Lee Tank Expansion
description: The first batch of M3S Lee tanks were sent over to Russia in October 1941. At first the M3-Lee tank confused Soviet tank designers with a hull mounted 75mm and a 37mm gun in its turret; the design was simply odd. The tank quickly proved itself to be a worthy fighting machine through its durability and reliability.

name: Tanks: Lend Lease Churchill Tank Expansion
description: The first 25 Churchill tanks were delivered to the Soviet Union in May 1942. With its heavy armour and powerful 6pdr gun the Churchill made an excellent addition to the Guards breakthrough regiments. The Churchill's roof-mounted periscope so impressed Soviet tank designers that it influenced later periscopes installed in the T-34/85 and IS-2.

name: All You Need Is Love
description:
The “ALL YOU NEED IS LOVE” board game, based on the popular TV program.

Get to know one another better by asking personal questions. Good answers win hearts for you and your friend or partner. The hearts are used to earn a place in the middle of the board. But look out: there’s always another player on the love caravan, testing your friendship. The first two players to prove their ultimate friendship or unshakable relationship in the middle of the board will win the game. Can you win the convivial and humorous ‘All You Need Is Love’ board game together?

All you need is love is a board game where players do not need any knowledge except of that about their friends. Answer questions about each other and earn heart tokens to win the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Sag's mir!: Demo Spiel
description:
This is a demo game of the Repos family game Sag's mir (aka Time's Up)
It contains less cards than the original game and was given away as a promo at Spiel '15

name: GROM: Un mondo di gelati e agricoltura
description:
We have combined GROM's expertise in everything related to the selection of raw materials, nature, food and the ingredients necessary to make the "best gelato in the world" with our creativity and experience in combining fun with educational content, and we have created the box that you have just opened.

Working together we have discovered that we have a common sensitivity towards the environment and people, attention to the little details that make the difference and we have put them in the box.

I hope you have time, because the game... lasts one year! It lasts the four seasons to let you taste the best ingredients of each of them, represented by the tree in the middle of the board that you can dress and cover with its colorful flowers, leaves and snowflakes.

A game lasts 4 rounds: one for each season.

In each season only those who complete a cup with at least three flavors of gelato earn points. To make a flavor you need the three basic ingredients and the ingredient of the flavor itself (eg. hazelnut or strawberry). The ingredients are won in the respective areas of the board and in the seasons in which they are available (e.g. fish at Mura Mura, but only in summer). The winner of the game is the one who, at the end of the fourth season, has scored the most points.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Die verrückte Wettermaschine
description:
The game of knowledge about the weather: Whether the child plays alone or with others, the tiptoi reader brings him a lot of knowledge on the subject of the weather. Exciting games allow you to discover and deepen your knowledge. Thanks to the tiptoi player, players pass tests, receive indications and explore the weather machine.
Exciting game mechanism with wheels and an original progression ladder;
8 themes: precipitation, wind, clouds, seasons, clothing, extreme events, weather forecasts and climate zones;
A fun discovery of natural phenomena and weather relations.

—description from the publisher

name: Deckfighters: Mixed Martial Arts Card Game
description:
Deckfighters is the only fast paced single deck, multi-player elimination-style card game based on Mixed Martial Arts. While emulating the best of a real MMA fight, Deckfighters is a highly re-playable game with multiple win conditions, endless strategies and a swift learning curve. No deck building or card collecting allows the action to take affect immediately at the start of the game. The 54 card deck consists of STRIKING, GRAPPLING, SUBMISSIONS, DEFENSE, HEALTH, FINISH & SPECIALTY cards.

—description from the designer

name: Coffeetopia
description: In Coffeetopia, players compete to satisfy coffee import requests from nations across the globe. As Indonesian coffee exporters, players collect coffee beans, manage their warehouses and fulfill contracts in this strategic simultaneous action selection game.

name: Sask. Watch
description:
A group of budding photographers have set out in Northern Saskatchewan, Canada, in hopes of catching a rare glimpse of you – Sasquatch. In order to uphold the mystery surrounding the existence of Sasquatch, you must make your way out of the area without any photographer catching more than a blurry snapshot of you.

In this solitaire game, you will collect (or avoid collecting) cards from a deck representing the Saskatchewan wilderness on a snowy night. Each card you collect will either increase or decrease how visible and/or how blurry you are. When you inevitably encounter a photographer, the hand of cards in front of you represents the scene the photographer will see. Your goal is to build a hand of cards that makes you as hard to photograph as possible.

You win the game once you have successfully evaded all six of the photographers in the deck. You lose the game if any one of them takes a photo of you that is not blurry.

—description from the designer

name: Warfare at Sea in the Age of Reason
description:
Easy rules for naval actions in the age of sail, roughly from the Armada to the mid-19th century. 2 scenarios included. Easy to read ship charts and tables. Includes rules to use with the Sport of Kings campaign game or virtually any campaign system. Colorfully laid out. Designed and produced by the same team that brought you Warfare in the Age of Reason, Pig Wars, Age of Discovery, Age of Napoleon, Samurai Knight Fever and A Firebell in the Night.

—description from publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Liniell
description:
Liniell is an abstract tile placement game in which two players are building a 4 by 4 pattern of lines and rhombs.

Each turn the players have to draw a tile and place it next to the tiles already in play. Then they may place one of their two markers on this tile to occupy a line. Lines can only be occupied by one marker at a time and end only at rhombs or at the edge of the tiles.

The game ends when the player who placed the last tile finished their turn. Then, certain parts of the lines, the routes, are scored. Players score points according to the length of their routes, for routes enclosed by rhombs, and for blue rhombs on the ends of their routes.

—description from the designer

name: Pirates
description:
Game #7 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Hull shots and Repairs, Mast shots and Restores, Volley shots and Recovers, and Lookouts. After drawing a card, the player may hit other players with Hull, Mast, or Volley shots; take out a Lookout with a Mast Shot; use a Repair, Restore, or Recover card to remove a hit, or place it in front of them to protect them from a hit; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once all cards have been drawn and played or discarded, the player with the fewest remaining hits is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.

—description from the publisher

name: Aachoo!
description:
Aachoo! is a bluffing game set in the ocean, in the battle between monk fish and its tasty prey. Each player is a monk fish who has 9 mouth locations, arranged in a 3x3 grid. Players draw tiles, place fish on them either lying or telling the truth, and score more points for having all 3 colors of fish / tiles in a particular horizontal row.

When a player draws a tile, they examine it and then place it face down on the next open spot in their player's monk fish display. They then place a number of fish of one color on top of the tile. This claim can be either true or a lie. Going around the table, check whether another player wants to challenge the active player's claim. If challenged, the active player reveals the tile. If they were truthful, they keep the tile, but the challenger loses their most recent tile. If caught in a lie, the active player gives the tile and the bluff fish to the challenger, who places them in their next tile slot on their player board. In addition to the normal fish tiles, there are 2 special tiles which change up some of the results of the bluffing.

Play continues until all but one player has filled up all their slots, or until out of tiles.

Players score each horizontal row. In each row, they look at the colors of the fish (tokens or fish on tiles). If all 3 colors are represented, then they score the number of all fish in that row. Otherwise, the row scores the number of tiles.

—description from the publisher

name: Balloon Night
description:
Fantastic night with the air-balloon!
Everyone watches the night sky.
Tonight, it’s the Balloon Night! The air shines in the night sky with the burner.
The air-balloons make the specific figure, Mount-Fuji, Sakura and Nishiki-Koi! That’s an oriental!
Can the pilots make them for the people to be fever?
The balloon is inflating with a hot air. But the wind affects with it.So the order of flying an air-balloon is at random. The pilots try to anticipate the order, and make the figures!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Monopoly Deal London
description:
Monopoly Deal is all about collecting properties and stealing from your opponents. Use action cards to charge rent, swap cards, demand birthday money and lots more. Make sure you put lots of money into your personal bank, remember other players will steal from you too.
Not your usual Monopoly Deal game, instead of streets you have to collect places such as museums, restaurants and other locations. A quick, easy, fun game which only takes 20 minutes to play, great for playing on the go.

All property cards contain photographs of famous features of the London landscape such as Saint Paul’s, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, as well as more recent favourites such as the London Dungeon and London Transport Museum.

The new action cards feature famous images from around London, including the It’s My Birthday action card depicting Harrods.

The cards also include the nearest tube station to guide tourists directly to the landmarks while the popular Monopoly tokens depict modes of transport around the city, such as taxis, buses, tubes and the river bus.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sans Queue Ni Tête
description:
Goal:
You have to rebuild the chameleons on the table piece by piece, and try not to be the colour with most points on any of them.

At the end of a round, Player which colour has the most points on a chameleon will score these points. Players may score on several chameleons at once.

As soon as a player reaches 32 points, the game is over and the player with the least points win.

Overview:
A full game takes places in several rounds, a round is made of 6 turns, a turn is made of 3 phases

1. Picking cards
Each player secretly selects the card he wants to play and puts it face down on the table.

2. Throwing dices
When each player has a face down card in front of him, everyone roll their dice. The player with the lowest score starts. In case of a tie, tied players reroll their dice until a winner comes out.

3. Playing card
First player reveals his card and plays it. Then, starting with the player on his left, the other players do the same in turns clockwise.

Once the construction of a chameleon has started, you ought to complete its construction placing cards on it clockwise.

When all players have played, start the next turn, starting back at phase 1.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Battle of the Bulge: A Combat Boots Game
description:
The Battle of the Bulge is the first of Dark City Game's Combat Boots series of tactical wargames. Each piece is a squad or section of infantry, an individual vehicle, gun, or aircraft. The scale of the board is 50 meters per hexagon, and each game turn covers only a few minutes.

Additional: The game is a small-production printing. Includes a booklet of rules and 6 scenarios, single-sided printed map, and cardstock counters (that will need to be cut).

—description from the publisher

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Orc Team Booster
description:
Orcs have been playing Blood Bowl since the game was discovered – indeed it was an Orc who discovered the shrine where the sacred book of Nuffle was hidden. Orc teams are very hard-hitting, concentrating on pounding an opponent into the turf to create gaps through which the excellent Orc Blitzers can run. Indeed, if any fault can be found with Orc teams in general, it is that they sometimes spend a little bit too much time pounding the opposition, and not enough time running the ball to score!

Expand your roster and add variation to your line-up with this booster pack! It contains 4 resin miniatures – 1 Blitzer, 1 Thrower and 2 hulking Black Orcs, each covered in detail and posed dynamically, as well as differently to the plastic models from the Blood Bowl boxed game. They're the perfect way to add variety to your Orc Blood Bowl team.

These 4 resin miniatures are supplied with 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases. Up-to-date Orc team rules can be found in the Blood Bowl Almanac 2018.

Key Features
New players for your Orc team
Add variety to your lineup
4 gorgeously detailed miniatures

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: BrainBox: Hungary
description:
The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a d8 die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 10 minutes is the winner.

This version is designed for the Hungarian market, but is completely in English. In fact, practicing English skills is noted as another benefit of playing the game.

—user summary

A BrainBox Hungary angolul nem csak a hazánkról szerzett ismereteket bővíti, de az angoltudást is játékosan fejleszti!
Jegyezz meg minél több információt 10 másodperc alatt a kihúzott kártyán szereplő hazai nevezetességekről, majd dobj a kockával és válaszolj helyesen a kidobott szám szerinti kérdésre, persze angolul! De ne húzd az időt, mert a homokórán gyorsan leszaladnak a szemek! A helyes válaszokat a kártyán ellenőrizheted. Ha jó megfigyelő vagy, akkor a legtöbb kártya nálad landol!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Green Board Game Co., KENSHO Kft.

name: Xadram
description:
Xadram is a war game in the same vein of War, its most successful rival in Brazilian market. However, Xadram introduces new concepts and mechanics to the formula, like:


card-driven battle modifiers;
moving units by the sea;
hidden units;
towers (the player who loses the territory with his tower is eliminated);
6 leagues + neutral territories;


The game's objective is conquest four leagues entirely or eliminate all other players. There's no objective cards. However it uses 6 dices (3 for attack and 3 for defense), just like War.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection

name: Hemispheres
description:
Hemispheres pits 2 halves of the same brain against each other. Each half is trying to control the entire brain. To do this, each player has the same 8 cards as their opponent. Each player is trying to out think their opponent to swing the personality meter all the way to their side of the brain and take total control.

Turns are played simultaneously by choosing the card to play each round and then revealing them together (along with each cards special Trait chosen that turn). After applying the Traits, the final Power values are compared to affect the Node track (score). Cards have a cool off period before returning to the hand. Choosing the right Power value and right Trait becomes a mind game against your opponent. This game is best played against the same opponent repeatedly to get into each others's brains.

This game was originally designed for the 2016 2-Player PnP Contest.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Legions of Battle
description:
Legions of Battle are a set of Fantasy wargame rules designed to allow you to fight epic battles between a vast array of creatures and races.

The rules themselves can be tailored to suit any fantasy setting and the game system is designed to allow you to create and field any troops that you like, limited only by your imagination and figures available. A comprehensive points system allows the design of troops as you think they should be represented.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): High Elves
description:
Warhammer: High Elves is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect High Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Expedition to the Temple of Bir Tawil
description:
You are trying to reach the desert temple of Bir Tawil, moving through locations on the map with limited resources. Water and Fuel are essential, as is having Gold to trade with. Your path is guided by a magical device powered by Crystals, and is vital if you want to discover treasures or avoid bandit raids.

Through the course of the game you move along a map, with each space demanding different resources in order to travel. Most of the action happens on the action compass, a rondel-like track where each turn 1 or more bandits will move around blocking your actions. You will then be moving the resource dice around the action compass in order to gather resources.

The central game elements focus on engine building, resource management and dice manipulation. The effects of the dice rolls happen in future turns, and part of the challenge of the game is working out how best to manipulate the dice on the map before they resolve.

—description from the publisher

name: Filharmonia
description:
A game published by The Szczecin Philharmonic Orchestra, about ...philharmony. You have to match musicians with instruments and compositions to gest them to play a concert. All that with cards, dice and a board. And a little bit of negative interaction.

In the box (nicely finished in matte), you get a 4 page instruction, a board with 57 squares, 4 cardboard pawns (with plastic clip-on bases), 50 "Musician" cards, 50 "Music piece" cards, 50 "Musical instrument" cards, 50 "Event" or "Occurrence" cards, 18 "Concert" tokens, 18 "Golden treble clef" tokens and a six-sided dice. The goal of the game is to get 5 "Golden treble" tokens (or 3 in the shorter game variant).
Players actions consist of a dice roll, movement (either clockwise or counter clockwise), and performing the action listed on the space of the board (kind of like in Talisman ). The board spaces consist of actions like: draw a card from indicated pile, gain or lose a token, use a shortcut, exchange a card with other player and so on. The "Event" cards change the course of the game. You can use such card as soon as you draw one, or leave it for later (depending on the card). Example: "Thanks to your hard work, the orchestra will play at a festival abroad. You get a 'Concert' token".
"Music piece" cards should be matched with "Musicians" and "Instruments" - for example "Music piece: Chopin - Prelude in E minor. Instrument needed: piano" -> you have to find a musician who plays piano, like "Miss Wanda. A piano expert", and a "Instrument" card with a piano. One musician can often play more than one instrument, but there's a twist: for example you can get a pianist, but he only plays one composer's pieces, or he doesn't play Chopin's or Mozart's or someone's music. "Instruments" cards (50 cards, but 16 types of instruments) include some technical/historical info; "Musicians" cards are quite funny in polish. If you get 3 such matching cards (music piece, musician, instrument), you get a "Concert" token. Then you have to get to a "Practice room" field on the board (there's two of them; roll a dice or use a shortcut). When you get there, you discard the "Concert" token and get the "Golden clef".

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: BallTriX
description:
BallTriX, is a new cool game to share good times with family and friends.

The game is quite similar to Abalone. But instead of pushing your opponent's marble out of the board, you try to push the red marble out of the board with your own marbles. When this happens, you or your team wins the game.
It can be played individually (2-3 players) or in teams (2-2 or 3-3).
With its modern and elegant design, it is a beautiful decorative object that will integrate perfectly in your living room, on a coffee table, a piece of furniture or a shelf of your library.

name: Ménestrels
description:
The King and his court are visiting the region. All the local nobles - meaning you - want to impress him with holding the best party, hiring minstrels, musicians, jugglers, actors, acrobats and beast tamers.

Minstrels is a card game in which players draft cards from a central tableau to compose the best artist troupe. Of course, many of these artists have special abilities. The player with the best group of performers at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer

name: Dwa-lam-bury
description: Dwa-lam-bury brings the best twist to charades since introducing dry erase markers! Now both teams can play at the same time, trying their best to guess the cards. But keep in mind, it doesn’t matter who guesses right – the point always goes to the team.

name: Tides of Time: Demo Deck
description:
The Tides of Time Demo Deck is great way to introduce players to this fast, fun, and easy-to-play game.
The demo deck contains just six cards, but that’s all you will need to understand and get a feel for how the game plays.

name: Twee tot de zesde macht
description:
Play the popular TV quiz now at home, and discover which team will become "the highest exponent". To make a chance to win the game, each duo has to bundle their forces and outdo themselves and not by a little.

Knowledge alone won't be enough in "Twee tot de zesde macht".
Associative thinking, reacting quickly and being well-matched make the difference between winning and losing. Play the well-known rounds from the TV quiz like the roster, the 4 answers, and double right.

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Most or Least
description:
Most Or Least is a relaxed style party game for 4-8 players ages 13 and up. In the game you and your friends go through a selection of interesting playful question which ask if you are most/least likely to do something or make a selection between three unpredictable & hilarious choices.

Each round a new person draws a card and reads out the question then selects the card that best fits their personality/desires/experiences. The other players must then select an answer in an attempt to match the reader’s card answer. Points are awarded for correctly guessing answers and the game play time is between 30-45 minutes. Most or Least avoids ‘adult’ themes which allows younger players to enjoy the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Apothecary
description:
Welcome to the middle ages, where life was short and medicine was terrible. You and 1 to 3 other players are masters of herbal remedies and potions who have come to make new lives for yourselves in a small town. Will you be a helpful addition to the community, becoming the Apothecary, or will you be a snake oil salesperson, only in it for a quick buck before moving on to the next town?

---

Apothecary is a medieval-themed game of medicine-making and disease management for 2-4 players. You and your friends play competing herbalists who have set up shop in a small town. You will buy resources (represented by cards and tokens) and use them to treat sick villagers (represented by cards). You will have the choice to actually treat or filmflam the villagers with snake oil—but watch out—too much lying and you’ll get run out of town. Do it right and you’ll be made the Apothecary!

The game is played in a series of phases, (A-E).

- In Phase A (Auction), players will bid for turn order, and the prices for the herbs players will use will be set.
- In Phase B (Barter), players will buy supplies from the market, forage in the woods, or trade with other players.
- In Phase C (Collect), players will select villager cards for treatment.
- In Phase D (Disease), players will use their resources to treat their villager cards, either honestly or dishonestly.
- In Phase E (End), the market will be reset, and disease tokens will be added to villager cards, bringing them closer to death!

In order to win the game, players must either accomplish a unique objective they've been dealt at the beginning of the game, or treat enough villagers honestly so that they land on the Apothecary space of the Apothecary track. If one player is Run Out (the other end of the track), the player(s) who were not Run Out and who have the most money win the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Trading

name: Yunnan Forest
description:
In Yunnan Forest, players roll the dice to match up animals and earn leaf tokens. If you are unable to make a match, grab a binoculars token that may help you later in the game. Play continues until after all of the binoculars have been claimed, and the player with the highest score from leaf tokens at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: All or Nothing: The Fight for Fort Mercer – October 22, 1777
description:
By late October of 1777, the British had repulsed the American attack at Germantown, and were occupying Philadelphia in Pennsylvania. American forces still occupied two forts south of the city, blocking the only viable British supply line out to sea via the Delaware River. Plans were made to eliminate the two redoubts. Can you as the American player hold off the Royalist attack on Fort Mercer? Will you as the Hessian take the Rebel stronghold to really secure the American capital and perhaps end the rebellion? Learn and enjoy!

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Chronicles of Crime: Lizzy Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the The Family Gamer tier from Promo Paradise 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Adds a new suspect for missions in Chronicles of Crime.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Vietnam Quest
description:
Vietnam Quest, also titled Đồng Hành (in Vietnamese meaning togetherness), is a collaborative game of strategy and teamwork. The game is set in 19th century Vietnam. Players take turns traveling through the country using actions like moving, building and harvesting. Actions have costs, so players must plan carefully. In addition, there are also bandits that randomly appear as the game develops. Players will work together to exchange resources when necessary to move efficiently or fight off bandits. In order to win the game, all areas of the map has to be discovered. In addition to visiting all regions, players can also challenge to clear out all bandits to claim a perfect victory.

Originally designed in Vietnamese, this game has also been translated into English to attract an international audience. The game features a foldable map, resource crystals, region cards and icons, village rings, a rolling die, villagers and bandit cubes. Vietnam Quest also comes with advanced rules for a more challenging game with variants and different winning conditions. The game also includes region cards which shares historic facts and information about the destinations. Players connect and learn many things about Vietnam, from its culture, food, and geography.

—user summary

name: Police Precinct: Let's Roll
description:
Let's Roll is a lightening fast Coop for 1-8 players. It's from the World of Police Precinct, and is inspired by the original in many ways, but make no mistake about it, it is its own game. Let's Roll is a fully stand-alone, dice roller basegame with ALL NEW mechanics.

Each player will be a cop (play a unique character with special powers), and is a member of the task-force assigned to take down the crime family that has been terrorizing the city.

Includes 3 types of cards and never seen before custom dice where the SIZE of the die intuitively tells players what to expect. The game clock is measured on a Crime Track, and TIME IS RUNNING OUT!

Police Precinct has won recognition for its strong theme, and Let's Roll will live up to this, but with a broadened audience as it is more of a gateway game, enjoyed by gamers and non-gamers alike. Inspired by all of the many American TV shows about Crime Fighting Police Work.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fighter Duel
description: 'Fighter Duel' is a set of freely available variant rules which originally in 2018 used the aircraft data from the Avalon Hill WWII air combat game Mustangs, but from 2019 switched to using the data cards and later the single plane counters from the GMT Wing Leader series. It can also use counters from the SPI game Spitfire and the map from the Avalon Hill game Flight Leader. Fighter Duel covers combats between 2 to 4 fighters per side, and focuses on simple but realistic modelling of formation tactics, aircraft energy and situational awareness. It now includes unique solitaire rules allowing any or all fighters to be placed under AI control. In 2023 the simpler spin-off Fighter Duel Lite was posted, with just 2 pages of rules and no luck after initial deployment. Both games are available at https://boardgamegeek.com/filepage/180451/fighter-duel-delux....
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Super Wash
description:
Superhero siblings Hanno and Fantastic Fiona are ready to save the world once again...or are they? Their superhero clothes need to be washed and dried first, and the evil Dr. Cloud has vowed to throw a spanner in the works.

In Super Wash, players take turns in the role of one of the siblings and Dr. Cloud. Whoever hangs up the most laundry wins!

name: Pur Sang
description:
An Argentine game, published in the 80's, about horse racing and betting, where mechanics is developed by cards that, at random, determine the progress of the race.
It has a strategic and speculative component with the use of cards that do not specify the progress of a particular horse, this being at the discretion of each contributor. It is currently discontinued and it is very difficult to get.

—user summary

name: Caccia al tesoro
description:
Everything you need to make a treasure hunt at home.
Children has to solve puzzles and clues to find the pirate chest hidden somewhere in the house. Children can play all together or in 2 teams.

—description from the designer

name: NEBUTA BEAT
description:
In Japan, there are summer festivals known as Nebuta Matsuri. The most famous one takes place at Aomori, and is considered as an intangible national treasure in Japan. During the festival, huge floats (Nebuta) are paraded through the town, depicting brave warrior figures or kabuki style heroes and gods or just local celebrities, and dancers walk alongside dressed in special costume (Haneta). They perform a sort of bouncing dance as they walk, and call to the mass of tourists to join in. The call is a sing-song, Rasserā (ラッセラー), and they sing "Rasse ra, Rasse ra, RasseRasseRasse ra". In addition, there are Crow Dancers, Karasu-zoku (カラス族 "crow gang"), who act to disrupt the festival.

Nebuta Beat is a party game to simulate the rhythmic chanting and dancing. Each player gets a specific dancer card, showing their colour and their own dance move. The players stand around the table, taking turns to play a card from their hand to the centre in rhythm with the chant. All the players keep up the chant, Rasse ra, Rasse ra, RasseRasseRasse ra, and according to which cards are played (by colour and form), different players must perform their correct slow bouncing dance steps. If they make a mistake, they get cards as a penalty, until a score is reached.

Publisher's description
"NEBUTA BEAT" is a card-driven, real "dancing" game. NEBUTA is a Japanese famous summer festival. You can experience the festival by this game. Let's dance and jump!

Components
30 Haneto (Dancer) cards
15 Karasu Haneto (Crow dancer) cards
5 Assigned pattern cards

NEBUTA BEATは、青森ねぶた祭りをテーマにした、祭り体感型カードゲームです。

あなたはハネトとなり、ねぶた祭りの掛け声と共に跳ねて跳ねて跳ねまくってください！
NEBUTA BEATは次の３つのパートを繰り返すゲームです。

①ラッセラー！
②ラッセラー！
③ラッセラッセラッセラー！

①ラッセラー！でカードを出すハネトが次に出すカードを準備し、
②ラッセラー！でカードを表にして出します。
③出たカードの模様、色で指定された人が踊ります！

単純で楽しい！運動不足も解消！みなさんもNEBUTA BEATでラッセラー！しませんか！
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Music, Party Game, Real-time

name: Fossil Wars Dinosaurs
description:
There's a central deck of cards from which players dig fossils. Most of these cards are dinosaur fossils. Some of these are too big and hence broken into 2 or 3 parts. On each fossil card, you'd find three main attributes of that dinosaur - it's type, time period and region. It also has a face value assigned on the top right corner. Players dig fossils from the central deck and exhibit their finds in different sections as per their type, time period or region. A section with at least 2 dinosaurs is considered complete. While digging 1 card is free, players can pay and dig more in the same turn. For this, they may gather money by selling fossils that they may not use to the market. Other players may also find what they need in the market and can buy from there as well. If a player completes 3 different sections or exhibits 5 dinosaurs within 1 section, the game ends. To determine the winner, all players calculate the total value of their exhibited fossils plus any remaining cash plus bonus points for the diversity of their collections.

—description from the publisher

name: Mbrane
description:
A modern, compact, territory-control strategy game with no elements of chance. "Minutes to learn, a lifetime to master"

The game is played on a standard 9x9 sudoku board, using integers 0 through 8.

Players take turns placing integer under the standard sudoku rules of placement; each number can occur only once in each row, column, and 3x3 region. The game ends when no more tiles can be placed, or both players agree to resolve the gameboard.

Placing tiles give the player "power" in the regions containing the tile. This power is equivalent to the integer value.

Additionally, if the tiles are in a cell that touches an external region, either diagonally or orthogonally (rows/columns), the player receives "influence" equal to 1/2 tile value in each connected external region.

The general goal is to control a majority of regions at the end of play.

In simplified versions, the points are totaled for each region, both power and influence, and the player with the most points in a given region is said to have control.

In the advanced game, a cascade known as Resolution occurs. (For more info on the advanced game, see http://mbranegame.com/rules-of-m/)


The game is available on the App Store and Google Play—apps are free, ad-free, purchase free and collect no user data:

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mbrane/id1232076299
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=mclass.com.mab...

The game can also be played on Steven Taverner's AI AI:

http://mrraow.com/index.php/aiai-home/

name: Witchful Thinking: Grikk the Gremlin Promotional Character card
description:
Grikk the Gremlin is a promotional Character card for Witchful Thinking.

Grikk's first Character Ability, Mischievous, represents every gremlin's instinct of ruining peoples lives and sabotaging their dreams. This Character Ability allows Grikk to force a witch to swap 1 Potion card of his choice with him or another witch when he plays a Sneaky Witch card. In Witchful Thinking, the winner of the game is the player who has collected the most Potion cards. If there is a tie, all tied players must add their own Potion cards together, and whoever has the greatest value wins. This means that players want Potion cards with positive numbers instead of negative numbers to ensure their own victory. So for example, if a witch has the Elixir of Life which has a value of +18, Grikk can use his Character Ability to take that valuable card away and give it to another witch instead, or he can take it for himself.

Grikk's second Character Ability, Trickster, represents every gremlin's desire to play tricks on others. This Character Ability allows Grikk to force a witch to swap their entire hand of Ingredient cards with another witch or himself when he plays a Sneaky Witch card. Forcing other players to swap their cards with each other can be a useful tactic because you can interrupt what the players were planning to do next. Alternatively, Grikk can use this Character Ability to get new cards if his own cards are no good.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Math

name: Witchful Thinking: Patricia the Poltergeist Promotional Character card
description:
Patricia the Poltergeist is a promotional Character card for Witchful Thinking.

Patricia's first Character Ability, Ghost, represents all of the ectoplasm (or Ghost Goop) that she leaves around. When Patricia places Ghost Goop into the cauldron, it is super concentrated with ectoplasm and is worth +4 instead of +3.

Patricia's second Character Ability, Haunt, represents how spooky ghosts can be. Haunt allows Patricia to scare another witch into missing their next turn. Patricia can use this ability once per Potion card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Math

name: Witchful Thinking: Betsy the Bat Promotional Character card
description:
Betsy the Bat is a promotional Character card for Witchful Thinking.

Betsy's first Character Ability, Echolocation, represents Betsy's unique senses to find the best ingredients. This Character Ability allows Betsy to double the value of an Ingredient card that she places into the cauldron. So, if an ingredient has a value of +4, Betsy can keep the value as is, or can change it to +8.

Betsy's second Character Ability, "It's in My Hair!", represents how people may react to bats if they are scared of them... and if the bat flies around them and maybe land on their hair. This Character Ability allows Betsy to interrupt another witch's turn by making the witch take back an Ingredient card that he or she just placed into the cauldron and exchanging it for a different Ingredient card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Math

name: Mimo
description:
Mimo is a game with 50 cards (30 actions and 20 animals).
It rempliments classic games like Charades and Memory.
In the first game a player draws one card and acts it: who guesses the action/animal earns the card and becomes the new actor.
The second game is similar to the first one, but there are 12 cards on the board face up: the actor secretly choose 1 card and the others have to pick the right one.
In the third game the active player has to act all the already drawn cards in the right order. If a player makes a mistake, he takes the turned over cards as penalty.
In the last game, players choose in turn the cards on the board, acting them: then, they have to guess which cards the opponents have, acting them again.

—description from the designer

name: La Grande Armêe: Napoleonic Warfare at Divisional Level 1800 - 1815
description:
"La Grande Armêe: Napoleonic Warfare at Divisional Level 1800 - 1815" is a set of miniatures wargame rules designed for full army engagements between the French and Allied forces of the Napoleonic period. Armies are subdivided into Corps, with the Corp Commander giving orders to elements of Brigade or Divisional size for cavalry and elements of Divisional size for infantry and the artillery reserves.

The bound sequence is based around Corp command actions that allow the individual elements to execute actions, whilst opposing elements may react to these actions. Has the battle progresses the elements will start to become disrupted and will obtain a number of disruption markers. This disruption will hinder the elements in their actions and give advantage to elements that are less disrupted.

These Napoleonic rules are designed to give a generic battle with little or no detail below Divisional level. Troop classes are subdivided into infantry, cavalry and artillery, whilst troop class are split into guard, seasoned and garrison. As with most of our rules we have tried to make the rules fun, but still maintaining the realistic feel of the period... so enjoy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Middle Earth
description:
Middle Earth is a set of Fantasy themed Tactical level miniatures wargame rules based around the trilogy of J.R.R. Tolkien.

The rules allow large or small scale actions and the ability to refight any of the battles that are depicted within Tolkiens books. Refight your favourite battle or skirmish and let the characters of the game become true heros of legend.

Enjoy the world of Middle Earth once again and relive the excitement of the struggle of Good against Evil.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Magicoa
description:
Every year, magicians from around the world come to the MAGICOA Grand Market to buy new magic potions.

Try to buy the best magic potions available using your gold coins by bidding
Accumulate magic points or use your potions to activate powers
You'll have to use cunning and mischief to win the most coveted potions and become the most powerful magician!

name: El Corralito
description:
Your goal is to reach the end of the year, of course this is not an easy task. Pickets, fines, taxes, protests, corralitos, looting, devaluations and other endless problems will be presented to you every day. But now let's talk about the game ... Well, it's similar, only much more fun and it will also help you see reality in a different way. To achieve your mission you have 5,000 pesos in your pocket, 5 cards and a chain of businesses ready to open.

On your turn, you must choose one of the following options:
a) Advance, as many boxes as the dice indicate.
b) Charge, the State will pay you 100 times what the dice say (and well, it's a game!).
c) Draw a card.

There are three kinds of cards: problems, solutions and bonds. With the problems, you can stop the other players by devaluating them, fining them, looting them or corralling their money. With the solutions, you can solve the problems that your competitors threw at you (but unfortunately these solutions only work in the game). With the bonds (and this may be strange for everyone) you can take advantage of their value and exchange them with the state for money.

On your way to the end of the year, you will land on empty lots where you can put your business, listen to the National Chain, collect privilege pensions, pay extraordinary taxes, sell pots and many other things that will make you think that you have always been a great player of this game and that nobody else will be able to win.

This game references the 1998-2002 Argentine Great Depression.

—description from the translated

Su objetivo es llegar a fin de año, claro que esto no es tarea fácil. Piquetes, multas, impuestos, cacerolazos, corralitos, saqueos, devaluaciones y otro sinfín de problemas se le presentarán día a día. Pero ahora hablemos del juego… Bueno, es parecido, sólo que mucho más divertido y además le ayudará a ver la realidad de otra manera. Para lograr su cometido Usted cuenta con 5.000 pesos en el bolsillo, 5 tarjetas y una cadena de negocios lista para abrir.

En su turno, Usted debe optar por una de las siguientes opciones:
a) Avanzar, tantas casillas como indiquen los dados.
b) Cobrar, el Estado le pagará 100 veces lo que dicen los dados (¡y bueno, es un juego!).
c) Levantar una targeta.

Hay tres clases de tarjetas: problemas, soluciones y bonos. Con los problemas, Usted puede frenar a los otros jugadores devaluándolos, multándolos, saqueándolos o acorralándoles el dinero. Con las soluciones, Usted puede resolver los problemas que sus competidores le arrojaron a Usted (pero lamentablemente estas soluciones sólo sirven para el juego). Con los bonos (y esto puede ser extraño para todos) Usted puede aprovechar su valor y cambiarlos al Estado por plata.

En su recorrido hasta fin de año, Usted caerá en lotes vacíos donde podrá poner sus negocios, escuchará la Cadena Nacional, podrá cobrar jubilaciones de privilegio, pagar impuestos extraordinarios, vender cacerolas y muchas otras cosas que le harán pensar que Usted siempre ha sido un gran jugador de este juego y que nadie le va a poder ganar.

Este juego hace referencia a la Gran Depresión Argentina 1998-2002.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Blume: Botanist
description: Mini expansion given to backers during the Blume Kickstarter. Adds 15 Botany Cards and 3 Water Beads
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: TTMC Tu te mets combien: la Carte Goodie
description:
Just shuffle the card with the others during set up.

Card found in Plato Magazine 116
publishers: Les Editions de base, Plato Magazine

name: Rolling CUBES Parolandia
description:
Rolling CUBES Parolandia is a game that allow you to have fun coming up with long sentences with the italian words you rolled.

The box contains 13 wooden dice of different colours with words on them. Circled words are worth bonus points when used in a sentence.

You can play 3 different games (as standalone or as a tournament) and a variant based on YAHTZEE (playable solo). The idea of all 4 games is to throw the 13 dice and make the longest sentence possible, also trying to score bonuses (using all 13 dice for example).

name: Don't Drop The Donut
description: Throw the die and carefully remove a stick of the colour indicated on the die. The sticks come in several widths. The widest sticks are the hardest to remove, but they count for the most points. Take a deep breath and remember... don’t drop the donut!

name: Flowers for Balcony
description:
A dexterity social deduction game (with a chance to change one's assigned colors) to visit and cheer up your sick cousin on the 6th floor of the apartment by blooming flowers on the balcony on each floor.

Like A la carte, Players aim to shake out their own colored flowers from the bottle.
The flowers that players shaked out grow on a building and bloom on the balconies while aiming for the roof.

The player who put three flowers on the balconies first or one on the roof wins.

However, you have to keep your color secret to other players. Because the girl on the 6th floor may exchange your color for another color.

—description from the designer

name: スクラッチ オーケストラ (Scratch Orchestra)
description:
In スクラッチ オーケストラ, also known as "Scratch Orchestra", players are collecting animal musicians for their orchestras, using an "I-split, you-choose" mechanism.

Specifically, the start player will reveal 7 cards from a deck face up in a row. The start player will also secretly look at 2 cards without revealing them to the other players. The start player adds the 2 cards face down to anywhere in the sequence of 7 cards (including before or after), but may not rearrange the 7 cards. The start player then splits the row of 9 cards into a number of sets equal to the number of players, and starting with the player to the left of the start player, each player takes one group of cards.

The cards have an "L", "R", or "L R" which shows which side of a player's Conductor card they may be placed. The game continues until the deck of musicians is exhausted. Players will earn points based upon how well balanced their orchestra is between "L" (left) and "R" (right); private goals (such as having at least 2 French Horns to the right of the Conductor); and instrument specific goals (such as 4 points for each Bass card, but 0 points if a player has the most Bass cards).

—user summary

name: Möbi Kids
description:
Mobi Kids is the perfect introduction to numbers for your little ones. Players each select one set of number tiles. Each set contains the exact same numbers. Players connect their number tiles to form equations using the communal operation tiles (+,- and =). The first player to connect all their number tiles wins!

If your little one is like ours, and not quite able to make equations yet, don't worry ... Inside the whale, there is an activity booklet full of mini-games. These games help kids gain confidence with numbers by offering a step-by-step approach to equation building and subsequently Mobi Kids gameplay!

-from the publisher's website

name: Ragnarok: The Abyss
description:
A supplement introducing the horrors of the Gaping Abyss to Ragnarok, the game of vicious Viking combat with a heavy metal edge.

Ginnungagap, the Gaping Abyss, was once what separated the realms of Ice and Fire, keeping them in balance and sparing the other realms from their ravages. With the Nine Realms shattered, however, Ginnungagap has been left unguarded and unspeakable horrors now await those who wish to cross it.

Ragnarok: The Abyss includes new scenarios for Ragnarok as well as new monsters to vanquish in glorious battle. New mechanics introduce something once barely recognized by war clans--Fear--and present entirely new challenges for them to overcome in the telling of their sagas.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Muffins Among Us
description:
A band of misfit cupcakes have discovered a terrible secret about their creator. Daily aliens visit the creator to take some of them away to lands unknown. It is up to these misfit cupcakes to convince all of their friends and family into escaping the bakery with them. Little do they know, there are some muffins among them who are up to no good, and will stop at nothing to keep them from escaping.

Muffins among us is a semi co-op adventure where players play as 7 unique characters with different stats and abilities. Each character will play as either a cupcake, or as a muffin disguised as a cupcake.

The Muffins must not let their presence be known, as they thwart the escape attempts of the cupcakes. Or, they can choose to pose as a cupcake, and convince all of the other cupcakes to follow them to their demise.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Rörmokar'n
description:
Rörmokar'n ("The Plumber" in English) is a children's game about building a pipe system, all in colorful plastic.

Each player has their own color of pipes with corresponding start and finish positions on the board.
The players use a spinner to determine which kind of pipe he or she gets to place, but can also plug other player's pipes to prevent them from building further. Some pipe parts have two open endings which enables you to choose an alternative route to continue building, should one path be plugged up.

The object of the game is to be the first player to build your pipe from one end of the board to the other.

—user summary
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Magic Origins
description:
Magic Origins was released on July 17, 2015. Magic Origins told the origin stories for 5 planeswalkers who are featured in sets after Origins. It featured a cycle of double-faced cards (originally used in Innistrad) that have a legendary creature on one side representing the character before their transformation, and a planeswalker on the reverse face that represents them after gaining their new power.

The set introduced the mechanics of renown, spell mastery, and menace. It also features cards with the prowess mechanic, which was introduced in Khans of Tarkir block, and the scry mechanic, which was introduced in Mirrodin block.

In February 2015, Wizards of the Coast said that it would be an introductory product "like a core set", and it was published in the time period that a core set would have taken up during the pattern established by Magic 2010. After Origins, Magic switched to a new schedule where each year contained 2 blocks, and each block contained 2 sets. With the new schedule, there are no announced plans for a major "standalone" set like Origins that is not part of a block.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Naruto Shippuden: Village Defenders
description:
When Leaf Village comes under attack while most of their ninja
are out on various missions, it falls to a small handful of ninja to protect the village! Together, the members of Team 7 and a
couple of their close friends will attempt to turn back the
invaders. They are the last line of defense, and they must not
fall! Naruto Shippuden: Village Defenders is a fast paced,
cooperative card game where players assume the role of
TEAM 7’s heores as they fight back an invading force of
enemies that fans of Naruto Shippuden will be quick to
recognize. Play as your favorite Naruto character and face off against the series classic villains. Build combos and focus your chakra to unleash massive attacks!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Sword Beach Landings
description:
Part of Against the Odds Magazine's Pocket Battle Games series, this is the fifth of their "Five For Fighting" series of linked games covering the D-Day invasion.

LPS Pocket Battle Game #25

name: Calx
description:
An area control game that gradually raises the stakes.

Cards are arranged in a line from the least valuable to the most valuable. On their turn a player must either claim a card, place a marker on the least valuable occupied card or least valued unoccupied card, or move an existing marker equal to the number of markers on their current card. If they move off the end of the line however, their marker is lost without scoring. When all of the cards have been removed or claimed, the player with the most valuable collection wins.

This is a print and play game. In addition you will need 8 markers per player.

—description from the designer

name: Wing It: Beyond
description:
Wing It: Beyond is the Space/Travel/Apocalypse themed expansion to Wing It: The Game of Extreme Storytelling. It can be played by itself or in combination with the original. In Wing It: Beyond, players can use Surprise cards that make weird stories even weirder. In one round, all stories must be love stories; in another, everyone needs to include their boring neighbor Steve.

—description from the publisher

name: オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu)
description:
In オフトゥンからの脱出 (Ofutun kara no Dasshutsu, Escape from the Futon) You didn't get enough credits to graduate college, but you have one more chance - you just have to pass the special exam at the end of a week of intensive lectures. If only you can get out of bed...

The game is played over four days (rounds). Each day one card per player is dealt to the center of the table, and then everyone simultaneously bids how early they'll get up. Early risers get first pick at the cards on the table, but waking up early uses up energy, and if you get too tired you'll end up skipping class.

The basic strategy is to maintain a careful balance between energy and your studies, but there are risky options like energy drinks or just saving all your energy for the final exam. Solitaire rules are also included. Character cards have two sides, one with a cat and one without.

Can you escape from your futon and make it to class?

—user summary

name: One Night Werewolf: Madness
description:
One-night people 狼 Madness is a new series that has Cthulhju myth as a motif and in addition to title cards, madness cards have been added. [Madness card] "old ruler" who becomes a prisoner of this work's man scatters madness during the night. It is dealt to the player as a madness card and adds various restrictions during the daytime discussion. However, it is only a little strange madness, such as "I sing with my white eyes removed", "I call my next person as a mom" and "Ah! You may be blown out involuntarily in the argument which does not advance rightly!

Cards added: Crawling Chaos, Dreamer, Zealot, Great Old One (x2), Investigator (x3) plus madness cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Rats
description:
Rats is a trick-taking game where each player is dealt a hand of 7 cards and an initial trump suit is determined by revealing the top card of the deck. The suit of this card is the trump suit for the first hand of cards.

The player left of the dealer leads the trick and everybody follows suit. The highest card takes the trick. If you cannot follow suit then you have the option to trump. A trump card beats everything other than another trump card. A card plaid which does not follow suit and is not a trump has no trick-taking capabilities. Trumps cannot be led until you have no cards left to lead other than trumps or until a trick has been taken by trumping another suit.

After the entire hand has been played, anybody that took 0 tricks is on "stand-by" for the rest of the game. The player that took the most tricks declares the next trump suit. Ties are broken by having each player draw from the remaining cards in the deck until one player draws a higher card than the other, and they decide the trump suit for the next hand.

A second hand of 6 cards is dealt, and then the player that decides trumps declares the trump suit. Play continues until all tricks have been taken. Any player which is on stand-by and took no tricks is eliminated from the game. Any player which was not previously on stand-by and took 0 tricks is now on stand-by. Whoever took the most tricks declares the next trump suit. Ties are broken as before.

Play continues with each hand decreasing down to 1 card or until all players have been eliminated. If two or more players remain after the hand of 1 card, play continues with hands of 1 card until only one player remains.

—user summary

name: Brawlings
description:
Brawlings are grumpy creatures that have been accidentally summoned from another dimension by Archmage Archimedes. We must send them back to where they came from before they destroy his tower!

Brawlings is a modular card game for 2 to 4 players that consists of 54 cards divided into 4 modules. At the start of the game, build the deck with cards from the modules you wish to use, then divide them equally among all players.

In the middle of the table you'll have Brawls, which are groups into which any player will be able to play other Brawlings from their hand, to fight those already in play and try to knock them down.

Players collect any Brawling they knock out during their turn, by laying it face up in three piles in front of them. Brawlings on top of those piles are called Champions.
At the end of the game, players calculate their score by using their Champions score multipliers. The player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: 1973: The Yom Kippur War
description:
This installment of the Procedural Combat Series sees a return to historical conflict in one of the cold war’s most iconic campaigns. A well trained, well armed, but unprepared Israel must defend herself against a multinational coalition lead by Egypt and Syria that is bent on her destruction. 1973 highlights the highly mobile nature of this campaign, and adds a realistic treatment of air operations. Some support units are included in the OOB as to give players a chance to experience how new weapons systems for the time had an impact on the battle space. Moving the PCS series to a desert environment gives mechanized and motorized units a huge level of freedom in terms of maneuver.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Eid
description:
Eid refers to the Muslim festival, Eid al-Adha which honors the willingness of Ibrahim (Abraham) to sacrifice his son as an act of obedience to God's command. But, before Abraham could sacrifice his son, God provided a lamb to sacrifice instead. Eid al-Adha is a Festival of the Sacrifice and families celebrate with prayers, charity, social gatherings, and Festive Meals!

In Eid, players will be going to the market to try to get all the ingredients they need to complete the recipes before the other player does. Players will gain ingredients by altering the current market for ingredients and then trading away their current ingredients to get more of another.

Players will alter the market by playing a card to a two-sided function. The player will then use that function to trade in one type of ingredient to gain the ingredients listed on the other side of the function. Play will continue until one player has completed two of the three recipe cards.

—description from the designer

name: Richard Wagner's Ring of the Nibelung
description:
Richard Wagner's Ring of the Nibelung is a fast and easy-to-learn card game based on norse myth and Wagner's opera. Siegfried, Brunhilde the valkyrie, Fafner the Dragon and even the Gods from Valhalla will join the fight!
