Players take the role of great lords of the north trying to get Alberich's Ring. But, alas, the Ring comes with a terrible curse that destroys anyone who wears it for too long!

In your turn you take a character either form Midgard (the main deck) or from your hand and then, you put him (or her) in your Great Hall. A Great Hall can contain up to six characters. Heroes and villains can kill each other or even fall in love, changing greatly how the Great Halls look. Also, each character has a "Ring" value that allows you to take the mighty Ring from whoever is wearing it right now.

Having the Ring allows you to take treasures. Treasure cards may give you victory points or, even better, old artifacts with amazing powers. But beware!! If the curse affects you, you will lose a treasure and one of your own characters will die. You can, however, give up the ring before this happens.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Risk: Assassin's Creed
description:
Throughout history the Assassin Brotherhood and the Order of the Knights Templar have been waging a secret war. Now the Templar's grip on the free world is tightening and as a loyal Assassin, it is down to you to take back control and free humanity from their imposed world order. Play as one of five different groups of Assassins as you use your wits, strategy and a little bit of luck, to explore and free territories. Use special cards and missions in this epic Risk battle. Work in the dark to serve the light.

Key Features

The Game of Strategic Conquest
Choose your side, deploy your armies and go into battle
Beautifully crafted game pieces, including Hooded Assassin and the Assassin Order Insignia.
Quick-play version and easy set-up
Risk is the game where you need to conquer it all


—description from the publisher
categories: Territory Building, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling
publishers: Winning Moves France, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Yokai Quest: The Oni Invasion
description: Expansion for Yokai Quest, offering new adventure scenarios, new heroes, new enemies, and new bosses.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Hopes of Glory: Module 1 – A New Campaign for Five Leagues From the Borderlands
description:
A brand new campaign for the Five Leagues From the Borderlands miniatures rules, this puts you right in the middle of the disputed border territories as war is looming.

Build a new war band or use your hardened veterans as you take on the terrors of warfare, dealing with enemy patrols, deserters and desperate outlaws.

This is a replacement campaign for the one in the core rules, focusing on a non-supernatural experience in a war-torn land.

In addition to the new encounter table, you will also find new skills to learn and a host of new non-combat encounters as you explore a land on fire.

Whether you are simply looking for something new to do, you've been waiting for a more medieval-feeling campaign or want to delve into the grit and blood of a "Black Company" style adventure, it's all here for you.

We even include a campaign system to help resolve the war acting as a backdrop to your adventures, complete with campaign events that will influence the battles you have.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Variable Player Powers

name: Dejlige Danmark
description:
Dejlige Danmark is a trivia game about the history of Danmark. Each of the 165 cards depicts a historical event on its front side, and has the year of the event on the back side.

There are two different gameplay modes: In the drafting mode, you try to arrange drafted cards into chronological order. The player with the fewest misplaced cards wins.

In the trivia mode, you try to guess the correct year by placing markers on the gameboard. The game is played over a fixed number of rounds, and whoever has the most points at the end wins.

—user summary

name: The Witches' Annual Race
description:
A real time dexterity racing game, fun for all the family

The annual witches’ race is the single most important event of the year for the witches’ guild. As in every year, your control over your ‘Pen’ broomstick will be your main challenge against the wind, fire, and air elements of this ever changing race course. By maintaining your focus and dexterity, during the race, coping with unexpected events and with a little bit of luck, you can finish the year as the fastest and most talented witch of all.

During the game the players need to keep their markers inside the race lines while encountering events (cards) during the race and overcome them while your opponent keeps running.

Obstacles can be in a form of the complex movement of the pen on the board, a die that delays you from moving forward, and even closing your eyes to increase the difficulty.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Line Drawing, Point to Point Movement

name: Warfare in the Age of Napoleon III
description:
These rules are intended to permit simple but fairly realistic wargames in which players with relatively few figures can refight colorful European actions of the mid-19th Century. The focus is on Napoleon III's Italian adventure and 1870 debacle. However, with a realistic assessment of the characteristics of the different armies, the Crimean, Austro-Prussian and Mexican campaign can be refought. With even more allowance for local eccentricities, the War Between the States and contemporary colonial battles can be accommodated. In fact, the rules dealing with first effect and melee results do reflect consideration of American example. Since the emphasis is on European action, the higher level of organization of European armies of the period is not always known to the gamer new to the period, typical corps structures are shown at the end of these rules.

—description from the designer

This complete rule set/game was first published as an article in Vol. VII, No. 5 of The Courier magazine (1982).

name: Scenario Seven
description:
The following is a new and truly different scenario for FIREPOWER buffs, designed to be played by five to six players in training for a life in crime. It springs from the twisted mind of that arch desperado, the designer of the game, who nevertheless has a keen eye for fun.

The scenario is "The Bank Robbery" and is set in the 1920s/30s world of Eliot Ness and the Untouchables. It also includes complete stats for weapons of the period.

—description from the designer

This expansion/scenario was first published as an article in The General, Vol. 25, No. 5 (1989).
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Sombras luego divinidad
description:
Sombras luego divinidad is an epic fantasy game with hidden roles and combat using cards. It is played in about 15 minutes and allows 4 to 12 players to play.
At the start of the game each player receive a candidate with different and secret objectives to win the game. In a turn, you use cards with creatures to attack other players or spells with various uses. A candidate cannot use all creatures, only the ones of their own class. Players need to find out who their opponents is, and to achieve their own objectives.
—description from the designer

Sombras luego divinidad es un juego de fantasía épica con roles ocultos y combate usando cartas. Se juega en unos 15 minutos y permite jugar a entre 4 y 12 jugadores.
Al inicio de la partida cada jugador recibe un aspirante con diferentes y secretos objetivos para ganar el juego. En un turno usas tus cartas de criatura para atacar a otros jugadores o hechizos con muy variadas funciones. Un aspirante no puede usar todas las criaturas, sólo las que pertenecen a su tipo. Los jugadores deben intentar averiguar quiénes son sus oponentes, y lograr cumplir sus propios objetivos.
—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Spin Off
description:
Spin Off is a 2-player fight over gravity. Players manipulate mechanical controls to tilt the dished playing board in a battle to steer and deflect balls that are in play. Players use both defensive and offensive moves to tilt and roll their own balls into the center goal while keeping their opponent's balls out. The first player to sink all five of their balls wins.

Alternate play includes adding up to eight pegs to the board for an added obstacle challenge. Players navigate their balls through these obstacles and into the goal. For an additional challenge, the board may also be configured with "bumpers" by adding a rubber band to any pair of obstacle pegs.

—description from the publisher

name: Deluxe Poker Rummy Game
description:
In Deluxe Poker Rummy there are two sets of 4 different color tiles (black, red, yellow and blue) each numbering 2 through 10 plus Jack, Queen, King, and Ace; plus 2 jokers. The games comes with rules to play both the American Way and the International Way.

How to play Deluxe Poker Rummy the American Way:

Each players picks 14 tiles and must have a total of 25 points in one or more sets or runs in their hand in order to place those tiles on the table. After you place your initial tiles down you are ready to play the table (i.e. add to sets or runs already played) but if during your turn you are unable to play on the table you must pick a tile from the remaining ones. Jokers are wild.

The first player who gets rid of all the tiles in his hand is the winner. The other remaining players must total all the points left in their hand. Each tile is worth the number of points as valued on the tile. The jokers are worth 25 points.
Your objective therefore is to keep as few points in your hand as possible.

How to play Deluxe Poker Rummy the American Way:

The bricks are laid face down, shuffled and arranged - still face down - in one stack of 8 bricks and fourteen stacks of 7 bricks each, starting from left to right. The opener starts the game by turning face up the top brick of the last stack on the left which then becomes "Trump" for the round.

The stacks are then dealt until each player has 14 bricks, except for Player #2, which will have 15. Player #2 takes an unwanted one from his hand and puts it on the table to his right, face up.

The first stage of the game is to arrange the bricks on your stand in Sets of "Runs" or "Groups". Players draw a brick from the pool and then discard either it or another brick from their stand. You can meld any Sets from your stand onto the table, provided their total value is 50 or more. Once a Set has been melded it may be added to, but not changed or taken back.

—user summary

name: Toraja
description:
Toraja, South Sulawesi. A region in Indonesia that famous for its coffee. Many Coffee Expert are considering Torajan Coffee as one of the best speciality coffee in the world. In this game, You are land owner in Toraja that dreams of changing it into a coffee plantation. You do that by managing your resources and carefully plans your landscape. Establishing Trade with other region will also give you competitive advantage. The most effective player wins the game!

Toraja is played in two phases: Drafting and Building. In the drafting phase, you draft resource cards and making combo out of it. Collected resources can then be used to build or improve your coffee plantation, and possibly gain benefit from initiating foreign trade. Clever plays wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Goblin Hills: A New Campaign for Five Leagues From the Borderlands
description:
On the road down to the village, you admired the scenery: Majestic mountains and wind- blasted crags overlooking a fierce, rugged wilderness with tiny specks of civilization scattered throughout.

Arriving in town, you noticed the tense, fearful looks in the eyes of the locals. Militia men, too old or too young, clutch their spears while patrolling the palisades.

As you ask around, the villagers whisper one word in response:

“Goblin”


* * * *


In this brand new campaign for the Five Leagues solo battle game, you are tasked with defending a village from raids of blood-drunk goblins.

As you turn the tide of battle, you must track down their lair and venture into the dark to crush the rotten heart.

Facing barbed arrows, goblin-venom and sorceries, you will have allies fighting on your side to even the odds, offering a chance for large skirmishes with a dozen or so combatants on each side.

As you progress, you will acquire new treasures as rewards, including vile goblin weapons, and learn unique skills obtainable only through this campaign.

As always, we include options to tailor the game, including 6 variant goblin types and "players choice" options for customization.


* * * *


This product requires a copy of the Five Leagues rules to use.

It is intended for a war band with some experience under its wings and can be played as part of any long-running campaign along with the core rules experience and Dark Woods of Winter.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Die Welt der Saurier
description:
In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Sami Saurus" (SS) and "Mats Mogel" (MM) guide through one of 3 different game modes.


Knowledge: Learn about the dinosaurs specified on 26 different cards with SS.
Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.
Card Game with MM


For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Radio Times
description:
A special edition of the original Trivial Pursuit themed around the 'Radio Times', a British TV listings magazine. Players move around a simplified Trivial Pursuit board answering questions and collecting wedges; the first to collect all the wedges and answer a final question in the middle of the board wins.

The categories in this edition include 'Entertainment & Childrens' TV', 'Radio', 'Film', 'Events and Documentaries', 'Comedy', and 'Drama & Soap'.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Code 3: The Corrupt Mayor
description: The Corrupt Mayor is one of the first 3 expansions packs for Code 3. It includes a new officer, new chief and new scenario to play.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Tail Story
description:
Tail Story is a reverse deck building game: build your deck using other player's discard pile and force your unused cards to them!

Each player takes the role of a pet from 1 of the 3 types: CANINE, FELINE or RODENT & FRIENDS.
to collect achievements to win the game!

The players take turns and do whatever it takes to draw the cards from their own deck as fast as they can to complete 4 achievements to win the game!

Each player is dealt 15 EVENT CARDS to make his/her own deck at the start of the game. Every time a player runs out of cards in his/her deck, the player shuffles all the cards in his/her discard pile to make a deck again. He/she then chooses 1 card from his/her hand and puts it face-down in front of him/her. This is called AN ACHIEVEMENT. The player who gets the 4th ACHIEVEMENT first is considered the winner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Action Queue, Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Role Playing, Trading, Turn Order: Random, Variable Phase Order

name: Lighthouse Ahoy!
description:
Summer, sun, sea, and a red-yellow lighthouse: Who wouldn't think of vacation?

In Lighthouse Ahoy!, each player builds their own tower, which includes the base, red and yellow disks for the tower, and the green roof. The individual components are available only with the right dice combination.

Who will have a lucky hand and get the most points?

name: SUCK
description:
You are each a member of a secret society of humans, living inside an underground bunker to hide from the vampires who lurk above. When someone gives you provisions, it makes you more valuable to the group, which matters when the boat finally arrives to whisk your group to safety. But the provisions are tainted with vampire blood....

On their turn, players send provisions to other players from a face-up deck. The cards are public but the undersides of the cards may have bites on them. Each provision has a low, medium, or high probability of being tainted with vampire blood. The players with the most valuable provisions are thus the most dangerous to the group. Subtle negotiation is required to get the most provisions onto the boat without bringing too many vampires.

This semi-sequel to GROWL (2019) keeps the primary "card giving" mechanism but removes player elimination and the honor-system aspect. It also introduces a riveting finale.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Memonsters
description:
Memonsters is a bright and fun game, in which you need to raise your monster.
Open the tiles one by one and try to make your mentee out of them.
Whoever manages first - wins!
Each player chooses his mentee and puts a tile with his head in front of him.
The remaining parts of the selected monsters (6 body parts and tails each) are mixed together with special tiles facedown between the players..
In his turn, the player opens 1 tile so that everyone can see it. If this is a part of his monster, he tries to attach it.
Sometimes you need to rotate tile to attach it. Sometimes you can’t attach the tile you need to put it back and take later.
If a player opens a special tile, he immediately plays it's effect, and then puts it away in the box.

Bright children's game with intuitive rules.
Develops spatial thinking, memory, attention, perseverance.
Child-friendly components.
Balanced gameplay, suitable for the youngest.

—description from the publisher

name: Ratinger Speed Puzzle
description:
Competitive puzzle game for two to four teams of two players each. It contains four different puzzles with eight square tiles each.

There are four skill challenges to play the game.


Pick the correct tiles (pattern recognition)
Complete puzzles (speed matching)
Puzzle with index finger only (dexterity)
One team member is blindfolded and the other has to conduct (team-based game)


The team which collects the most points in these four challenges wins the game.

—user summmary
mechanics: Pattern Building, Speed Matching, Team-Based Game

name: Die Befreiung der Rietburg: Varkur – der dunkle Magier
description: Mini-expansion, consisting of one card that increases the difficulty.

name: Die Befreiung der Rietburg: Der alte Wehrturm
description: Mini-expansion, consisting of one card that decreases the difficulty.

name: Langland Lotto
description:
At Langland Lotto the body parts of the animals have gotten confused while playing. Each player therefore tries to form two complete animals from the individual body parts. Each round one of the animal tiles is uncovered. Whoever owns the tableau with the corresponding animal may take it. The winner is the first player to fill out both of his animal tableaux completely and correctly.

—description from the publisher

name: Reckless Daring: Brigade Level Minatures Rules for the Colonial Age 1870-1910
description:
Reckless Daring is a complete rules system to refight colonial era battles at the brigade level from 1870 to 1910. Covers the Sudan, Indian Mutiny, Boer Wars, Ashanti Wars, Zulu Wars, Dahomey Wars, Abyssinian Wars and the Sahara. Army lists, army guides, painting guides and scenario for Omdurman are included

—description from the publisher

name: Gridlock: Boston
description:
A competitive board game about driving through the city where the roads make no sense and everything is always changing on you. Players build and modify a road network across the board based on a real-life city (Boston, in this edition).

Roads are represented by intersections on hex tiles and can be laid out in any space and orientation available on the board. Players can drive across any road, no matter who laid it.

The first player to get to their randomly-chosen destinations wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pieces as Map

name: Yum Yum Island: Cocow promo
description:
A promo animal with 10 food tokens (5 pink and 5 green) to add to the game. Once rescued, Cocow allows you to communicate for the next airdrop, so you will not need to roll the die. On the other hand, the players will have to use the language of Cocow to guide the squadron leader, that is only "moo".

—user summary

name: Génies en Herbe: Les vrais génies
description:
Trivia games where players are split in two teams. Each team tries to be the fastest to give an answer but if it's wrong, the opposite team gets a right of reply. Questions themes goes from school subjects to public figures passing through sports and general knowledge.

Questions come from the 2017 provincial Génies en herbe tournament in Thetford Mines, Québec, Canada.

—user summary

name: Eight Wizards
description:
八人の魔術師 (Hachi-nin no majutsu-shi) Eight Wizards is a two player fantasy card game from Japan.

In the distant past, two rival beings possessing unimaginable magical power clashed for control of the world. In the end, their conflict triggered an incredible explosion of energy, resulting in the mutual destruction of these god-like beings. This explosion was so powerful, it twisted the very fabric of reality in upon itself, ripping the world in two and leaving time to flow in an infinite loop. Those who survived the brutal conflict soon realized the energy of these dead gods was slowly being drawn to the central point where the two worlds now met. Skilled in the art of energy manipulation, those known as Summoners are now able to harness the power stored in this central point, referred to as The Node, to conjure Wizards and Monsters to do battle. By defeating a conjured being in battle, Summoners can capture energy in special Gemstones. Only through the use of these energy-filled Gemstones can the loop finally be broken and order restored to the world. However, there is a catch. Only the side with the greatest amount of stored energy will survive when the two halves of the world merge once again. With the fate of their world at stake, the battle between the Summoners thus began.

A game consists of 4 rounds with 5 battles. Each round is played as follows:


The Attacker chooses one card from their hand and plays it face-up on the table. Activate any abilities that apply.
The Defender then chooses 1 card from their hand and plays it face-up in front of the Attacker's card. Activate any abilities that apply.
After all relevant abilities have been applied, compare the cards' Power levels. The card with the higher value wins.
Turn the losing card sideways to the defeated position. (In the case of a tie, turn both cards sideways.) Note: A card is not considered "defeated" if the battle ended in a tie.
Assign the role of Attacker to the player who won the battle, and Defender to their opponent. (In the case of a tie, the roles of Attacker and Defender remain the same as the previous battle.)
Repeat steps 1-5 until all 5 battles have been played OR the special win condition is met.


After all 4 rounds are finished, the player with more points showing on their Gemstones is declared the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Law of The Forest
description:
Infamously known as a concrete jungle, Hong Kong is a lot more than mere concrete as its reputation suggests. With about 70% of its 1,100 km2 area being vegetated, Hong Kong actually has more green than grey. Amongst the greenery are over 3,300 species of vascular plants, within which are more than 60 species of mammals; more than 500 species of birds; around 80 species of reptiles; some 20 species of amphibians and tens of thousands of different invertebrate species. These animals strive to survive every day. To them, Hong Kong is a dangerous place.

To survive, they will need to be able to find food and suitable habitats, avoid predation, outcompete other competitors and be able to adapt to or be lucky enough to avoid a myriad of human disturbances. If you are now part of this community, will you be able to master the Law of the Forest and survive in this harsh environment?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Pieces as Map, Race, Role Playing, Simulation, Turn Order: Pass Order, Zone of Control

name: Ragnarok: The Vanir
description:
The Aesir are dead, and the Vanir, now uncontested in their divinity, come to claim what is left of the Nine Realms. The War Clans must oppose, or align with, these new foes.

' Ragnarok: The Vanir' features new Godsparks that War Clans may harness to combat the marauding Vanir, as well as new scenarios, monsters, and options to further develop players' campaigns.

'—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Word Limit
description:
Word Limit is a fast, competitive clue-giving word game with multiple dynamics.

A card with six words is visible for everyone to see. Two opposing players are the clue-givers. They compete to give a clue that indicates one word to the other players, while not being confused with the other five words. But wait! A Word Limit card is first drawn, restricting what the clue-givers are even allowed to say in the first place. But don't wait! Whoever gives their clue first claims the chance to earn the point!

—description from the designer

name: Stargazer
description:
The world of stars that once looked up from the ground.
With the rapid development of space technology, the human race that finally enabled interstellar navigation
At last, we will start exploring unknown planets.

Waiting there is a brilliant glory or an unexpected ruin.
The greatest romance of mankind opens!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Anzac Cove
description:
"Anzac Cove" is a narrative solitaire wargame that tells the story of the Australian and New Zealand Army Corps (Anzacs) and the landing on the beaches of Gallipoli in the early morning of April 25th, 1915. You must lead your fellow Aussies and work together with your Kiwi and Indian allies in the desperate fight to take and hold the heights overlooking the Dardanelles.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sports Arena
description:
17 SPORTS OF ALL SORTS
for 1,2,3, or 4 players

The Sports Arena is the world’s most versatile gameboard.
There are games to delight all ages and all temperaments-games to suit your every mood: hilarious games and quiet games, games of luck and games of skill, games of precision and games of speed, games of physical coordination and games of strategy. For a frolic, a fracas, or a fray, Sports Arena is tops.

THRILLS!!!
-A WIDE VARIETY!!!

Standing targets blasted in fast shooting contests of fire-power!

Standing targets strategically maneuvered in battles of wit!

Moving targets delight sportsmen with problems of leading, timing, judgement of distance, and hand-eye coordination!

Bobbing targets that lurch, dart, and roll in circles!

—description from the rulebook

name: Friends Against Friends (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
A brand new game from the creators of Paper Against The Office! Friends Against Friends is the next great game you should have on your shelf at home!

Order yours now to be among the first to get this great game!

It contains 36 Black Cards and 144 White Cards.

Card sizes are the standard 2.5"x3.5"

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Monopoly: A Belgian Rail Odyssey
description:
Specialty edition of Monopoly edited by NMBS/SNCB and Train World, the first being the national railway operator of Belgium and the second a railway museum.

The properties in the game are replaced by historical locomotives and trains of the Belgian rail fleet (in chronological order) and the stations are replaced by actual stations. This edition comes with vintage playing pieces, one of which is a locomotive.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Dico Games, Hasbro, Winning Moves International Ltd

name: Black Sun: Rules for 28mm Weird Nam Skirmish Battle
description:
Cthulhu 1968: Black Sun 28mm Miniatures and Rulebook

Black Sun is a game of ground combat that accompanies our 28mm Black Sun range of models. It is set in another dimension that is known as Black Sun, located somewhere in an alternate jungles of Cambodia in the year 1968. The rules are designed to give you an authentic feel for warfare in the Viet Nam War and could certainly be used for this purpose. However, the game also includes some fantastic events from the alternate dimension of the Black Sun. These rules include unpredictable events – sudden rushes, explosions, ambushes, and malfunctioning weapons along with more far flung environmental and strange atmospheric manifestations – that will challenge your strategy and tactics as a tabletop general. The terrain can be as elaborate or as simple as you like; but the game is best played with lots of cover (jungle, trees, jungle, rocks, downed helicopters, ancient buildings and yet more jungle). The playing area can represent anything from an ancient city to an alien jungle canopy to a Bug-infested tunnel complex!
Each player controls a Force about the size of a small squad (6-15 models). Some Forces may involve more models than others since they consist either of less skilled troops (like NVA militia or poorly armed and trained conscripts) or weird alien Fury Bugs whose strength lies in their overwhelming numbers. As players become more experienced, they can control larger numbers of troops as well as vehicles and incorporate more advanced rules for Viet Nam era warfare. At its most basic size (squad level), a game of Black Sun should take an hour or less to play.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: The Road So Far
description:
A quick play, family friendly card game.
Take the Impala out around the country to collect groups – Angels, Demons, Hunters, Allies, Family, and two brothers. The player with the majority of groups at the end of the road wins. The Road So Far is a casual card game for 2-4 players.

The Road So Far is a card game for 2-4 players; recommended 8 and up. Players take turns as “driver” of the Impala “travelling” on the board to collect character cards. Once the majority of a group is collected, “mayhem” ensues. Play continues until the Impala can no longer move. At that time, the player that has the majority of group markers wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Chain Mail: The Empty Cauldron – Adventure Kit
description:
Word on the street is that a mage needs four very special items and is paying well to get them.

It seems simple, but this dangerous task involves volatile ingredients that can react tragically if you don't proceed with caution.

The Empty Cauldron is an Adventure Kit for Chain Mail: Adventures of Earthshine.

Goal: Find and deliver the 4 ingredients.

This expansion includes:

Quest: The Empty Cauldron
Map: The Glass Mirror
Monsters: Goblin Shaman / Orc Zombie
Treasure: Frostbite



Released in the July 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Pippinzip
description:
Pippinzip is a square board connection game for 2-3 players. Various sizes of boards are possible, from short games on a 5x5 grid played with pencil and paper, to longer games on a Go board (9x9, 13x13, or 19x19).


THE BASIC IDEA:

The game begins with an auction phase -- a sort of mini-game of chicken (reminiscent of Unlur), in which an initially empty board is gradually seeded with a growing number of initial stones. The auction phase determines who will play the role of "Pip" (using black stones) and who will play the role of "Zip" (using white stones).

After the auction phase ends and the roles are thereby determined, the players take turns playing stones of their color to the board. Play continues until a winning condition is reached. (Draws are impossible.) Pip wins by connecting any TWO opposite sides of the board via a chain of orthogonally-adjacent black stones. Zip wins connecting all FOUR sides of the board via a chain of 8-way-adjacent white stones. ("8-way-adjacent" = either orthogonally or diagonally adjacent.)



IN MORE DETAIL:

There are two varieties of play, "Zipline" and "Pipline".


Pipline:

This is the standard version of the game. The game begins with an empty board and an "auction phase." In this phase, on his/her turn a player places 1-3 BLACK stones onto empty points on the board. (Each player has a free choice of whether to place 1 black stone, or 2 black stones, or 3 black stones on his/her turn.) Players alternate turns, playing black stones exclusively in this phase of the game, until one player on his/her turn says "Take" instead of placing any stones. This taker is henceforth known as "Pip" and will play a SINGLE black stone on each future turn. The opponent (i.e. the non-taker) is "Zip," who will play a SINGLE white stone on each future turn.

Immediately after "take" is announced, the non-taker (i.e. Zip) has his/her turn and places a single white stone, followed by a single black stone from Pip, then a single white stone from Zip, etc. Turns alternate in this fashion until one player achieves his/her win condition (or until one player resigns). Zip wins by connecting all FOUR sides of the board with a chain of white stones that are orthogonally and/or diagonally adjacent; Pip wins by connecting any TWO opposite sides with a chain of black stones that are orthogonally adjacent.

Pencil-and-Paper Play: Pipline is the recommended version of the game for pencil-and-paper play (draw four vertical lines and four horizontal lines to make a 5x5 grid, as depicted here: https://boardgamegeek.com/image/5173760/cdunc123)


Zipline:

This is an alternative version of the game. To start the game, on each turn a player places 1-3 WHITE stones in the auction phase. (Each player has a free choice of whether to place 1 white stone, or 2 white stones, or 3 white stones on his/her turn.) Players alternate turns, playing white stones exclusively in this phase of the game, until one player on his/her turn says "take" instead of placing any stones. This taker is henceforth known as "Zip" and on future turns Zip will play a SINGLE white stone per turn. The opponent (i.e. the non-taker) is known as "Pip." On future turns, Pip will play TWO black stones per turn, with the following restriction: Pip's second black stone of a given turn is NOT allowed to be placed orthogonally adjacent to the first black stone of the turn. (Placing two diagonally adjacent black stones in the same turn IS allowed. Also, note that in the extremely rare case where ALL remaining empty cells are orthogonally adjacent to first black stone, the second black stone is forfeited.)

Immediately after "take" is announced, the non-taker (i.e. Pip) has his/her turn and plays two black stones, followed by a single white stone played by Zip, then two black stones from Pip, then a single white stone from Zip, etc. Turns alternate in this fashion until one player achieves his/her win condition (or until one player resigns). Zip wins by connecting all FOUR sides of the board with a chain of white stones that are orthogonally and/or diagonally adjacent; Pip wins by connecting any TWO opposite sides with a chain of black stones that are orthogonally adjacent.

"Freestyle" Variant: For variety you can play Zipline with free placement for Pip's two black stones, that is, with no ban on orthogonally adjacent placements in the same turn.

Three-Person Pippinzip: The Zipline version of Pippinzip can also be played as a 3 player game. In 3 player Zipline, the taker plays as Zip and the two non-takers play as a single Pip team. Each non-taker plays a single black stone on his/her turn, for a total of two black stones for Pip for every one white stone for Zip. Roles are determined in the auction phase using the same process described for 3 player Unlur in this thread: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1706872/unlur-three-people.



MISCELLANEOUS NOTES


Before the game, players should agree whether to place stones on the intersections of the game board grid (as in Go) or alternatively, place stones within the cells of the game board grid. Either mode of play is fine; it is a matter of personal choice.



The board starts out empty.



Placement must always be to an EMPTY intersection or cell (depending on which mode was agreed before the start of the game). There is no capture or displacement of enemy stones in Pippinzip.



Once placed, stones never move.



If during the auction phase, a player creates the win condition for the color being used in the auction phase, then that player wins the game. (However, this won't happen if both players play competently!)




-description from designer

name: Look A Round
description:
A simple family party game, based on the popular Kaleidos game system: turn over an illustrated card and look for something whose name begins with a random selected letter. The first to declare an acceptable word, wins the card

In the box there are 80 large round cards, illustrated with hundreds of objects and with a letter on the back.

Every time players turn over a card a new combination of objects and letter is randomly selected.

The first player to get a determined number of cards, wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Plausible Deniability: Spec Ops Missions for Skirmish Sangin
description:
Plausible Deniability contains 12 Special Forces scenarios for Skirmish Sangin.

It includes 9 ORBATS of Special Forces teams:

MARSOC
SEALS
SAS
UK PATHFINDERS
FALLSCHIRMJGER
GSG9
GROM
SPETSNAZ
RPIMA


and all the associated rules to run a Special Operations campaign using the Skirmish Sangin Rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Dragon Ball Z: Smash Battle – The Miniatures Game
description:
Dragon Ball Z - Smash Battle is a tabletop game of super detailed miniature superheroes and villains battling against each other. Players fight with each other with special event cards, fighting skills, defending skill in an exciting contest of strategy.

This is a game designed for 2 to 4 players. Each player takes control of his own faction of miniatures fighting in the famous Dragon Ball Z scene - Battle Arena.

GAME PLAY:
Build up your own team and game set up

4 Phases per Round:
PHASE 1. Event Phase - Dragon Ball Story Scenario
Draw an Event Card from the deck. Each Event Card does not only tell a scenario of the DBZ story, but it also affects the characters in that round. It might be a mission of collecting Dragon Ball, Saiyan turns to Great Ape, Ginyu Force Team sudden attack and more.

PHASE 2. Initial Phase - Prepare for Battle:
Set up the action sequence of characters. The action sequence is critical and players have to apply their strategy in the next action phase

PHASE 3. Action Phase - Moving and Battling:
Each character comes with a character card which lists all of attributes, fighting skills and abilities. Players apply their strategy along with the characteristics of each character in the combat of each battle.
Not only can players calculate the result of the battle by referencing the characters' card data with the rule book, but players can also apply the Augmented Reality (AR) app to get the battle result easily.

PHASE 4. Refresh Phase - Finalize the battling result and refresh for next round:
Finalize all the damages and results from the previous phase, and refresh the energy if needed.

name: Vanagloria: The Card Game
description:
Once Vanagloria was an enchanted world, inhabited by entities who lived in harmony and peace. But sadly, that is the past. Today Vanagloria has been corrupted and marred by dark sorcerers craving for world domination to the detriment of life itself. For years, these masters of black magic have been warring with one another to seize the “Alpha-E.S.” (Alpha Energy Source). The first to do it will be able to sweep away all of their opponents with a simple gesture…

Vanagloria: The Card Game is a Strategic board game.
Take the role of a sorcerer in search of the energy needed to gain total control over the world of Vanagloria.
During the game you will have to use cunning to face those who try to hinder your plans. You will use the available cards strategically to overwhelm your opponent in a fight to the last spell!

By playing the action cards you can increase in number, enhance the level of concentration, defend yourself, arm yourself and then attack.

The goal is to get your sorcerers to concentrate as much as possible to gather more energy than your opponents.

—description from the publisher

name: Squad Hammer: Man to Man
description:
Squad Hammer Man to Man is an expansion for the Squad Hammer rules focusing on adding a bit more character:

Namely to let you play games where the units are individual figures rather than squads of troops.

Within this supplement you will find:


Advice and suggestions for handling single-figure units in conventional games, including combat and spotting rule adjustments and new rules for Officers (inspired by Trench Hammer).



A collection of new options for games where every unit is a single figure, including new damage mechanics, tweaks to the combat systems and more cinematic action.



Notes on melee-only characters.



A new melee initiative system.



Rules for Goons: Perfect for Imperial storm troopers, nazi thugs and other cannon fodder.



A detailed injury table allowing characters to be stunned, knocked out or otherwise injured when they get shot.



Detailed infiltration rules for stealth scenarios, adapted from FiveCore.



A D20 table allowing you to add individual objectives to a character: Perfect for solo gamers and big club games alike.



A system to gain experience, upgrade your heroes... and have them die horribly in battle.


Many of these options are also applicable to games of Trench Hammer, October Hammer or Winter Hammer especially those of you who are interested in something a bit more pulpy and cinematic.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Northern Voyage: Strategic Warfare During the Viking Age – Startegic Warfare Druing the Viking Age for One Player
description:
You are a Jarl in charge of a Viking Voyage into the Northern Territories. Your goal? To seek fame and fortune in the eyes of your people and your Gods. To do this? Conquer all of the northern towns and fortresses.

Northern Voyage is the 2nd game in the “Point Ops” Wargame series. The first game in the series was Blood & Gold, a pirate-themed wargame. Northern Voyage takes the war to the ancient world of the Vikings.

Additionally, this game streamlines many of the rules, the flow of gameplay, and the components.
This is to make it so the game can easily fit onto a single printed page while also making it friendly to newer solo wargamers.
You also only need 1 six-sided die for these newer rules (rather than the previous 6+ dice), thus making the game easier to travel with.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Битката за Балканите: Ерата на Калоян
description:
Битката за Балканите. Ерата на Калоян is set around the year 1204. Every player controls one of five medieval Kingdoms of the period in the Balkans - Bulgaria, Nicaea, Epirus, The Latin Empire and Venice, in the struggle for sovereignty, territory and power. The Kingdoms have three types of armies – regular, elite and a king army (except Venice, since it was a republic), as well as fleets. Part of the armies are put on the board at the begining of the game, while the others can be recruited during the game. After an army is destroyed it is returned to the player and can be recruited again.
Victory is achieved after the accumulation of a certain number of points “Influence“, elimination of the other players or conquering enough provinces. You control armies in sea and land battles, gain gold and conquer territories. Every move should be planned well, but luck also plays a role – your enemy can hold cards that can turn the game. There are three types : “Strategy”, “Battle tactics” and Kingdom specific cards, which are different for each Kingdom.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Kanonen und Dublonen
description:
Gold in sight! Together with their pirate crew players set sails to the treasure island they discovered. But what is that?! Another pirate ship also set course towards that island. Into battle! Send the other pirates to the bottom of the ocean — hope that your cannons don't awake the Kraken — and secure the troves full of gold.

In Kanonen und Dublonen (Cannons & Doubloons) players each turn secretly choose one of their pirate cards simultaneously, to decide which of the three treasure islands they will visit. If they are the only one at the island, they may collect all doubloons they find there. If other players decided to visit the same island, each players must roll a die that determines if they stay in combat over the treasure, or if they retreat — only if a single player is left in combat, this player receives all doubloons. In the end, the richest pirate wins.

—description from publisher

name: Jackpot Payout
description:
“The race is on to drain the casino of its last penny. The casino’s slot machines are hot! But you aren’t the only one to realize this. Apply smart decision-making while getting a little help from Lady Luck to make the house go broke! Claim victory over the other gamblers (and the house) by walking away with the most coins!

Jackpot Payout combines the wild swings of fortune of slot machines with player-driven choices of deck-building games. Hit a jackpot by matching symbols on all three cards in play. Cards are worth their value in coins, but each card can only be scored once. The game ends with a final jackpot round where players can chain multiple jackpots together! Can you hit the jackpot and win the payout?”

In Jackpot Payout, each player receives the same starting hands of cards and a play mat. A display area of cards that can be obtained is placed within reach of all players. On a player's turn, the player will draw the top 3 cards from their hand of shuffled cards and place them on the 3 areas of their player mat. The mat represents 3 reels of a slot machine.

If a player gets 3 matching cards, they hit the jackpot! Those cards are placed in the player's score pile. Cards will have coins on them in addition to symbols and special text. As the cards with coins enter the score piles, these cards can no longer be played, but they count towards the player's total score.

Once a player receives 12 coins, the game end is triggered and a final round takes places where players have an opportunity to chain jackpots together!

If a player does not hit a jackpot, they may take a card from the display and that card as well as the rest of the cards in hand are discarded. If you need to draw or reveal a card and your draw deck is empty, you must score a single coin card from your discard pile.

Special cards within the display allow players to break and bend the rules - similar to action cards.

Jackpot Payout is a light and quick, family friendly deck-building card game.

—description from the designer

name: Multi Playing Cards
description:
Multi Playing Cards are 56 poker size cards with extra games and extra functionality. 20 different symbols on every card! You can play Domino, Chess, Checkers, Band It, Roulette and more. Ther are Dice and Play Money in it. Make Play Fields and more... Packed in the Multi Tuck Box with Dealer button, Trump, 4 Tokens, 10 x 10 Matrix and rulers.

Fields on the card:
01 - Playing Card Symbol - standing
02 - Domino 9
03 - Hi-Lo
04 - Letters
05 - Dice
06 - Power
07 - Fiches And Chips
08 - Color
09 - Roulette
10 - Quintet
11 - Turn
12 - Do, Dare Or The Truth
13 - Band It
14 - Start With
15 - Who Are You?
16 - Words & Points
17 - Chess
18 - Checkers
19 - Make Your Own Card Game
20 - Playing Card Symbol - up side down

name: Micro Sci-Fi Army Card: Star Pods
description:
A ziplocked expansion army set for Tabletop Games' 1977 release, Micro Sci-Fi.

—user summary

Tree-like creatures . . . [that] exist for the sole purpose of self reproduction, and this can only be achieved by their feeding on metal. Initially there are five Pod creatures which land on the planet. There are two stages in the growth cycle, each stage taking one complete time period.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Micro Sci-Fi: Xylon
description:
A ziplocked expansion army set for Tabletop Games' 1977 release, Micro Sci-Fi.

—user summary

This force comprises four command units, each of which controls nine robots, control being by audio/visual radar mounted on each robot, and monitored by its controlling vehicle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Micro Sci-Fi: Kripton
description:
A ziplocked expansion army set for Tabletop Games' 1977 release, Micro Sci-Fi.

This force consists of three large Land Crab vehicles, nine Assault Carriers, three small Scout aircraft, nine small Tristrike aircraft, and nine Assault Sections of troops armed with firearms.

–user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Pocket Investigations: Cluny
description:
Pocket Investigations is a series of "escape boxes", i.e. cooperative investigation board games that are based on escape games, with real items for clues, and playable at home.

In this scenario, you will try to unravel the mystery of the Lady and the Unicorn, using your five senses.

name: Affinity: Extension Sensuelle
description:
An expansion for Affinity, which adds a new emotion : sensuality !

90 new cards in a little box.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Das Gesellschafts-Spiel
description:
We are in the near future: there is a basic income for every citizen - unconditionally. This ensures the existence of each and every one of us and no one has to worry about how to finance their livelihood anymore. Money only plays a subordinate role. Citizens can now discover what competences they have and how they want to realise them. How does society benefit when everyone is free to decide whether to pursue a traditional profession or to become involved in society without having to take up gainful employment because their existence is unconditionally secured?
From the publisher.

A mission card based roll and move. Manage your hand and your occupation vs. free time for activities to fulfill goals. Action cards may change your status, your goals and may help or hinder you in your aim to change society to universal basic income.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Saviors of the Sea
description:
A card game of Somali pirates.

From the Indian Ocean and the Gulf of Aden into the Arabian Sea, small groups of Somali nationals are challenging international shipping traffic. While many call them pirates others see them as badaadinta badah: saviors of the sea. In either case, being financially viable is crucial to survival. In the Saviors of the Sea game you and others play as leaders of different Somali factions fighting to capture and ransom vessels that enter your valuable ocean territory.

SOS is a card-driven game where players use cards to aid their hijacking attempts or to impair other players in their attempts. Players use skiffs to attack vessels such as oil tankers, cargo ships, and yachts that fly the flags of other nations or unions. Every ship and nationality has its own value for ransom and help comes from many quarters including foreign intelligence groups. But be warned, foreign powers include things such as Special Forces units and naval operations.

—description from the designer;;

name: Isles of Terror: Kolonial Korps Faction Expansion
description:
Adds a fifth player (sixth if you have the Wokou).
Contains 7 faction strategy cards, 1 faction ship card, 2 event cards, 1 mission card, faction sheet, faction player board, linen bag, extra resource & success tokens, faction specific action tokens and wooden components for this faction.

Contains the specified amount of cards in both German and English.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Chroni: Rois et Reines de France
description:
Play to reconstruct the timeline of events and put history in order!

From the arrival in Gaul of Clodion the Long-haired (around 430) to the overthrow of Napoleon III (1871), find in this title a selection of 60 sovereigns who have marked the history of France.

Chroni - The Kings and Queens of France is a learning game with which we have fun gradually and durably memorizing the big dates. Ideal for the curious who wish to discover or rediscover History in all or simply or the amateurs who want to consolidate their knowledge.

Chroniis a card game where each card depicts a historical event, invention or discovery on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred, invention or discovery was made on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

name: The Silver River: Industrial Outposts
description:
This deck contains 54 all new Explore Cards for the 4X game The Silver River. Extend your experience with new missions across Industrial sectors of the Milky Way galaxy.

Just replace the Explore Deck that came in your Silver River base game with this deck and you’ll be set to experience all new adventures!

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Blood of Baal
description:
Book 3 of the Psychic Awakening Series

The dark new era of warfare heralded by the Psychic Awakening continues apace, with the action now taking us to the Baal System – home of the mighty Blood Angels Chapter. Hive Fleet Leviathan is on its way, but can the full might of the legendary Sons of Sanguinius and their successor Chapters halt the swarm? Part rules manual, part thrilling narrative, this is your guide to the greatest threat that the Blood Angels have faced since they stood beside their Primarch in defence of Holy Terra more than 10 millennia ago.

Through thrilling lore, you'll read how the Blood Angles prepared to defend Baal against the full might of a Tyranid hive fleet, and what happened once battle was finally joined. Meanwhile, a vast set of rules expansions enhance your Blood Angels, Flesh Tearers and Tyranids armies with name generators, updated datasheets and much more besides.

Inside this 80* page book, you'll find:


Riveting background that brings the terror of impending invasion by Hive Fleet Leviathan to thrilling life
Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles that took place when angel met extragalactic horror
Expanded army rules for the Blood Angels – including the Primaris version of Mephiston, Lord of Death – as well as their most storied successors, the Flesh Tearers
Expanded army rules for the Tyranids, including new Stratagems, name generation tables, and a system that lets you build your own Hive Fleet Adaptations!


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Basilisk's Lair (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
The agents are sent to a village in 1799 to find and defuse Basilisk, a monster that got there through a space-time rift from an alternative dimension.

Basilisk's Lair is a Czech fan extension for T.I.M.E Stories. To play it is necessary to own a basic game. It is issued in the form of “print and play”, so you have to print and cut it first.

The script is original, not an adaptation of a book, film, or comic. This is an amateur act, which is reflected primarily in the graphic aspect of the game, but it is comparable with similar acts published here on the site.

The scenario is rather relaxed, you will not have to solve challenging and lengthy puzzles, which does not mean that it is a linear adventure without thinking. At almost any point in time, you will have to make decisions, some of which can be fatal and have a major impact on your group's fate. In addition, there is not only one path leading to the goal, and not all paths lead to the goal.

The scenario will guide you through the preparation and subsequent participation in an expedition to find and kill Basilisk. It contains some non-standard elements (“minilocations”, special status tokens directly printed on the cards) that enrich the basic game principle.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ultra Quick Hockey
description:
The scope of Ultra Quick Hockey is much like the other games in the Ultra Quick lineup. With UQ Hockey, we aim to provide you with an extremely quick and accurate method of resolving the final score between two hockey teams. With UQ Hockey you can play out an entire season for a team or a league in rapid fashion. UQ Hockey makes a perfect stand-alone game for season replays. It also functions very well as a complimentary game by resolving the games that don’t particularly interest you in a detailed shot-by-shot game, while you use the detailed game to play out the games that do interest you.

Unlike most quick play games, which only provide a team score, UQ Hockey does offer an optional individual scoring module to allow you to track league leaders in goals and assists. UQ Hockey also features an individual goalie modification for even more realism.

With UQ Hockey, you'll be able to track not only Team wins and losses, but league leaders for Goals scored, assists and GAA.

—description from the publisher

name: Glimstone Grab
description:
A cooperative game for 1-4 players. Much Middling is an average place, except for the special gems (glimstones) in its forest. Children love to play with these but unfortunately, a group of trolls has settled into a glade there. They love the glimstones too and have been snatching the children for lunch. A wizard recruits Esmeralda, from the Hoard game, as he knows of her reputation stealing treasure from a dragon and hopes to put her skills to use to benefit the community.
The wizard and Esmeralda set off in opposite directions, collecting glimstones which can be used to ransom snatched children and buy time. When they meet again, if they have the right combination of glimstones, they can perform a spell to zap a troll. They must zap all the trolls to win, but if a player ends their turn and all children have been taken, the players lose.
Players use movement cards to move the characters between the gems; it is possible to plan sequences of movements to get the characters to align again. Before each player's turn, an event card reveals if a child has been snatched or other forest inhabitants, some friend and some foe to the players, have been active that turn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Ellen's Games: You Bet Game
description:
The You Bet game is a wildly funny game based on the You Bet Your Wife challenges seen on the Ellen DeGeneres Show and Game of Games. One player sits behind the game unit with their head under a water container. Yup…you guessed it! If the person in the hot seat can't meet the number of items their teammate predicted they'd guess, they'll eventually get the drop! The container tips and dumps water on that player's head. Includes 100 double-sided category cards featuring lots of fun categories. The team that doesn't get wet wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: No Freakin! Way
description: No Freakin Way! is a hilarious game where you discover just how well you know your friends and relatives. You'll be surprised at what they'll do for a buck! A player is presented with a crazy scenario, then the other players at the table can add to the scenario, making it even crazier. Then the original player must decide just how much-or how little-it would take to perform the challenge. All other players try to guess the amount the original player has chosen-using poker-like chips valued from one dollar all the way to "No Freakin Way!" Everyone reveals their best guess the same time. Those who guess correctly, get "gems". The player with the most "gems" at the end is the winner.

name: Great Battles of History for DBA 3
description:
12 Historical Battles for use with the DBA 3.0 Ancient and Medieval Miniatures rules.

Battles:

Gela 405 BC
The Hydaspes 315 BC
Bagradas 255 BC
Cannae 216 BC
The Revolt of Spartacus 71 BC
Carnuntum 170
Battle of Hormozdgan 224
Yarmuk 636
Brunanburh 937
Bouvines 1214
Verneuil 1424
Enguingatte 1479
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Craft Your Brew: The Brewing Game
description:
The stealthy and cunning beer-crafting card game!

Work in teams and keep your wits about you in this fast-paced card game based on all things beer! Outwit, deceive and fool your opponents using stealth and guile to signal to your teammate when you have four-of-a-kind, or hone your senses to block your opponents from doing the same and clinching a point!

—description from the publisher

name: Sword of Honor: Ronin
description:
Sword of Honor: Ronin is a solitaire combat pen and paper RPG with a unique character creation system centered around the Seven Virtues of Bushido; Honor, Courage, Justice, Honesty, Duty, Righteousness and Respect. You are a masterless Samurai, who must restore his lost virtues through trials and adventure to avenge his Lord’s death at the hands of the scheming and treacherous Kira. Your path will take you through unexplored lands and into the depths of the Underworld, where it is rumored Kira has conjured ancient scrolls to become a demonic monster who will destroy all that is good and honorable in men - the Seven Virtues of Bushido. You must search over land and underworlds to find and destroy Lord Kira’s abomination so your master’s soul can rest from eternal darkness -or die trying.

With pencil, paper, dice and your imagination you can create and play your own adventure to explore a mythical land, do righteous deeds, combat demons,marauding bandits and restore honor lost.

You are a Ronin

—description from the designer

name: Shut the Lines
description: Shut the Lines is a simple but very interesting dice game for 2 to 4 players. The game requires a big deal of mental arithmetic and the ability to think strategically. The goal of the game is to cover as many number rows on the game plan with the playing chips of your colour as possible. The players roll dice, calculate and try to cover the fields of the rows with their playing chips. You only get a point if you can cover a complete number row. The one who has the most points in the end wins.

name: Frumentaria
description:
Year 700 A.U.C. (53 b.C.). A roman army, strong under the lead of Caius Julius, is waging war over Gaul. His personal power is ever increasing, shaking the very foundation of the Republic, while Senators tremble in fear. This is the time in which great men can show their value and fools their weakness.

In a tight 1 vs 1, players will challenge each other, turn after turn, in wrestling control of the map and its resources. To win, a player needs either 5 aligned pieces at the end of any round or having acquired more fame at the end of the game.

The goals above are pursued using actions - represented on double faced cards - that require specific combinations of resources, therefore making placement on the map critical.
Actions with greater impact need more resources, leading players to increase the quantity they control. To this purpose, player can use centuriae, camps and forts, each with their own strength and weaknesses.

It’s important to foresee your opponent’s moves and plans while advancing yours, since available actions change each turn: when a player takes an action, the used one leaves place to the one on the rear of the card.
A main characteristic of Frumentaria is replayability, granted by the layout of the map, which is different in every game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Mint Julep: Win, Place, Show
description:
Win, Place, Show is a 4-card expansion to Mint Julep, giving each player the ability to place an extra bet. The Win Place or Show card is placed under any other bet card, and it’s betting on the placement of that horse. If the bet is correct, it pays out 3 points for a win, 2 points for a place (2nd), and 3 points for a show (3rd). It’s a very cool addition to the game taking it up just a notch of extra gameplay.


Released in the November 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Racing

name: Witching Weald
description:
Witching Weald is a short Programmed movement game for 1-10 players. The game was release as a free print and play for those who were isolated in the COVID-19 outbreak.

The Witching Weald lies deep and dark. Few are those who have ventured in to the heart of its thicket and returned. Even fewer, those who returned with their sanity intact. In the depth of the forest many peculiar ingredients can be found. Some are vital for a witches concoctions and thus their immortality. But not even witches dare walk into the forest in their flesh. Instead they summon their familiars to do their bidding. Witches can only control their familiars for a short period of time. If a witch loses control of her familiar she may lose important ingredients she sought to collect.
Therefore planning ahead is of the essence.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Movement Template, Programmed Movement, Set Collection

name: Shiloh: First day
description:
SHILOH: First day is a ASCARI Scenario depicting the attack led by Gen Johnston on April 6th 1862 at 11am in the left flank of the US Army.

The attack towards the Bell crossroads was successful and the Confederates continued to push back the US Army. Just the sudden death of the CS Commander stopped the advance.


Scenario rules,
a colorful A3 map
and nice counters wait for you


Remember that in order to play this Scenario you will need the ASCARI rules!

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Million Dollars But... The Game: Expansion Pack II
description:
Million Dollars, But... The Game Expansion Pack #2 comes with 100 new cards to either play standalone, or combine with your core game to expand the fun.

Million Dollars, But... The Game (based on Rooster Teeth's popular comedy series, Million Dollars, But.) is a card game that puts your morals and imagination to the test, posing the question, "What would you do for a million dollars?"

-Publisher Description

name: Battlegoats: Origami Goat Promo Card
description:
A promo card printed at the same time as Battlegoats: Reinforced, and originally given out at conventions.
Was also made available through the Promo Paradise 2019 Kickstarter.

A single promo card, compatible with both BattleGoats, and BattleGoats: Reinforced.

Card Text:
Origami Goat

+ 2 for each other card in the same row as Origami Goat.

+2 for each other card in the same column as Origami Goat.
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: The Toymaker
description:
Late last year a series of grisly murders in the town of Valley Falls captivated the world. A handful of victims were abducted at various points throughout the month, killed in gruesome ways, decorated to resemble popular children’s toys, and gift-wrapped for the police to find. Among those “toys” that were created and left for the authorities: a life-sized Jack in the Box that caused a spring-loaded victim to pop out of the top when the handle was cranked, a Nutcracker doll decorated with greasepaint and blood, a robot that was created from both human and mechanical parts, and a marionette whose movements could be controlled via a series of cables that were attached the victim’s limbs. The gift cards attached to each one were all signed by someone calling themselves “The Toymaker.” Police were closing in on the culprit when The Toymaker stopped killing, causing the trail to grow cold. They have continued to pursue leads throughout the year, but they haven’t had any real breakthroughs in a while. Earlier this week, a new “gift” arrived from the killer, and it is reasonable to assume that the murders will start anew. If the pattern holds, there is only a very finite amount of time to investigate before The Toymaker goes underground again. No doubt The Toymaker has more “toys” in mind to create so lives are at risk.

Difficulty Level: 7/10

name: Traitor
description:
Dead Men Tell No Tales...or Do They?

Pirates, plunder, and pleasure. That’s what passengers who sign up to “Voyage Aboard the Black Dagger” will experience as they set sail on a 4-day luxury pirate-themed cruise in the Atlantic. Those who book a spot aboard The Dagger will spend their time in full pirate regalia, enjoying the high seas as buccaneers of old did: imbibing on copious amounts of rum, feasting in the banquet hall, gambling, and lounging on the deck. As part of a new promotion, guests aboard the ship will also have the duration of the cruise to search for clues aboard The Black Dagger that will lead to Captain Armstead’s treasure. Whoever finds the treasure first wins $25,000. Given your recent case load with The Will Street Detective Agency, you are eager for a break and book passage aboard the ship, thinking it sounds like fun...and a way to possibly win a nice stack of cash. A group of history and English professors from Valley Falls University has the same idea and books spots on the cruise as a last hurrah before the fall term begins. The voyage is everything the brochures describe and more. Everyone is having the time of their lives when the unthinkable happens and one of the professors, Dr. Alexander Gorman, is found stabbed in the back in his cabin. Because the ship is hours from the nearest port and you have had some success with this type of case you offer to help with the investigation. The captain readily agrees. There is a killer aboard The Black Dagger, and it is up to you to uncover the motive behind Dr. Gorman’s murder and bring the killer to justice.

Difficulty Level: 7.5/10

name: Three Dragons
description:
Three Dragons is similar to ancient custodial capture board games such as Petteia, Tablut, Hnefatafl. However, it has two additional features as advanced variants of the base game:

Player pieces have strengths, so that a stronger piece can capture a weaker piece (in additional to traditional custodial capture), and
Three "dragon cave" spaces on the board allow players to obtain strong dragon pieces.


The base game is straight up custodial capture, with no strengths of pieces, and no dragons (but still the dragon cave spots in the center of the board to make things more interesting there).

—description from the designer

name: King of Movies: The Leonard Maltin Game
description:
To triumph at King of Movies, it doesn’t matter if you’ve seen every film ever made or if you’ve never seen a movie in your life. The fun is in the fibbing!

In this party game honoring the great American film critic and historian Leonard Maltin, players create their own film synopses based on real (but obscure) film titles while attempting to mirror the writing style of the titular reviewer.

Once written and submitted, all fake descriptions are read aloud by "The Maltin" - a role that passes each every turn. The REAL synopsis is also mixed in the bunch, and players must vote to identify which they believe to be Maltin's own handiwork.

Points are earned by identifying the real review, or by fooling others into thinking yours was written by Maltin. Whoever earns the most points by the end of the game is declared the KING OF MOVIES, and gets to don the included crown!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Satchel: A Journey Unknown
description:
Satchel: A Journey Unknown is a solo adventure game. You are an adventurer sent on a quest to find a lost artifact in order to save the world. Scattered throughout the land are magical altars which hold clues to the items location, but they are well guarded. Someone or something doesn't want you finding the source of all this madness. Find the artifact before time runs out, or all is lost.

Every turn you will be revealing a part of the map, which is different with each game. The game features multi-use cards, which you may trade for items and gold or imbue into weapons to fend off dangerous creatures. With the coins you earn, you can upgrade your abilities making your survival more likely. An AI system will be moving around and spawning new creatures, so choose your fights wisely.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Addition, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Tulip Holic
description:
Tulip Holic is a light party auction card game that can be enjoyed by anyone of all ages. To prepare the game shuffle the cards depending on the number of players and deal out 4 cards to each player. The rest of the cards is the draw pile.

In a turn a card from the draw pile is revealed and all players must play a card face down and reveal it simultaneously. The player who played the highest card wins the revealed card and puts it in front of them together with the bidding card. Then every player places the bidding card in front of them and draws back up to 4 cards.
Goal is to make a set of 6 same colored tulip cards in the value from 1 to 6.
After the deck is empty scoring happens. Whoever has the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Set Collection

name: Tucson-Opoly
description:
Buy Tucson properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Lord of the Fries: Ghicciaroni's Family Style Italian Buffet
description:
This is a stand-alone expansion for Lord of the Fries, set at Ghicciaroni's Italian restaurant. The deck contains all new art and ingredients, with a new menu for 2 to 6 players, and instructions for combining the deck with the core game to create a deck that plays with up to 8 players.

The menu's special rule is: Any order from the red zones (pizza and pasta) starts at minus 1 ingredient, which means you may immediately leave something out.

name: Ruba Memo
description: Players turn over two tiles in a grid, and if the pictures match, they claim the tiles. What’s different from previous Memo editions is that each tile has two pictures on it and a player can choose to match either of the pictures in order to claim the tile. Furthermore, a player can search for a match from among the tiles already captured; even tiles held by an opponent. Whoever holds the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Maggotkin of Nurgle Rotbringers
description:
The foot soldiers of Nurgle’s Maggotkin love nothing more than spreading filth and bountiful contagions, hoping to transform the Eightpoints into a sacred garden of beautiful putrescence.

These cards enable you to lead a band of plague-infested warriors across the Bloodwind Spoil!
