Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set gives you everything you need to add Rotbringers to your skirmish games. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of five fighter cards provide profiles for four types of Putrid Blightkings and Pusgoyle Blightlords.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese and Russian, as well as two divider cards to keep track of tokens that apply to fighters in game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Maggotkin of Nurgle Daemons
description:
Plague-ridden, diseased and festering, Daemons of Nurgle spread terrible miasmas and rotting, fuming death across the Eightpoints in the name of their benevolent god.

Summon a disgusting rabble of trundling Daemons of Nurgle to infest the wasteland. Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, these cards allow you to command this pestilent warband in your skirmish games. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of six fighter cards provide profiles for Nurglings, two types of Plaguebearers, Beasts of Nurgle and two types of Plague Drones.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese and Russian, as well as two divider cards to keep track of tokens that apply to fighters in game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Star Trek: Playing Card Game – The Original Series
description:
TRIBBLE RESISTANT CARDS

Captain's log, stardate 1313.5. Hop the nearest transporter and get ready to boldly explore new game frontiers. This card game combines specialized images and instructions to play Star Trek - The Playing Card Game, and doubles as a regular deck of cards - you get two games for the price of one. So, set your phasers to fun...warp speed to a great time. And remember - loser is a redshirt!

—description from the back of the box

name: Wild Assent: Exclusive Workers Promo Cards
description:
A promo pack of five exclusive workers for Wild Assent!

Includes:
Jungle Guide - Draw 2 random resources at the end of each encounter and discard 1.

Herald - Heal 1 seeker for 20 after each encounter.

Hunt Director - At the start of each encounter, all seekers have +3 health. Once lost, this health may not be healed.

Gryphon Whisperer - Threat 3 creatures sell for 2 additional gold at the Silvestrem.

Illusionist - At the start of each encounter, discard the first instinct card drawn. Do not draw a new card.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Dragondado
description:
With Dragondado children and adults have fun while working on their concentration, reflex-speed, emotional self control, fine motor skills and math abilities.

A compelling board game in which participants will have to compete against each other to complete 14 mathematical mental calculation tournaments with speed and dexterity in the shortest time possible!

After training in each of the 14 challenges, players can challenge each other in the Knights Arena to find out who the Dragondado Knight will be.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Fantasy, Math

name: Pizza Delivery
description:
In Pizza Delivery, you are a pizza delivery courier, and you must try to make the most profit out of one delivery day, both by delivering pizzas and by fulfilling your secret objectives. You can also use money to buy extra equipment if you think that will help you in the long run.

Whoever has the most money at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Turn Order: Time Track

name: KAOS
description:
KAOS is a battle game where two sides of twenty fighters will have to defeat each other in order for the wish of their God Etharyl to be fulfilled. In KAOS each player represents an Etharyl, who will declare a wish before battle.

The player (an Etharyl God), before combat, can make sacrifices in his own team to resurrect fighters or make them more powerful, managing his team in order to avoid running out fighters. Also, the player can erase skills from rival fighters by exhausting glint points, in a limited way. During combat between fighters, destiny will decide.

The game is finished when an Etharyl runs out of fighters. At this moment, it must accept the wish of the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Until the Frost Comes
description:
Until the Frost Comes is a solo roll-and-write game of mapping your new domain of the Autumn Court.

You are the latest ruler of the Fairie Autumn Court, trying to build up your reputation by enchanting humans foolish enough to venture into your lands; protecting your borders against the Summer and Winter Courts with brambles; and decorating the land with pumpkins, apples, and festively colored leaves to make it feel autumnal.

Of course, not everyone in the Autumn Court wants you to succeed... Puck, Tricksters, Redcaps, Changelings, and the Wild Hunt all work against you, trying to ruin your plans!

During each of the 13 turns, roll 5 six-sided dice, consult the chart for rolls of singles, doubles, or triples going through the dice from lowest to highest, then choose any hex you'd like, and using a pencil draw what the chart says in that hex. At the end of the game, tally each type of item you have drawn on the map to get your score.

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Mythology, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Yōkai: Tsurube Otoshi
description:
Tsurube Otoshi is a goodie with rules for a new level for Yōkai.

It comes as a bottle opener and a rules card.

The Tsurube Otoshi sits on four cards that players cannot interact with on their turn. Once their turn is over, they move the Tsurube Otoshi to a new location for the next player to deal with.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Pattern Building

name: Roll Low
description:
A dice game where players attempt to roll one of several combinations using 7 dice in as few attempts as possible. Scoring is determined by how many rolls a player took to obtain a specified combination.

Roll Low is similar to Yahtzee but has unlimited rolls and allows 1 reattempt with a two point penalty. Roll low has two different scoresheets with different prescribed combinations.

At the start of a players turn, a player rolls 7 dice and determines if a combo can be scored. If so, the player will write a 1 on the scoresheet for the available combination. If a combination can’t be scored, then the player will hold dice of their choosing and reroll the remainder noting the number of rolls that has passed until a combination can be scored.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Construction Sight
description:
Construction Sight is a roll & write game based on the logic puzzle Skyscrapers by Masanori Natsuhara. Draw each building in your new city center using the roll of 3 dice as its width, depth and height, in any order. Each of the park benches around the city challenges you with the goal of how many buildings you want to be visible, one behind the other, along a line of sight from that bench to the city.

—description from the designer

name: Taro Paradise
description:
Taro Paradise is a light strategy and hand management planting game. You will be a Taro farmer on Maddish Island. You can utilize all of the limited resource and multiple tools to make the combo to plant Taro. And you have to properly help each other and make use of special Paradise System to get more opportunities and harvest. Do not seek quick success and instant benefits, then you can score more!

How to play:
The player who recently ate or planted Taro will be the first one to draw cards. Each player randomly draw 1 Farmer Card from one of two decks (clockwise) ,until all players have 5 Cards.
When it's your turn, choose one of the two actions:Work Action/Lazy Action.
In the end of the action , draw 1 card from Farmer Deck. If the hand is less than 5, draw cards until it's 5. The player's hand has no limit.
Each player take turns doing Farmer Action until all Farmer Decks run out. After everyone's hand runs out, this game ends.
If all Farmer Deck runs out, the player who runs out of their hand will end the game first and wait for all players ending the game. Finally, start calculating scores.

Farmer Cards are classified into 3 types: Tools, Resource and Paradise.
Resource include Water and Fertilizer. When the number of the Water and the Fertilizer are the same on the Field(1:1), it's called "Pair". Then you can plant a taro on this Field. Planting is the main way to score in the game.

There are 2 more special mechanism in this game:
1. Helper System：
As a kind-hearted farmer, you need to help each other. If Field's Inside become "Pair" due to your Farmer Action ( Work or Lazy), you can place a "Helper Marker" on the "Helper Area" at the end of Action. When the Field was Planted,each Player's Helper Marker which placed on the Field will return to the Player Boardand immediately get the reward!
2. Paradise System：Taro Paradise is a mysterious area hidden in Taro Field. You can discard a taro to Paradise. When Taro is abandoned by Farmer, Taro Fairy will appear to take care of it. When the Field meets the conditions of Planting,Taro will Fall into Field and be Planted.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: TOBITO
description:
TOBITO is a pure abstract strategy game for multiple players. The goal is simple: Move your three pieces to the three spaces on the opposite side of the board before your opponents can do so. Players may jump over opposing pieces, which they then relocate. You will find it's not easy to progress at times because of your opponent's movement and re-location of your pieces.

Each player has three colored pieces with reversible faces to show their goal sign. Each player sets their three pieces, plain color up, on their three starting spaces. A turn is made by moving one of your pieces. Passing your turn isn't allowed.

You can move any one of your pieces to an unoccupied space in any of eight directions (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). You may move a piece by jumping over any number of adjacent pieces, whether your own or an opponent's, onto a vacant space. When jumped, your pieces stay where they are, but opposing pieces must be relocated to a vacant space.

Once a piece reaches the goal, you flip it over, and that piece is now immobile. You can't move it, and opposing players can't jump over it because it can't be relocated.

At the end of your turn, if you haven't won and all of your starting spaces are occupied with pieces — whether yours or others — you are out of the game. If more than one player remains in the game, remove all of your pieces from the board. Continue the game to determine the winner.

The first player to move their three pieces to the opposite side of the board or the last active player still in the game wins.

name: Battle for the South China Sea
description:
Battle for the South China Sea is a two-player board-wargame that investigates a potential Chinese drive to take control of Southeast and Eastern Asia through force in the near future. Each player must contend with the delicate political balance in the region with an uncertain and unstable political landscape. Once the conflict begins the Chinese player must balance focusing their forces against the scope of their ambitions, including potential control of the first and second “island chains”. The US player must manage a disparate, political unstable alliance where each country is concerned with their own security. Combat takes place on land and at sea, with the various airpower, missile, air denial, and sea denial systems of the regional powers influencing the outcome.

Planned for publication with Modern War #57.
However Modern War stopped being published in 2021 and last issue was #55

(description from the publisher and user's comments)
mechanics: Area Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tom's Party
description:
Today is Tom the mouse's birthday and his friends are preparing a surprise birthday party. Place the different elements and guest in the party before Tom appears. If he arrives early, quickly release a balloon so that he can linger to play with it, and you'll have time to finish the surprise.

We should take from the bag one wooden piece with some guest, elements or Tom, if we take some guest or element, then we can prepare the party, but if we take Tom, we should give him a balloon, then Tom will play with the ballon and we have the another chance to finish the party. We have 4 balloons, if we finish the party before we loose the 4 balloons, then we win, otherwise we lose, due Tom discover the surprise.

—desciption from the publisher

name: Burocracia
description:
A game in which you will have to go through countless administrative obstacles to do a simple procedure. Innovative game that puts the calmest and most patient people to the test.

Instructions:

Cards and money are dealt. Each player will receive $ 1000 for expenses, stamping, fines and finances and five "counter deck" cards that must be visible to their opponents and which are the counters to go to achieve the sealing of the process.
The undistributed banknotes will constitute the treasury and next to the leftover cards from the "counter deck" and the "disposition deck" cards, it must be located in some space near the board.
In turn, each player rolls the die. Take your token to the right place and you can choose whether or not to pick up a card from the "layout deck."
If a player decides not to roll the die to stay at the window and get a card from the "disposition deck", he must pay $ 50 to the treasury.
Once the move is made, the "disposition deck" card is placed at the end of the deck. Every three or four coats the cards in the "layout deck" should be shuffled.
The "disposition deck" cards contain rewards and penalties.
To complete the process and win the game, you must obtain the sealing of the five "counter deck" cards received without having debts with the treasury.
To determine the winner, all players must play the same number of turns.


—description from the publisher (translated)


Un juego en que tendrás que atravesar incontables obstáculos administrativos para hacer un simple trámite. Novedoso juego que pone a prueba a las personas más tranquilas y pacientes.

Instrucciones:

Se reparten las cartas y el dinero. Cada jugador recibirá $1000 para gastos, timbrado, multas y finanzas y cinco cartas de “mazo de ventanillas” que deben quedar a la vista de sus oponentes y que indican cuáles son las ventanillas a recorrer para lograr el sellado del trámite.
Los billetes no repartidos constituirán el fisco y junto a las cartas sobrantes del "mazo de ventanillas" y a las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones" se debe ubicar en algún espacio cercano al tablero.
A su turno, cada jugador arroja el dado. Lleva su ficha al lugar indicado y puede optar por levantar o no una tarjeta del "mazo de disposiciones".
Si un jugador decide no arrojar el dado para permanecer en la ventanilla y sacar tarjeta del "mazo de disposiciones" debe pagarle $50 a fisco.
Una vez hecha la jugada, la tarjeta de "mazo de disposiciones" se coloca al final del mazo. Cada tres o cuatro manos se debe mezclar las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones".
Las tarjetas del "mazo de disposiciones" contienen premios y castigos.
Para completar el trámite y ganar el juego hay que obtener el sellado de las cinco cartas de "mazo de ventanillas" recibidas sin tener deudas en el fisco.
Para determinar el ganador, todos los jugadores deben jugar la misma cantidad de turnos.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Pike & Shotte: Samurai Starter Army
description:
The Samurai are the almost mythical warrior caste of Japanese history.
Their most famous exploits occurred during the Sengoku period between 1467 and 1603.
With the Emperor and the Shogun unable to control the many daimyos, there was near constant fighting between the various factions. In these times the Samurai code (Bushido) became more defined and standards of fighting improved.
Even the introduction of the musket in 1543 was seen as an opportunity rather than a threat.

Ashigaru (literally “light foot”) were so named as they had lighter armour than the Samurai. They also formed the bulk of the armies of the day. Each Samurai was expected to provide two armed Ashigaru. Many of these would be armed with the yari (spear). These are not the pike blocks of contemporary Europe as the Ashigaru were trained to fight in a looser formation, travel quicker and their spear was for slicing and thrusting. Many a battle was won by the Ashigaru, especially if cavalry were foolish enough to attack them from the front.

The biggest change in the Sengoku period (1467-1603) would affect the role of missile troops in battle. At the start of the period, these were all armed with the yumi (bow) and fought in coordinated units to pepper the enemy with their arrows. This bow, like the equivalent English Longbow, took many years training to perfect but was deadly when used correctly. Due to the training needed there were never as many yumi armed troops as a daimyo may have wanted!

By the 16th and 17th centuries, warfare was changing and the Samurai were changing with it. They did not forget their horse-riding roots while this change happened. Even though the introduction of the long spear made cavalry charges more difficult to pull off they were still performed. A well-timed strike by a unit of Samurai horsemen could turn the tide of a battle. These cavalry attacks continued throughout the Sengoku period and many a daimyo lost his head to one.

—description from the publisher

name: Space Dogs
description:
Space Dogs need homes on earth. All players are owners of dog agencies. Your goal is to find homes for Space Dogs by fulfilling contract requirements.

Each turn a player draws cards from the Space pile and can do 3 actions like playing a card (dog,training or event), draw and/or transferring cards while trying to fulfill a Contract card. The game end triggers when a player gets 10 Points (total from the Contract cards) and at the end of that round the player with the most points wins the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Malacca 1511
description:
It is the year 1511 and the Portuguese Empire rules the seas. Far in the east, the port city of Malacca makes the mistake of backstabbing them, sparking a war at their doorstep. As Admiral of the Portuguese Empire, you arrive at Malacca to punish the Sultan's foolish betrayal by laying waste to his city. Meanwhile, as Laksamana of the Sultanate, you must repel the invaders and save your home from certain doom.

Malacca 1511 is a 1-2 player game of the Portuguese conquest of Malacca in 54 cards - with 2 Solo Modes: a Solo game as the Portuguese Empire, and a Solo Campaign as the Sultanate.

In a two-player game, each player leads one side, fighting over the city and against each other's armies in this unique Deck Builder vs Engine Builder card game. The cards are double-sided, with one side being the Empire Attackers besieging Malacca, while the flip side is the Sultanate's Defenders trying to hold them at bay. The game also uses a creative area control mechanic that simulates the Frontline of battle. This makes vying for the right cards and spaces on the battlefield key to winning the war.

The Portuguese Empire plays as a Deck Builder, building up their strength to unleash increasingly deadly attacks against the city. The Sultanate plays as a Set Collection, Tableau + Engine Builder, adding Fighters to their city to bolster up defenses and making it easier to defeat enemies on future turns.

Awards:

From the 2020 54-Card Game Design Contest.
-Best War Themed Game: 1st Place!
-Best Solo Game: 2nd Place!
-Best Euro Game: 2nd Place!
-Best Overall Game: 3rd Place!
-Jury Prize: 3rd Place!
-Best 2 Player Game: 3rd place!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Πολυσκορ (MULTISCORE)
description:
Πολυσκορ ("Multiscore") is a rare board game from the late 80's, made in Greece by MIKA toy company.
An exceptional combination and tactical game. By putting their cards on the board players gain points.With a beautifully illustrated board where we meet the famous cartoon heroes and villains from Ducktales series. It can be played from 2 to 4 players.

—user summay

name: RuneSword: Cal – Warrior with Sword and Shield
description:
A thematic series in the Lost Worlds series (these books are even compatible with the others). Players each take a character represented with a game book and a stat sheet. By giving the book to the opposite player, the pages give a first person view to the combatants. As various moves direct the players to turn to this page or that, combat damage, restrictions, and other special events are relayed to the players via the pages of the book.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.

name: RuneSword: Hathor – Troll with Axe
description:
A thematic series in the Lost Worlds series (these books are even compatible with the others). Players each take a character represented with a game book and a stat sheet. By giving the book to the opposite player, the pages give a first person view to the combatants. As various moves direct the players to turn to this page or that, combat damage, restrictions, and other special events are relayed to the players via the pages of the book.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.

name: Lost Worlds: "Eilee" the Sprite
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside cover of book and User Summary:

This book represents "Eilee the Sprite" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable with all other LOST WORLDS books.Each book is unique and has its own special advantages and weaknesses. You must have two books to play a game.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside front page with User Summary:

This book represents "Felina the Tiger Lady" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

Character creation by James L. Walker

From back of the book:

Zocchi the dicemaker is famous for the high-quality little gambling stones he makes for players worldwide. But few people realize he is also a powerful magician, one of the oldest in the world. Among the inner circles of mages, he is known as "The Ancient One." If you are foolish enough to challenge him, you will discover that not only can he cast powerful spells, he can use one of his magic dice bags as amace or a shield. And you do NOT want to see what can come o ut of his magical top hat .."
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: "Oowell" the Ghoul
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

description:

description:

name: Knights Club: The Alliance of Dragons
description:
Previously, you met King Orc, whose daughter is missing. On the advice of his most loyal friend, the Prince of Nekashu, the King has entrusted you with a mission of the utmost importance: to bring his child back safe and sound by pulling her out of the clutches of the terrible mountain scoundrels....

Chevaliers 4 is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles.

—description from the publisher

name: Ceramus
description:
In Ceramus you are an important artist who will have to compete with others to become the best of all! Create amazing murals with different styles from different moments in the history of tiles. From Medieval to Islamic, from Art Nouveau to Portuguese.
Here, you will have to manage your tiles, use creativity and strategy to build your mural with the best combinations.
Ceramus is an abstract game inspired by tile art and features a mix of strategy and area domination and resource management.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Fracto
description:
In the jungle, all the animals are gathering. They demand that all resources be divided rightfully among them. The stronger ones are taking more than the weak. That’s wrong! But, who will ensure that peace prevails? The winner of this battle of wits will be the King of the Jungle!

Fracto is a 3-in-1 card game to learn operations with fractions. It has a set of 80 playing cards. There are 3 kinds of fraction cards - number cards, image cards and word cards.When the sum of two fraction cards is equal to 1, it is called a whole pair. For example: ⅓ + ⅔ = 1 : so, the fractions ⅓ , ⅔ together forms a whole pair. where as ⅚ + 2/6 = 7/6, so the fraction ⅚ + 2/6 does not form a whole pair. Remember, here you can make whole pairs using only two fraction cards. The three different gameplay of fracto are: Whole-in-1, Deck of Fortune and Memory Hero.
Let’s look at the first gameplay: To play Whole-in-1, shuffle the cards and distribute 8 cards to each player. These are the hand cards. The main deck is placed face down in the centre of the table. Check your hand cards if you can make any whole pairs. if you can, then place the pairs face down on the table in front of you.At any given point in the game, you must have even number of hand cards. Pick the top card from the main deck. place it face up on the table. This is the discard pile. The player on the left of the dealer starts the game and it continues clockwise. On your turn, you can either pick up the top card from the discard pile or the top card from the main deck. Check if you can make a whole pair using the new card. if yes, then place the whole pair, face down, in front of you and discard any card from your hand cards into the discard pile. if you cannot make a pair, then put any of your hand cards into the discard pile. The turn moves to the next player. You must call out “fracto” whenever you have only 2 hand cards. This is applicable even at the start of the game. if you do not call out “fracto” and you are caught by another player, you must draw four cards from the main deck. You finish when you have made whole pairs with all your hand cards. There will be one card remaining, which will be discarded into the discard pile. When you have made all the whole pairs, you must show the whole pairs to the other players. If you have made a wrong whole pair, you need to draw four cards from the main deck. you must also pick up the incorrect pairs and the game continues.

Let’s look at the second gameplay: To play Deck of Fortune, shuffle the cards and distribute equally until all cards are over, amongst all players. All the cards are dealt face down. you are not allowed to see your cards. The player to the left of the dealer starts the game. The game continues clockwise. On your turn, you pick up the top card from your player deck and place it face up on the table. This is the discard pile. You check whether the card placed forms a whole pair with the card below it. if it does, you pick up the entire discard pile and place it below your player deck. if it does not, the game continues and the next player places their card. This continues until a player completely finishes their player deck.

Let’s look at the third gameplay: To play Memory Hero, remove the red cards from the deck. Make a deck of blue and green cards. shuffle the two decks separately. Distribute 7 blue cards to each player. These are the hand cards. you can see your hand cards. Take 16 green cards and arrange them, face down, in a grid of 4 by 4.These are the table cards. The remaining green cards are kept separately as the main deck. The player to the left of the dealer starts the game and the game continues clockwise. On your turn, you will open any one table card, so that everyone can see it. If the table card forms a whole pair with any one of your hand cards then pick up that card, show the pair to everyone and set the pair aside. If you cannot form a whole pair, you keep the card back facing down. the game continues. Once a table card is used you must replace it with another card from the main deck, facing down. You can only combine one hand card with one table card. You can open a table card only on your turn. The game ends when a player completes all their hand cards.

The perfect educational family entertainer with three engaging games packed in a single set! Fracto provides your kids with a blend of academics, life skills and moral values while they have loads of fun. Your kids will enjoy this fantastic 3-in-1 learning experience with their family and friends. Sit back and see them become conceptual masterminds right before your eyes!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Speed Matching, Take That

name: ボトルビーチ (Bottle Beach)
description:
Bottle Beach is a game where you have to find figurines in a bottle full of pearls representing water.
Each turns, players take a tile disposed facedown on a table and have one minute to find them in a glass bottle without opening it.
There is a number on each time and after each players have played 3 or 4 turn, the player with the more point wins the game.

name: 18WE: Western Europe
description:
18WE: Western Europe is an 18xx game based on Mike Hutton’s popular 1862: Railway Mania in the Eastern Counties system, with a larger board, more offboard areas, and a strong operational spin. It features a random setup of twenty one companies that have four different kinds of licenses, and appear in different orders through the game. Additionally, it has both major company and minor company scenarios, as well as differing starting cash values that create major differences in play styles.

Major and minor companies get pooled board actions to determine tile and station placements and upgrades. All track tiles are unlimited. Major companies may place up to twelve stations which can also be acquired from bankrupt companies via auction.

In the historical game, French major companies receive extra track actions, Germanic major companies (based in Germany, the Netherlands, and Belgium) receive industry markers that increase the value of one Germanic city, and Southeastern major companies (based in Italy, Austria Hungary, and Switzerland) receive extra warranties that allow their trains extra staying power. These simple differences in setup present the players with major strategic decisions in what railroads to found, as well as how their companies will best be developed and operated.

Mergers, refinancing, bankruptcy, chartered and non-chartered corporations all function in exactly the same ways as 18EA/62. Finally, 18WE will support solo play.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Print & Play, Trains

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Tyranids
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ramparts (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
24 tiles with new city and road segments enrich the game.

No additional rules
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Ecliptic
description:
1781: the first planet to be discovered by telescope, and the beginning of an age full of astronomical discoveries. Chart annual meteor showers, catalogue comets and search for planets in your attempt to become the illustrious Astronomer Royal.

Ecliptic is a strategic simultaneous-action game for 2-4 players. Set your star wheels to observe the night sky or choose to spend your time researching and corresponding. Climb the social ranks and establish your scientific legacy to become the Astronomer Royal.

Inside the Box is publishing this game in partnership with the Royal Observatory, Greenwich - the home of time.

Players are attempting to collect and publish sets of papers on various celestial objects, first by selecting the best time of year to make their observations, (and hoping for good weather), as well as researching different technologies to be the first to publish research on planets, or publish the most impressive catalogues of nebulae.

Each season has a different distribution of weather results, determined by a roll of 4 unique weather dice each turn, and players that select the same season will have to share the observations made - making your decisions as much about what you expect others to research as what openings the heavens give you in the first place.

Will you be a commander of comets or a master of meteors?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Claim Action
publishers: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

name: Zombies!!!: Battle Royale Promo Card
description:
All players roll a die. The losers must spend life or bullet tokens to meet or beat the winner's die roll.

Available at Essen 2012 and 2013.

name: Zombies!!!: Zombies!!! Yo! Promo Card
description: When you play this card, all players must discard all of the bullet tokens they have in play.

name: Zombies!!!: WTH...10 Years? Promo Card
description: Play this card from your hand to move your pawn and another pawn 10 spaces each. Players must fight any zombies encountered using normal combat rules.

name: The Medieval Expansion (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The Medieval Expansion collects together four fan-made expansions that adds excitement to a city. Each of these expansions may be added to the game of Carcassonne separately, or they may be added together. They are all developed by Jonathan Warren and consist of:


Jousting Tournament, which creates an additional scoring area in a city
The Orders of Chivalry, which allows a knight to be added to a city unconventionally
In the Stocks, which allows a knight to be removed from a city temporarily
The Gallows, which removes a knight from the city permanently
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Granda Land
description: You have to go around the city and the villages of the province buying property and managing your assets, competing hard with your opponents to become the richest in the BIG PROVINCE!A monopoly-like game set in the "Provincia di Cuneo" Piedmont, Italy
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Track Movement, Trading

name: 1905: Days of Decision – The War That Never Happened
description:
1905: Days of Decision is the third game in The Scandinavian Wars Trilogy* from Pantero Games. The game is a strategic level analysis of potential war that could have happened when the union between Norway and Sweden was dissolved in 1905. Units are battalions and regiments, with a few squadrons of cavalry and dragoons thrown in. The game will use the same basic set of rules as the other games* in the series and also has a few separate rules to account for the time period and way of war in the early 1900's. The map depicts the border area in southern Norway and Sweden, from Trondheim to Gothenburg. The game also includes a set of naval rules and units, to account for the fact that both navies were mobilised and had been modernised heavily before 1905.

As the Swedish player your goal is to keep Norway in the unions by capturing Christiania, take control of the border fortresses and force the Norwegian parliament to resign or accept a continued and renewed union. As the Norwegian player, your goal is hold the Swedes back long enough, and cause enough casualties to make King Oscar II order the Swedish forces to stand down and enter negotiations.

-description from designer
categories: Civil War, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Movie Plotz
description:
This is a ONE CARD version of Movie Plotz, conveniently printed on plastic so that you can put it in your wallet! It's the size of a credit card and offers the Movie Plotz experience in an even smaller footprint.

—description from the publisher


Movie Plotz is a wild game that allows your group to create hilarious fake movie storylines, then pitch them out loud for maximum laughs. Movie Plotz was designed as a very effective team building event that has evolved into a crazy party game where everyone contributes to the fun.

Players begin with a simple plot (a simple sentence) then choose a challenge/modifier from a list (instead of a card) to modify the movie concept. With each change, players get to redo the pitch and make it even more exciting. In the end, the final plot will be a guaranteed hit!

Depending on the rules variation that you choose to play, the player with the most points will win.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Clan War: Unicorn Army Expansion
description:
Clan War: Unicorn Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Unicorn Clan army in Clan War

history,
units,
organization, and
tactics
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Tackle
description:
The player throws the dice to kick off and one die shows how many squares the ball must be moved to the side and the other shows how far forward the player should move.

The aim, as in real life rugby, is to reach the try line.

It is not just a game of chance but a little bit of skill in it as well, for example when landing on a ruck square you must decide which side of the pitch to move to next.

"You just play up the field until you go over the try line. Everything you can do in rugby you can do in this game.

—description (extract) from the Shropshire Star

name: ANiMOZ: Fight for Survival
description:
Throughout the game Rangers will build two areas: an Ecosystem consisting only of species in their BiOME, and a Sanctuary made up of any species in their hand. At the end of the game, points are awarded for different aspects of the Ecosystem and Sanctuary, and the winner is the Ranger with the most points.

If using 1 Starter Pack between Rangers, each Ranger takes their 9 BiOME cards and the rest of the cards are shuffled. Deal the remaining cards evenly between the Rangers, up to a maximum of 9 each. Leave the rest aside. If each Ranger has their own pack of cards, they may select 9 BiOME and 9 non-BiOME cards for their hand (rather than randomly dealing). Each Ranger now places down an Eden card (the first card in your ecosystem) and 3 Sanctuary cards.

DURING THE GAME

The Ranger whose turn it is is called the Active Ranger and has 3 choices: Endangerment, Sanctuary or Clash.

In Endangerment, ALL Rangers place a species into their Ecosystem (called an Eco card). The Active Ranger then rolls the die to see which danger (e.g. Persecution) must be overcome. Rangers use their remaining Holding cards (i.e. those not already in Ecosystem/Sanctuary/Life Cycle) to overcome the danger. If a Ranger can’t overcome the danger, they lose the Eco card they just played, plus 1 of their Sanctuary cards.

In Sanctuary, the Active Ranger only places a card into their Sanctuary. No more than 4 species are allowed in the Sanctuary at any one time.

In Clash, the Active Ranger nominates another Ranger, and both choose a species from their Holding cards. Both cards are placed face-down on the table, and revealed at the same time. Follow the Clash matrix to find the winner of the meeting between the two species. Both cards are placed into each Ranger’s respective Life cycle (the discard pile) and rewards/punishments enacted (see full Gameplay guide for Clash matrix and outcomes).

END OF THE GAME

When a Ranger runs out of Holding cards or Sanctuary cards, the game enters Brumation. Each Ranger still in play then has 2 turns as Active Ranger each, before the game is finished. At this point, each Ranger counts their score from their Ecosystem and Sanctuary (see Gameplay guide for scoring system), and the winner is announced.

The starter pack features 54 amazing species, including 9 cards from the Forest, Desert, River and Scrub BiOMEs, 7 cards from Sky, 6 cards from Coast, and 5 cards from Mountain!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental

name: Złota Kaczka
description:
Once upon a time, in the dungeons of the Ostrogski Castle, there lived a princess turned into a golden duck. It was said that whoever found her could make them rich. A poor shoemaker named Lutek decided to try. He was lucky and he found a golden duck who had promised him wealth. The boy received a purse of treasures, but also one condition: he had to spend it in one day without sharing it with anyone. If he succeeds, he will become a great rich man.

How to play:

Reveal round card - check the rules,
Discard cards according to the rules for the round,
Whoever finishes the round first will receive the most points.


Each round presents the participants of the game with specific rules for discarding a card. The players also try to play cards to get rid of them as quickly as possible without making a mistake.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dawno, dawno temu w lochach Zamku Ostrogskich żyła królewna zaklęta w złotą kaczkę. Mówiono, że tego, kto zdoła ją odnaleźć, może uczynić bogatym. Biedny szewczyk imieniem Lutek postanowił spróbować. Szczęście mu dopisało i odnalazł złotą kaczkę, która obiecała mu bogactwa. Chłopiec otrzymał sakiewkę skarbów, ale też jeden warunek: musiał wydać je w ciągu jednego dnia, z nikim się nie dzieląc. Jeśli mu się uda zostanie wielkim bogaczem.

Jak grać:

Odkryjcie kartę rudny – sprawdźcie zasady,
Odrzucajcie karty zgodnie z zasadami rundy,
Kto pierwszy ukończy rundę otrzyma najwięcej punktów.


Każda runda przedstawia uczestnikom rozgrywki określone zasady odrzucania karta. Gracze jednocześnie starają się zagrywać karty, tak aby pozbyć się ich jak najszybciej, nie popełniając przy tym błędu.

—description from the publisher

name: Phoenix Command: Wild West Weapon Data Supplement
description:
While primarily thought of as a combat system for Leading Edge's Rhand Morningstar Missions RPG, the original Phoenix Command rules were also intended to be used for man-to-man skirmish wargaming, either on the tabletop or a hex map.


Now the Phoenix Command Small Arms Combat System lets you ride with the soldiers and gunslingers of the American Frontier. This supplement features 48 of the most popular and memorable weapons of the West, as well as special rules for the classic shootouts of legend. Included are:- Pistols, from the Derringer to the Colt Peacemaker
- Muskets, from the Charleville to the Springfield 1863
- Breechloading Rifles, from the Sharps Carbine to the Springfield 1873
- Lever Action Rifles, from the Henry Repeater to the Winchester 1873
- Other Weapons, including the Sawed-Off Shotgun and the Gatling Gun

Also included are sections on Quick Drawing, Fanning Revolvers, Speed Loading, and rules for Firing From (and Firing At) Horses, as well as an overview of weapons development through the nineteenth century.

Fully illustrated, this supplement allows Phoenix Command players to include the Napoleonic Era, the Civil War, and the days of the American Frontier in their gaming.

-from the back cover
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: The Emperor Strikes Back
description:
The Emperor Strikes Back is a simple wargame simulation of the Battle of Waterloo in 1815 that finally ended Napoleon's dream of French dominance.

One player controls the French Grand Armee and the other player controls Wellingtons British army, reinforced by the Prussians. It is intended as the ideal introductory game for people new to strategy games with an interest in the era.

Several optional rules are included for more experienced young gamers such as those who have played our other games.

—description from the publisher

name: Hindsight 2020
description:
Hindsight 2020 is the game of the year. Check the news, enact policies, protect your citizens, and sabotage rivals to be the last nation standing!

In Hindsight 2020, 2-6 players will start with a population of 10 million (10 tokens), and take turns flipping cards from the deck and playing cards from their hand that cause themselves and/or opponents to gain or lose population, with the goal of eliminating all others or having the most population by the end of the deck.

While Event cards cause players to gain or lose population, Policy cards contain stats that modify the amount each player is affected. Bonus cards allow players to perform special actions, and to combo actions. The Hindsight card retroactively protects a player from any event!

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Math, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Ο Κρυμμένος Θησαυρός Των Πειρατών
description:
Ο Κρυμμένος Θησαυρός των Πειρατών is an extremely rare and beautiful Disney-themed Greek board game from the late 50's or early 60's. The name translates to "Hidden treasure of the pirates". The game can be played from 2-4 players and it was released from ΕΡ.ΚΑ.Π. toy company.
The board has a pyramid shape and each player, put his pin (pawn)at the starting point hole in his side. Every player in his turn roll the dice (roulette) and moves. The winner is the player who arrives first at the top of the mountain with the exact number of steps.

—user summary

name: Circles in the Forest (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
This expansion brings different features to the forest tiles.
You can can can use them separately or with the origin expansions. The rules of the origin expansion applies so no additional rules are required:

3 tiles with (tree shaped) crop circles,
3 vineyard tiles,
3 hill tiles,
3 bazaar tiles,
3 tiles with flying machine symbol,
3 tiles with mage symbol,
2 tiles with a robber symbol,
4 tiles with wind roses.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Territory Building

name: Taxi! Board Game: Brighton and Hove Albion FC
description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. Sound Off topics allow for players to gain more money by mouthing off on a subject to match key words for a minute. But watch out for the diversion! You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

description: A fun and educational game for all the family, themed around the shift of a taxi driver. Players (drivers) race from destination to destination picking up passengers and fares. Trivia question stops (based on the theme of each version of the game) allow for gaining £2 or £4 tips. You don't want to get stuck there and lose out on fares! You can play for as long and short as you like. The player with most money at the end wins.

name: Spell Card Strike
description:
Spell Card Strike (スペルカードストライク) is a doujin card game of Touhou Project designed by doujin group AQUA STYLE.

Spell Card Strike is a one-on-one battle-type card game that uses the power of the "Spell Card" that appears in the Touhou Project.

Call the girl who owns the spell card as a "striker" on the 5x4 "stage", unfold the barrage pretend. The battle on the board with up to 12 strikers, including both enemies and allies, gives you a feeling of play like a strategy simulation game.

name: S'Crew UP: Bots & Nuts
description:
S’Crew Up: Bots & Nuts is a strategic two-player worker placement and a take-that game where it is all about mechanical efficiency and smashed robots.

After an update in the factory’s systems, robots teamed up others from the same manufacturer to improve productivity and get everything fixed. But a bug in the patch caused a frantic side effect: in the pursuit of being harder, better, faster, and stronger, robots are now smashing smaller ones and even creating new problems.

With a length of approximately 30 minutes, the game is played in alternate turns. Players control 4 different robots to execute actions and collect resources, fixing problems, or robots that were smashed by the opponent. The first crew to clear their workshop, fixing all problems, and lining up all its robots in the Production Line of the factory wins the game.

Turns are simple and divided into three phases: In the first, robots in the workshop charge up; in the second, a single robot is called up to activate its quadrant in the Production Line, generating resources to fix problems and other robots. In the last phase, the available robots can be lined up in quadrants of the Production Line for later activation.

Although robots can block quadrants from the Production Line by their presence there, bigger robots can smash them out, sending their pieces to their workshops to be fixed.

As problems are fixed and players get closer to winning, combos are forged, and in a blink of an eye, your opponent can take you from certain victory to an “hasta la vista” defeat.

How to end the game? The first player to finish his turn with his office empty, solving all problems and allocating all robots on the production line, wins the game.

-description from designer

name: Save the Queen!
description:
"Our new Queen is finding us a new home after her statement with her rival. As a member of her royal guard, we must protect her. The problem is she is so fast and always finds her way into trouble!"

Save the Queen!

In Save the Queen! you are a royal guard sent to protect the Queen Bee as you search for a new home. Defeat other insects as you compete for territories, but bee careful; you only have so much nectar and so much time to get to a new home before the colony dies.

Combat is based on hopping over opponents, like solitaire or checkers, with the addition of special abilities. Navigate through cards valued between 1 and 3 territories, with increased difficulty for each value.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rettet Rapunzel
description:
How can we free Rapunzel from her dark tower? No, not by climbing up her braids of hair! We simply deconstruct the tower, piece by piece. But defying all logic, we don't start at the top of the tower, but at the bottom! Using a wooden disc, we attempt to perfect our aim to knock out the tower piece at the base — but without the tower collapsing!

It's all because of the law of gravity. Of course, not every go is successful — and that's half the fun. After all, the other players also want their turn.

Who will bring Rapunzel safely down to terra firma in Rettet Rapunzel?

—description from the publisher

name: Grimdark Future: Firefight Starter Set – Assault on Outpost Lixus
description:
Grimdark Future: Firefight is a miniature wargame set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures.
The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging sci-fi battles for new and experienced players alike.

This starter set gives you everything you need to start playing exciting battles right away, without having to worry about painting miniatures or putting together your own army lists.
With game rules that fit on a single page, you'll be able to learn them quickly and start playing in no time!

The Assault on Outpost Lixus Starter Set contains all of the following:

Core Game Rules
Unit Stat Cards (10 Cards)
Battle Sisters Army (8 Miniatures)
Heroes: High Sister
Troops: Battle Sisters, Fanatic Sisters
Upgrades: Heavy Flamethrower, Fusion Rifle

Alien Hives Army (8 Miniatures)
Heroes: Snatcher Veteran
Troops: Assault Grunts, Shooter Grunts, Soul-Snatcher, Hive Warrior

Terrain Pack (11 Terrain Pieces)
Small: Fields, Crates & Barrels, Barricades
Large: Forests, Ruins

Play Tokens (106 Tokens)
Objectives, Activations, Wounds, Pinning
Magic, Suppression, Fatigue, Danger



—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Chirpee
description:
Chirpee is a matching card game for kids of all ages. It has super simple rules, perky illustrations, and a short game play time. 54 full color cards for 2 to 8 players ages 8 and up. It takes between 10 to twenty minutes to play.
On a players turn they will try to match something about the active card and a card in their hand. There are a variety of things that can be matched, the bird itself can be matched as well as the presence of a sword, shield, flag, head gear, and bow. Once a match can be made the player places their match on top of the active card creating a new active card. The winner is the player that empties their hand first.

—description from the publisher

name: Catalyst: Solo mode
description:
The official solo mode of Catalyst - originally released as a promotional set of rules in IoGioco game magazine.

GOAL OF THE GAME
Confront your skills against a fearsome Artificial Intelligence (AI).

PREPARATION

Choose the difficulty level: easy (+10 PV), standard (+20 PV), advanced (+30 PV).
Follow the instructions for preparing a 2-player game. You are the first player.
Return all building cards to the box with the exception of a building costing 1, one that costs 2, one that costs 3 and one that costs 4. They must all be of a different color and randomly selected (e.g.: play with the blue “1” building, the “2” red building, the “3” yellow building and the “4” green building).


PLAYING THE GAME
Play multiple turns in a row until the game ends.
During each of your turns you must perform one of the three actions of the game, with the following additions to the normal rules:

Collect Contributions: you get coins as usual, and the AI gets a military power token.
Recruit a Catalyst: You recruit a Catalyst as usual, then take the first card to the left of the one you recruited and place it, without looking at it, in the deck of AI's scoring pile. If you recruit the first Catalyst to the right of the deck (the one on the space marked with “+1”), then place the top card of the draw pile, without looking at it, in the scoring pile of the AI.
Activate a Catalyst: activate a Catalyst as usual, then place the card on top of the drawing deck, without looking at it, in the AI’s scoring pile.


Note: When you get coins or actions to recruit a Catalyst through a Catalyst or a building’s effects, and when you spend Chain activation tokens to activate Catalysts, the additions to the normal rules (see above) do not apply: This means that while you perform the effect of an activated Catalyst or building, the AI does not get any military power tokens nor you must put cards in its scoring pile.

THE END OF YOUR TURN
As in the standard rules, after you have chosen and performed one action (and possibly the AI has gained a card in its scoring pile or a military power token), your turn is over. If one or more spaces of the board are empty, slide the other cards to the right until there are no gaps, then draw new cards from the deck to fill the board back up to 5 cards.

THE END OF THE GAME
When the last card of the reserve deck is discarded or put on the board, the game ends immediately.
Count your VPs as usual, including the goal card’s points. The AI instead obtains the VPs written on the cards in its scoring pile, the VPs provided by each pair of its military power tokens (and for the majority), and additional VPs depending on the difficulty level chosen (see Preparation). If you scored at least 1 VP more than the AI, you won – otherwise, try harder!

—description from the publisher

name: Treasure Tumble
description:
You are an archaeologist who has finally uncovered a long rumored ancient treasure chamber. Glorious riches await you, but not without their challenges. Your excavations have unearthed ancient mechanisms that redirect treasure falling from great heights, how much can you now collect in your treasure buckets?

SETUP
Take your sushi roll case and lay it out on a flat surface. This will be the floor of your treasure chamber. Long press 2 Blinks until they flash white, then set them standing up on the sushi roll case. These are your treasure buckets. Take another Blink and set it between the two buckets. This trio of Blinks is the foundation of your treasure chamber.

Finally, take at least 1 Blink and triple click it. It should now be green with a swirling face. This Blink is your treasure spawner. It will drop one treasure piece whenever it is placed on top of the treasure chamber tower.

GAMEPLAY
The goal of this game is to collect as much treasure in your bucket as possible by using the mechanisms built into the treasure chamber walls.

The game is played in two stages. First, both players work together to assemble the treasure chamber. Take turns adding one Blink at a time to the tower and watching the mechanisms self-assign.

WIN CONDITION
When the bucket is full it will turn purple - the first player to fill their bucket with treasure is the winner!

However, if one of the players causes the tower to collapse, they must empty all the treasure from their bucket. Double-click a bucket to empty it. Then the first stage of the game is repeated and the tower is reassembled before treasure is allowed to tumble again.

name: Confrontation
description:
Confrontation is played with the 4-10 from two standard decks of cards. 13 cards are dealt to each player and the remaining 4 are discarded unseen. The players sit with partners across from each other.

On a turn a player plays a card to their team's area, either creating a new set or adding to an existing set. Sets can either be cards of the same number of cards of the same suit. If a set is ambiguous (e.g. any single card) it does not have to be declared. Once a set is unambiguous it is moved to the imaginary "confrontation line" between the two team's areas. A team may not have more than one of each kind of set.

Once all cards have been played any ambiguous sets are discarded and the rest are compared; the team with more cards in a set of given type gets the points for that type. Number sets are worth their printed value and suit sets are worth ten.

name: Cash Flow
description:
Cash Flow uses a standard 52-card deck and a supply of money (points). Each player receives 30 points. The deck is shuffled and one card is turned up to start a row.

On a turn a player can choose to buy any number of cards from the row, including none. The card farthest from the deck costs ten, the next nine, and so on, with a minimum cost of one. Regardless of whether or not any cards were purchased a new card is drawn and placed at the end of the row.

The cards are used to form sets of the same suit or same rank. However, a suit set can only contain cards from 2-9 or J-A - the high and low cards cannot be mixed. A table of set values is provided. Before buying cards a player may sell any number of sets from their hand.

The game continues until the deck runs out and no players want to sell any sets or buy any cards.

name: Criss-Cross
description:
Criss-Cross is a simple roll-and-write game for any number of players. Each player has a 5x5 grid of squares.

Each turn two standard dice are rolled and all players enter the sum in an empty box in their grid; 10, 11, and 12 are entered as 0, 1, and 2 respectively.

After 25 turns the grids are full and each player scores their rows and columns: 2/3/4/5 of the same number score 1/3/6/10 points, and 5 sequential numbers (not necessarily in order) scores 5 points. If a row or column contains multiple scoring combinations (two pairs or a pair and a triple) just add the scores for each combination.

The second version of the game (in Dice Games Properly Explained) gives a few variants:


For larger groups it suggests entering two different numbers on each sheet to begin with and playing 23 turns.



In Criss and Cross the rows and columns are totaled separately and you only score the lower of the two numbers.



Criss versus Cross is for two players only; players use the same grid and take turns entering numbers. One player scores rows and the other columns.
publishers: Elliot Right Way Books, Games & Puzzles Publications

name: Arkaroll & Write
description:
Arkaroll & Write is a roll and write game in which we will pretend to be the pilots of the Arkadya ship, our mission is to destroy the energy blocks that prevent the ship from entering the planet Arkus to leave supplies, at the same time we will score for the blocks of color destroyed, where the pilot who manages to collect the most points throughout the 4 missions will win.
Move from left to right, shoot and get the most points, but be careful you must manage the results of the dice well to be as efficient as possible.
Throughout the game we will evoke the experience of the mythical arcade game of the 80's ... what wonderful years.

In the game you must manage the throwing of the dice so that it is more efficient to be able to move and shoot the colored blocks, you will add points for the different destroyed colored blocks, you must optimize your dice since there are a number of rounds that must be completed before adding scores.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gościniec: Poprzez Czas i Przestrzeń
description:
Players play themselves as they take a mystical journey through time and space to reach Baby Jesus in Bethlehem. They are guided by the the Archangel Rafael. During their journey they will answer test their mind and body. Will they reach the manger in time?

The game has two modes. The quick mode (30-60 minutes) consists of a series of trivia questions related to Christmas (both historical and modern day customs). Very 7 days (tries) the trivia question is replaced with a physical or mental challenge - either group or individual.

In the narrative mode, the players must visit 8 locations on their journey. The locations consist of choose-your-own-adventure style narratives and choices may lead physical or mental challenges. The choices and results of the trials will affect the passage of time and available resources.

In both modes, if the players don't run out of time or resources, they arrive in time to meet Baby Jesus in Bethlehem.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Race, Real-Time, Voting

name: Rock Paper Kittens
description:
Ben Begeal's Rock Paper Kittens is an RPS game that pauses for some social shenanigans.

All 3 cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table. The active player will look at 2 cards, choose to keep one as their role and placing the other back on the table face down. With two cards remaining, the active player will offer one to the other player. That player will choose to take the card offered or the other face down card as their weapons. Roles are resolved by RPS rules.

—description from the publisher


Released in the April 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Triple Tongue Twisters: Go Fish with a Twist!
description:
Can you say “Happy Hippo Hiccupped” out loud, three times, fast? Collect sets of "3 word" Triple Tongue Twisters and say them out loud without your tongue tying to score points. The funniest “Go Fish with a Twist” and dare we say...most educational.
Playing Triple Tongue Twisters is so much fun, you will not realize you are perfecting your English with each game played.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: CBI ATC:  China-Burma-India Air Transport Command
description:
This is a VERY playable (free to print off and play) aerial transportation solitaire game about the U.S. Army Air Force's effort to fly supplies to China to keep it in World War 2 and tie up so many Imperial Japanese Army soldiers on the Asian mainland which it did. http://www.CoatneyHistory.com/CBIATC.htm

(In the "Advanced" game, one player can be the Equipment transporter and the other the Fuel Transporter and separate record/chits could be kept to see if they achieve their respective delivery requirements. Of course, if either fails too often, they both lose overall, so .... :-) )

The player chooses either the H (High Himalayas) route with its hazards or the M (Japanese fighter-interceptor aerodrome at Myitkina) route. He takes the maximum number of transport aircraft pieces possible and then adds to that upside-down piece mix a number of hazard pieces equal to half the number of transports rounded up.

(In 1942-43, trying to fly the lower route over Myitkina is very much pushing your luck, depending on Japanese fighter strength and who wins the air battle.)

From that inverted total he pulls a number of pieces equal to the number of original transports and finds out if sufficient loads - DC3s/C-47s carry 1, C-46s and (B-24 Liberator transport) C-87s carry 2 (although the C-87s can only carry 1 over the High route), and the late war DC-4s/C-54s carry *4*! - make it over the Hump.

Of course, the number of loads required each season increases with the Allied supreme commanders' demands.

The USAAF Air Transport Command actually delivered far more supplies in the air than could be delivered by gas-guzzling trucks on the Burma and then Ledo/Stilwell Roads.

Hazards include Engine Failure, Unexpected Mountain, Mule Stampede! (wrecking the center of gravity ... 3,000 mules were delivered, 4 to a plane), Spontaneous Explosion (C-46s only), Bad Compass-Thick Clouds-Out of Gas, Oxygen Loss-Disorientation, and Rock Throwing Yetis! (Some planes just disappeared along the costly "Aluminum Highway." Wrecks and remains are still being found.)

The no-dice Basic Game plays in about 40 minutes max. and really gives you the overall sense of the air transport campaign. (Ernest K. Gann was an ATC pilot and later wrote the book Fate is the Hunter. The movie is free to watch on YouTube.)

The Advanced Game, differentiating Fuel and Equipment loads, including sea and rail transport cargo capacities to the East India airfields, and having abstracted ground combat rules takes longer.

All aircraft icons are by me, pixel by pixel (hence, the small datafile size of the counter sheet).

The Dedication includes mention of one Bob Coatney, who was a master sergeant based at ATC headquarters in Dacca, East India.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Transportation, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Force Commitment, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: LOL: Le jeu
description:
With over 500 comedic scenes inspired from the universe of the television series LOL ComediHa! ? to choose from, the players will have to recreate the scenes originally brought to life by the comedians.

The Judges team will have to guess whatever it is that they are trying to act out.
If they can figure out what were the given scene keywords, both the team who mimed and the Judges will get points.
Important note: additional points will be awarded to the team who gave the best performance, so give it everything you’ve got!

—description from the publisher

Once every team has had a turn as the Judges, the game ends. The team with the most points wins!

Be ready to laugh out loud!

name: Activity Solo & Team
description: 2 versions in 1 box of this famous party game: You can either play in teams or each play against all the others.

name: Monopoly: Mon quartier
description:
Buy land, build and improve your neighborhood ... and collect your rent!
Players buy land to build houses, hotels, and grow their neighborhood.
They draw Money cards, collect rent, but watch out for the effects of Action cards!
Once the 6 in-game hotels have been built, the game ends. Who will have built the most profitable district?

name: Les Gens Qui Trash
description:
This game is an expansion pack for the “Les Gens Qui” board game. You will be able to judge even more trashy situations and try to guess what your friends think.

In Les Gens Qui - Trash expansion, you can find :


330 new people cards to judge.
1 new exclusive hand set to mix with the basic version hand sets for playing up to 9 players.
1 alternative game rule to discover a new game mode!


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Weiß Schwarz: Attack on Titan Trial Deck
description:
2 types of exclusive RRR Foil cards and 1 SP Gold Foil/Hot Stamp signed card from the Japanese voice actor are randomly inserted in decks!!
Eren: Yuki Kaji


Pre-constructed Trial Deck (Same content for each deck.)
50 cards per deck
6 decks per display
8 displays per carton
Rule sheet, deck manual, playbook, and playmat included.



The English Edition does not include the PR cards from the Japanese Edition.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Memory, Take That

name: Forgotten Treasure
description:
Forgotten Treasure is a strategic and easy-to-learn turn-based card game from Wicked Magic Games. In this game, you are competing against fellow pirates to collect Treasures using various Keys, Items, and Defenses while protecting yourself against other players and dangerous Events.

The game is played over a varying number of rounds, all with the goal of being the first player to claim 4 Treasures. The first player to claim 4 Treasures is the winner.

Each turn you have two action points that can be used to draw cards, play Items, or claim Treasures.

There are five card types in the game: Treasures, Keys, Items, Defenses, and Events.
Treasures are the main goal of the game and provide you with helpful effects when claimed.
Keys are used to claim Treasures.
Items have a variety of effects that assist you in claiming Treasures or hinder other players.
Events are crazy, game-changing cards that are played immediately when drawn. So Events may cause to you keep your hand exposed to all players, while other might
force you to trade hands with other players.
Defenses are used to protect yourself from Events or stop other players from playing Item cards.

-description from designer

name: On Your Mark!: A Think On Your Feet, Track Building Game
description:
You are an aspiring Olympic athlete who is training for the next Summer Olympics. You have decided the best way to improve your endurance is to create the most obnoxious and grueling track ever conceived! The longer the track the more in shape you will be when the games begin!

Players will be competing to create the longest track by drafting three track cards at a time and building on to their starting card. Any track segment that results in a dead end will not count towards your total distance, so make sure to plan for a way back to the starting line! In addition to track segments, players will occasionally come across Resource Cards which can be used to purchase Exhaustion Cards which if used correctly can earn the player a huge bonus.

The game ends when the cards run out, tally up your distance using the included scorepad and the player with the longest track wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Backhand
description:
"Serve! Volley! Lob! Smash! Roll Dice to simulate hitting a tennis ball back and forth, sometimes spending more energy to make powerful shots."

This has you trying to win a set as in tennis and deciding whether you want to use a power shot or not. The power shot uses up a limited supply of energy (tracked on one die) to roll an extra die for sending a shot in...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

name: Cat Capers: Museum Heist
description:
Gather the family for a clever game of quick captures with Cat Capers! Cat Capers is an interactive tabletop card game for up to 6 players. To play, line up the five 3D objects in a circle and shuffle the deck of cards. Each player must sit on one hand throughout the game, where the object is to identify the match or missing object on the card in play. Be the first to capture the right (or missing!) object, and keep that card. If you grab the wrong object, you must return your card randomly to the deck. Collect the most cards to become the ultimate cat caper!

Cat Capers includes five 3D objects and 60 playing cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction

name: Cum Face Game
description:
This hilarious duel pump action penis game is like nothing else you’ve seen and the perfect party piece for bachelor and bachelorette parties and other fun-filled events.

How to play… Before you begin, pour liquid into the hole positioned between the two shafts. We advise water but any safe to consume liquid can also be used.

The object of the game is to pump the penises as quickly as possible to be the first player to squirt their opponent in the face, or mouth, and be declared the fastest w@*ker. Then, pass it on to the next contenders.

Fill it up and start pumping, be quick though, or you’ll get a face full. Let the games begin.

—description from the publisher

name: Lingo Land
description:
The King of Lingo Land sets all visitors a task and only the highest performers are admitted. You’re under pressure and you need to impress. Five complete words must be created to secure your entry. The longer the word, the more you’ll score and topical words are even better. But beware, gobbledygook will get you nowhere!

Before you play, as a group choose a category (e.g., the ocean, food & drink or board games) and write it down.

Play is simultaneous. Each player chooses how to use the two dice on their own scoresheet. One die shows the box a letter must be chosen from and the other die shows the line that letter must be written on.

Each player writes their chosen letter anywhere on the selected line. Players may choose any letter from the box. Each letter can be used an unlimited number of times. Sixes are wild and can be used instead of any other number. Cross off a 'Pass' box if you choose not to place a letter.

Each player is allowed a maximum of three passes. After your third pass, you must withdraw from the game. Other players may continue until they have used all their passes. When the last player has finished, the game ends.

Your aim is to make a complete word on each line. You score points according to the length of the word, as shown on the scoresheet. If your word is relevant to the chosen category score two extra points.

To play, you’ll need to print a scoresheet for each player. You’ll receive the file in black and white, for easy printing. You may like to laminate your scoresheets and use dry erase pens to play. This will reduce your need to print new sheets out.

You'll also need 2 dice and a pen for each player. To play, you write directly onto the scoresheet.

Any number of players can play the game. Lingo Land is also ideal for playing online via videoconferencing.

—description from the publisher

name: Würfel Pie
description:
In this game, players are pushing their luck and trying to find the exact right combination of fillings in their pie and serving it up.

The active player draws and rolls 2 more dice than the number of players from a bag with 10 dice (8 dice in 4 colors which represent the 4 different pies and 2 wild dice).
