Then he takes 1 of the rolled dice and marks the colored number of the dice or the corresponding amount of tiles of that colored pie on the player sheet (each pie has 8 tiles).
After the active player, the other players clockwise take 1 die until every player has selected 1 die. Then the next player becomes the active player and starts a new round with new drawn dice.
There are some (one-time) actions to influence the dice rolls and results like change the the chosen die value +1/-1, add a die from the bag and reroll.
The game ends when one player completed all 4 pies or all 6 colored numbers of 1 pie on the player sheet.
Scoring is done by sum up the marked numbers of the pies, which give points influenced by the pie completeness, and the player with the highest point total wins.

Solo mode is mostly played the same way, but has an additional end-game trigger when none of the 3 rolled dice can be used to mark a number or pie tiles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Re-rolling and Locking

name: キャトルミューティレーション (CATTLE MUTILATION)
description:
キャトルミューティレーション (CATTLE MUTILATION) is a co-operative memo-style game from Japan. The players are cattle farmers, trying to improve their stock, but aliens abduct and harm the cattle. The farmers must try to reconcile matters with the aliens in order to save their herd.

The game has tiles showing various flying saucers, and alien tiles showing a saucer with its levitation beam on one side, and human to alien handshake on the other, numbered 1 to 10.

A tableau of face-down tiles for the various flying saucers is surrounded by the tiles showing beams. As players turn up saucers, they can pay cow tokens to the abduction beams to move them about. If the players can turn up a matching pair of saucers, they can flip a beam saucer to its handshake side, and recover the cow tokens.

In this way, players try to build up peace with the aliens, by retrieving handshakes without sacrificing too many cows.
user summary

name: Charge of the Light Brigade: A Solitaire Wargame
description:
Charge of the Light Brigade is a solitaire, tactical game depicting the Crimean War "charge of the noble 600" during the Battle of Balaclava, October 25th, 1854, made famous by Tennyson.

The game is low complexity, and emphasizes high playability and historicity.

As Lord Cardigan, commander of the British Light Brigade, you have received orders from your commander: attack the Russian position at the far end of the valley about a mile away. This involves running a gauntlet with enemy cannons to the left of you, to the right of you, and in front of you.

Your task seems like folly... but yours is not to reason, yours is but to do and die.
The charge seems doomed from the start, but you do have the French Chasseurs d'Afrique on your left to possibly assist, and the Heavy Brigade behind you, so perhaps there is more chance to carry the opposition than at first appears?

Play the game, experience the situation, and find out.

The original orders: Lord Raglan wishes the cavalry to advance rapidly to the front, follow the enemy, and try and prevent the enemy carrying away the guns. Troop horse artillery may accompany. French cavalry is on your left. Immediate.
Optional rules and scenarios allow you to explore various "what if?" interpretations of these orders, providing more strategy.

All you need to play the game (specifically designed for solo play) is:

a standard deck of 52 playing cards,
a six-sided die, and
pencil.


Available separately or in Panzerschreck #18

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rhyme Antics
description:
Players divide into teams.

The team that goes first will choose easy, intermediate, or difficult rhymes. A member of the opposing team draws a card and reads a target word corresponding to the difficulty level chosen. A timer starts (when using the app this will include a musical beat) and the team has one minute to say as many phrases as they can that end with a word that rhymes with the target word.

Points are received based on how many rhymes the team came up with and the difficulty level of the word they chose. Some specifically difficult rhymes appear on the card as bonus points, but any rhyming word is acceptable, even words not listed.

Then it is the other team's turn to do the same. Each team plays four rounds, and then the team that has the most points will be the winners.

Contents:
135 Playing Cards (Easy, Intermediate and Intellectual)
1 Scoreboard
2 Playing Card Clips
1 Microphone
1 Dry Erase Marker
1 60-Second Sand Timer

name: La Taja
description:
A night in a bar with friends. Your objective is to get drunk (catch "La Taja") before the rest of the players, adding and subtracting "taja" points. The taja points needed to win varies depending on the amount of players.

Set collection card game with Drink cards to get taja points, refreshment cards to reduce your oponent taja points and action cards to interact between players.

In his turn each player can draw a card from deck, play a card, discard a card or pass. Respecting the following rules:

Alcohol control: If you end your turn with more than 5 cards in hand, your opponents will randomly send cards from your hand to the Graveyard until you have 4.

Progressive taja: To be able to play a 2 point drink from your hand, you must have a 1 point drink on the table; and to play one of 3 have some of 2.

name: Pass The Biscuits
description: Teams must try to guess the words written on biscuit cards. There are three rounds in the game. The first round, you describe the words. The second, you mime out the words. The third, you can only use a one word clue.

name: The GemShine Pylons
description:
The empire needs power! But not all power is created equal – different gems have different uses, and so you must construct gem-powered Pylons that will be used by the most people. The better you do, the more the empire will reward you. Making them attractive as well will increase your favor among the nobility.

During the game you will buy multi-use cards from a market - often leaving gems behind to pay for them. If there's nothing you want to buy, you can gather all the gems from the market to clear it and fill it with new options. Cards have immediate effects, like building pylons or inserting gems in them for points, but they also have attributes which affect the value of those gems at the end of the game. Even seemingly small choices can have big results!

The player who scores the most points, wins! Co-op and solo modes are included as well, to expand your options for play.

-description from designer
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Brainfart
description:
The trivia game where it´s right to be wrong!

In Brainfart, players are faced with 1,100 inane, ridiculous, and laugh-out-loud questions. The challenge? To blurt out the opposite of the correct answer with no time for thinking. It’s harder than it sounds! Who can keep it going the longest and who blanks out completely?

Game-play: Begin play by choosing one person to read the questions in the first round and one person to answer. The answerer should keep answering one question after another as long as they answer correctly (that is, incorrectly). Answers must come quickly, without hesitation. It's up to the reader to decide whether the answers are fast enough, but a few seconds is a good rule of thumb. Answers that take too long are considered a wrong answer and play passes to the next player.

The reader continues by asking the new answered questions from the same card, picking up with the next question. When all questions from a card have been asked, draw a new card from the pile. A new reader can take over at any time.

The player with the highest number of correct questions in a row is considered the leader. If another player beats their record, they are now the person to beat. Play for a set number of rounds, and the person with the highest score at the end wins.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Impulse Movement, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Turris: City of Giants
description:
Build your faction's tower then battle, choosing Warfare, Mystic or Science as your weapon!

The Towers are the last bastion of refuge for this world, a world gone dark and dangerous. Rival factions have built monstrous towers that spire past the clouds. Each tower is as unique as its inhabitants. Some with slim and smooth outer faces and others with protruding arms that simultaneously protect and threaten. These magical and mechanical structures roam across The Wilds seeking resources, and new conquests. City of Giants refers to an annual Gathering of the the Spires under a tenuous truce.

In Turris, players become Lords of their faction. By adding new cards to your tower you’ll add new abilities and followers to your structure. You can choose from mystic cards that call upon the gods both kind and cruel, science cards that explore power of machines and potions, or warfare cards that focus on combat. Will you specialize in one area or create powerful combos across each? The faction with the most Influence wins, but all players must defend against the Darkness, or you all lose! Looking to add more players? Just print a second set of Turris to accommodate up to four players!

Turris: City of Giants features:

Elegant mechanics that build on one another for emergent gameplay
Fully-realized dystopian fantasy immerse you like no other 'Micro' game
Dual-sided cards offer twice the decision making fun
Easily expands to support 4 players with an extra copy of the game
Faction strategies support numerous paths to victory for extended replay-ability


DETAILS

Players: 2-4 (with additional print)
Length: 15-20 minutes
Ages: 8+


GAME INCLUDES

3 Faction cards
15 Structure cards
Rules


COMPONENTS YOU PROVIDE

8-10 Follower Tokens in 2 colors
6-8 Energy Tokens

name: BATSU!: The Punishment Card Game
description:
BATSU! is a party card game where players compete in hilarious challenges to avoid humiliating or mildly painful punishments!


Based on the hit live Japanese punishment game show in NYC and Chicago
Put your “funny” friends to the test in challenges while risking a BATSU!
Everyone wins, except the loser!


Compete In Challenges
Each round a different player is the judge. The judge of the round draws a Challenge Card for the other players to compete in. These could be anything from telling a story to acting as props for a play.

Audience Suggestions
There is a deck of audience suggestions to switch things up every time a challenge is drawn. Different challenges require different types of suggestions. For example, the judge may draw a Place Card so the scene could take place anywhere from a baseball field to Mars.

Hilarious Punishments
The judge then decides which player did the worst and deserves to be punished, Japanese game show style! It could be something humiliating like calling a friend to tell an embarrassing story about you, or painful like getting an arm hair plucked out! In the end, players are either funny or get punished!

name: Fruit Punch
description:
Fruit Punch is a fruit-themed game where players have to collect Fruit cards to win the game. The deck contains 62 cards, which consist of Fruit and Animal cards.

In the beginning, each player is given 5 Fruit cards. The players take turns drawing card(s) from the draw pile until someone draws Mad Monkey. When that happens, the player is knocked out. However, the knocked-out player can still take action and gather points.

During their turn, players may either play a fruit card as an Action card or place it in their Field as a Point card. To end the turn, the player must draw at least 1 card from the pile. If the drawn card is an Animal, the player must end the turn and get the penalty written on the card. The game continues clockwise until only 1 player left, and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

name: Wanna Hocka Lugie
description:
Follow in the footsteps of the ancient Hawaiians in Wanna Hocka Lugie, the trading game inspired by the legend of Ka'ao. Players head to the Hawaiian marketplace in a race to fill their baskets. Each player controls two pawns - one that can trade goods and one that can steal goods from the baskets of other players. There's a delicate balance as players map out their acquisition strategy - trade or steal - and all the while avoiding thievery themselves! Players begin with a basket containing three items. By landing one's trading pawn (Tally Trader) on various items, a player can trade up for more valuable goods, stepping up the value of the items in his basket. Maneuvering one's stealing pawn (Shifty Shorty) onto the same space as an opponent's trader gives him the opportunity to shortcut the whole system and pick up valuable goods the "easy" way. Trade and steal. Steal and trade. Twists, turns, and a little bit of luck keep it close until the end. Who will return triumphantly from the market as the Big Kahuna?

Contents include: Game Board, 4 Trading Pawns, 4 Stealing Pawns, 2 Dice, 4 Trading Basket Placards, 54 Item Cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Dish 'em Out
description:
Rival diner owners are under pressure to cook breakfast for their customers as quickly as possible. As some foods take longer to cook, you will need to plan ahead so the entire order is ready to serve at the same time. Players receive points for each successfully completed order and lose points for wasted food and incomplete or incorrect orders. The player with the most points when the flow of customers runs out is the winner.

Setup
Each player chooses one diner board and places it in front of them.

Sort and place the food tiles and penalty tokens into each slot of the kitchen caddy.

Shuffle the customer order cards. Based on the amount of players, remove the number of cards needed and place the remaining cards back in the box (see chart at right).

The first person to shout out what they ate for breakfast will deal first. Give them the chef’s spoon and cards.

How to Play
This game is played in rounds. Each round consists of the following actions:
1. Dealer assigns customer order cards.
2. All players select food tiles.
3. All players cook food items.
4. All players serve their customers, if they are able.

After all four actions are completed, the chef’s spoon and the customer order deck are passed clockwise to the next player, and a new round begins.

1. Assigning Customers
The player with the chef’s spoon is the dealer for each round. The dealer draws customer order cards equal to the number of players. The dealer then assigns one customer order to each player, including themselves. You can keep a more difficult card with the higher risk and point value for yourself or assign it to an opponent in hopes of giving them more than they can handle. All players then place their customer order cards on an empty table space within the Orders section of their diner board. In later rounds, if all the table spaces on a player’s diner board are full, they must immediately serve one of their current customers, even if that order will be incomplete, before receiving a new customer order card for that round.

2. Selecting Food Tiles
Starting with the dealer, players take turns in clockwise order selecting food tiles from the kitchen caddy based on their orders and cooking times. Each player may take up to a total of seven food tiles, from up to three different food types. This is the maximum; you are not required to select more food tiles than you want or need. Take your selected food tiles, and place them in a stack on their corresponding spaces in the Prep column of your diner board.

3. Cooking Food
All players cook their food at the same time. When everyone is ready, the dealer for the round announces, “Cook time!” Now, starting with the top row and working your way down, move all food tiles on your diner boards one space to the right. Keep each round’s stack of tiles together as they move across the board. Some food types do not need to stop in each column. When a tile reaches a space with an arrow, slide it across the arrow until it reaches the column indicated. Once food items are in the Ready to Serve spaces, they can be used to serve any combination of orders (see Serving Customers section).Any unserved food in the final column of the Ready to Serve section will be moved into the Trash column during cook time.

4. Serving Customers
Players may serve their customers during actions 1 or 4 using any food tiles that are in the Ready to Serve area. When you are ready to serve a customer’s order, move the food tiles from your Ready to Serve area and place them on the corresponding spaces of the customer order card to check that you have the correct food items.

End of Game
Complete the round in which the last customer order cards have been assigned. Then the game enters the final phase. Still taking turns going clockwise, each player has the chance to select one last set of food tiles to place on their diner board. Cooking then occurs as normal. The final phase then continues with all players cooking their food and serving their remaining customer orders (repeating actions 3 and 4). The game ends once all customer order cards are removed and all food tiles have been served or moved into the Trash column.

Scoring
Players total the scores from their served customer order cards and subtract any penalty tokens received to determine their final scores. The player with the most points wins. In the case of a tie, the player with the fewest penalty tokens wins. If there is still a tie, the player with the five highest-point customer order cards wins.

-description from publisher

name: Domaniacal
description:
Domaniacal is a fast paced, 2-5 player strategy card game. Played with domino cards, players take turns removing cards from their hands and stealing from other players to create a stack of cards. Once the draw pile is out, the player with the largest stack wins!

—description from the designer

name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Venerable Machine Spirit Stratagem Promo Card
description: This promo card was included in the November 2020 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 4 other games. It is a "Tricks and Tactics" Stratagem card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dino Diner
description:
It’s survival of the fattest in a pre-historic race to invent the restaurant! But this quest for fryers is fraught with danger! The more you cook for hungry customers, the more attention you draw from ravenous dinosaurs whose monstrous appetites can only be sated by one of three things – your dwindling food supplies, your customers, or you!

Primarily a set collection game with push-your-luck elements and heaping portion of player interaction, Dino Diner combines strategy and angst into a light meal of a game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Twin Play Classics: Clue and Sorry
description:
Two of the world's favorite family games, Clue and Sorry, in an beautiful boxed set.

These board games were a combination of two popular classic games contained in a premium wooden box, with the idea that they would grace a coffee table. The boards of each paired game were on each other's flip side. The case came with a brass plate and was sometimes called The Collector's Edition. It was marketed as a game that would "a great gift" or "part of your family's collection".

name: KamiMaï
description:
You were told not to enter the cursed room in the school library. But you couldn’t help it!
Attracted by the desire to learn more about your emerging powers, you push the door and come face to face with an old dusty Grimoire curiously placed on the floor. The moment your fingers touch its torn pages, you feel sucked into a cold and dismal world ... The KamiMaï who inhabits the old Grimoire has trapped you in the world of Nightmares ...
Will you be able to escape?

You play as a summoner apprentice in a cooperative game: you win together or lose together.
In turn, you will draw cards from the balanced Magic Grimoire to cast spells in order to defeat the KamiMaï and allow the group to escape from the world of Nightmares.
If the Grimoire collapses, the group loses 1 Energy Point. If you lose your last Energy Point, you lose the game, forever trapped in the world of Nightmares.

name: Horizon Wars: Infinite Dark
description: Horizon Wars: Infinite Dark is a science-fiction spaceship tabletop miniatures wargame. It allows for solitaire, co-operative, and competitive versus play. Players create a fleet of ships, customizing both their statistics and their heroic pilots. When played solo or cooperatively, the AI adversary is controlled through an AI and a standard deck of playing cards. Scenarios are objective-based and range from one-off encounters to narrative campaigns, complete with character progression.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly Junior: Super Zings
description: Other version of Monopoly Junior now with Super Zings. Choose four different Super Zing exclusive models. Visit and buy your favourite Kaboom City places. Collect the most money by the end of the game to win.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tower Block
description:
Use building blocks to build a tower as high as you can. The highest tower wins the game. Move your playing piece and answer questions correctly to add building blocks. There are two types of questions, multiple choice and "Hazard a Guess" where you will have no idea of the answer but the closest guess wins.
We have tried to make this game as environmentally friendly as possible. Being Eco friendly was important to us and because of that, everything in the game, barring the dice, is wooden or cardboard
The game is designed for adults and children and up to 4 players or teams. Whether you are into team games or want to be an individual player, it really doesn't matter. The rules are easy to learn, ages 12 or up would be quite capable of playing this and having loads of fun.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Stacking and Balancing, Team-Based Game

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot LITE
description:
AN INTRODUCTION TO THE QUEST!

Killer Bunnies Lite is a simplified version of the full Quest for the Magic Carrot game (start with the QUEST section if you want to explore more). Lite is a stand-alone game is not compatible with any other Killer Bunnies game; however, you can incorporate the 10 Carrots into your full Quest game!

name: Semino
description:
Semino is a game of chance and strategy. Victory goes to the player who can grow their plant the quickest.

—description from the back of the box

Each player rolls a die and moves their bamboo tube across a grid, collecting marbles in the bottom. Each marble collected pushes colored leaves up to the top until it fully blooms.

Two difficulty levels are included:

Players may collect marbles of any color.
Players can collect marbles only of their own color.


—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Nähdään Kosken Rannassa
description:
Trivia game about one of Finland's cities, Tampere. The game has 900 questions and is suitable for everyone who wants to learn more about Tampere.

The name of the game means "See you at the rapids" and refers to the Tammerkoski rapids that run straight through the city (although now largely covered/developed) from lake Näsijärvi - itself one of the largest lakes in Finland and an important means of communication and trade before the advent of railways and the motor car - to lake Pyhäjärvi, and which the city was originally developed around; the rapids provided a ready source of power for the weaving mills, paper mills, engineering works etc. of the emerging industrial revolution of the 19th century and started Tampere on the path to becoming what it now is.

The game is basically the Tampere edition of Nähdään kellon alla!, the original version set in Helsinki. Unlike that version however, this is not completely bilingual; only 300 of the 900 questions have been translated to Swedish and there's a separate deck for those cards, furthermore the cards are not categorized but simply have the "easy" or "difficult" option on them.

name: Karty Dżentelmenów: Epizod Szósty
description:
Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty Dżentelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

This is the Sixth deck of polish spin-off CAH and the cards are 2 languages (Polish and English). It is playable by itself or can be combined with previous decks.

About what is the game? Players draw answer cards to their hand. One person draw question card. In secret everybody add their answer and after shuffle everybody votes on the best/funniest/craziest answer card. The person with the higher number of votes wins the round and take the card to his players area as a point. Than everybody fill answer cards, and the winner draws another question card. You can play how long you want, or determine how much point you need to earn to win the game.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Haspelknecht: Bochumer Cowherd Boy Promo Tile
description:
Promotion tile from from the designer himself.

In the game Haspelknecht, when the players acquire the cowherd boy, they immediately receive 3 victory points.

name: Conocer Europa
description:
Buy and sell, the game of the common market.
Get yourself some leather shoes in Italy, with a coal shipment from Germany and a butter shipment from Denmark. Brussels, the seat of the common market, they will give you papers so you can acquire products from every EU company. Let's do business!

—description from the back of the box (translated

name: Munchkin Santa-Sized Holiday Grab Box
description:
This is a shipping box for Munchkin - used to ship a bundle of Munchkin items in it.

It comes with special benefits for the owner, the Twelve Bonuses of Christmas. On the box there are various special abilities, such as "Draw one extra treasure when you kill a monster". Each ability has two checkboxes, which have to marked when the bonus is used.

name: Munchkin Holiday Grab Box
description:
This is a shipping box for Munckin - used to ship a bundle of Munchkin items in it.

It comes with special benefits for the owner, the Twelve Bonuses of Christmas. On the box there are various special abilities, such as "Draw one extra treasure when you kill a monster". Each ability has a checkbox, which has to marked when the bonus is used.

name: Munchkin Special Delivery
description:
This is a shipping box for Munckin - used to ship a bundle of Munchkin items in it.

It comes with a one-time special benefit for the owner, the Twelve Bonuses of Christmas. It says: "You may show this carton to double the treasure for one combat per game, after you have confirmed your victory but before drawing the Treasure cards."

name: So, You've Been Eaten.: Dyspepto-Beastmol
description:
As part of the Beast’s reaction to the Miner’s presence, its bowels secrete a special antacid that exobiologists have termed Dyspepto-Beastmol. Should they come in close contact with it, an enterprising Miner may use it as a temporary boost to power more actions. However, if dislodged from its naturally occurring sources, it will disperse and enhance the Beast’s Immune Responses.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Troy: Green Expansion
description:
Kickstarter exclusive of green cards. These add extra unknowns into the game of earthquake, poison, mourning and disease.
All affect both players and change the game. Some will even finish the game when played. All done when double 6 is rolled by a player.

—description from the designer

name: Zoo Roll Out
description:
The concept is simple: Help the animals break out of the zoo. Zoo Break is compact and easy to grasp for kids as young as five, who are still learning their numbers, but it involves strategy and level variations that make it intriguing for the sharpest of gamers. (We challenge advanced gamers to try getting through Levels 1-10 in one play session!) Zoo Break can be played alone, or collaboratively by multiple people. It's a great family game.

To play, simply shuffle the cards and lay them out in an 8x8 grid. Place the four colorful wooden animals in the center. Roll the green dice to guide the animals to freedom, using strategy to choose the best path for each animal. But watch out for the zookeeper! For every roll of the animal dice, you'll also roll the zookeeper dice. The zookeeper locks down cards and closes off escape routes with every roll.

Win the game by breaking out all four animals before their escape routes close. Strategy abounds around which paths to take, and this makes for great interaction with kid co-players. Four free spaces help you on your way. But if the zookeeper locks down a card that is currently occupied by an animal, it's back to the central cage!

—description from the publisher

name: Backyard Baseball
description:
Backyard Baseball captures the spirit of an impromptu game played by two teams of two kids each. The game lasts three innings. Each half-inning consists of a series of plays, each of which has four steps:

1. The fielding player positions the fielder pawn, then secretly chooses a pitch card.
2. The batter chooses a batting card, both players reveal their cards, and roll the die.
3. Compare the roll to the # on the pitcher's card; if it's less, check the pitcher's card to see where the ball goes, otherwise use the batter's card. If the fielder pawn is there, it's an out, otherwise it's a hit!
4. The batter may try to extend the play and advance the runner(s), but the pitcher gets to play a card to try to throw the lead runner out.

The batting team only has two pawn, so when a pawn that's on base has to bat, it's replaced with a ghost runner.

If a runner reaches home, the batting team scores a point (run).

After three outs, the teams switch roles and repeat the process.

The team with the higher score after three innings wins!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Champ'd Up: Slam Down
description:
Champ’d Up: Slam Down is a collectable card game with custom decks of cards generated by playing Champ’d Up from The Jackbox Party Pack 7. The games live in the same universe, but they’re totally different. For starters, one is a video game and one is a card game. Also, one is an 8-player party game about making funny characters and the other is a 2-player combat strategy card game.

Champ’d Up: Slam Down is a unique two-player card game where each player takes the role of a trainer battling champs against their opponent until only one player is left standing/sitting! Each turn you will recruit champs from your hand into the ring to fight your opponent’s champs. Deplete your opponent’s reserves and call them out to declare victory and win the game!

To get a pack (you only need one), play an online game of Champ’d Up in The Jackbox Party Pack 7. Create ridiculous champs and battle them for supremacy. But draw with care because these champs are going to make their way into the physical world! After your game, you can purchase a pack of Champ’d Up: Slam Down cards with the characters you created in Champ’d Up. It will be custom printed and delivered right to your door. When you receive your cards, grab a friend and play this simple but exciting take on a 1-on-1 collectable card game. Combine decks and trade cards with others for even more ridiculous mayhem.

Players will take turns until a player wins the game. The player who is taking a turn is referred to as the “active player.” At the very start of their turn, the active player gets 3 energy. On the active player's turn, they can use energy to execute a variety of actions: Recruit, Hype, Fight, use Special abilities, and Call out their Opponent. Slam Down's custom cards means a diverse variety of cards can be printed from playing Champ'd Up (in the Jackbox Party Pack 7) repeat times. Fighting is how players remove opposing champs from the ring. If the active player has a champ in the ready position and their opponent has no players in the ring, the active player can call them out. If the active player calls out an opponent with no champs in their reserve, the game ends and they win the game!

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Timber Tumble
description:
A beaver stands on top of a haphazard dam made of wooden cylinders. Use the wand to knock the wooden logs out from under the beaver, slowly lowering it to the ground.

If you get the beaver to the ground without letting it fall, you win!

—user summary

name: Conus Wabantus
description:
The game consists of two game boards, five big and many smaller ceramic cones.
One board is the actual playing field. The central nine spaces hold small cones at the beginning. The active player rolls the five big cones and places them on the second board. Upright cones go in the center, the other cones are go around it, depending on where their tip pointed after rolling. The player then turns the board into the desired alignment and makes their move. All pieces have to remain connected at least diagonally. A piece moves into the direction of the cone tip, jumping over all other connected pieces in front of it (like in Reinhold Wittig's old game Wabanti, which inspired the name). An upright cone means placing a new cone in the central area, a second upright cone means removing a piece anywhere.
The winner is the first player who has a piece leave the game board on their side.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Stellaris: Infinite Legacy – Empires Expansion
description: This expansion adds everything that is necessary to play Stellaris: Infinite Legacy with 5 and 6 players. The additional player colours are grey and purple.

name: Stellaris: Infinite Legacy – Frontiers Expansion
description:
The Frontiers Expansion does include all unlocked stretch goals of the Stellaris: Infinite Legacy crowdfunding. This adds minis and replayability/variance to every game of Stellaris!

This expansion adds:
30 Starbase minis (5 per player colour)
30 Robot population clips
4 Ancient mining drone minis
4 Space amoeba minis
4 Crystaline entity minis
4 Space whale minis
4 Void cloud minis
4 Gateway minis
4 Pirate ship minis
536 Advanced tech cards
31 Tech story packs
6 Collaborator story packs
- "Enigmatic Observer" by Templin Institute
- "Shadow Goverment" by Templin Institute
- "Expanded Conciousness" by Frederik Knudsen (Down the Rabit Hole)
- "The Device" by Aspec
- "Clerk Debacle" by Stefan Anon
- "Planetary Deconstruction" by Xenonion

Other components:
12 gateway counters
18 starbase module counters
36 alien portrait cards
5 human portrait cards
6 flag cards
4 Stellaris Invicta Factions (4 flag cards + 1 civic card)
12 exotic resource tokens
1 Sol/Deneb system tile
1 Earth planet disk
5 Spaceborne home systems (Space Amoeba, Crystaline Entity, Void Cloud, Ancient Mining Drone, Tiyanky Space Whales)
1 Pirate base system

—user summary

name: Anno Domini: Ali Baba Spieleclub e.V.
description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 340 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this ain’t no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because it’s full of surprises and pure fun. Highly Recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Unfortunately there is no English edition in existence, but this game could be a good way, to improve your already existing German skills or a very good reason, to learn German language in the first place.

The Set "Anno Domini - Ali Baba Spieleclub e.V." is a special release for the 30th anniversary of the German boardgame club "Ali Baba" and acts as a club chronicle. It contains events related to the history of the club. It can be played as a standalone or together with the other sets, which is the best way of playing it.

Part of the Anno Domini series
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Saloon Duel
description:
Saloon Duel is an unconventional trick taking game for 2 to 4 players.

Like standard trick-taking games, a player leads by playing one card. All other players take turns playing one card. Each player may follow the suit of the leading card or play any blue card unless you have trump. If you have a trump card in your hand you must play it. A trick is defined as the single cards that each person plays for the current turn. A trick is captured by the person who played the highest card of trump, unless a trump is not played, then the highest card of the suit that was lead wins. When you win a trick you may keep a single card with a 1 value in your score pile, if there was one played.

A poker chip on a card at the saloon determine trump and ending points. The cards in the saloon may be moved by players in some circumstances. Suits in this game are the Outlaw, Gambler, Kid, Cowboy or Deputy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Trick-taking

name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Evolved
description:
Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Evolved includes six all-new miniatures featuring all new sculpts in a dynamic pose of legendary characters from the Pathfinder role-playing universe

Characters featured in this set list include:


Valeros, human fighter
Harsk, dwarf ranger
Seoni, human sorcerer
Fumbus, goblin alchemist
Merisiel, elf rogue
Kyra, human cleric
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Lost Explorers: Promo Cards
description:
With these promo cards, you can now play a real Adventurer:

Will you play the brave Beth Mc Journey, the reckless Ivan Mochilero, the intrepid Lynda Reisender or the determined Paul Beaulieu?

Each Adventurer has a special power. You can use it once in the game, whenever you want.

name: Pie Face Wolkenklatscher!
description:
As a variation to the Pie Face game, here the "pie throw" is triggered by a different mechanism. A hammer is used to hit a trigger that flings a weight upwards. When the weight reaches the pie thrower, there is the pie throw simulated with spray foam.

—user summary

name: Invención de Haikus
description:
A creative game for writing Japanese poetry.
Go through the seasons of the year and put together a photograph made of words.

Divide the deck into 4. Each card you draw will guide you to write a haiku. In nature you will find the rest!

name: The Catholic Card Game: Consecrated Expansion
description:
54 card expansion filled with cards written ONLY by nuns and priests!

Cards written by:


The Clergy of Ascension: Fr. Mark-Mary Ames, CFR, Fr. Josh Johnson, Fr. Mike Schmitz, Fr. Mark Toups
Catholic Stuff You Should Know
The Sisters of CJC
Fr. Paul from Conception Abbey
Fr. Tim Nelligan


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Religious

name: Fortifications of Moroni
description:
Can you protect the Nephite cities from the invading armies of Lamanites?

The Lamanites are invading. Chief Judge Pahoran and Chief Captain Moroni have raised the Title of Liberty and called upon you to fortify the cities of the Nephites against these attacks and to protect and defend the lives and liberties of your people. Can you build walls around the cities while under attack or will the Lamanites destroy your walls before you can complete them?

In this 2-4 player game, players build Walls and trade with other players to get the Wall Segment types they need to completely fortify a city and earn Fortification Points. 100 Fortifications points are required to win, but players may exceed those points to beat out other players.

Cities can be attacked by Lamanites, destroying the Wall Plans you have built. Each city has multiple Wall Plans and completing each plan lessens the damage from a Lamanite attack.

Buy Reinforcent Cards to help defend your cities until your cities are complete Fortified and impervious to Lamanite attack. Move Moroni's army to protect your city against attacks while you fortify it.

Although there is only one winner, players work together to complete their cities.
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Move Through Deck, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Stadt Name Land
description:
The aim of the game is to collect the most question or task cards. Each player receives three question cards at the beginning of the game. The game leader draws a letter card and names the letter. Whoever can give an answer to one of his question cards puts it down in front of him and names the answer. He draws a new question card and the game continues in this way until all question cards are used up.

—user summary

name: Salto Wortale
description:
Who can find all the solution words in the puzzle term? The communication game "Salto Wortale" offers 275 puzzles on 50 topics. The players have to fill out certain categories with words that are already contained in the puzzle term. The player who finds the most words the fastest wins. The game promotes language and is suitable for a non-contact, digital game evening.

How to play:
The players all receive the same sheet of paper. They have to find the words within long puzzle terms. The player who finds the most words gets the most points and wins.

name: Darkness Rising
description:
You play a ranger who is trying to save villagers by navigating through a wilderness that is rapidly being taken over by a dark force. Luck and strategy are required to survive the journey and fight the monsters.

You must navigate by rolling a dice and filling in the hex grid with the corresponding pathways. Every round one hex is eliminated making it harder to navigate. When the pathways go out of bounds you must fight monsters by rolling dice and matching each monsters pattern. Your goal is to collect as many villagers as you can and navigate to safety. Sometimes you must make the hard decision to sacrifice your villagers to the monsters and elements so that you can survive.

—description from the designer

name: Arcadia Quest: Koba
description:
Insatiably curious since an early age, Koba demonstrated an obsession for anything and everything related to adventure. Swords, spells, sneaking… you name it, she wanted to master it. When adventurers would stay at her grandparents' tavern, she'd virtually appear next to them wherever they went, and hound them for tales of adventure and monster-slaying techniques. Some indulged her precociousness. Others did not, and she has an intense dislike for anyone that she suspects is hiding something from her. When she was of age, she shouldered her swords, staffs, and daggers (quite a trick) and marched off for a life of adventure and excitement in the distant land called Arcadia.

Promotional character for Arcadia Quest.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: He Did What Heroes Do: Grand Tactical Wargame Rules for the Napoleonic Era
description:
He Did What Heroes Do is a set of grand tactical rules for wargaming the Napoleonic Wars.

You don't just control a division or a corps, but an entire army.
Your units on the tabletop will be infantry divisions, cavalry brigades and groups of artillery batteries, led by your subordinates.
This wargame will allow you to play some of the largest battles of the wars in just a few hours. As the battle goes on, your commander in chief will rally wavering units, redeploy and push in reserves, or even change your subordinate's orders entirely.

He Did What Heroes Do has its focus on command, but the usual aspects of Napoleonic warfare will make an appearance. Skirmishers, heavy cavalry, square formations and grand batteries are all viable tactical options.
All combat needs is just a few D6 to work out if your charging unit has broken through, your musket volleys are wearing the enemy down or if your artillery are hammering away effectively.

This game doesn't use cards, rolling on tables, distributing points or even command radii to decide which units you can use each turn. Every unit gets to activate once every turn, but they will only follow the orders you gave to their general.
Want those cavalry to charge?
Change their corps' orders, or move your commander to the unit and order them forward yourself!
Or do you hang on for another turn, waiting until the enemy are even weaker?
Your impact can be crucial, but you can't be everywhere at once.
As the army commander, your focus will be on taking the initiative, supporting your subordinates and hopefully winning the day.
Good luck general.

Designed to be played with 2 to 6mm, but can be adapted to other scales.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Scavenger
description:
Open your box, imagine that you are a consulting detective tasked with solving a particular case, and begin solving your mystery.

When Ernest Whitlock, the head of the Valley Falls Historical Society, is found dead from a gunshot wound inside City Hall. Take up the task that Ernest Whitlock started, play the game the Enigmatic Assembly has set into motion, and be prepared to go into the deepest, darkest places in Valley Falls to find Whitlock’s killer. The Hunt is on!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cats collection (あつめねこ )
description:
A large number of cats are coming to the backyard. Show them your yummy foods to invite the cats into your home! However, if your food is not so unique, the cats will go away. Now it's time to choose your foods.

Players use rice cards to collect cats. If you collect the most cats, you will win! The rules are simple, just give out a different card and call a cat! Atsumeneko uses Japanese-English bilingual notation on all cards and instructions.

name: The Game オバケやしきのすうじのアクマ (Demons of Numbers)
description:
THE GAME オバケやしきのすうじのアクマ is a new incarnation of The Game where players struggle to seal away ghosts and other creatures lurking about a haunted mansion.  

The premise of the game is that players are naughty children who enter a haunted house and accidentally open a book that releases a host of demons. They must work to seal these escapees back into the book. However, the demons are actually Demons of Numbers and therefore the players cannot speak in numbers (or else be cursed and die).

The basic gameplay is the same as The Game, where players work together to discard all cards into four piles depending on the UP/DOWN conditions of each pile. During their turn, players discard either a larger or smaller value card(s) as appropriate. Afterwards, players refill their hand.  

Players cannot share the numbers of the cards in their hand with other players but must find ways to collaborate in order to effectively place cards in the four piles so that all players can have zero cards in their hand at the end of the game.

If there is an exact difference of 10 between the card a player discards and the last card in a pile, the player is free to play the card regardless of the UP/DOWN direction of the pile.  

In Demons of Numbers, there are also six types of effect cards (which are number cards with an effect written at the bottom): Reverse, Skip, Short, Draw 2, Silence, and Declaration of Death.

There are three types of ending results for the game: Total victory, victory, and loss.

--

Additional Information:

This all new game builds upon the original The Game with additional rules for a spookishly fresh gameplay experience.

Unlike The Game Extreme which added rules to make gameplay even more challenging for players, Demons of Numbers offers a more interactive, conversational experience. The new design also allows for up to 6 players.

Familiar “effects” are added to the game to give it a more UNO-esque familiarity. In fact, these changes have earned this version of the game the nickname “The Game Junior” by the original publisher.

The increased player number, new rules, and random events make it more difficult for players to find a repeatable pattern to beat the game and result in a making Demons of Numbers more of a “party game” for all ages and for gamers and non-gamers alike.

The designer, 326, felt that the original The Game had a title that was really not ideally optimized for easy internet searches, as well as artwork that would make it for children to convince their parents to purchase the game for them. He wanted to take a new approach and was able to find a willing partner in Arclight Games.

Illustrations are also by 326.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Chronicles of Stampadia
description:
The reign of Stampadia had thousands of years of history of dangerous places and brave mercenaries before disappearing mysteriously from our globe. But Stampadia monks, generation after generation, managed to document relentlessly the story of every single adventurer, the map of every single dungeon, and the clue of every single mystery in a huge tome called Chronicles Of Stampadia.

We managed to find a damaged copy in an abandoned basement and it looks like that the book is imbued with some kind of magic: the reader can live every page of its story with just two dice, an eraser, and a small token!

We’re trying to recover, translate and digitalize a new page of this book every day on the project website!

Chronicles of Stampadia is a print-and-play adventure game inspired by classic roguelikes, board games, and gamebooks that has a little twist: the map, the enemies, the quests, the mysteries, and the traps are mixed and generated by a computer algorithm, as in a roguelike videogame. On the Chronicles of Stampadia homepage you will find a unique dungeon to download, print, and discover every day.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Med andra ord: Pocket
description:
The word-explaining game Med andra ord made portable in this card based version. The words are on cards instead of tokens, and are worth 1-3 points depending on the difficulty.

You play in pairs, where one has to explain the word on the card "in other words" and the other guesses. In 45 seconds, you should try to explain and guess correctly on as many cards as possible. When the game is over, the points are added up according to the denomination on the cards. The team with the highest score wins.

name: Hunt A Killer: The Moon Summit Mystery Box Set
description:
A graduate student named Toby Mendia appears to have died from a fatal bear attack while on a scientific expedition in Moon Summit Park, Alaska. Although the case closed in the summer of 2018, a friend of Toby’s has reached out to you, thinking there might be something strange surrounding his death. Was Toby murdered? If so, why – and by whom?

Players channel their inner detective to investigate the suspected murder in Moon Summit Park, Alaska. Uncover the motives of each suspect through ciphers, clues, and puzzles that progress the story to its thrilling conclusion.

The Moon Summit Mystery Complete Box Set contains the full season (6 episodes) of the previous Hunt A Killer subscription series.

Difficulty: 3/5 - Medium
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Great Northern War: Kalisz 1706
description:
Game covers several battles of the "Polish" part of the Great Northern War, a major conflict fought at the beginning of XVII century, when Saxony, Russia and Dennmark attacked Sweden. Thanks to the leadership skills of the Carolux XII, Swedish army won several battles during this war.

"Kalisz 1705" allows to recreate couple of battles of this war - small scale skirmish at Tylewice 1704, medium battle - Poniec 1704 and two major battles - Wschowa (Fraustadt) 1706 and Kalisz 1706.

Game uses Husaria system rules, slightly modiefied for the more infantry based battles than usually in this system.

name: Riksja Race
description:
Race in your rickshaw to be the first to pickup and drop-off passengers to gain the most points. But beware other players might steal your passengers.

Players take turns throwing dice to move their rickshaw on the game board, after picking up a passenger you take a card to see where the passenger needs to be dropped off.

The player earns points for every completed trip. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: スライプ (Slipe)
description:
Slipe is an abstract board game for two players.

Players take turn moving one of their five pieces across the board. Pieces may be moved forward, back, left, or right. However, when moved a piece will slide all the way until there is a barrier (end of board or another piece). A piece cannot stop moving midway.

The first player to move their main piece into the center space wins the game.

name: Mystery cards: Das Phantom der Achterbahn
description:
A guessing whodunit from the world of books "Knickerbocker Gang".
The whodunit is told on 49 cards. These cards are shuffled and you have to find the right order to solve the mystery.

In the box there are 49 mystery cards, each of which has a part of the exciting story printed on it. The player or players must now put the cards in the right order, which can be done by carefully reading and logically arranging each part of the story.

If the cards are in the right order, one can easily solve the puzzle from the information and answer the question found on the last card.

A hint on a special card can also help. And how do you know if you have guessed correctly? Quite simply, the cards are turned over carefully and one by one, without changing their position, and the letters on the back then give the correct answer.

Reading, logical combination, drawing conclusions, recognizing sequences, all these essential elements are trained in this game, and on top of that without the children noticing it.

—user summary

name: Rugby 15
description:
A little game of bluff. Players use cards of different value and category (forward,back) to progress on the pitch.

The game is divided in 2 halves. A half ends when a player can't draw cards.

Each half is divided in rounds. For each round, the 2 players draw and discard cards to maintain a hand of 4 cards. the comparison of the value and type of cards gives the result : attacker progression on the pitch or ball winned by defender

The winner is the player with the higher score at the end of the match.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Shrdlu
description:
A row of five cards is dealt out, some of which contain constraints like "only 1 of this letter" or "alphabetically earliest letter in the word". Players then race to think of a word that fits the cards dealt.

When the 15-card deck is exhausted, whoever called the most words wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Escape Adventures Wendepuzzle: Gestrandet
description:
After their boat was destroyed in a heavy storm, the players strand on a mysterious island. They have to solve various puzzles in order to leave again. But the island holds a secret, they didn't expect ...

Escape Adventures is played in two phases: First, the players have to piece together a two-sided, round puzzle. Than they begin to solve puzzles. Some of them require to turn the whole puzzle around, as some important information is only found on one of the sides.

A booklet contains the story of the game that develops as players solve more puzzles. To see if they solved the current puzzle correctly, players use special puzzle tiles to see if their solution forms a continuous line of a specific color.

The game aims to brimg the experience of an Escape Room to the home of the players. It can be played multiple times as no material gets destroyed while playing.

name: Asusta Cucos
description:
In this game when the ant goes into action, the Cucos get scared. With Asusta Cucos you are going to put speed, concentration and coordination into play. The player who scares the most Cucos will be the winner.

All cards are dealt to players. Each player in turns puts their top card in the table, not covering any other card. If the And (Cuco scarer) is shown. Everyone has to cover, with their hands, cards of the most present color on the table, and they win that card if it is correct (and penalised returning a card if not).

The game ends when the last player card is shown, and each player counts the points on the Cucos bellies of the cards won. The player with the higher score wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Escape Quest: Lupin's Challenge
description:
Embark on a series of standalone adventures in which YOU will be the main character, during which to move forward you must solve mysterious puzzles to avoid all the traps and obstacles in your way. But beware! Only faultless logic and clever deduction will let you beat all the riddles and advance through the story. Will you be up to the challenge?

Escape Quest is an adventure gamebook series born of a collaboration between Ynnis’ publishing team and Don’t Panic Games’ design team. It is the fruit of all our combined knowledge of game design and book publishing. Much more than just a “gamified book” or a “book-like game”, we put great care in conceiving each of those volumes - collaborating with award-winning game designers, authors and illustrators - to create an immersive, fun experience that is both a great book and a great game.

LUPIN'S CHALLENGE

Cat-burglar extraordinaire!

Travel to Paris in the steam-powered era of the gentleman burglar, Arsène Lupin as he makes an announcement that shocks the shadowy community of the underworld to its core: He has decided it is time to pass on his knowledge and so issued a challenge. The first thief who can steal a certain prize jewel will become his new apprentice and learn all of his secrets! He has left puzzles and riddles that could slow you down or speed you on your way. Study your mark carefully, to plan for the heist of the century and succeed before anyone else. Can you become Lupin’s new apprentice?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Egmont Polska, Ynnis Éditions

name: Strange but True
description: Take turns to answer the questions. The first to get 15 correct is the winner

name: Roll Hiawatha
description:
Roll Hiawatha is a "Roll and Write" game that requires each player to cross off spaces on their card using a pair of communal dice to complete historic Hiawatha routes and score points. The game ends when at least one player has completed 3 or more of the historical Hiawatha Routes. A game takes about 30 minutes.

One player rolls 2d6 and all players may use these two dice to mark off one or more legal locations on their card. Each player chooses whether to use the dice singly or as a pair. Single dies may be used for Stations and Pullmans. Dice must be used as a pair in The Roundhouse, the Stock Market, and the Train Yard.

name: Monopoly: Lunar New Year
description:
Inspired by the colorful and lively Lunar New Year festival, the Monopoly Lunar New Year edition board game has players buying shops, collecting gifts, and finding good fortune. Move around the board buying shops such as a Jade Shop, Flower Market, a Firecracker Shop, and more. The more shops a player owns, the more money they'll get when opponents purchase gifts from those shops. Feeling lucky? Fortune Stick and Pinwheel cards can be game changers! At the end of the game players can store the tokens, cards, dice, and money in the red envelopes. What a fun way to celebrate the Lunar New Year!

The game includes exclusive tokens inspired by the lunar festival: tangerines, a lion head, a bull, a firecracker, a gold ingot, and a lantern
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Solluna
description:
Anglais

In this epic pixeled card game, players will use cards to raise or lower the Village's influence level, trying to secure a powerful mythical stone, the Atris Lucidum.

But before that, players will secretly pick a Heroes of Legends card, that changes the objective depending on which Hero you get. Solaris heroes will want the influence type to be Sol at the end of the game, while Lunaris heroes will want it to be the Luna type. Neutralis heroes will want to keep the influence level low, no matter the type.

Then, each player will draft 9 Prestations cards, pick one of them and pass the rest of the pack to the next player. Players will again have to pick a card from that now 8 cards pack, and pass the rest to the next player, and so on until there is no cards to pass.

Finally, players will play 1 card at their turn. Most cards will help raise or lower the influence level, but some of them can make a player skip a turn, cancel another card effect or power up another one.

The game ends when a player has no card to play, or if the influence level reach 20 (or more). Then, the winners are decided depending on the type and level of the influence.



Dans ce jeu épique de cartes pixelisées, les joueurs utiliseront des cartes pour augmenter ou diminuer le niveau d'influence du village, en essayant de s'emparer d'une puissante pierre mythique, l'Atris Lucidum. Mais avant cela, les joueurs choisiront secrètement une carte Héros des légendes, qui modifie l'objectif en fonction du héros choisi. Les héros Solaris voudront que le type d'influence soit Sol à la fin de la partie, tandis que les héros Lunaris voudront que ce soit le type Luna. Les héros Neutralis voudront que le niveau d'influence reste bas, quel que soit le type.

Ensuite, chaque joueur va tirer 9 cartes Prestations, en choisir une et passer le reste du paquet au joueur suivant. Les joueurs devront à nouveau choisir une carte dans ce paquet de 8 cartes, et passer le reste au joueur suivant, et ainsi de suite jusqu'à ce qu'il n'y ait plus de cartes à passer.

Enfin, les joueurs joueront une carte à leur tour. La plupart des cartes permettent d'augmenter ou de diminuer le niveau d'influence, mais certaines d'entre elles peuvent faire sauter un tour à un joueur, annuler un effet de carte ou en renforcer un autre.

Le jeu se termine lorsqu'un joueur n'a plus de carte à jouer, ou si le niveau d'influence atteint 20 (ou plus). Ensuite, les gagnants sont désignés en fonction du type et du niveau d'influence.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: KrimiGames Case 1: La Famiglia
description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

The Carabinieri of Catanzaro need your help: The notorious Tegano Mafia family controls the city and the entire province. But with the death of the eldest son, there is a unique opportunity to put an end to their trade forever.

In this puzzle game, you will receive a case file with evidence, documents and all kinds of clues. Analyze bills, parking tickets, newspaper articles, autopsy reports and much more in order to convict the perpetrator. Use tools like social media profiles and websites to identify motives and check alibis.

Can you solve the case?

- Case files based on real criminal cases
- Interactive elements
- Use other exciting sources such as the Internet
- Put your analytical skills to the test
- Work with your friends

name: Warrior Heroes: To Be King
description:
A KINGDOM IS YOURS FOR THE TAKING!

Includes color counters and Battle Boards
Your troops are tired and slowly giving ground. They've fought hard all day against an infinite number of enemy troops. They've done all that you've asked of them and more. They've covered themselves with both blood and glory and look to you for victory.

The fate of your nation hangs in the balance as you desperately search for that one spot to launch your final attack. There! Gathering your personal horsemen, you draw your sword for it is now or never. The battle rests on your strong right arm.

Warrior Heroes – To Be King! is set in the mythical world of Talomir and is compatible with our Fantasy RPG, Warrior Heroes – Adventures in Talomir. Talomir is a land where dozens of Nations vie for dominance and like other games, we've provided you with Army Lists that describe your troops and how to assemble them for Battle. Other games allow for fighting individual Battles, but we've taken it farther, much farther.

We’ve added a simple to use, fast play Campaign System that ties all your Battles together to insure that every Battle means something. With the Warrior Heroes – To Be King! Campaign System, you are the Commander of the Army one minute and the King, or Queen, the next.

And best of all; you can play solo, cooperatively against the game, or competitively, head to head.
Do you have what it takes to be King?

–Description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Weekend Warriors: The Ultimate Tabletop Skirmish Game To Play With Your Kids
description:
Weekend Warriors is the ultimate tabletop skirmish game to play with your kids!
It’s a fast-paced, action-packed tabletop skirmish game that is fun to prepare and play together.
The rules are simple and quick to learn but provide enough depth to keep the bigger kids just as immersed and entertained!
Learn the rules once and then apply them to any genre.

You can use any models to represent your warriors, from construction toys to paper drawings to your favourite plastic or metal miniatures. Then all you need is a measuring tape, gauge or ruler, some six-sided dice, and a keen imagination.

Set your game in any setting; Sci-fi, fantasy, historical, modern or zombie-infested apocalyptic wastelands; it's up to you. Tell your story your way as you develop adventures based on your interests. Weekend Warriors gives you a framework to build your stories around as you prepare and play your game.

As you take control of the narrative and choose which rules to use and which ones to leave out, it’s great for any age. But the game is perfect for children aged 7+ when all the rules are in play.

A big part of the game is choosing your band of warriors. This is where your imagination can be let loose as you create your Warband and equip them with the gear and skills they need to succeed in battle.

This book gives you everything you need to create epic adventures with your friends and family.
So that leaves one question.
Are you ready to accept your destiny and become a Weekend Warrior!?

–description from the publisher

name: Nuuk
description:
Nuuk is a Print & Play card game to play solo or with two players. Each poker-sized card has one of Greenland's coastal villages - visit a new village each time you turn over a card. Starting with just a couple of basic resources, your aim is to gain as much money as you can in order to pay for your sea passage home, before you run out of time.

Trade resources and learn new local skills as you travel between villages. Skills will gain you benefits later in the game, or help you avoid penalties, but learning a new skill means spending more precious time in that village. You'll need to decide when to invest in skills and when to push on to the next village.

With multiple solo and two player modes, this pocket sized game will keep you thinking for hours.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Trading

name: Yuru Camp x Cat & Chocolate
description: Yuru Camp x Cat & Chocolate is an anime-based version of storytelling game Cat & Chocolate. Based on the Yuru Camp theme, players will use items to solve problems while camping. The team that solves more problems wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: BattleTech: Dark Age Turning Points – Liao
description:
When The Republic of the Sphere was founded by Devlin Stone after the Word of Blake Jihad, Sun-Tzu Liao was forced to give up many of his worlds to the new nation. Several times in the following decades the Capellan Confederation tried and failed to reclaim those worlds, including the ancestral homeworld of Liao.
But Sun-Tzu's son, Daoshen, is crafty and patient.

In the wake of the devastating collapse of the hyperpulse generator network, The Republic is beset on all sides and Daoshen sees his chance. Taking advantage of a student uprising and unrest against The Republic, Daoshen's secret agitators and devoted troops will try one more time to avenge the dishonor of losing Liao. And this time, they will know victory!

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a “Liao flavor.” The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Liao, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: RaceKart Riot: Rainbow Galaxy
description:
Rainbow Galaxy is a very unique track in the sense that there are multiple tracks to choose from, each with slightly different lengths and spaces to land on. This track will keep you coming back as you discover which path is ideal for you!

The first new racer is Sonico Oxblade! Instead of driving a normal racekart, Sonico found the fastest Ostrich alive and trained him until he was fast enough to keep up with the fastest of racekarts!

The the second new racer is Fabio! Originally a bodybuilder, Fabio was told that for whatever reason, he just looked like he should be a racer. Only time will tell if he can live up to everyone's racing expectations of him!

—description from the publisher

Includes 1 additional track and 2 more racers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Adeptus Astartes Cards – Aircraft and Aces
description:
Keep track of your Adeptus Astartes aircraft, weapons and upgrades, ground assets, and two Ace pilots along with their unique aircraft with this essential reference card pack.

This pack contains the following cards:

26 Adeptus Astartes Aircraft cards make ideal references for your Xiphon Interceptor, Storm Eagle, Fire Raptor, and Thunderhawk Gunship aircraft. Also includes the ‘Dark Fire’ and ‘The Unkillable Phantom’ named aircraft

20 Aircraft Upgrade cards (including Ceramite Plating, Infernum Halo Launcher, Veteran, Techmarine, Infra-red Targeting, and Armoured Cockpit)

30 Aircraft Weapon cards (including Pair of Hellstrike Missiles, Krak Missiles, Dual Krak Missiles, Hunter-killer missiles, Dual Hunter-killer missiles, Port Twin Autocannon Turret, Starboard Twin Autocannon Turret, Port Twin Lascannon Turret, Starboard Twin Lascannon Turret, and Pair of Wing Bombs)

2 Ground Defence cards (including Icarus Stormcannon Array and Skyspear Missile Launcher)

8 Adeptus Astartes Ace cards (including Argan Fal’shan and Athor Vae, and 6 additional Adeptus Astartes Ace Ability cards)

name: Ducks in the Pond
description: A Yatzee-style roll n' write for duck enthusiasts and gamers seeking a fun filler. Roll a set of dice for six days attempting to collect different classifications of ducks in the Thibodaux, Louisiana reservoir. Watch out for the weather though which progressively worsens and reduces your dice pool. Dice may be manipulated in some cases. Are you a novice, connoisseur, or professional at duck-watching or just there to get an honorable mention?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M4A1 Sherman (76mm)
description:
The M4A1 Sherman (76mm), much like it’s slightly less powerful brother, is one of the most recognizable tanks of World War II and can be counted on to perform reliably in almost any role on the battlefield. It bring a solid set of stats with a firepower of 5 standing out amongst the crowd meaning you can get away with little to no upgrades. Of course if you want to make a good thing better, then it is hard to beat a Vertical Stabilizer to give your tank an advantage on the move, whilst the Wright Continental R-975C4 engine that enhances your tanks initiative can benefit both M4 Sherman variants, as well as the “yet-to-be-released” M18 Hellcat (can someone say “spoiler”?).

—description from the publisher

name: Doodle Dungeon: Promo Pack
description:
A promo pack for Doodle Dungeon consisting of 4 cards each of

• Lasso: At the beginning of the next turn: If you have played this lasso, you draw 1 of your hand cards and add them to your hand.

• Zäher Schleim,: Immediately get 1 slime monster, strength: +14, damage: 1. Ignore the distance rule. A hero on a space with slime will not move until the slime has been defeated.

• Schicksalswürfel: If the monster wins, the hero suffers double damage. If the hero wins, he gets back as many ♥ as the damage indicated for the monster. (No further dungeon action allowed.)


In destail:
• Lasso
Zu Beginn des nächsten Zugs: Wer dieses Lasso gespielt hat, zieht 1 deiner Handkarten und nimmt sie auf die Hand.• Zäher Schleim
Erhalte sofort 1 Schleim: Monster, Stärke: +14, Schaden: 1. Ignoriere die Abstandsregel. Ein Held auf einem Feld mit Schleim bewegt sich erst weiter, wenn der Schleim besiegt wurde.

• Schicksalswürfel
Vor dem Kampf spielen: Gewinnt das Monster, erleidet der Held doppelten Schaden. Gewinnt der Held, erhält er so viele ♥ zurück, wie beim Monster als Schaden angegeben ist. (Keine weitere Dungeonaktion erlaubt.)

name: Yammer
description:
Yammer is a game where you make words from letter cards in your hand and on the table to score the most points possible. The deck has 108 cards: 51 red letters, 51 orange letters, 2 wild cards, 2 2x multiplier cards, and 2 3x multiplier cards. It has rules for four games:

Yammer: Make a new word from cards in the hand and/or the well, scoring the sum of the letter values, doubled if they are all the same color, and times any multiplier cards played. Cards from the deck are used to replenish the well first, and then the hand. The highest score when the deck runs out wins.

Yammer Solitaire: Yammer for one player, aiming to have a high score at the end, or the fewest cards unused.

Yammy: Gin Rummy with the Yammer deck. Wild cards and multipliers are removed. Players start with 9-card hands, and on their turn they draw from the top of the draw or discard pile, and then discard a card. The round ends when one player can use their whole hand to spell words, each of which must be of the same color. Play until winning a target number of rounds or reaching a target total score.

500 Yammy: 500 Rummy with the Yammer deck. Like Yammy, except that players may play single-color words during their turn, and/or add to existing words on the table. They may also draw any card in the discard pile, but they must use that card to make a word immediately, and must draw all cards above that card in the pile. A round ends when one person depletes their hand. Play until reaching a target total score.

name: La Cucaracha!: Wargames rules for engagements with small forces during the Mexican Revolution
description:
Skirmish rules 20mm-54mm Plus scenarios, including what if's of foreign intervention.

(description from publisher)

name: Chronicles of Frost: Kickstarter Edition
description:
This entry is for the Kickstarter edition with additional content in the box. Limited content consists of 18 cards:
- 8 More Fate cards, numbered "LFS01"-"LFS08".
- 4 More Item cards, numbered "LIS01"-"LIS04".
- 5 More World Event cards, numbered "LWR01"-"LWR05".
- 1 More Ally cards, numbered "LAB01".

The land of Valskyrr needs its heroes once again! Only those with true skill and resolve can brave the ever changing icy paths and monstrosities spawned by the nefarious power of the Mists. Fell mighty enemies, explore and shape the land, embark on quests, write your own chronicle, and become a legend in a world of dark sorcery and peril. Will you answer the call to adventure?

Chronicles of Frost is a deck-building adventure game set in Æstemyr, a dark fantasy universe rich in its own lore, shared by Mistfall, Heart of the Mists and Shadowscape.

Start with two unique quests and a small deck, and improve your character by gaining new ability cards, items and allies. Unlock each card's more powerful effect by using skill tokens or by exerting your character to push ever further on your way to becoming a legend. Face ruthless enemies and reap the rewards of your victories. Explore and build the world, creating a new map every time you play, and use the special abilities of locations to your benefit. Manage your deck by retiring cards into your personal chronicle, where they will yield more fame at the end of the game.

Face up to three opponents in a new competitive adventure game (or brave the frozen wilds cooperatively), playable in 80 minutes, and write the chronicle of your hero.
