mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Cards Against Humanity: Nasty Bundle
description:
The Nasty Bundle is a collection of six themed packs that's too spicy for most stores. Shuffle these into your deck and make everyone uncomfortable the next time you play!

Comes with the Period Pack, Weed Pack, Ass Pack, Saves America Pack, Picture Card Pack 1, and Picture Card Pack 2.
Also includes ten all-new extra-nasty cards we wrote just for you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Monopoly: Tex
description:
Tex Willer is a very popular Italian comic book, started in 1948 and still running. Tex Willer, the main character, is a Texas Ranger. American Natives call him "Aquila della Notte" (Night Eagle).

Now he has his own Monopoly edition, too.

Includes a reprint of the classic story "Vendetta Indiana", by Giovanni Ticci

—user summary
categories: American West, Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Connectors: Mission Space
description:
In Skillmantics Connectors Mission space 1-4 players aim to build a rocket trail and defeat aliens. Game can be played contributing to one main map or with each player trying to expand their own spaceship trails as much as possible.
Group layout.

Distribute 3 tiles to player
Place starting tile. Tiles need to be placed connecting similar colors and asteroids may not be aimed towards planets. Aliens must not face each other.
Players pick any tile from their hand to add to start. If they cannot they draw from the tile bank.
First player to use all their tiles wins.

name: Steal
description:
Steal is a fast and furious new letter game of cunning, treachery and outright theft! A hugely exciting game from New Zealand, with all letter tiles contained in a handy mask-shaped fabric bag, allowing it to be played almost anywhere. Steal is suitable for 2-8 players of all ages, easy to learn but more difficult to master.

Play proceeds by flipping tiles (every 2-3 seconds), with players calling out and forming three+ letter words from the exposed letters. As the game proceeds, the aim then is to steal words from your opponents by adding one or more letters. So pin might be stolen as pain, and stolen again as inapt, then pliant, implant, platinum, manipulate, planetarium, perambulating etc....! All the while other words are of course being formed and stolen.

The set contains ten coloured STEAL letters which double the score of the word, so the highest scores are always obtained by assembling/stealing long words containing a coloured letter. Play is further enhanced by the mask (joker) tile which can be any letter you want (& can change as the word is stolen).

Flipping stops while words are being assembled (with the last assembler being next to flip) but stealing does not. So often a word is stolen whilst it is being formed with the addition of an already-exposed new letter! Frustrating and hilarious at the same time, bringing out the competitive streak of everyone who plays. Once all letters are flipped and no more words can be made or stolen...the scores are counted up to find the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Čiri-biri Bajka
description:
A children's storytelling game, where players are presented with a basic narrative arc which informs them of what they need to accomplish. Each player has his own character with which he explores the map by opening new hexagon tiles and finding different items. These serve as inspiration and opportunity to tell a story and progress thorugh the game towards it narrative finale.

On a turn, a player rolls a die which tells him how many action points he gets to use. As an action, he can open a new tile, move to an adjacent tile, or pick up an item from the tile he is on. There's also a possibility he gets to use his special power. All this should be narrated as well. The game ends when all the story cards are completed, that is, a set amount of items in requested colours are collected. The players win together, I noted the game is cooperative. But I guess, there is no winning as such, as the game is about telling a story, there is no mechanical challenge.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Set Collection, Storytelling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Woordrace
description:
Throw 13 dice with different letters on them. Then when the hourglass starts you try to make a crossword of words that give you the most points.

Each letter has a point value. Total up your points for each word. the player who has the most points at the end of the game, wins.
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling

name: Bloody Harry
description:
In this game inspired by the Harry Potter parody comic book, Your objective will be to win your house by earning as many victory points as possible. Collecting the lessons will be profitable for you but do not hesitate to use magic cards, because all the blows are allowed to grab the victory !!

You start the game with 5 magic cards in hand, the card of your house and its associated power and a number of school cards placed on the timetable, variable according to the number of players. On your turn, you perform 2 actions : Draw magic cards or collect a school card (at a variable cost depending on the number already in your possession). You can perform the same action twice. Do not hesitate to activate the effects of the school cards and play your magic cards in order to perfect your strategy, increase your score or, better yet, decrease that of other players by giving them bad points!
The game ends when a player has 10 school cards in front of him at the end of a turn. The winner is the one with the most victory points.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor

name: BattleTech: Interstellar Expeditions – Interstellar Players 3
description:
Nearly fifteen years have passed since the end of the Word of Blake Jihad and the rise of the Republic of the Sphere. Yet even as the Inner Sphere adjusts to a new sense of normalcy, questions remain about whether the Blakist threat is gone for good or merely hibernating.

Once a disorganized collective of hobbyists and academics backed by the idle wealthy, Interstellar Expeditions has emerged from the fires of war to take up the mission once claimed by ComStar's Explorer Corps: to search for the elusive hiding places where humanity's enemies might have gone. From the dead worlds within the borders of the Inner Sphere itself, to the distant, uncharted reaches of the Deep Periphery, IE relentlessly searches for the answers to mysteries dating back to mankind's first ventures into deep space, while simultaneously watching for any sign of the zealots who so recently waged the most horrendous interstellar war in modern history.

Interstellar Expeditions: Interstellar Players 3 describes the organization and efforts of Interstellar Expeditions as it continues to search within (and beyond) human-occupied space in the BattleTech universe. First introduced in Interstellar Players, IE's operations have now gone truly universal, seeking answers and treasures not only from the lost and forgotten worlds of humanity's distant past, but also the distant colonies and civilizations that have risen--and even fallen--beyond the boundaries of the Inner Sphere. Gamemasters and players can decide which of these groups and discoveries may actually bear fruit, and which are the misdirections left behind by the surviving leaders of the Blakist war machine. Whether from this sourcebook or the gamemaster's own imagination, these discoveries can become the ultimate villain, ally, or unique new setting for any type of BattleTech campaign!

name: BattleTech: HexPack – Promotion 1
description: The HexPacks are a flexible map system aid from the BattleTech game system. Designed for use in conjunction with other pre-printed mapsheets (such as those for the 25th Anniversary Introductory Box Set), the systems flexibility allows for easy modifications to existing mapsheets, increasing the enjoyment of a given scenario as players quickly change the terrain to bring new excitement to each game they play!

name: BattleTech: Handbook – Major Periphery States
description: Handbook: Major Periphery States collates the essential history, politics and culture of the Major Periphery States into a single volume. More than a mere sourcebook, Handbook: Major Periphery States provides rules for both BattleTech and A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG game play, including new support vehicles, creatures and more!

name: Cafe Chaos: Junk Food Pack
description: This pack has 28 new cards focused on expanding your food cards. It includes 2 new character and their actions, 12 foods, 3 toppings, 3 conditions, 3 bonus actions and 3 events.

name: Cafe Chaos: Sooubway Pack
description: This pack has 28 new cards adding food to your game based on that famous footlong place. It has 2 characters and their actions, 12 foods, 3 toppings, 3 conditions, 3 bonus actions and 3 events

name: You Be Aim (ユビエイム)
description:
ユビエイム (You Be Aim) is a 2 player flicking game from Japan. The publisher Protocraft focuses on games with miniatures of mechas (brutalist robots). Players have a crawling mecha each, and must move around the factory to achieve goals. The mecha has a hollow body and the player loads a cylinder into the mecha and then fires it across the board by flicking the back of the mecha.

The game board in You Be Aim is double-sided, so players can play two different games. In one game, Watari Usagi (わたりうさぎ), they aim to fire cylinders at the rabbit robots of their opponent. In the other game, Jitsuriki Sugoroku (実力すごろく), the players must move around the factory and fire at targets on the walls without hitting the rabbit robots.

Customers who reserved early for the game at the Tokyo Game Market got a free metal miniature rabbit robot.
user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Flicking, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Horseshoes and Hand Grenades
description:
Unconventional tabletop warfare!

Each player is dealt one HQ card, which has its own tactical advantage. Players are then dealt cards, on their turns they draw a card and play a card, attack or defense. Forge and break alliances, wars on all fronts, the table is your warzone!

Each HQ can within stand 20 points of damage before falling, the damage is inflicted by horseshoes, hand grenades, and nukes! There are cards to repair your damage, but remember, nuclear damage is not repairable! Once your HQ hits 20 points of damage, you are out of the game, last HQ standing wins.

—description from designer
mechanics: Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Rad Zone: Radioactive Reindeer Christmas Expansion
description: Expansion including two festive missions, new rumours, four additional journey charts, two new maps with Christmas themed search matrices.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: HR: The Toxic Workplace Game
description:
You and up to 3 frenemies are Managers on the climb up the brutal corporate ladder. Manage your team of familiar employees and win by completing projects OR by getting everyone else FIRED by HR instead!

The game starts with all Employee Cards being dealt to each Manager. Each Manager is then dealt 5 cards which be their hand. During a turn, a Manager can choose to play a Misconduct Card OR a Project Management Card OR an Action Card from their hand. At the end of a turn, Managers redraw to make sure they have 5 cards in their hand.

There are two ways of Winning HR.

The first is to eliminate all other Manager's Employees by serving them Warning Letters for Misconducts. When an Employee receives 3 Warning Letters, the Employee is Fired and placed in the Retrenched Pile. Some Misconduct Cards would deal 2 Warning Letters to specific types of Employees instead of 1.

The second way of winning the game is when a Manager successfully completes an entire Project Cycle by putting down all 4 stages of Project Management Cards.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dungeon Party: Floating Eye
description:
Dungeon Party is an easy-to-learn, raucous, play-anywhere, social role-playing game, where the rooms, monsters, and treasures are all on bar coasters. Players take turns bouncing a coin to "hit" the monsters, disarm traps, or avoid cursed rooms. Players work together to survive the dungeon and gather the most loot, but there can only be one winner!

On their turn, a player reveals a room and monster, battles the monster, and recovers treasure. The game ends if all players’ characters are defeated in an encounter and the adventure failed, or if the last Boss monster has been defeated and the adventure has succeeded and you win.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Flicking, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Set-up

name: 肛門で語る人生 (Komonde Kataru Jinsei)
description:
肛門で語る人生 (Komonde Kataru Jinsei) is a trick-taking game from Japan. The game title is a vulgar expression, as the theme of the game is about human’s filthy life. The publisher's blurb says "Throughout life, people accumulate their filth to reach their climax, then fall suddenly.". So the game title translates as 'Life told through the anus'. The box cover shows a purse with a star-like decoration, which is recognisable in Japan as an anus.

The publisher says "In this game, the cards are played out two at a time from a hand of five. At the end of each round, the hand is replenished from the deck, so you always have five cards in your hand. This makes trick-taking a relatively light game.

There are two types of cards in the game: simple numbers 1 to 5 and special cards with the number 0. The special cards are Monko-sama (a monk) and Servant. The person who makes a bigger number with two cards wins the trick (an offering at the temple), but the special cards affect the trick.

If there is a servant played, the player who played the servant wins.
If there is both a servant and a monk played, the player who played the monk wins.
If there is no servant but a monk is played, the player who played the monk loses.
In a battle between monks and servants, the player with the higher number wins.

As you play, the number you play in a round is your 'life experience' and you record this value of the experiences you have talked about. At the end of the game, the total number of experiences is calculated, and the player with the highest total is eliminated from the game as having "experienced too much". Of the remaining players, the player with the highest total of offerings wins the game.

肛門で語る人生は、トリックテイキングと呼ばれるタイプのゲームです。

ありふれたトリックテイキングはカードを配り切って手札から1枚ずつ出していくのですが、肛門で語る人生は、手札5枚の中から2枚ずつ出していきます。ラウンドの最後に山札から手札補充がありますので、手札のカードは常に5枚です。

手札補充があることにより、トリックテイキングとしては比較的ライトなプレイ感に仕上がっています。

1から5までの単純な数字のカードと、0の特殊なカードが2種類あります。

特殊なカードは「もんこう様」と「下僕」です。

基本的にはカード2枚でより大きな数字をつくった人が得点（＝お供え）を獲得するのですが、

・場に、下僕がいる場合、下僕を出したプレイヤーの勝ち、

・場に、下僕ももんこう様もいる場合、もんこう様を出したプレイヤーの勝ち、

・場に、下僕がおらず、もんこう様がいる場合、もんこう様を出したプレイヤーの負け

となります。

もんこう様同士、下僕同士の戦いは数字の大きな方が勝ち、数字が同じ場合は後出しの方が勝ちます。

そのラウンドで出した数字は、このゲームで語ったあなたの「経験値」です。

人生での"経験"を示しているわけですね。

毎ラウンド、語った経験の経験値を、ホワイトボードマーカーでメモっていきます。

ゲーム終了時にこれまでの経験値の合計を計算するのですが、最も合計値が高いプレイヤーは「経験しすぎている」ということでゲームから脱落します。

残ったプレイヤーの中で、最もお供えの合計点の高いプレイヤーの勝ちとなります。

name: Espionaje
description:
A Clue reimplementation based on spies.

Players move from room to room to solve the mystery of: who done it, with what, and where? Players are dealt character, weapon, and location cards after the top card from each card type is secretly placed in the confidential file in the middle of the board. Players must move to a room and then make an accusation against a character saying they did it in that room with a specific weapon. The player to the left must show one of any cards accused to the accuser if in that player's hand. Through deductive reasoning each player must figure out which character, weapon, and location are in the secret file. To do this, each player must uncover what cards are in other players hands by making more and more accusations. Once a player knows what cards the other players are holding, they will know what cards are in the secret file. A great game for those who enjoy reasoning and thinking things out.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Barby
description:
Barby is a 2 player compendium game with a traditional deck adapted from Barbu. Barby consists of a series of hands where players choose one of seven possible games. Each game offers a task (such as avoiding the last two tricks, or trying to avoid winning Queens). After fourteen deals, each player must call each game once. The game cycles through each player's narrowing choices. Mandatory doubles keep the tension high.

—description from the designer

name: Floralia
description: Each gardener will need a good memory and a strategy for flipping the pyramids in the right direction to find weather that is indicated on the current page of the books to help a flower to grow. First who has a complete beautiful flower will be the winner.

name: Bien Cordialement
description:
Bien Cordialement is a humorous ambiance game. The goal is to turn a classical painting into a meme-like cartoon by combining nonsensical sentences with the images.
A game master votes on the most funny creation and determines the winner
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Renaissance

name: Focus Storia: Il Grande Gioco
description: In the board game we will be able to cross different historical periods: from classical antiquity to the Middle Ages, from modern to contemporary history. In a question and answer game, you move across the board

name: Flamencos
description:
Flamencos is a memory and speed game for the youngest of the house. In this game the flamingos wear socks under the water!

The objective of the game is to collect the greatest number of flamingos in the lagoon, looking for their averages to coincide with the characteristic proposed by a random dice.

On each turn, the dice is rolled and everyone must choose a flamingo from the lagoon, when they are taken out of the water, whoever has a flamingo that matches the dice, wins the flamenco, the others must put them back in their place in the lagoon.

Whoever gets the most flamingos wins!
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Magic Hat
description:
A children's game based on memory. There are six hats, one is removed from the game casually. Players can watch in a hat to see the animal that is in the hat.

The first who knows which is the missing animal wins the round. When a player wins two rounds, they win the game.

Contents: 6 plastic magician’s hats, 6 ‘animal’ cards, 4 ‘magician’s hat’ tokens, 1 ‘magic wand’ token.

name: Battle of Kotesashi
description:
This is an issue game of "Bushi Life" #3, depicts the Battle of Kotesashi, a samurai battle between Nitta Yoshisada and Sakurada Sadakuni on May 11, 1333. This battle was a part of the decisive Kōzuke-Musashi Campaign during the Genkō War in Japan that ultimately ended the Kamakura Shogunate.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Kotesashi_(1333)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: AtomBlitz: Operation Epic Poem
description:
The year is 2039. Against the background of the rest of exhausted Europe, Scandinavia seems quite prosperous: there is no war, or even hunger. Sweden, a small regional leader with a recently acquired nuclear arsenal, seems to be completely safe from any encroachments. Neighbors on the peninsula are reaching out to her for protection.

A rogue state, the Great British Republic, is stirring up the North Sea. Once proud frigates, and now pirate ships of the British scurry back and forth in search of prey. Threatening with missiles, they take the "passage fee" from every oncoming vessel. In a world where bank accounts have lost value, tribute is collected in goods: from tankers - oil, from trawlers - fish, and so on.

So far, no one has dared to resist the brazen sea racketeers, but there is a limit to everything. When the British Overprotector demanded offshore oil platforms from the Norwegian government, the King-Queen of Sweden stood up for the allied country, threatening nuclear retaliation...

—description from the publisher

Britain vs. Sweden
Naval and AirLand combat.
OGRE-like structured ships mechanic.
Nuclear weapons available for both opponents.
categories: Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Astronika (アストロニカ)
description:
The year is 2061. The Moon Base Development Project. Also known as Astronika.

It's been almost 100 years since the Apollo missions, when humans first set foot on the Moon. The history of the moon is about to be rewritten by mankind. With the development of science and technology, the Moon is no longer an impenetrable territory, but a new frontier within reach.

And it is no longer the nations of the past that are inviting mankind to the Moon. Instead, it is the international space companies, which transcend national boundaries.

Players are the project leaders of an International Space Company. Your mission is to select the "right people", assemble a team and lead the project to success.
Which company will establish a bridgehead in the new frontier of the Moon?

- A medium-weight board game with the theme of developing the moon
- Expansion & Reproduction x Engine Build x Area Majority
- Assemble a diverse crew and build your own team!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Worker Placement
publishers: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

name: 9-Card Dungeon Quest
description:
In 9-card Dungeon Quest you are an adventurous thief who has entered the Dragon’s dungeon seeking your fortune and fame. You’ve been told the dungeon is under an illusion spell and all the room seem to shift and move. You must make your way through a random dungeon path to reach the Dragon's Chamber all the while dealing with dangerous traps that are impossible to avoid. You will earn gold as you move through the dungeon and once you reach the Dragon's Chamber you can try to steal as much treasure as you can before he awakens. If you tire from stealing or don't die from the Dragon’s fire breath, you will make your way back to the exit along a new random path and escape the dungeon for good. Along the way you may find treasure chests that will earn you extra gold or lifesaving potions to heal you as you escape.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: FIVES
description:
If You Can Count
You Can Play

Fast!! Fascinating!! Fun!!
A game for ages 5 to 105
2 to 6 persons may play

HOW TO PLAY: Shuffle deck. Deal four cards face up to each player. Turn one card face up in the center of the playing area and place the remaining pile face down next to it. The player to the left of the dealer begins by putting a card with the next numerical value on top of the card that was turned up. Only one card can be played. If the player does not have the right card, he picks a card from the face down pile. If he picks the right card, he must play it. If he picks the wrong card, he places it face up with his other cards. The player to his left then takes a turn. If the pile you pick from gets used up, play continues. Each player, in turn, must play the right card if he has it, or, pass if he does not have it. The first one to play all of his cards is the Game Winner. The deal is passed clockwise for succeeding games.

name: AdvanceQuest: The New Hill
description:
The quiet village of Berryside isn't known for adventure... but that's about to change. Steel yourself to face the mysterious threat that dwells inside The New Hill.

AdvanceQuest is a compact adventure system. Generate a character with any traits you want, and advance your way through the story, rolling dice against challenges and trying to reach the end.

A new chapter in the AdvanceQuest story is coming.

Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the story will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two story elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue on. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects! If you can make it through the story, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to collect along the way – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

In The New Hill you will protect the village of Berryside from ravenous insect creatures that are attacking the town and all who inhabit it. This is the second AdvanceQuest adventure.

—description from the publisher


A solo micro-game designed by C.C. Chamberlin, based on Dungeon Hero. Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy. Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then start the adventure.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape Adventures Adventskalender:  Die geheimnisvolle Burg
description:
It is cold. Snow melts on the skin. Winter has come. Suddenly you find yourself in an ice-blue world full of knights, alchemists and long-forgotten creatures. Start your story on December 1 and behind each door find out which door you need to open next. The mystery of sabotaged festivities and an ancient castle are waiting to be explored. Riddles must be solved and shady items like Rubik's cubes or puzzle pieces must be combined to reach the end of the story. Will you find the exit to escape the Escape Room by Christmas? Find out!

-description by the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Folklore: The Affliction – Dark Tales Expansion: Return to Spice Tower Rumor Card
description:
A new rumor card for Folklore: The Affliction. You need Dark Tales to use this Rumor. The card has you travel to the Alchemist's Tower. You then have the choice titled "Entrance" or "Defenestration."

This promo card was released as part of the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

name: A Crowning Glory: Austerlitz 1805
description:
Even weeks before Trafalgar, by August 1805 the newly crowned Emperor Napoleon Ier, had come to understand his plans required action on land. More specifically, he had to defeat his continental enemies in order to secure his continued power. Britain, Russia and Austria were allied against him and, since he couldn’t get at the British on their island fortress, and Russia was too far away to allow for the required quick victory, he was left with invading Austria.

Rapidly surrounding and capturing the main Austrian Army at Ulm, December found Napoleon at Austerlitz (modern day Skavkov u Brna) in southern Moravia at the end of a very stretched supply line. He also appeared to be slightly outnumbered by an Coalition army made up of the remnants of Austrian forces, plus a sizable Russian contingent. Feigning weakness, Napoleon lured the Coalition force into attacking his right flank (where he wanted them to), then counterpunched through the Coalition center to encircle most of them. The Coalition were crushed, and through the victory, Napoleon cemented his hold on the throne. It was a crowning glory.

This two-player grand-tactical simulation by Ty Bomba presents the battle generally considered to have been Napoleon’s greatest victory. Both players have the opportunity to attack and defend, but the main burden of the offensive resides with the French player. His opponent, the Allied player, commands the Austrian and Russian units. Each hexagon on the map represents 600 yards (549 meters) from side to opposite side. The units are brigades and divisions. Each full turn represents one hour of ‘real time.’

Published in Against The Odds #57

—description from the publisher

name: Pot-YUCK!
description:
Pot-YUCK! is a party game in which 3-5 players combine Food, Spice, and Method cards from their hand to create the worst combination possible and get promoted for their accomplishment.

Players take turns being the Manager, who starts the round by drawing a recipe card which defines the food the other players must make (ex. ____ Cheesecake, which must use at least 1 Food or 1 Spice card). All players present their version of that recipe, and the Manager then chooses which they think is the worst combination, promoting the winner to the next kitchen-based rank. Each rank brings with it perks and limitations (e.g. a player with the Prep Cook rank may not use meat or fish in their recipes). If a player catches another player using items their current rank doesn't allow, the offending player loses rank!

Gameplay also includes Method cards, for adding to the "grossness" of a combination, and Kitchen Items, which can be played to ban certain foods in a round, challenge other players, change a player's rank, or even enforce new rules for the round.

Play continues, rotating the Manager role each round, with players leveling up through 5 ranks (Dishwasher, Prep Cook, Line Cook, Sous Chef, Head Chef), until a player wins a round while Head Chef and wins the game!
mechanics: Player Judge, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Cthulhu Wars: The Prophetess
description:
Part of Cthulhu Wars: Onslaught 3 Stretch Goal Box.

To obtain the Prophetess Loyalty Card: Pay 2 Doom to take this Loyalty Card, then place the Prophetess into any area on the Map.

Powers:

Hierarchy (Ongoing): The Prophetess generates 1 Power during the Gather Power Phase. She can be Captured like any Cultist and is Recruited rather than Summoned. She cannot Create or Control Gates.

True Vision (Doom Phase): The player with the highest-ranked Unit in the Area with the Prophetess can pay extra Power when performing a Ritual of Annihilation. That player gains 1 additional Elder Sign for every 3 (additional) Power spent. Unit rank in order from lowest to highest is Cultist, Monster, Terror, Independent Great Old One, Faction Great Old One. In case of a tie, no one benefits from True Vision.

Notes: Once the Prophetess' Loyalty card is in play, any player can Recruit her (she still belongs to the Faction which has this Loyalty Card).

name: Globe Runner
description:
Globe Runner is a classic race around the world board game for all the family that uniquely contains questions on every country in the world.

Learn as you play by answering multiple choice questions on countries, capitals, flags, etc. to get a bonus go and encounter the hazards of crossing Antarctica, rounding the treacherous Cape Horn or getting lost in the Sahara, Amazon or Bermuda triangle!

Adjustable to the age & abilities of the players allowing people with different levels of knowledge to play together.

Quick, simple, fun and a great way to learn all about the world. First around the world wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Tap It!
description:
The electronic buzzer game Tap It! with 4 individual buzzers contains four ways to play.


Memo: works very similar to the MB game "Simon".
Tap It: quickly press the buzzer that shows your color
Switch: like Tap It, but with buzzers that light up at the same time and can change their color abruptly. Note: Tap It and Switch can be played with up to 8 players as the game probvides 8 different colors.
Pong: a table tennis simulation for 2 players.


—user summary

name: UNLOCK: The guessing game
description:
In UNLOCK, 1 to 6 players compete to unlock the hidden smartphone-unlocking code created by another player called ‘The Lock’ by a series of attempts. The lock player will give players information about how close they are to the hidden code on each attempt. When at least one of the players finds the secret code, the one that did best in the unlocking attempts will win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Gadget Grid
description:
Two ten-sided dice determine both the initial placements of player tokens and the placements of Gadget Cards throughout the game. Setup takes less than a minute and gameplay is simple and fast-paced. 2-8 players scramble around a 10x10 board collecting Gadget Cards that can alter the layout of the board, enhance their own abilities, change existing conditions, or - most importantly - attack other players. Attacks remove one of three "Life Gizmos" from a player. Players battle until only one person has any Life Gizmos left.

During a turn, players will move around the board collecting Gadget Crates. They can play Actions, spawn new Gadget cards, or move any player token that does not have Life Gizmos. At the end of their turn, they can Attack other players, removing one Life Gizmo from every target they hit.

When a player is reduced to 0 Life Gizmos, they can no longer collect or use Gadget Cards, but can still move around the board and damage other players. If they manage to get to a player who still has Life Gizmos, they steal one of them and can continue gathering and playing Gadget Cards as normal. Gameplay continues until Life Gizmos have been removed from all but one player.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Movement Points, Square Grid

name: dice_mancala
description:
ダイスマンカラ (Dice_Mancala) is a dice game from Japan. The players are dice farmers, and work hard in the dice fields harvesting dice.

Using a Kalah mechanism, players collect dice which they then use to roll and complete treasure cards. When a player has got their fourth treasure card, the game ends once everyone has had their turn. The player with the most points from their treasure and from the dice they harvested is the winner.

Whilst the active player rolls dice, and the other players also get to roll dice. The more dice the active player rolls, the better their chance to gain treasure, but the more chances the other players get too.

The designer says the game needs more than luck to win. Players make strategic choices through the game.
user summary
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Mancala, Modular Board, Variable Set-up
publishers: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

name: SHASN: Earth 2040 – The Future of Humanity
description: This Campaign deck with the Earth 2040 theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the hypothetical politics of the near future

name: Hoffer
description:
Hoffer is a precision bidding card game for 2 - 4 players. In this game, players will simultaneously bid on how many tricks they will capture. Accuracy is key as players who hit their bid will earn the most points.

Players wrestle with changing hand sizes, Jacks that move up in rank, and Jokers that automatically win or lose the trick. With the use of a tight 26 card deck, the Bower system borrowed from Euchre, and two Jokers, players will scramble for points as they travel up and down the river.

Whoever has the most points at the end of the final round wins the game.

name: Select 5
description:
This is a fun, quick, interactive game - with no turns.

Goal of the game is to get as many 'streaks' of 5 cards in a sequence. Players work mostly independently with the ability to steal the last card from an opponent.

Games is competitive with a mix of age groups.

Its a quick (less than 10 min), fun game with a need for skill but not much strategy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Pattern Building

name: Solitaire Legends: Tiger Lily
description:
Solitaire Legends is a series of traditional-style solitaire card games based on popular myths and legends.

Tiger Lily is a solitaire game based on Peter Pan that can be played with a traditional deck of cards. The game was created by Jonathan Auffarth in 2022.

Long gone are the days of Captain Hook and the boy who wouldn’t grow up. Now, pirates battle for control over Neverland, and the Fairy Kingdom is enslaved. Their pixie dust is harvested as a weapon of war. Alas, a new hero rises. All aboard the Jolly Roger as Queen Tiger Lily leads the Lost Boys to free the fairies once and for all!

In Tiger Lily, you must take control of the Jolly Roger. To do so, Find and align 3 Lost Boys (J) in a vertical, horizontal, OR diagonal line. On your turn, play a card from your hand, resolve the action, and then draw back up to 4. Catch Fairies along the way, fight Pirates, and look out for the Crocodile lurking in the water below!

For more games in the Solitaire Legends series check out Guinevere and Maid Marian!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Matching, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Double Feature: The Ventriloquist & Howl at the Moon
description:
This featured two full games in one box!

The Ventriloquist: The police are shocked when a man walks into the police station with a bomb strapped to his chest. The mystery deepens, however, when they discover that he is simply a puppet that has been manipulated and sent there by someone calling themselves The Ventriloquist. What is The Ventriloquist's message to the Valley Falls police, and why has he taken the entire police force hostage? Don't be a dummy. Investigate this case and find out!

Howl at the Moon: Three recent deaths in Valley Falls have all thesigns of animal attacks. However, the evidence about the sort of animal that could be responsible is inconclusive. Rumors abound that the murders might have been committed by a werewolf, given that they all occurred under the light of a full moon. The local authorities, however, aren't taking that seriously. The only connection that the three victims share is their love and patronage of a local watering hole called Ernie's Bar. Can you determine who (or what) is responsible for the deaths of these three victims? Beware: this case may get a little hairy!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pocket Sports Snooker
description:
Pocket Sports Snooker replicates the tension and thrill of the game with a great simulation.

The game uses five custom dice that cover safety play, potting chances, tricky pots, snookers and colours you can attempt after potting a red. You have been left a tricky chance, do you go for the pot or play it safe? Keep the break going or wait for another opportunity to clear up?

Pocket Snooker needs strategy but not a table so you can play it anywhere. All you need is the dice.

name: 乙未戰爭 (Japanese Conquest of Taiwan)
description: "Japanese Conquest of Taiwan" is a postcard wargame, inheriting the game system of "800 Heroes: Defense of Sihang Warehouse". Players play as the commander of the Democratic Republic of Taiwan (Taiwan Army) and the Japanese Empire (Japanese Army). Both sides take turns using the rotating action points to move, attack or retreat. There are 6 turns in the game, and the Japanese army must occupy a total of 5 areas at the end.
mechanics: Action Points, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: 三国ファイト (Three Kingdoms Fight)
description:
A multi-player game that expresses the activities of famous military commanders in the novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" in a battle with cards. With the fun of handling people as the most important factor, this game reproduces the uniqueness of "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" such as "single combat" and "strategy" with a simple and exciting battle system.
208 cards
6 management sheets
approximately 100 counters
1 map
2 pages of rules

name: 三国戦記 (Sangoku Senki)
description:
This is a campaign wargame of the novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms" and deals from the death of Dong Zhuo to the White Emperor Castle. This game is limited to 3 players (Liu Bei, Cao Cao, and Sun Quan), and the campaign can be played in one day.
315 units
1 map
20 fate cards
4 politics cards
3 charts
3 corps sheets
1 explanation sheet
7 pages of rules

name: Shape Shift
description:
The competitive shape-building game that tests your reflexes and mental agility with some fast-paced fun!

Each card shows a shape challenge, ranging from a four-block puzzle up to the trickier eight-block and mystery challenges. Players race to see who will be first to build the shape shown on the card using their wooden blocks.

The first player to win 10 challenges wins the game.

name: Sockjaw
description:
Sockjaw is a card game of winning pairs of matching cards from a 5x5 grid. It is played with a traction 52 card deck of playing cards.

There are three possible types of pairs that can be captured from the grid.

The aim is to take as nearly equal a number as possible of each of the three types of pair.
